<PRE>
==============================
"After Hours"
==============================
album _The Velvet Underground_
(The Velvet Underground, 1969)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        one, two, three
        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the wine-glass out
        and drink a toast to never

        Oh, someday I know
        someone will look into my eyes
        And say hello
        you're my very special one

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        Dark party bars, shiny Cadillac cars
        and the people on subways and trains
        Looking gray in the rain, as they stand disarrayed
        oh, but people look well in the dark

        And if you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        Cause if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again
        I'd never have to see the day again, once more
        I'd never have to see the day again



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



                                    (one, two, three, If you -)
        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- sun-shine out, and ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F}{Fm...            (- people are dancing ...)

break   {C}{A7}{Dm/G}{C}            (- close the door, I'd ...)

        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- wine-glass out, and ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F...{Fm...          (Oh, someday I know ...)

        {C}{A7}{Dm/G}{C/B}          (- close the door, I'd ...)

bridge  {Em}{B}{Em/B}{Em/D#.A}      (Dark party bars, shiny ...)
break   {A}{A7}{Dm}{G...            (- gray in the rain ...)

        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{Dm}{G}              (- sunshine out, and say ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F}{Fm...            (- people are dancing ...)

        {C}{A7}{Dm/G}{C.G/A7}       (- close the door, I'd ...)
        {Dm/G}{C.G/A7}{Dm/G}{C...   (I'd never have to see ...)




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



                                      (one, two, three, If you -)
        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- close the door, the ...)
        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- sun-shine out, and ...)

break   {A#}{A#7}{D#}{D#m...          (- people are dancing ...)

break   {A#}{G7}{Cm/F}{A#}            (- close the door, I'd ...)

        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- close the door, the ...)
        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- wine-glass out, and ...)

break   {A#}{A#7}{D#...{D#m...        (Oh, someday I know ...)

        {A#}{G7}{Cm/F}{A#/A}          (- close the door, I'd ...)

bridge  {Dm}{A}{Dm/A}{Dm/C#.G}        (Dark party bars, shiny ...)
break   {G}{G7}{Cm}{F...              (- green-gray in the rain ...)

        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- close the door, the ...)
        {A#}{G7}{Cm}{F}               (- sunshine out, and say ...)

break   {A#}{A#7}{D#}{D#m...          (- people are dancing ...)

        {A#}{G7}{Cm/F}{A#.F/G7}       (- close the door, I'd ...)
        {Cm/F}{A#.F/G7}{Cm/F}{A#...   (I'd never have to see ...)







=================================
"After Hours"
=================================
album _Live At Max's Kansas City_
(The Velvet Underground, 1972)

Aug 23, 1970
Max's Kansas City, NYC
=================================


        one, two, three
        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancin'
        and they're havin' such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'll never have to see the day again

        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Why don't you take a wine-glass out
        and say hello to never

        Oh, someday I know
        someone will look into my eyes
        And say hello
        I'm your very special one

        And if you close the door
        I'll never have to see the day again

        Dark party bars, shiny Cadillac cars
        and the people on subways and trains
        Looking gray in the rain, as they stand disarrayed
        oh, but people look well in the dark

        And if you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancin'
        and they're havin' such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'll never have to see the day again, one more time
        I'll never have to see the day again, one more time
        I'll never have to see the day again



                                      (one, two, three, If you -)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (- the sunshine out, and ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F}{Fm...              (- people are dancing ...)

break   {C}{A7}{D7/G}{C}              (- close the door, I'd ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (- take a wine-glass out ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F...{Fm...            (- someday I know ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7/G}{C/B}            (- close the door, I'd ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (- close the door, the ...)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}                (Leave the sunshine out ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F}{Fm...              (- people are dancing ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7/G}{C/A7}           (- close the door, I'd ...)
        {D7/G}{C/A7}{D7/G}{C.F/C...   (I'd never have to see ...)

===============================
"After Hours"
===============================
box set _What Goes On_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Oct 19, 1969
End of Cole Ave., Dallas, Texas
===============================


        one, two, three
        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the wine-glass out
        and say hello to never

        Oh, someday I know
        someone will look into my eyes
        And say hello
        you're my very special one

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        Dark party bars, shiny Cadillac cars
        and the people on subways and trains
        Looking gray in the rain, as they stand disarrayed
        oh, but people look well in the dark

        And if you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again
        I'd never have to see the day again
        I'd never have to see the day again

 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

==================================================
"After Hours"
(The Family Dog, San Francisco, 11-8-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 08, 1969
The Family Dog, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        one, two, three
        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        If you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the wine-glass out
        and drink a toast to never

        Oh, someday I know
        someone will look into my eyes
        And say hello
        you're my very special one

        And if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again

        Dark party bars, shiny Cadillac cars
        and the people on subways and trains
        Looking gray in the rain, as they stand disarrayed
        oh, but people look well in the dark

        And if you close the door
        the night could last forever
        Leave the sunshine out
        and say hello to never

        All the people are dancing
        and they're having such fun
        I wish it could happen to me

        But if you close the door
        I'd never have to see the day again
        I'd never have to see the day again
        I'd never have to see the day again

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}            (- close the door, the night ...)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}            (- sunshine out, and say ...)

break   {C}{C7}{F}{Fm...          (- people are dancing ...)

break   {C}{A7}{D7/G}{C}          (- close the door, I'd ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}            (- close the door, the night ...)
        {C}{A7}{D7}{G}            (- wine-glass out, and drink ...)

        {C}{A7}{D7/G}{C/B}        (- close the door, I'd ...)

In "After Hours", according to my ears the line should be:

"Looking gray in the rain, as they stand disarrayed"

not:
"Looking gray in the rain, as they stand a surrey"

<HEAD>
<TITLE>All Through The Night</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================
"All Through The Night"
==============================
album _The Bells_
(Lou Reed, 1979)

written by Lou Reed/Don Cherry
==============================


        Don't you feel so lonely when it's in the afternoon
        and you gotta face it
        all through the night
        Don't it make you believe
        that something's gonna have to happen soon
        oh baby, all through the night

        All through the night
        oh baby, all through the night
        All through the night
        all through the night

        Have you ever played with an all-night band
        and gone through it, baby
        all through the night
        When the daytime descends in a nighttime of hell
        everybody's gone to look for a bell to ring
        all through the night
        And they do it, all through the night
        babe, all through the night
        When the words were down and the poetry comes
        and the novel's written and the book is done
        you said, oh Lord, lover, baby give it to me
        all through the night
        And she says it

        My best friend Sally, she got sick
        and I'm feeling mighty ill myself it happens all the time
        and all through the night
        I went to St. Vincent's and I'm watching the ceiling
        fall down on the body as she's lying there on the ground
        says oh babe, gotta celebrate all through the night
        Made me feel so sad I cried all through the night
        I said oh Jesus, all through the night
        If the sinners sin and the good man's gone
        and a woman can't come and help him home
        and what you gonna do about it
        when they go on all through the night
        And they sing, oh baby, oh baby, oh baby
        all through the night
        and he says give it to me all through the night
        It ain't so much when a man's gotta cry
        give a little loving and some piece of mind
        I said hey babe, give it to me all through the night

        And some people wait for things that never come
        and some people dream of things that never been done
        they do it, oh baby, all through the night
        The city's funny and the country's quiet
        but I'd wanna know why they don't have a riot
        why don't they do it, baby, all through the night
        Ooohhh mama, ooohhh mama, tell me about it
        all through the night
        I want to have it all through the night
        If Christmas comes only once a year
        why can't anybody shed just one tear
        for things that don't happen all through the night
        Ooohhh mama, all through the night
        oh baby, do it to me all through the night
        Easy, easy, baby, why don't you give it to -
        - me all through the night, yeah




intro   {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}
        {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}

        {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}   (Don't you feel so lonely when ...)
        {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}   (Don't it make you believe ...)

chorus  {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}   (All through the night ...)
        {E/B}{E}{A/B}{E}   (All through the night ...)

        ....

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>All Tomorrow's Parties</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
========================================================
"All Tomorrow's Parties"
(mono single version)
========================================================
7" single
(The Velvet Underground, 1966)

box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

album _The Velvet Underground and Nico - Deluxe Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 2002)

written by Lou Reed

* edited double voice version
========================================================


        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where will she go and what shall she do
        When midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom none will go morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties




intro   {D}{Em}{G}{A/G.Em}   bass
        {D}{D}{D}{D}         (And what -)

        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (- costume shall the poor girl ...)
        {G/Em}{A}{A}         (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (A hand-me-down dress from who ...)
        {G/Em}{A}{A}         (To all tomorrow's parties, And -)

        {G}{A}{G}{A}         (- where will she go and what ...)
        {A}                  (She'll -)
        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (- turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G/A}{D}             (And cry behind the door)

guitar  {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D/                  (And what -)
        ....



* edited version
 (short intro, short guitar part and fade out ending)

* see the tabs for
_The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version down below.








=======================================
"All Tomorrow's Parties"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

* double voice version
=======================================


        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where will she go and what shall she do
        When midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And what will she do with Thursday's rags
        When Monday comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom none will go morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties




intro   {D}{Em}{G}{A/G.Em}   bass
        {D}{D}               drums
        {D}{D}{D}{D}         piano
        {D}                  (And what -)

        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (- costume shall the poor girl ...)
        {G/Em}{A}{A}         (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (A hand-me-down dress from who ...)
        {G/Em}{A}{A}         (To all tomorrow's parties, And -)

        {G}{A}{G}{A}         (- where will she go and what ...)
        {A}                  (She'll -)
        {D}{C.G/{D}{D}       (- turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G/A}{D}             (And cry behind the door)

guitar  {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}         (And what -)

        ....




* riff (standard-tuning)

To all tomorrow's parties
    {G    /     Em}  {A}           {A}

 2B -----------------------------------------------
 3G -----------------------------------------------

 5A -----------------------------------------------
 6E ------------------5---5--3---3--7---7--5---5---




* riff (standard-tuning)

... when midnight comes around
    {G}  {A}   {G}           {A}           {A}
 1e -------------------------------------------------------
 2B -------------------------------------------------------
 3G -------------------------------------------------------
 4D --------------------------7---7--5---5--9---9--7---7---
 5A -------------------------------------------------------
 6E --------------------------5---5--3---3--7---7--5---5---




* Lou Reed's "ostrich" guitar - all the strings tuned to D

 1d ----- * downtuned to d (from e to d)
 2d ----- *   uptuned to d (from B to d)
 3D ----- * downtuned to D (from G to D)
 4D
 5D ----- *   uptuned to D (from A to D)
 6D_----- * downtuned to D_(from E to D_)



backing: scale (all the strings tuned to D)

        0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7
*1d -o-||---|-o-|---|-o-|-o-|---|-o-|- ...

*3D -o-||---|---|---|---|---|---|---|- ...
*4D -o-||---|---|---|---|---|---|---|- ...
*5D -o-||---|---|---|---|---|---|---|- ...
*6D_-o-||---|---|---|---|---|---|---|- ...

==============================
"All Tomorrow's Parties"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where will she go and what shall she do
        When midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And what will she do with Thursday's rags
        When Monday comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom none will go morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where will she go and what shall she do
        midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door




* chords: same as _The Velvet Underground And Nico_ version








===============================
"All Tomorrow's Parties"
(demo take-11)
===============================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

Jul 1965
John Cale's Ludlow Street loft,
lower Manhattan, NYC
===============================


        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where shall she go and what will she do
        When midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And what will she do with Thursday's rags
        When Monday comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom un-shall the morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}     (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties, A -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- hand-me-down dress from who ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties, And -)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (- where will she go and what ...)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (- midnight comes around. She'll -)
        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G}{A}           (And cry behind the -)
        {D}{G/D}{A}      (- door)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties, Why -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- silks and linens of ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties, And -)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (- what will she do with ...)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (- Monday comes around, She'll -)
        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}     (And cry behind the door)

guitar  {G}{G}{D}{D}
        {A}{A}{D}{D}
        {G}{G}{D}{D}
        {A}{A}

        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties, For -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- Thursday's child is Sunday's ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (For whom un-shall the morning, A -)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (- blackened shroud, a hand-me ...)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (Of rags and silks, a costume)
        {D}{D}{C/G}      (Fit for one who sits and -)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (- cries)
        {G}{A}{D}{D...   (For all tomorrow's parties)

===============================
"All Tomorrows Parties"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And what will she do and where shall she go
        When midnight comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And what will she do with Thursday's rags
        When Monday comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        And what costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom none will go morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>



and then set capo on 3 fret


          (0) (1) (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) (7) (8)
                       0   1   2   3   4   5
1c# ... --||---|---|-e-|---|---|---|---|---|-...
2G# ... --||---|---|-B-|---|---|---|---|---|-...
3E  ... --||---|---|-G-|---|---|---|---|---|-...
4B  ... --||---|---|-D-|---|---|---|---|---|-...
5F# ... --||---|---|-A-|---|---|---|---|---|-...
6C# ... --||---|---|-E-|---|---|---|---|---|-...



intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor girl wear)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (A hand-me-down dress from who knows where)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (And what will she do and where shall ...)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (When midnight comes around)
        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G}{A}           (And cry behind the -)
        {D}{G/D}{A}      (- door)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor girl wear)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (And what will she do with Thursday's ...)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (When Monday comes around)
        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown)
        {G}{A}           (And cry behind the -)
        {D}{G/D}{A}      (- door)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}           (And -)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (- what costume shall the poor girl wear)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (To all tomorrow's parties)

        {D}{D}{C/G}{D}   (For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown)
        {G}{Em}{A}{A}    (For whom none will go morning)

        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown)
        {G}{G}{A}{A}     (Of rags and silks, a costume)
        {D}{D}{C/G}      (Fit for one who sits and -)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (- cries)
        {G}{A}           (For all tomorrow's -)
        {D}{G/D}{A}{D}   (- parties)
        {D}{G/D}{A}{D}
        {D.A/D.

========================
"All Tomorrow's Parties"
========================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
========================


        What costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        A hand-me-down dress from who knows where
        To all tomorrow's parties

        And where will she go and what will she do
        Oh, when midnight comes around
        Oh Nico, oh oh oh oh oh
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        What costume shall the poor girl wear, ah
        To all tomorrow's parties
        Why silks and linens of yesterday's gowns
        To all tomorrow's parties

        Oh Andy
        What will she do with Thursday's rags, ah ah ah
        When Monday comes around
        She'll turn once more to Sunday's clown
        And cry behind the door

        What costume shall the poor girl wear
        To all tomorrow's parties
        For Thursday's child is Sunday's clown
        For whom none will go morning

        A blackened shroud, a hand-me-down gown
        Of rags and silks, a costume
        Fit for one who sits and cries
        For all tomorrow's parties
        For all tomorrow's parties, ah
        For all tomorrow's parties

        Costume, costume, costume shall the poor girl wear
        Costume, costume, costume ....

        (All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties)
        (All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties)
        ....

        All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties
        All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties
        ....

        All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties
        All tomorrow's parties, all tomorrow's parties
        To all tomorrow's parties

        {A}{D}{A}{A}
        {A}{D}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        ....

<TITLE>Alone At Last</TITLE>

<PRE>
==============================================
"Alone At Last"
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================


        Alone at last
                (Alone at last)
        hello, I must be going
                (hello, I must be going)
        I met myself
                (I met myself)
        a year from today
                (a year from today)
        what a shock
                (oh what a shock)

        Alone at last
                (Alone at last)
        hello, I must be coming
                (hello, I must be coming)
        I ran into myself
                (I ran into myself)
        two years ago today
                (two years ago today)
        what a shock
                (oh what a shock)

        What did that girl look like that
        I never married
                (that I never married)
        I fly into the future and see her
                (I fly into the future and see her)
        with a baby carriage
                (with a baby carriage)
        (You didn't miss much old sport)
        (you'd be in a pauper's court)

        Look into the future, look into the past
        here I am alone at last
        With history gone and tomorrows to come
        I witnessed the invention of the atomic bomb

        (I saw my own death, should I try to prevent it)
        (and if I did, could I live forever)
        (And never age and always be healthy)
        (could I change the times and become very wealthy)

        Would history change
                (Would history change)
        because I had viewed it
                (because I had viewed it)
        alone at last, alone at last
        Alone at last

        (Here I am alone at last)
        (a head on my shoulders, legs under my ass)
        (Before me the future, behind me the past)
        (the present always shifting)

        If I knew what I could do
        one is one (and two is two)
        But this is time I'll travel through

        Alone at last
        future past
        Alone at last
        future past
        (future past)



        {G}{Am}{G}{Am}      (Alone at last, hello, I must ...)
        {G}{Am}{C}{C/C.D}   (I met myself a year from today ...)

        {G}{Am}{G}{Am}      (Alone at last, hello, I must ...)
        {G}{Am}{C}{C}       (I ran into myself two years ...)

        {C}{G}{Am}{G}       (What did that girl look like ...)
        {Am}{G}{C}{C}       (You didn't miss much old sport ...)

        {G}{Am}{G}{Am}      (Look into the future, look ...)
        {G}{Am}{G}{Am}      (- history gone, tomorrows to ...)

        {C}{G}{Am}{G}       (I saw my own death, should I ...)
        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}      (-ever, And never age and always be ...)

        {C}{Am}{Am}{Am}     (- history change because I had ...)
        {G}{G}              (Alone at last)

        {G}{Am}{G}{Am}      (Here I am alone at last, a head ...)
        {G}{Am}{C}{C}       (Before me the future, behind ...)

        {C}{G}{Am}{G}       (If I knew what I could do ...)
        {Am}{G}             (- this is time I'll travel through)

        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}      (Alone at last, future past)
        {Am}{Am}{G...       (Alone at last, future past ...)







===========================================

(Lou Reed, 1997)

        what a shock

        hello, I must be comin'
        I ran into myself two years ago today
        what a shock
        ......

        You didn't miss much old sport
        you'd be in a pauper's court

        here I am alone at last

        and if I did, could I live forever
        And never age and always be healthy
        could I change the times and become very wealthy

        alone at last, alone at last
        Alone at last

        Here I am alone at last
        head on my shoulders, legs under my ass
        Before me the future, behind me the past
        the present always shifting

        If I knew what I, you ..... do
        ah, one is one and two is two
        But this is time I'll travel through

        Alone at last, ooohhh, alone at last, ah
        alone at last
        Alone at last, alone at last
        future past

<TITLE>America (Star Spangled Banner)</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================================================
"America (Star Spangled Banner)"
=========================================================
box set
_Between Thought And Expression - The Lou Reed Anthology_
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Francis Scott Key

* outtake from _Growing Up In Public_ sessions

early 1980
Air Studios, Montserrat
=========================================================


        Oh, say, can you see
        by the dawn's early light
        What so proudly we hailed
        at the twilight's last gleaming
        Whose broad stripes and bright stars
        through the perilous fight
        O'er the ramparts we watched were so
        gallantly streaming

        America, America
        America
        America, America
        America

        And the rockets' red glare
        the bombs bursting in air
        Gave proof through the night
        that our flag was still there
        Oh, say, does that star -
        - spangled banner yet wave
        O'er the land of the free
        and the home of the brave

        America, America
        America
        America, America
        America
        America, America
        America
        America, America
        America
        America, America
        America
        America, America
        ooohhh



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   synthesizer plays Star-Spangled Banner

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (Oh, say, can you see, by the ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (What so proudly we hailed, at ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (Whose broad stripes and bright ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (O'er the ramparts we watched ...)

        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)

guitar  {D}{A}{G}{D}
        {D}{A}{G}{D}

        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (And the rockets' red glare ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (Gave proof through the night ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (Oh, say, does that star ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (O'er the land of the free, and ...)

        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}            (America, America, America)
        {D}{A}{G}{G.A/Bm.C#m}   (America, America)
        {D...                   (ooohhh)




---------------------------------------------------------------------

        {C}{G}{F}{C}            (O'er the ramparts we watched ...)

thanks: Kirill Rodionov (thaumaturge@chat.ru)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

hope to get all the lyrics to the 'previously unreleased' songs..
pretty soon !!! So keep in touch.


"AMERICA"


OH, SAY, can you see, by the dawn's early light, 
What so proudly we hailed at the twilight's last gleaming,
Whose broad stripes and bright stars through the perilous fight,
O'er the ramparts we watched were so gallantly streaming?

AMERICA.....       AMERICA......     AMERICA.......

And the rockets' red glare, the bombs bursting in air,
Gave proof thro' the night that our flag was still there.
Oh, say, does that star-spangled banner yet wave
O'er the land of the free, and the home of the brave!

AMERICA.....       AMERICA......     AMERICA.......


Posted by KIRILL from RUSSIA

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Andy's Chest</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Andy's Chest"
===================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        If I could be anything
        in the world that flew
        I would be a bat and come
        swooping after you
        And if the last time you were here
        things were a bit askew

        Well you know what happens after dark
        When rattlesnakes lose their skins and their hearts
        And all the missionaries lose their bark

        Oh, all the trees are calling after you
        And all the venom snipers after you
        Are all the mountains bolder after you

        If I could be any one of the things
        in this world that bite
        Instead of an indentured ocelot on a leash
        I'd rather be a kite
        And be tied to the end of your string
        and flying in the air, baby, at night

        'Cause you know what they say about honey bears
        When you shave off all their baby hair
        You have a hairy minded pink bare bear

        And all the bells are rolling out for you
        And stones are all erupting out for you
        And all the cheap bloodsuckers are flying after you

        Yesterday Daisy May and Biff
        were groovin' on the street
        And just like in a movie
        her hands became her feet
        Her belly button was her mouth
        which meant she tasted what she'd speak, ooohhh

        But the funny thing is what happened to her nose, ooohhh
        It grew until it reached all of her toes, ooohhh
        Now when people say her feet smell they mean her nose

        And curtains laced with diamonds dear for you
        And all the Roman noblemen for you
        And kingdom's Christian soldiers dear for you
        And melting ice cap mountains tops for you
        Oh-oh, and knights in flaming silver robes for you
        And bats that with a kiss turn prince for you
        Swoop-swoop, oh baby, rock-rock
        Swoop-swoop, rock-rock
        Swoop-swoop, rock-rock



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {E}{E}{Asus4}{A}   (If I could be anything ...)
        {E}{E}{Asus4}{A}   (I would be a bat and come ...)
        {E}{E}{Asus4}{A}   (- if the last time you were ...)

        {F}{C}{G}{G}       (- know what happens after dark ...)
        {F}{C}{G}{G}       (- rattlesnakes lose their ...)
        {F}{C}{G}{G}       (And all the missionaries lose ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}       (Oh, all the trees are calling ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}       (And all the venom snipers ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}       (Are all the mountains bolder ...)

        ....




* riff (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

  - know what happens after dark 
     {F}      {C}      {G}      {G}

*2A ---------------------------------------
*3F ---------------------------------------   ...
*4C --3---2-0--------------------5---------
*5G -----------3---2-0---------------------
*6D --------------------3------------------




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords and tabs for standard-tuning

        {D}{D}{Gsus4}{G}   (I would be a bat and come ...)
        {D}{D}{Gsus4}{G}   (- if the last time you were ...)

        {D#}{A#}{F}{F}     (- know what happens after dark ...)
        {D#}{A#}{F}{F}     (- rattlesnakes lose their ...)
        {D#}{A#}{F}{F}     (And all the missionaries lose ...)

        {C}{F}{G}{G}       (Oh, all the trees are calling ...)
        {C}{F}{G}{G}       (And all the venom snipers ...)

        ....

==============================
"Andy's Chest"
==============================
album _VU_
(The Velvet Underground, 1985)

May 13, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
==============================


        If I could be anything
        in the world that flew
        I would be a bat and come
        swooping after you
        And if the last time you were here
        they were a bit askew

        Well you know what happens after dark
        When rattlesnakes lose their skins and their hearts
        And all the missionaries lose their bark

        Oh, all the trees are calling after you
        And all the venom snipers after you
        Are all the mountains bolder after you

        If I could be any one
        of the things in this world that bite
        Instead of an identured ocelot on a leash
        I'd rather be a kite
        Be tied to the end of your string
        flying in the air at night

        'Cause you know what they say about honey bears
        When you shave off all their baby hair
        You have a hairy minded pink bare bear

        And all the bells are rolling out for you
        And all the stones are erupting out for you
        And all the cheap luck suckers are flying after you

        Yesterday Daisy May and Biff
        were grooving on the street
        And just like in a movie
        her hands became her feet
        Her belly button was her mouth
        which meant she tasted what she'd speak

        But the funny thing is what happened to her nose
        It grew until it reached all of her toes
        Now when people say her feet smell they mean her nose

        And all the curtains laced with diamonds for you
        And all the Roman noblemen for you
        And kingdom's Christian sailors dear for you
        And melting ice cap mountain tops for you
        And knights in flaming silver robes for you
        And bats that with a kiss turn prince for you
        Swoop-swoop, rock-rock
        Roll-roll, swoop-swoop
        Rock-rock, roll-roll



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {E}{E}{Asus4}{A}      (If I could be anything ...)
        {E}{E}{Asus4}{A}      (I would be a bat and come ...)
        {E}{E}{D}{A}          (- if the last time you were ...)

        {Dm/Em}{F/F#}{G}{G}   (- know what happens after dark ...)
        {Dm/Em}{F/F#}{G}{G}   (- rattlesnakes lose their ...)
        {Dm/Em}{F/F#}{G}{G}   (- all the missionaries lose ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- all the trees are calling ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- all the venom snipers after ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- all the mountains bolder ...)

        ...

g.solo  {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{A}

        ...

        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- all the curtains laced with ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- all the Roman Noblemen for ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- kingdom's Christian sailors ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- melting ice cap mountain ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- knights in flaming silver ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (- bats that with a kiss turn ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}          (Rock-rock, roll-roll)
        ... fade out

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: clayton m (claytooon@hotmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

line 08: When rattlesnakes "lose" their skins and their hearts


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Tom Murray (murlock@nycap.rr.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

However, I'm nearly positive that the lyric from
Andy's Chest is not either of the following:

        If I could be any one
        of the things in this world that bite
****    Instead of attention or slow on a leash
****    I'd rather be your kite

        If I could be any one of the things
        in this world that bite
****    Instead of being a tethered ocelot on a leash
****    I'd rather be your kite

Rather, it is:

        If I could be any one of the things
        in this world that bite
        Instead of a dentured ocelot on a leash
        I'd rather be a kite

I could be wrong,
but if you listen to the song a few times with that lyric in mind,
I think you'll find it sounds right.
It drove me nuts trying to figure out
what he was saying at that point in the song,
until a friend told me.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

<PRE>
=========================
"Animal Language"
=========================
album _Sally Can't Dance_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        Miss Riley had a dog
        she used to keep it in her back yard
        And when the dog began to bark
        all the neighbors began to shout
        Then came a stormy night
        Miss Riley let her dog out
        And when the neighbors found him round
        they put a gun down his mouth and shot him down
        and he went -

        Ooohhh wow, bow wow
        Ooohhh wow, bow wow

        Miss Murphy had a cat
        on her lap it sat
        And once in a great big while
        it looked like that Cheshire Cat did smile
        But often it used to chase
        anything that crossed its face
        But one day it got so hot
        that Cheshire Cat had a blood clot
        and she said -

        Ooohhh meow, me meow
        Ooohhh meow, me meow

        Meow

        Then the dog met the cat
        the dog was hot and the cat was wet
        Then in came some sweaty dude
        he put a board between the two
        Then they couldn't get at it
        got frustrated all about it
        So they did the only thing you could do
        they took the dude's sweat and shot it up between the two
        and they said -

        Ooohhh wow, bow wow
        Ooohhh wow, bow, meow, wow




intro   .x}              drums
        {D}{A}{F}{G}
        {D}{A}{F}{G}     (Wow wow)

        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Miss Riley had a dog ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (And when the dog began to bark ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Then came a stormy night ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (And when the neighbors found him ...)

chorus  {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Ooohhh wow, bow wow)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Ooohhh wow, bow wow)

        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Miss Murphy had a cat ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (And once in a great big while ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (But often it used to chase ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (But one day it got so hot ...)

chorus  {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Ooohhh meow, me meow)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Ooohhh meow, me meow)

guitar  {D}{A}{F}{G}     (Meow)
        {D}{A}{F}{G}

        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Then the dog met the cat ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Then in came some sweaty dude ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Then they couldn't get at it ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (So they did the only thing you could ...)

        {D}{A}{G}{D}     (Ooohhh wow, bow, meow, wow)

        {D}{A}{G}{D...

<PRE>
=======================
"Annabel Lee/The Bells"
=======================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
=======================



Annabel Lee:

        Let the burial rite begin
        The funeral song be sung
        An anthem for the queenliest dead
        That ever died so young

        Sweet Lenore has gone before
        Taking hope that flew beside
        Leaving instead the wild dead child
        That should have been your bride

        It was many and many a year ago
        In a kingdom by the sea
        She was a child and you were a child
        In the kingdom by the sea

        But the moon never beams
        The stars never rise
        No angels envy thee
        For Ligeia rests dead
        With three winged seraphs
        In this kingdom by the sea

        Wedded darkly
        Soul to soul
        You shrink in size
        Down to a mole
        And disappear into the hole
        Of the dark mind's imaginings

        Shrinking

        Shrinking

        Shrinking

<TITLE>Are You Falling In Love</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
==========================
"Are You Falling In Love"
==========================
demo
(Lou Reed, 1971)

written by Lou Reed

* a.k.a. "Falling In Love"

1971
NYC
==========================



        please post lyrics to
        wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)
(or a half-tone down ??? I'm not sure the pitch.)



        {D}{D}{G}{G}       (When you .... made me cry ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}       (- ...., When you walk away I ....)

        {F}{G}{Fmaj9}{G}   (Ooohhh ......)
        {Fmaj9}{G}         (Oh my baby, Are you -)
        {C}{C}{F}{F}       (- fallin', are you fallin' in -)
        {G}{F}{G}{F}       (- love, fallin' in love ...)
        {G}{F}             (- love ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}       (When you ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}       (- feet, What can I say, you know ....)

        {F}{G}{Fmaj9}{G}   (Ooohhh ......)
        {Fmaj9}{G}         (Oh .... my baby, Are you -)
        {C}{C}{F}{F}       (- fallin', hey, are you fallin' in -)
        {G}{F}{G}{F}       (- love, ..... are you fallin' in ...)
        {G}{F}{G...        (Woh, fallin' in love .... ooohhh)




* Fmaj9 chord (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

*1d ---3---
*2A ---1---
*3F ---2---
*4C ---3---
*5G -------
*6D -------




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Aaron (pulpalittlesoul@yahoo.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

i thought i'd send in a little chord correction..
on the lou demo 'are you falling in love',
youve presented the third chord of the chorus as 'F6' ...
actually the chord you have there
(which is an F major chord with a G note on the E string)
is called F major 9th, or Fmaj9 for short.
F6 is a different chord altogether -
it has the same notes as Dm7 (F, D, A, C).
the sixth note in the F scale is D, not G.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
chords transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

<PRE>
=====================
"Average Guy"
=====================
album _The Blue Mask_
(Lou Reed, 1982)

written by Lou Reed
=====================


        I ain't no Christian or no born-again saint
        I ain't no cowboy or a Marxist D.A.
        I ain't no criminal or Reverend Cripple from the right
        I am just your average guy, trying to do what's right

        I'm just your average guy
        an average guy
        I am just your average guy
        I'm just an average guy

        Average guy, I'm just your average guy
        I'm average looking and I'm average inside
        I'm an average lover and I live in an average place
        you wouldn't know me if you met me face to face

        I'm just your average guy
        average guy
        Average guy
        I'm just an average guy

        I worry about money and taxes and such
        I worry that my liver's big and it hurts to the touch
        I worry about my health and bowels
        and the crime waves in the street
        I'm really just your average guy
        trying to stand on his own two feet

        I'm just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        average guy

        Average looks, average taste
        average height, an average waist
        Average in everything I do
        my temperature is 98.2

        I'm just your average guy
        an average guy
        Average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        Average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        Average

=======================
"Average Guy"
=======================
album _Live In Italy_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

Sep 07 (or 10), 1983
Verona (or Rome), Italy

        I ain't no Christian or no born-again saint
        I ain't no criminal or no Marxist D.A.

        I am just your average guy, trying to do what's right

        oh, your average guy
        I'm just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy

        I'm average looking and I'm average inside
        I got an average place and I lived in an average place
        you wouldn't recognize me if you met me face to face

        I'm just your average guy
        your average guy
        Baby, just your average guy
        I'm just your average guy

        I worry 'bout money, taxes and such
        I worry that my liver's big and it hurts to the touch
        I worry about crime waves and battles in the street
        I'm really just your average guy, trying to .... his feet

        I'm just your average guy
        your average guy
        Your average guy
        your average guy

        average look, average waist
        I'm average in everything I do
        my temperature is 98.2

        your average guy
        Your average guy
        your average guy
        Average guy

<TITLE>Aye Co'lorado</TITLE>

<PRE>
============================
"Aye Co'lorado"
============================
album _Urban Desire_
(Genya Ravan, 1978)

written by
Genya Ravan/Charles Giordano

Lou Reed: vocals (duet)
============================


        Well I'm so tired of your lyin'
        tryin' to paint a pretty picture, boy
        it's down right embarrassin' to me
        Hey, I know you're a hitter
        from the corner of the city
        just a cool Puerto Rican on the scene

        I'd spill myself out on the table
        if for one time I were able
        to get it up on the roof and just do
        But I'm always getting wasted
        by the man I call my best friend
        that I met under the third El Avenue

        I said, oh Co'lorado, Co'lorado
        Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen desperado

        You wake up every mornin'
        with the sweat pourin' down you
        while you're starin' down you new used shiny gun
        Hey, I caught you in the parlour
        cause you know it made the girls holler
        across your arm a tattoo reading, mom

        Hey, it's me that's rejected
        cause your splittin's so perfected
        yeah, I'm a Puerto Rican and man, I'm gettin' so mean
        I know it's my porno mind
        that makes you feel it's worth the grind
        that rollin' look so I'll try and keep a clean machine

        I said, oh Co'lorado, hey Co'lorado
        Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen desperado

        Oh Co'lorado, Co'lorado

        Hey, I'll catch ya down on Rivington and Ridge
        all right, baby
        I'll wait there till you make your switch

        Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen desperado



intro   /C}                    piano
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}
clap.   {C}{C}{C}              (Well I'm so -)

Genya   {C}{C}{C}{C}           (- tired of your lyin'...)
        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}      (- know you're a hitter ...)

Lou     {C}{C}{C}{C}           (-self out on the table ...)
        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}      (- always getting wasted by the ...)

chorus  {A#}{F}{C}{C}          (- oh Co'lorado, Co'lorado)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C/C.C#}     (Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen ...)

Genya   {C}{C}{C}{C}           (- wake up every mornin' ...)
        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}      (- caught you in the parlour ...)

Lou     {C}{C}{C}{C}           (- it's me that's rejected ...)
        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}      (- it's my porno mind ...)

chorus  {A#}{F}{C}{C}          (- oh Co'lorado, Co'lorado)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C/C.C#}     (Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen ...)

        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}

        {D#}{F}{G#/A#}{C}

        {A#}{F}{C}{C}          (Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen ...)
clap.   {C}{C. break (clap ...)

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

thanks: Simon Flint (simon.flint@reedbusiness.com.au)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Note:
These are official, as taken from the album sleeve.


Well, I'm so tired of your lyin'
Tryin' to paint a pretty picture, boy,
It's down right embarrassin' to me
Hey, I know you're a hitter
From the corner of the city,
Just a cool Puerto Rican on the scene

I'd spill myself out on the table
If for one time I were able to get
It up on the roof and just do
But, I'm always getting wasted by the
Man I call my best friend
That I met under the third El Avenue

I said, Aye Co'lorado, Co'lorado
Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen desperado

You wake up every mornin with the
Sweat pourin' down you
While you're starin' down you new used shiny gun
And when I caught you in the parlour
Cause you know it made the girls holler
Across your arm a tattoo reading, Mom

Hey it's me that's rejected cause your
Splittin's so perfected
Yea, I'm a Puerto Rican,
And man, I'm gettin so mean
I know it's my porno mind
That makes you feel it's worth the grind
That rollin look so I'll try and keep
A clean machine

I said, Aye Co'lorado Co'lorado
Aye Co'lorado Hell's kitchen desperado
Aye Co'lorado Hey Co'lorado
I'll catch ya down on Rivington and Ridge

Yeah I'll wait there till you make your switch
Aye Co'lorado, Hell's kitchen desperado

<PRE>
=========================
"Baby Face"
=========================
album _Sally Can't Dance_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        Jim, living with you's not such fun
        You're not the only one
        You don't have the looks
        you're not the person that you used to be
        And there are people on the street that would go for me

        And I said no no no no no
        baby face
        And I said no no no no no
        baby face

        I met you in a bar in L.A.
        I was not feeling so good
        You did the proper moves
        you did everything that you should
        But now you're making a mistake
        and somebody else will take your place
        You're taking drugs over me

        And I said no no no no no
        I said now no no no no no
        I said now no no no no no
        baby face
        I said now no no no no no
        baby face

        You're not the kind of person
        it's easy to live with in a house
        I cook all your meals
        I make sure that you work out
        But lately it's been gettin' so hard
        (man you don't split your stash or your bread)
        the way you talk, ooohhh, the way you walk
        (you can keep it)
        And I'm not sure exactly what it's all about

        And I said no no no no no
        baby face
        I said now no no no no no
        baby face
        I said now no no no
        I said now no no no no
        ooohhh baby face, ah huh, ooohhh
        No no baby, baby
        No way now baby face
        uh uh
        (you can keep it, just keep it)

<TITLE>Balloon</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Balloon"
================================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed

sung by Kate and Anna McGarrigle
================================


        I'm a little balloon and I get puffed up
        squeeze me and bend me it's never enough
        Put your lips around me, blow me up
        but if you prick me I will pop

        I'm a little balloon full and firm
        here is my aft and here is my stern
        Here's my lips and here's my hose
        put me down or I will burst

        If you prick me I will burst




        * a cappella








==================================
"I'm A Balloon"
==================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

performed by actor

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
==================================


        I'm a little balloon and I get puffed up
        squeeze me and bend me it's never enough
        Put your lips around me and blow me up
        but if you prick me I will pop

        I'm a little balloon full and firm
        here is my aft and here's my stern
        Here's my lips and here's my hose
        put me down or I will burst
        If you prick me
        I will burst




        * a cappella




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

"Banging On My Drum"
===========================
album _Rock And Roll Heart_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
===========================


        I'm banging on my drum
        I'm banging on my drum
        Then banging on my drum, boy
        and I'm having lots of fun
        I'm banging on my drums, yeah
        I'm banging on my drums
        I'm banging on my drum, now baby
        and I'm having lots of fun

        I'm banging on my drum
        I'm banging on my drum
        I'm banging on my drums, boy
        and I'm having lots of fun
        I'm banging on my one, huh, my one
        yeah, my-my drum
        I'm banging on my one, my drums, my one
        I'm banging on my drum
        Yeah, I'm banging on my drums, yeah
        yeah, I'm banging on my drum
        Yeah, I'm banging on my drums now-now
        and I'm having lots of fun-fun-fun

        Yeah

        {D}{E}{A}{A}   (- drum, now baby, and I'm having ...)

        {D}{A}{D}{A}   (I'm banging on my -)

<TITLE>Baton Rouge</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Baton Rouge"
===================
album _Ecstasy_
(Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        When I think of you Baton Rouge
        I think of a mariachi band
        I think of sixteen and a crisp green football field
        I think of the girl I never had

        When I think of you Baton Rouge
        I think of a back seat in a car
        The windows are foggy and so are we
        as the police asked for our I.D.

        So helpless
        so helpless

        Ooohhh, so helpless
        ooohhh, so helpless
        Ooohhh, so helpless
        so helpless

        Well I once had a car lost it in a divorce
        the judge was a woman of course
        She said give her the car and the house and your taste
        or else I set the trial date

        So now when I think of you Baton Rouge
        and the deep southern belles, ah, with their touch
        I wonder where love ends and hate starts to blush
        in the fields in the swamps in the rush

        In the terra-cotta cobwebs of your mind, ah
        when did you start seeing me as a spider spinning web
        Of malicious intent and you as poor poor me
        at the fire at the joint, this disinterred and broken mount
        in the bedroom in the house where we were unmarried

        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless

        When was I the villain in your heart
        putting the brake on your start
        you slapped my face and cried and screamed
        that's what marriage came to mean
        The bitterest ending of a dream

        You wanted children and I did not
        was that what it was all about
        You might get a laugh when you hear me shout
        you might get a laugh when you hear me shout
        I wish I had


        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless

        Sometimes when I think of Baton Rouge
        I see us with two and a half strapping sons
        One and a half flushed daughters preparing to marry
        and two fat grandsons I can barely carry

        Daddy, uncle, family gathered there for grace
        a dog in a barbecue pit goes up in space
        The dream recedes in the morning with a bad aftertaste
        and I'm back in the big city worn from the race of the chase
        what a waste

        So thanks for the card the announcement of child
        and I must say you and Sam look great
        Your daughter's gleaming in that white wedding dress
        with pride
        sad to say I could never bring that to you that wide smile

        So I try not to think of Baton Rouge
        or of a, of a, of a mariachi band
        Or of sixteen and a crisp green football field
        and the girl, and the girl I never had, had, had, had

        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless




                             (When I think of -)

        {Am/D}{G}{Am/D}{G}   (- sixteen and a crisp green ...)

        {Am/D}{G}{Am/D}{G}   (- think of Baton Rouge, I see us ...)
        {Am/D}{G}{Am/D}{G}   (- daughters preparing to marry ...)

        {Am/D}{G}{Am/D}{G}   (- bad aftertaste, and I'm back in ...)

==================================
"Baton Rouge"
==================================
album _I Will Break Your Fall._
reissue CD bonus track
(Fernando Saunders, 2006)

Lou Reed: duet, lead vocal, guitar
==================================


        When I think of you Baton Rouge
        I think of a mariachi band
        I think of sixteen and a crisp green football field
        I think of the girl I never had

        When I think of you Baton Rouge
        I think of a back seat in a car
        The windows are foggy and so are we
        as the police asked for our I.D.

        So helpless
        so helpless

        Ooohhh, so helpless
        ooohhh, so helpless
        Ooohhh, so helpless
        so helpless

        I once had a car lost it in a divorce
        yes, the judge was a woman of course, haha..
        She said give her the car, the house and your taste
        or else I set the trial date

        So when I think of you Baton Rouge
        and the deep southern belles, ah, with their touch
        I wonder where love ends and hate starts to blush
        in the fields in the swamps in the rush

        In the terra-cotta cobwebs of your mind, ah
        when did you start seeing me as a spider spinning web
        Of malicious intent and you as poor poor me
        at the fire at the joint, this disinterred and broken mount
        in the bedroom in the house where we were unmarried

        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless, ooohhh
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless

        When was I the villain in your heart
        putting the brakes on your start
        you slapped my face and cried and screamed
        that's what marriage came to mean
        The bitterest ending of a dream

        You wanted children and I did not
        was that what it was all about
        You might laugh when you hear me shout
        you might laugh when you hear me shout
        I wish I had


        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless, ooohhh
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless

        Sometimes when I think of Baton Rouge
        I see us with two and a half strapping sons
        One and a half flushed daughters preparing to marry
        and two fat grandsons I can barely carry

        Daddy, uncle, family gathered there for grace
        a dog in a barbecue pit goes up in space
        The dream recedes in the morning with a bad aftertaste
        and I'm back in the big city worn from the race of the chase
        what a waste

        So thanks for the card the announcement of child
        and I must say you and Sam look great
        Your daughter's gleaming in that white wedding dress
        with pride
        sad to say I could never bring that to you that wide smile

        So I try not to think of Baton Rouge
        or of a, of a, of a mariachi band
        Or of sixteen and a crisp green football field
        and the girl, and the girl I never had, had, had, had

        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless, ooohhh
        So helpless, so helpless
        so helpless




* chords: same as _Ecstasy_ version

thanks: Taco Veenstra (taco@tppveenstra.myweb.nl)

They are the exact words he sings,
not just lyrics I copied from the booklet.



Baton rouge
------------

I think of a Mariachi band
I think of 16 and a crisp green football field
I think of the girl I never had

I think of a back seat in a car

as the police asked for our ID

Lost it in a divorce

She said give her the car and the house and your taste
or else I set the trial date

So now when I think of you Baton Rouge
and the deep southern belles with their touch
I wonder where love ends and hate starts to blush
in the fields in the swamps in the rush

When did you start seeing me
as a spider spinning web
of malicious intent

at the fire at the joint

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Rouge</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Rouge"
(instrumental)
===================
album _Ecstasy_
(Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed
===================



        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}       strings and bass
        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}

        {C}{G}{C}{G}
        {C}{G}{C..







==============================================================
"Rouge"
(extended version)
==============================================================
from the film _Before Night Falls_
(directed by Julian Schnabel, 2000)

* note: listed as "Baton Rouge" at the end credit of the film.
==============================================================



        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}       strings and bass
        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}

        {C}{G}{C}{G}
break   {C}{G}{C..

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}

        {C}{G}{C}{G}
break   {C}{G}{C..

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}

        {Am}{G}{Am}{G}
        {Am}{G}{C}{G}
        {G... fade out

<TITLE>The Bed</TITLE>

<PRE>
===================
"The Bed"
===================
album _Berlin_
(Lou Reed, 1973)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        This is the place where she lay her head
        when she went to bed at night
        And this is the place our children were conceived
        candles lit the room brightly at night

        And this is the place where she cut her wrists
        that odd and fateful night
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling

        This is the place where we used to live
        I paid for it with love and blood
        And these are the boxes that she kept on the shelf
        filled with her poetry and stuff

        And this is the room where she took the razor
        and cut her wrists that strange and fateful night
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling

        I never would have started if I'd known
        that it'd end this way
        But funny thing, I'm not at all sad
        that it stopped this way

        This is the place where she lay her head
        when she went to bed at night
        And this is the place our children were conceived
        candles lit the room brightly at night

        And this is the place where she cut her wrists
        that odd and fateful night
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling
        And I said, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, what a feeling




* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)




intro   {A}{G}{F/G}{A}
        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}

        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (This is the place ...)
        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (And this is the place ...)

        {A}{D}{Bm}{D}               (And this is the place ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A/G.F.G}{A}   (- said, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A/G.F.G}{A}   (- said, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)

        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}
        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}

        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (This is the place ...)
        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (And these are the boxes ...)

        {A}{D}{Bm}{D}               (And this is the room ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A/G.F.G}{A}   (- said, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A/G.F.G}{A}   (- said, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)

bridge  {A}{A}{D}{D}                (I never would have ...)
        {B}{B}{G(onA)}{F(onA)}      (But funny thing ...)
        {Dm7}{E}

        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (This is the place ...)
        {A}{G}{F/G}{A}              (And this is the place ...)

        {A}{D}{Bm}{D}               (And this is the place ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A/G.F.G}{A}   (- oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)
        {Bm/C#m}{D/E}{A...          (- oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh ...)

        ... S.E. into "Sad Song"

    This is the place where she lay her head
