*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








===============================
"Black Angels Death Song"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        The myriad choices of his fate
        set themselves out upon a plate for him to choose
        What had he to lose

        Not a ghost-bloodied country all covered with sleep
        where the black angel did weep
        not an old city street in the east
        Gone to choose

        And the Rally Man's patter ran on through the dawn
        Until we said so long to his skull
        Shrill yell

        Shining brightly, red-rimmed and red-lined with the time
        effused with the mind on ice skates scraping bells
        from the chunks
        Say so long

        Cut mouth bleeding razors make it hard to forget
        where you come from
        the stools of your eyes serve to realize pain
        Ooohhh, come again

        And Roberman's refrain of the sacrilege recluse
        for the loss of a horse
        went the bowels in the tail of a rat
        Gone to choose, choose to go

        If epiphanies terror reduced you to shame
        have your head bobbed and weaved
        choose a side
        To be on

        If the stone glances off split didactics in two
        lay the color of the mouse trails
        all's green try between, but if you choose
        Oh, if you choose, choose to lose
        for the loss of refrain come and start
        Start the game
        I chi-chi, chi-chi I
        chi-chi-chi, ka-ta-ko, if you choose
        choose to lose, choose to go



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




intro   {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}                       (The myriad ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- choose ...)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}                          (- lose, Not a -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}   (- ghost ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- east, Gone to -)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}            (- choose ...)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}             (- Rally Man's ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- skull, Shrill -)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}                          (- yell, Shining -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}   (- brightly ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- chunks, Say so -)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}            (- long ...)

        {Dsus2}                                 (Cut -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}   (- mouth ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- pain ...)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}                          (- again, And -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}   (- Roberman's ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- rat, Gone to -)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}                          (- choose ...)

        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}            (If -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}             (- epiphanies ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- side, To be -)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}            (- on, If the -)

        {Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}{Em/Dsus2}   (- stone ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- choose, Oh ...)
        {Dsus2}{Em}{Dsus2}{Em}                  (- choose ...)
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Em}{Dsus2}               (- game, I chi ...)
        {Em}{Dsus2}{Em}{Dsus2}                  (-ko, if you ...)

        {Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}{Dsus2}
        {Dsus2}{Dsus2...




* Dsus2 chord (1 + 1/2 down)

      Dsus2
*1c# ---0---
*2G# ---3---
*3E  ---2---
*4B  ---0---
*5F# -------
*6C# -------








===============================================
"Black Angels Death Song"
===============================================
album _American Poet Box: Lou Reed - Paris '72_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

Jan 25 (?), 1972
Paris, France
(rehearsal)
===============================================


        The myriad choices of his fate
        set themselves out upon a plate for him to choose
        What had he to lose

        Not a ghost-bloodied country all covered with sleep
        where the black angel did weep
        not an old city street in the east
        Gone to choose

        Wandering's brother walked on through the dawn
        with his hair, in his face
        long a long splintered cut from the knife
        Of G.T.

        Rally Man's patter ran on through the dawn
        Until we said so long to his skull
        Shrill yell

        Shining brightly, red-rimmed and red-lined with the time
        effused with the choice
        of the mind on ice skates scraping chunks
        From the bells, say so long

        Cut mouth bleeding razors forget in the pain
        antiseptic remains coo goodbye
        So you fly to the cozy brown snow of the east
        Gone to choose, choose again

        Roberman's refrain of the sacrilege recluse
        for the loss of a horse
        went the bowels in the tail of a rat
        Choose to go

        If the stone glances off split didactics in two
        lay the color of the mouse trails
        all's green try between
        If you choose, choose to lose
        for the loss of remain come and start
        Start the game
        I chi-chi, chi-chi I
        ka-ta-ko, if you choose
        choose to lose, choose to go




* chords: same as _Le Bataclan '72_ version

<TITLE>Black Building</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================================
"Black Building"
===================================
album _No Balance Palace_
(Kashmir, 2005)

written by
Kasper Eistrup/Henrik Lindstrand/
Asger Engholm Techau/Mads Tunebjerg

Lou Reed: spoken word
===================================


        I've passed that little black building down on the corner
        so many times
        and I often wondered if anyone lived there

        It looked like an empty dwelling with its cracked faade
        dusty windows
        curtains withdrawn
        no lights, no signs of anything

        I talked to Jewel about it
        she had the same idea

        That old guy that always hangs out
        outside the liquor store next door

        Reghmann

        told me he'd once seen the devil
        in one of those windows up there
        blowing him a kiss

        He had a certain serious
        almost eerie look on his face as he said it
        as if he'd actually seen the dark Lord
        said he'd seen him throw trash out of the back window
        that he'd been stealing the furniture
        from whatever bars closed down in the neighbourhood
        but he's an old guy
        probably delirious

        So anyway the other day me and Ricco decided to break in

        to see what the dark palace was really all about
        (it had a long tall hallway)
        it had a long tall hallway
        that led to a staircase in the back
        and on the right side
        I counted
        seven doors




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>

"Blind Rage"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

===================

        sneaking up and down the hall
        I can't stand it anymore
        I can't stand it anymore

        sneaking up and down the hall
        I can't stand it anymore
        I can't stand it anymore

        I'm in a blind rage

        Blind rage
        blind rage
        Blind rage

        blocking out the stars and moon
        I fear you will attack me soon
        who goes there

        blocking out the stars and moon
        I fear you will attack me soon
        who goes there

        Blind rage
        blind rage

        Blind rage
        blind rage
        I'm in a blind rage

        Blind rage
        you're making me scared
        blind rage
        make me scared
        Blind rage

        Blind rage
        blind rage
        Blind rage

        Blind rage
        blind rage

<PRE>
==============================================
"Blood Of The Lamb"
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================


        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb is unforgiving
        I'd rather have the head from the King of Siam
        or the heart of a prince from Pakistan

        Who do you think you're kidding
        this sacrifice is unforgiven
        Next thing kill me a firstborn son
        bring me the cock of a tortured bull
        The hand, the foot, the tongue
        the brain of a man

        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb is unforgiving
        Bring me the ears of a pharaoh's wife
        barbaric love masquerades as hate

        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb is unforgiving
        Blood on the altar, blood on the feet
        blood on the landscape, oh what a creep
        A river of blood is like a river of piss
        to me

        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb is unforgiving
        The tooth of a king, the scalp of a queen
        the light of the stars, the start of a scream

        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb can't be forgiven
        Blood on the hands, blood on the feet
        blood in the alleys, blood in the street
        Blood that won't wash off a river of piss
        to me

        Who do you think you're kidding
        Who do you think you're kidding

        Who do you think you're kidding
        the blood of the lamb can't be forgiven
        Who do you think you're kidding
        who do you think you're kidding
        Just a blood of the lamb
        can't be forgiven



intro            {G}     count
        {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{A}{A}

        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (Who do you think you're kidding ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (I'd rather have the head from the ...)

        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (Who do you think you're kidding ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (Next thing kill me a firstborn son ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (The hand, the foot, the tongue ...)

        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (Who do you think you're kidding ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (Bring me the ears of a pharaoh's wife ...)

        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (Who do you think you're kidding ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (Blood on the altar, blood on the feet ...)
break   {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (A river of blood is like a river of ...)

        {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}

        {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}

        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (Who do you think you're kidding ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (The tooth of a king, the scalp of a ...)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Blue Mask</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=====================
"The Blue Mask"
=====================
album _The Blue Mask_
(Lou Reed, 1982)

written by Lou Reed
=====================


        They tied his arms behind his back
        to teach him how to swim
        They put blood in his coffee
        and milk in his gin
        They stood over the soldier
        in the midst of the squalor
        There was war in his body
        and it caused his brain to holler

        Make the sacrifice
        mutilate my face
        If you need someone to kill
        I'm a man without a will
        Wash the razor in the rain
        let me luxuriate in pain
        Please don't set me free
        death means a lot to me

        The pain was lean and it made him scream
        he knew he was alive
        They put a pin through the nipples on his chest
        he thought he was a saint
        I've made love to my mother, killed my father and brother
        what am I to do
        When a sin goes too far, it's like a runaway car
        it cannot be controlled

        Spit upon his face and scream
        there's no Oedipus today
        This is no play you're thinking you are in
        what will you say
        Take the blue mask down from my face
        and look me in the eye
        I get a thrill from punishment
        I've always been that way

        I loathe and despise repentance
        you are permanently stained
        Your weakness buys indifference
        and indiscretion in the streets
        Dirty's what you are and clean is what you're not
        you deserve to be soundly beat

        Make the sacrifice
        take it all the way
        There's no "won't" high enough
        to stop this desperate day
        Don't take death away
        cut the finger at the joint
        Cut the stallion at his mount
        and stuff it in his mouth



* Lou Reed (right channel): standard-tuning



intro   {D...                   feedback

        {D...
        {G...
        {D...
        {G...
        {D...
        {G...

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

verse   {D}{D}{G/{D}{D}   (They tied his arms behind his ...)
        {D}{D}{G/{D}{D}   (They put blood in his coffee ...)
        {D}{D}{G/{D}{D}   (They stood over the soldier ...)
        {D}{D}{G/{D}{D}   (There was war in his body, and ...)

chorus  {G}{D}{G}{D}      (Make the sacrifice, mutilate ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}      (If you need someone to kill ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}      (Wash the razor in the rain ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}      (Please don't set me free ...)
        {D}

        ...

        ...

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        ... repeat




* verse (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

They tied his arms behind his back  to teach him how to swim
     {E}           {E}             {A   / {E}         {E}
*1d --0...---------------------------------0...---------------------
*2A --0...---------------------------------0...---------------------
*3F --1...--------------------------2------1...---------------------
*4C --2...--------------------------2------2...---------------------
*5G --2...--------------------------0--x---2...---------------------
*6D --0...-----------------------------3v--0...---------------------




* chorus (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

 Make the sacrifice          mutilate my face
     {A}       {E}          {A}       {E}
*1d ------------0----0-----------------0----0-------------------
*2A ------------0----0-----------------0----0-------------------
*3F --2---------1----1-------2---------1----1-------------------
*4C --2---------2----2-------2---------2----2-------------------
*5G --0---x-----2----2-------0---x-----2----2-------------------
*6D ------3v----0----0-----------3v----0----0-------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

==============================
"Blues jam"
==============================
rehearsal
(The Velvet Underground, 1966)

written by ? (jam)

Jan 03, 1966
The Factory, NYC
==============================



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   ...B7/B7}{E.B7/B7}{E.B7/B7}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}                  ( ....)
        {A}{A}{E.

        ...tape skipped...

                 .E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.B7/B7}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E.E7...

<TITLE>Bo Diddley</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=================================================
"Bo Diddley"
=================================================
unreleased live
(Maureen Tucker/Sterling Morrison/Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Ellas McDaniel

Lou Reed: lead guitar, background vocals

Feb 20, 1992
Casino de Paris, Paris, France
=================================================


        Bo Diddley bought his babe a diamond ring
        if that diamond ring don't shine
        He gonna take it to a private eye
        hey, if that private eye can't see
        He'd better not take the ring from me

        Hey, Bo Diddley caught a bear cat
        to make his pretty baby a Sunday hat
        Bo Diddley caught a nanny goat
        to make his pretty baby a Sunday coat

        Hey, mojo come to my house, my black cat bone
        take my baby away from home
        Ugly ole mojo, where you been
        up your house and gone again

        Hey, mojo come to my house, my black cat bone
        take my baby away from home
        Ugly ole mojo, where you been
        up your house and gone again

        Oh Bo Diddley, Bo Diddley have you heard
        my pretty baby said she wasn't for it

        Hey Bo Diddley, oh Bo Diddley
        Hey Bo Diddley, oh Bo Diddley



intro   {E/D}{E.
        {E/D}{E.D/E.

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Bo Diddley bought his babe a diamond ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (He gonna take it to a private eye ...)
        {E}{E}         (He'd better not take the ring from me)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Hey -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- Bo Diddley caught a bear cat ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Bo Diddley caught a nanny goat ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}         (Hey -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- mojo come to my house, my black cat ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Ugly ole mojo, where you been ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}            (Hey -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- mojo come to my house, my black cat ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Ugly ole mojo, where you been ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}            (Oh -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- Bo Diddley, Bo Diddley have you heard ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Hey Bo Diddley, oh Bo Diddley)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Hey Bo Diddley, oh Bo Diddley)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}




* "Hey Bo Diddley, oh Bo Diddley ..." lines are actually from
Bo Diddley's another song "Hey Bo Diddley" (1957)
also written by Ellas McDaniel




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
=====================================================
"Booker T."
(live/instrumental)
=====================================================
album _Paris S'Eveille - Suivi D'Autres Compositions_
(John Cale, 1991)
* edited version

CDEP "Paris S'Eveille"
(John Cale, 1991)
* long version

album _Paris S'Eveille - Suivi D'Autres Compositions_
Japanese edition CD bonus track
(John Cale, 1992)
* long version

box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)
* long version

album _Psychedelic Sounds From The Gymnasium_
(The Velvet Underground, 2008)
* long version

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker

April 1967
The Gymnasium, NYC
=====================================================



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        fade in ... {E7}
        {B7}{A7}{E7}{E7}

        {E7}{E7}{E7}{E7}
        {A7}{A7}{E7}{E7}
        {B7}{A7}{E7}{E7}

solo    {E7}{E7}{E7}{E7}
        {A7}{A7}{E7}{E7}
        {B7}{A7}{E7}{E7}

        .... repeat

       E7         A7          B7

*2A -o-||---|-o-|-o-|---|-o-|- .... -|-o-|---|-o-|-o-|---|-o-|-
*3F -o-||---|-o-|---|-o-|---|- .... -|-o-|-o-|-o-|---|-o-|---|-

p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

<TITLE>Bottoming Out</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
========================
"Bottoming Out"
========================
album _Legendary Hearts_
(Lou Reed, 1983)

written by Lou Reed
========================


        I'm cruising fast on a motorcycle
        down this winding country road
        And I pass the gravel at the foot of the hill
        where last week I fell off

        There's still some oil by this old elm tree
        and a dead squirrel that I hit
        But if I hadn't left, I would have struck you dead
        so I took a ride instead

        Bottoming out
        bottoming out
        Bottoming out
        bottoming out

        My doctor says she hopes I know
        how lucky I can be
        after all it wasn't my blood
        mixed in the dirt that night

        But this violent rage, that turned inward
        can not be helped by drink
        And we must really examine this and I say
        I need another drink

        Bottoming out
        bottoming out
        Bottoming out
        bottoming out

        I'm tearing down Route 80 East
        the sun's on my right side
        I'm drunk, but my vision's good
        and I think of my child bride
        And on the left in shadows I see
        something that makes me laugh
        I aim that bike at that fat pothole
        beyond that underpass

        Bottoming out
        bottoming out
        Bottoming out
        bottoming out

        Bottoming out
        bottoming out
        Bottoming out
        bottoming out



* Lou Reed: standard-tuning



intro   {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}

        {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}   (I'm cruising fast on a motorcycle ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}     (- pass the gravel at the foot of ...)

        {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}   (There's still some oil by this old ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}     (- I hadn't left, I would have ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}   (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}     (- out, bottoming out)

        ....

chorus  {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}   (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}     (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)

chorus  {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}   (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}     (- out, bottoming out)

ending  {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{F#m}{F#m}
        {Bm}{Bm}{E}{E}
        ... repeat and fade out




- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -



* Robert Quine: D-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}
        {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}
        
        {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}     (I'm cruising fast on a motorcycle ...)
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}   (- pass the gravel at the foot of ...)

        {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}     (There's still some oil by this ...)
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}   (- I hadn't left, I would have ...)

chorus  {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}     (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}   (- out, bottoming out)

        ....

chorus  {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}     (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}   (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)

chorus  {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}     (- out, bottoming out, Bottoming -)
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}   (- out, bottoming out)

coda    {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}
        {B}{B}{G#m}{G#m}
        {C#m}{C#m}{F#}{F#}
        ... repeat and fade out




* riff (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

     {B}                {B}
*1d ----0---0----2---------0---0----2------
*2A --4---4--------------4---4-------------
*3F --4------------4-----4------------4----
*4C ---------------------------------------
*5G ---------------------------------------
*6D ---------------------------------------

----0---0----2---------0---0----2------
--4---4--------------4---4-------------
--4------------4-----4------------4----
---------------------------------------
---------------------------------------

----0---0----2---------0---0----2------

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Broadway Song</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=====================
"Broadway Song"
=====================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed

sung by Steve Buscemi
=====================


        Like to thank all you people for showing up tonight
        Sorry about the weather
        Let's have a big hand for my long time accompianist
        Manfred Gooseberry
        Hey Goose
        Take a bow, relax
        Be comfortable
        Have a cocktail on the Poo Poo Lounge
        And let us entertain you

        I'd like to sing you a Broadway song
        I hope that you'll all sing along
        A little dancing and some sentiment to put your mind at ease

        I'd like to play you something low and sexy
        look at our dancers they're so young and pretty, hi Olga
        And when we start to groove you can hear the saxophones blow

        Ah, show business is just a wonderful thing
        All I want is to get down on my knees and sing for you

        And let the saxophones blow
        blow baby blow

        I'd like to sing you a Broadway song
        I hope that you'll all sing along
        A little dancing and some sentiment to put your mind at ease

        I wanna bring a tear to your eye, oh
        good old Poe don't he make you cry
        Ain't it great the way he writes about the mysteries of life

        Ah, show business is just a wonderful thing
        All I want is to get down on my knees and sing for you

        And let the saxophones blow
        Blow baby blow

        Ah, show business is just a wonderful thing
        All I want is to get down on my knees and sing for you

        And let the saxophones blow
        blow baby blow baby blow baby blow

        Go Goose go




        {x}            count
intro   {F}{F}{F}{F}   (Like to thank all you people for ...)
        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (Let's have a big hand for my long time ...)
        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (Take a bow, relax ...)
        {F}            count

        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (I'd like to sing you a Broadway song ...)
        {F}{F}{G}{G}   (A little dancing and some sentiment ...)

        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (I'd like to play you something low and ...)
        {F}{F}{G}{G}   (Hi Olga, and when we start to groove ...)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (Ah, show business is just a wonderful ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (All I want is to get down on my knees ...)

        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (- blow, blow baby blow)

        {F}{F}{F}{F}   (I'd like to sing you a Broadway song ...)
        {F}{F}{G}{G}   (A little dancing and some sentiment ...)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (All I want is to get down on my knees ...)

        {F}{F}{G}{G}

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (Ah, show business is just a wonderful ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (All I want is to get down on my knees ...)

========================================
"Broadway Song"
========================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, local musicians (?)

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
========================================

        Sorry about the weather
        But doin' the best we can here

        Manfred Gooseberry, ooohhh

        Relax
        Be comfortable
        Have a cocktail in the Poo Poo Lounge
        And let us entertain you
        Yeah baby

        I hope that you'll all sing along
        A little dancing and some sentiment to put your mind at ease

        I'd like to play you something low and sexy
        look at our dancers they're so young and pretty, hi Olga
        And when we start to groove you can hear the saxophones blow

        Ah, show business is just a wonderful thing
        All I want is to get down on my knees and sing for you

        blow baby blow blow blow

        All I want is to get down on my knees and sing for you

        And let the saxophones blow

        Ah, show business is just a wonderful thing

        And let the saxophones blow

<PRE>
==============================
"Buddy Holly jam"
==============================
rehearsal
(The Velvet Underground, 1966)

written by ? (jam)

Jan 03, 1966
The Factory, NYC
==============================



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {A}{A}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E..



        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {B}{A}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E..



        {E...

===================
"Burning Embers"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Fly through the glass of a window pane
        fall through the sky feeling the rain
        Walk on broken glass your tell-tale heart

        Look through the bars of a dirty jail cell
        soar to heaven dive to hell
        Listen to your tell-tale heart

        Setting fires in the ghost twilight
        we see you dress we bolt with fright
        You see an apparition disappear

        Jump to the table, jump up the stairs
        stand on the rooftop, looking out through the air
        Walk on broken glass your tell-tale heart

        Lenore, am I dreaming

        How can death keep us apart, mmmm..
        Lenore, I see you burning

        And I'd walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

        Walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

        Walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

        Heart
        heart
        Heart
        heart

        Walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart
        your tell-tale heart

        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

        Walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

        Walk on burning embers
        walk on burning embers
        Walk on burning embers your tell-tale heart

<TITLE>Busload Of Faith</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Busload Of Faith"
===================
album _New York_
(Lou Reed, 1989)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        You can't depend on your family
        you can't depend on your friends
        You can't depend on a beginning
        you can't depend on an end

        You can't depend on intelligence
        ooohhh, you can't depend on God
        You can only depend on one thing
        you need a busload of faith to get by, watch, baby

        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by
        Busload of faith to get by
        you need a busload of faith to get by

        You can depend on the worst always happening
        you can depend on a murderer's drive
        You can bet that if he rapes somebody
        there'll be no trouble having a child

        You can bet that if she aborts it
        pro-lifers will attack her with rage
        You can depend on the worst always happening
        you need a busload of faith to get by, yeah

        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by
        Busload of faith to get by, baby
        busload of faith to get by

        You can't depend on the goodly hearted
        the goodly hearted made lampshades and soap
        You can't depend on the Sacrament
        no Father, no Holy Ghost

        You can't depend on any churches
        unless there's real estate you want to buy
        You can't depend on a lot of things
        you need a busload of faith to get by, woh

        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by
        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by

        You can't depend on no miracle
        you can't depend on the air
        You can't depend on a wise man
        you can't find 'em because they're not there

        You can depend on cruelty
        crudity of thought and sound
        You can depend on the worst always happening
        you need a busload of faith to get by, ha

        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by
        Busload of faith to get by
        busload of faith to get by




intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}

        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on your ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on a ...)

        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can only depend on ...)

chorus  {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (Busload of faith to get ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (Busload of faith to get ...)

        ....




* riff

    {Csus2 / G}      {D}
 1e ---------------------------------
 2B ---3-----3--------3---x----------
 3G ---0-----0--------2---x------2---   ...
 4D ---2-----0--------0---x--2h4-0---
 5A ---3-----2-----------------------
 6E ---------3-----------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

        You can't depend on a worst always happening

        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on your ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on a ...)

        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend on ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (You can't depend, ah ...)

chorus  {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (Busload of faith to get ...)
        {Csus2/G}{D}{Csus2/G}{D}   (Busload of faith to get ...)

        ....




* riff

    {Csus2 / G}      {D}
 1e ------------------2--------------
 2B ---3-----3--------3--------------
 3G ---0-----0--------2--------------   ...
 4D ---2-----0--------0--------------
 5A ---3-----2-----------------------
 6E ---------3-----------------------




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I was just listening to the "Perfect Night Live in London" album,
and noticed Lou quotes Jesus Christ
at the very beginning of "Busload of Faith":

"O ye of little faith", he says.
Just thought I'd mention it.

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
====================================
"Call On Me"
====================================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed

sung by Lou Reed and Laurie Anderson
====================================


        Caught in the crossbow of ideas and journeys
        sit here reliving the other self's mournings
        Caught in the crossbow of ideas and dawnings
        stand I

        Oh oh oh oh

        Reliving the past of the maddening impulse
        violent upheaval, the pure driven instinct
        The pure driven murder, the attraction of daring
        stand I

        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call on me
        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call



Rowena:

        A wild being from birth
        my spirit spurns control
        wondering the wide earth
        searching for my soul
        Dimly peering
        I would surely find
        what could there be more purely bright
        in truth's day-star



        Ooohhh
        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call, call on me
        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call

        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call on me
        Why didn't you call on me
        why didn't you call

        {G}{G}{C}{C}     (Caught in the crossbow of ideas and ...)
        {C}{C}           (Oh oh oh -)

        {G}{G}{C}{C}     (- pure driven murder, the attraction ...)

        {C}{D}{G}{G}     (- call on me, why didn't you call)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Calm Before The Storm</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"The Calm Before The Storm"
================================
album _Nothing But The Truth_
(Ruben Blades, 1988)

written by Lou Reed/Ruben Blades

Lou Reed:
co-arrangement, co-produce,
guitar, background vocals

(Mike Rathke:
guitar, background vocals)
================================


        There was a time when ignorance made
        our innocence strong
        There was a time when we all thought
        we could do no wrong
        There was a time, so long ago
        there was a time
        But here we are in the calm before the storm

        While the orchestra plays, they build barricades
        to help close the doors
        While the musician sings, the holocaust rings
        cymbals of war
        In the cities we stare at the things that were there
        and no longer are and in our hearts
        Here we are again in the calm before the storm, oh

        There was a time when we had an idea
        whose time hadn't come
        They kept changing its name, so we could still pretend
        it was not really gone
        We heard our screams turn into song
        and back into screams again and here we are again
        Here we are in the calm before the storm, oh

        Here we are, here we are
        in the calm before the storm
        Here we are, here we are
        in the calm before the storm
        Here we are, here we are
        in the calm before the storm
        Here we are, here we are
        in the calm before the storm, hey
        Here we are, here, here we are, here
        in the calm before the storm
        Here we are, here, here we are
        in the calm before the storm
        Here we are, here we are
        in the calm before the storm
        ....



                       (There was a -)
        {G}{C}{G}{G}   (- time when ignorance made ...)
        {G}{C}{D}{D}   (- time when we all thought ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{C}   (-  time, so long ago ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{G}   (- are in the calm before the storm ...)

        {G}{C}{G}{G}   (- plays, they build barricades ...)
        {G}{C}{D}{D}   (- sings, the holocaust rings ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{C}   (- we stare at the things that were ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are again in the calm before the ...)

sax.    {G}{C}{G}{G}
        {G}{C}{D}{D}
        {G}{C}{G}{C}
        {G}{D}{G}{G}   (There was a -)

        {G}{C}{G}{G}   (- time when we had an idea ...)
        {G}{C}{D}{D}   (- name, so we could still pretend ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{C}   (- screams turn into song ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are in the calm before the storm ...)

        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here we are, in the calm before ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here we are, in the calm before ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here we are, in the calm before ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here we are, in the calm before ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here, here we are, here, in the ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here, here we are, in the calm ...)
        {G}{D}{C}{G}   (- are, here we are, in the calm before ...)
        ... fade out




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

The Calm before the Storm (L.Reed-R.Blades););
   guitar: lou reed, mike rathke;
   arranged and produced by L. Reed-R.Blades;
   background vocals too.


lyrics:

there was a time when ignorance made our innocence strong.
there was a time when we all thought we could do no wrong.
there was a time, so long ago, there was a time...
but here we are, in the calm before the storm.

while the orchestra plays,
they build barricades to help close the doors.
while the musician sings, the Holocaust rings cymbals of war
in the cities we stare at the things that were there,
and no longer are.
and in our hearts, here we are again, in the calm before the storm.

there was a time, when we had an idea whose time hadn't come.
they kept changing its name,
so we could still pretend it was not really gone.
we heard our screams turn into song and back into screams again.
and here we are again, in the calm before the storm.

chorus: here we are, here we are, in the calm before the storm.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
chords transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

<TITLE>I Can't Stand It</TITLE>

<PRE>
===================
"I Can't Stand It"
===================
album _Lou Reed_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        It's hard being a man
        living in a garbage pail
        My landlady called me up, ooohhh
        she tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more, oh
        I can't stand it anymore more

        But if Candy would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Yeah, if Candy would just come back
        it'd be all right, come on baby

        I live with thirteen dead cats
        a purple dog that wears spats
        They're all out livin' in the hall
        and I can't stand it anymore

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more

        But if Candy would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Ooohhh, if Candy would just come back
        it'd be all right, be all right now

        Ah, come on baby

        I'm tired of living all alone
        yeah, nobody ever calls me on the phone
        But when, ah, things start getting bad, ah
        I just play my music louder

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it, oh
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it, no
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it, oh
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it
        I can't stand it, I can't stand it
        ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {E}{A}                 (I can't stand it anymore more)

        {D}{G}{E}{E}           (But if Candy would just come ...)
        {G}{D}{E}{E/G.D}       (Yeah, if Candy would just ...)

        ...

guitar  {E}{E/G.D}{E}{E/G.D}
        {E}{E/G.D}{E}{E/G.D}

        ....

ending  {E}{A/G.D}{E}{A/G.D}   (I can't stand it anymore more ...)
        {E}{A}                 (I can't stand it anymore more)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}           (I can't stand it, I can't stand ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}           (I can't stand it, I can't stand ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}           (I can't stand it, I can't stand ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}           (I can't stand it, I can't stand ...)
        ... fade out

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

==============================
"I Can't Stand It"

        it'd be all right

        living in a garbage pail
        My lady called me up
        and tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more

        it'd be all right

        be all right, oh God

=============================================
"I Can't Stand It"
=============================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live Volume 2_
CD edition bonus track
(The Velvet Underground, 1988)

Nov 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
=============================================


        It's hard being a man
        living in a garbage pail
        My landlady called me up
        she tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I Can't stand it anymore more

        But if Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right

        I live with thirteen dead cats
        a purple dog that wears spats
        They're all out living in the hall

==============================
"I Can't Stand It"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        It's hard being a man
        living in a garbage pail
        My landlady called me up
        tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it, stand it anymore

        it'd be all right

==================================================
"I Can't Stand It"
(The Family Dog, San Francisco, 11-8-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 08, 1969
The Family Dog, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        It's hard being a man
        if you're living in a garbage pail
        You know landlady called me up
        she tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I Can't stand it anymore more

        But if Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right

        I live with thirteen dead cats
        a purple dog that wears spats
        They're all out living in the hall
        and I can't stand it anymore

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more

        But if Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right

        It's hard being a man
        ...... living in a garbage pail
        My landlady called me up, huh
        she tried to hit me with a mop

        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more
        I can't stand it anymore more

        But if Shelley would just come back
        it'd be all right
        Shelley would, wow, just come back
        it'd be all right
        be all right (be all right)
        Be all right (be all right)
        be all right (be all right)
        all right

        Oh, be all right (be all right)
        oh babe, be all right (be all right)
        Be all right (be all right)

        Be all right (be all right), be all right, come on
        ........ (be all right), .......
        Be all right, hey babe, be all right
        hey, be all right, hey, be all right, mama
        Hey, be all right, hey, be all right



* chords:
same as _1969 Velvet Underground Live Volume 2_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Sarah Barmak (martooni@idirect.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


in regards to your transcription of "I Can't Stand It"
on your Lou Reed site, you wrote for the third verse,

'But you say we'll just come back
would it be all right
You say we just come back
would it be all right'

What it is, is

'But if Shelley would just come back,
it would be all right
If Shelley would just come back,
it'd be all right'

you know, Shelley was his old girlfriend at Syracuse.
Also, the first verse, that's repeated again,
you keep changing it every time
into all these things that don't make sense.
it's the same as it is on "Lou Reed",


'It's hard being a man
Livin in a garbage pail
My landlady called me up
She tried to hit me with a mop'

if you listen closely you can hear it.
i'm sorry, i'm not criticizing you or anything,
i'm just trying to help you out.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<PRE>
==============================
"Candy Says"
==============================
album _The Velvet Underground_
(The Velvet Underground, 1969)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Candy says, I've come to hate my body
        And all that it requires in this world

        Candy says, I'd like to know completely
        What others so discreetly talk about

        I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by
        maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Candy says, I hate the quiet places
        That cause the smallest taste of what will be

        Candy says, I hate the big decisions
        That cause endless revisions in my mind

        I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by
        maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Doo doo wah
        Doo, doo doo wah
        Doo, doo doo wah
        Doo, doo doo wah
        Doo, doo doo wah
        Doo



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {E}{G#m}{G}{C#}   (Candy says, I've come to hate my body)
        {F#m}{B}{E}{B}    (And all that it requires in this world)

        {E}{G#m}{G}{C#}   (Candy says, I'd like to know completely)
        {F#m}{B}{E}{B}    (What others so discreetly talk about)

        {E}{A}{F#}{B}     (I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly ...)
        {E}{A}{F#}{B}     (I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by ...)

        {D}{A}{B}{D...    (What do you think I'd see ...)

        ....

coda    {E}{E}{A}{A}      (Doo doo wah)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}      (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}      (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}      (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}      (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {E...             (Doo)




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



        {D}{F#m}{F}{B}   (Candy says, I've come to hate my body)
        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (And all that it requires in this world)

        {D}{F#m}{F}{B}   (Candy says, I'd like to know completely)
        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (What others so discreetly talk about)

        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly ...)
        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by ...)

        {C}{G}{A}{C...   (What do you think I'd see ...)

        ....

coda    {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D...            (Doo)








===============================================
"Candy Says"
===============================================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
limited digipak edition CD bonus track
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

album _American Poet Box: Lou Reed - Paris '72_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

Jan 25 (?), 1972
Paris, France
(rehearsal)
===============================================


        [skipped]

        Candy says, I've come to hate my body
        And all that it requires in this world

        Candy says, I hate the quiet places
        That cause the smallest taste of what will be

        I'm going to watch those blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm going to watch them pass me by
        maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        [skipped]

        Doo, doo doo wah



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




        {A}{C#m}{C}{F#/F#7}   (Candy says, I've come to hate my ...)
        {Bm/Bm7}{E}{A}{E}     (And all that it requires in this ...)

        {A}{C#m}{C}{F#/F#7}   (Candy says, I hate the quiet places)
        {Bm/Bm7}{E}{A}{E}     (That cause the smallest taste of ...)

        {A}{D}{B}{E}          (I'm going to watch those blue ...)
        {A}{D}{B}{E}          (I'm going to watch them pass me ...)

        {G}{D}{E}{G...        (What do you think I'd see ...)

        [skipped]

coda    {A}{A}{D...           (Doo, doo doo wah)




* licks on backing (1 + 1/2 down)

      {A}                {C#m}
*1c# --5------------------4--------7---4----
*2G# --5------------------5--------5---5----
*3E  --6------------------6--------4---6----
*4B  --7------------------6--------6---6----
*5F# --7------------------4--------4---4----
*6C# --5------------------------------------

 {C}                {F#     / F#7}
---------------------2--------2--------
--5------------------2--------5--------
--5------------------3--------3--------
--5------------------4--------2--------
--3------------------4--------4--------
---------------------2--------2--------

  {Bm    / Bm7}     {E}
--2--------5---------0-------------------
--3--------3---------0-------------------
--4--------2---------1-------------------
--4--------4---------2-------------------
--2--------2---------2----------0-2/4-0--
---------------------0--------0----------

 {A}                {E}
---------------------0-----------------
--2--------0---2-----0-----------------
--2--------2---2-----1-----------------
--2--------2---2-----2-----------------
--0--------0---0-----2-----------------
---------------------0-----------------




*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








========================
"Candy Says"
========================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

sung by Antony

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
========================


        Candy says, I've come to hate my body
        And all that it requires in this world

        Candy says, I'd like to know completely
        What others so discreetly talk about

        I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by
        maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Candy says, I hate those quiet places
        That cause the smallest taste of what will be

        Candy says, I hate those big decisions
        That cause endless revisions in my mind

        I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by
        oh, maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Doo doo doo doo doo
        Ooohhh, doo doo doo doo doo
        ooohhh, over my shoulder
        Doo doo wah wah wah
        oh, maybe when I'm older

        (scat)

        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (What others so discreetly talk about)

        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm gonna watch the blue birds fly ...)
        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm gonna watch 'em pass me by ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Doo, doo doo wah)
        {D...            (Doo)








===========================================
"Candy Says"
===========================================
album _Berlin: Live At St. Ann's Warehouse_
(Lou Reed, 2008)

sung by Antony and Lou Reed

Dec 15 (or 16), 2006
St. Ann's Warehouse, Brooklyn, NY
===========================================


        Candy says, I've come to hate my body
        And all it requires in this world

        Candy says, I'd like to know completely
        What others so discreetly talk about

        I'm goin' to watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm, I'm goin' to watch them pass me by
        maybe, baby, when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Candy says, now I hate those quiet places
        That cause the smallest taste of what will be

        Candy says, I hate those big decisions
        That cause endless revisions in my mind

        I'm goin' to watch the blue birds fly
        over my shoulder
        I'm goin' to watch them pass me by
        maybe when I'm older

        What do you think I'd see
        if I could walk away from me

        Ooohhh, doo doo wah
        Ooohhh, doo doo wah
        (over my shoulder)
        Ooohhh, doo doo wah
        (maybe when I'm older)
        Ooohhh ....




intro   {D}{F#m}{F}{B}
        {Em}{A}{D}{A}

        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (And all it requires in this world)

        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (What others so discreetly talk about)

        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm, I'm goin' to watch them pass me ...)

        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (That cause the smallest taste of what...)

        {Em}{A}{D}{A}    (That cause endless revisions in my mind)

        {D}{G}{E}{A}     (I'm goin' to watch them pass me by ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Ooohhh, doo doo wah)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Ooohhh, doo doo wah)

<PRE>
===================
"Caroline Says I"
===================
album _Berlin_
(Lou Reed, 1973)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Caroline says that I'm just a toy
        she wants a man, not just a boy
        Oh Caroline says, ooohhh Caroline says

        Caroline says she can't help but be mean
        or cruel, or oh so it seems
        Oh Caroline says, Caroline says

        She says she doesn't want a man who leans
        Still she is my Germanic -

        - Queen
        Yeah, she's my Queen

        The things she does, the things she says
        people shouldn't treat others that way
        But at first I thought I could take it all

        Just like poison in a vial
        hey, she was often very vile
        But of course, I thought I could take it all

        Caroline says that I'm not a man
        so she'll go get it catch as catch can
        Oh Caroline says, yeah Caroline says

        Caroline says moments in time
        can't continue to be only mine
        Oh Caroline says, yeah Caroline says

        She treats me like I am a fool
        But to me she's still a German -

        - Queen, ooohhh, she's my -
        - Queen, you're -
        - Queen, hey baby, she's to my Queen
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        (Queen)
        ...

        {C}{C/F.G}{C}{C/F.G}

        {F}{Dm}{G}{G}          (- Caroline says, ooohhh ...)

 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        Caroline says that I'm just a toy
        she wants a man, not just a boy
        Oh Caroline says, Caroline says

        Caroline says she can't help but be mean
        or cruel, or oh so it seems
        Yeah Caroline says, Caroline says, ah

        You know she doesn't like a man who lean
        But to me, she's just a German -

        - Queen
        Ah honey, she's just a Queen
        And you're not some quarter Queen

        hey, people shouldn't treat others that way
        But of course, I thought I could take it all

        Just like poison in a vial
        she was often very vile
        But of course, I thought that I could take it all

        Caroline says that I'm not a man
        so she'll go get it and catch as catch can
        Yeah Caroline says, oh Caroline says

        Caroline says that moments in time
        can't continue to be only mine
        Yeah Caroline says, Caroline says, faugh faugh faugh

        You know she treats me like a fool
        But to me she's a German -

        - Queen, hey, you're just a Queen
        Yeah, she's just a German Queen
        Oh, she's just a Queen

<TITLE>Caroline Says II</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Caroline Says II"
===================
album _Berlin_
(Lou Reed, 1973)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Caroline says
        as she gets up off the floor
        Why is it that you beat me
        it isn't any fun

        Caroline says
        as she makes up her eye
        You ought to learn more about yourself
        think more than just I

        But she's not afraid to die
        all of her friends call her Alaska
        When she takes speed, they laugh and ask her

        What is in her mind
        what is in her mind

        Caroline says
        as she gets up from the floor
        You can hit me all you want to
        but I don't love you anymore

        Caroline says
        while biting her lip
        Life is meant to be more than this
        and this is a bum trip

        But she's not afraid to die
        all of her friends call her Alaska
        When she takes speed, they laugh and ask her

        What is in her mind
        what is in her mind

        She put her fist through the window pane
        It was such a funny feeling

        It's so cold in Alaska
        it's so cold in Alaska
        It's so cold in Alaska




intro   {C/Bm}{Am/G}{C/Bm}{Am/G}

        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{C/Bm}{Am/F}   (Caroline says ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/Em.Am}{D}{G}     (Why is it that you beat me ...)

        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{C/Bm}{Am/F}   (Caroline says ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/Em.Am}{D}{G}     (You ought to learn more ...)

        {C}{F}{C}{F}               (But she's not afraid to die ...)
        {C}{F}                     (When she takes speed ...)
        {C}{G}{C}{G}               (What is in her mind ...)

        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{C/Bm}{Am/F}   (Caroline says ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/Em.Am}{D}{G}     (You can hit me all you want ...)

        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{C/Bm}{Am/F}   (Caroline says ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/Em.Am}{D}{G}     (Life is meant to be more ...)

        {C}{F}{C}{F}               (But she's not afraid to die ...)
        {C}{F}                     (When she takes speed ...)
        {C}{G}{C}{G}               (What is in her mind ...)

bridge  {Dm}{G}{C}{C}              (She put her fist through ...)
        {Dm}{G}                    (It was such a funny feeling)

        {C}{F/F.G}{C}{F/F.G}       (It's so cold in Alaska ...)
        {C}{F/F.G}                 (It's so cold in Alaska)

ending  {C/Bm}{Am/G}{C...








===========================================

===========================================
album _Berlin: Live At St. Ann's Warehouse_
(Lou Reed, 2008)

Dec 15 (or 16), 2006

===========================================


        Caroline says
        as she gets up off the floor

        it isn't any fun

        as she makes up her eye

        you ought to think more than just I

        as she gets up from the floor

        but I don't love you anymore

        and this is a, a bum trip

        {C}{G}{C}{G}               (What is in her mind ...)

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Cask</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"The Cask"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
===================



Edgar:

        Never bet the devil your head
        When I was an infant
        my mother treated me like a tough steak
        To her well regulated mind
        babies were the better for beatings
        But she was left handed
        and a child flogged left handed
        is better left unflogged
        The world revolves from right to left
        It will not do to whip a baby from left to right
        If each blow in the right direction
        drives an evil propensity out
        a blow in the opposite direction
        knocks it's quota of wickedness in

        Hence my precocity in vice
        my sensitivity to injuries
        the thousands of injuries heaped upon me by Fortunato
        and then finally his rabid insults for which I vowed revenge

        I gave no utterance to threat
        But the knowledge of "avengemenship"
        was so definite so precise
        that no risk could befall me
        by neither word
        nor deed had I given cause to doubt my good will
        I would punish with impunity
        I will fuck him up the ass and piss in his face
        I will redress the wrong
        But lips and psyche
        mind be silent
        Fortunato approaches



Fortunato:

        Don't take me to task
        for loving a cask
        The cask of Amontillado
        Please don't make a pass
        You can go kiss my ass
        All I want is this mythical cask
        The cask of Amontillado
        I've heard so much through the grapevine
        I've heard so much on the line
        But the one thing that I lust after
        Is the one thing I've never had
        So is it too much to ask
        Too have just one taste of the cask
        Why you could go kiss my ass for the cask
        of Amontillado

        Edgar old fellow
        dear bosom friend
        Hail fellow well met
        oh great elucidator
        great epopee



Edgar:

        Haha..
        Fortunato what luck to meet you
        what good good luck to meet
        you and see you looking so splendid
        I have received a cask of Amontillado
        or what passes
        for Amontillado



Fortunato:

        Amontillado
        That most wondrous sherry
        A cask
        Impossible
        How
        So rare



Edgar:

        I've had my doubts
        I was silly enough to pay the full price
        without consulting you in the matter
        but you were not to be found
        and I was fearful of losing a bargain



Fortunato:

        Fearfully stupid if you ask me Edgar



Edgar:

        I am on my way to see Mr. Bolo



Fortunato:

        A cask



Edgar:

        A cask
        To gather his opinion
        Are you engaged



Fortunato:

        Mr. Bolo cannot tell Amontillado from goat's milk



Edgar:

        Yet some say his taste is a match for your own



Fortunato:

        Hardly, dear boy
        Let us go



Edgar:

        Where



Fortunato:

        To your vaults to the supposed Amontillado



Edgar:

        Oh my good friend no
        I could not impose upon your good nature
        You have, after all, an engagement



Fortunato:

        To hell with the engagement
        I have no engagement
        Before the sky withers and falls let us go



Edgar:

        But the vaults are damp
        and I see you are afflicted with a severe cold



Fortunato:

        Oh let us go
        The cold is nothing
        You've been taken advantage of
        And Mr. Bolo cannot tell Amontillado from piss
        The cask



Edgar:

        It is farther on
        But see the white web work
        which gleams from these cavern walls



Fortunato:

        Nitre
        Nitre



Edgar:

        How long have you had that cough
        Yes, nitre



Fortunato:

        It is nothing



Edgar:

        We should go back
        Your health is precious
        You are a man who would be missed



Fortunato:

        [coughing]



Edgar:

        Let's return
        I cannot be responsible for causing you ill health
        And anyway there's always Mr. Bolo



Fortunato:

        Oh be damned, I'll not be swayed
        The cough is nothing
        It will not kill me
        I won't die of a cough



Edgar:

        Of that you can be sure
        Have some of this Medoc to warm the bones
        and defend you from this infernal dampness
        Drink
        Drink damn you



Fortunato:

        I drink to the buried that repose around us



Edgar:

        And I to your long life
        The nitre
        It hangs like moss
        We are below the river's bed
        The moisture trickles, chills the bones
        Let's go back
        Your cough



Fortunato:

        The cough is nothing
        Let us have some more Medoc
        Let us proceed to the Amontillado



Edgar:

        So proceed
        Herein the Amontillado
        Now Mr. Bolo



Fortunato:

        Mr. Bolo is an imbecile
        An ignoramus



Edgar:

        Can you not feel the nitre
        You really should go
        I implore you
        No
        Then I must leave you here
        But first
        let me render you all the little attentions within my power



Fortunato:

        The Amontillado
        Hahahaha..
        A very good joke indeed, haha..
        We will have many a rich laugh about it
        over our wine in the palazzo



Edgar:

        The Amontillado



Fortunato:

        Yes, yes yes
        The Amontillado



Edgar:

        Well
        Then let's go



Fortunato:

        Ah, for the love of God



Edgar:

        Precisely
        for the love of God
        Fortunato
        Fortunato




                     /A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        ....




* intro and riff

     /A}

 2B -------------
 3G -------------
 4D --4h5p4h5p4--
 5A --0----------
 6E -------------
