*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








========================================
"The Cask"
========================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, local musicians (?)

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
========================================



[The Cask Of Amontillado (spoken)]


        Never bet the devil your head
        When I was an infant
        my mother treated me like a tough steak
        To her well regulated mind
        babies were the better for beatings
        But she was left handed
        and a child flogged left handed is better left unflogged
        The world revolves from right to left
        It will not do to whip a baby from left to right
        If each blow in the right direction
        drives an evil propensity out
        a blow in the opposite direction
        knocks it's quota of wickedness in
        Hence my precocity in vice
        my sensitivity to injuries
        the thousands of injuries heaped upon me by Fortunato
        and finally his rabid insults for which I vowed revenge
        I gave no utterance to threat
        But the knowledge of "avengemenship"
        was so definite so precise that no risk could befall me
        by neither word nor deed
        had I given cause to doubt my good will
        I would punish with impunity
        I will fuck him up the ass and piss in his face
        I will redress the wrong

        .... (dialogue in German)
        ....
        ....

        I will fuck him up the ass and piss in his face
        I will redress the wrong
        But lips and psyche
        mind be silent
        Fortunato approaches




[The Cask (song)]


        Don't take me to task
        for loving a cask
        The cask of Amontillado

        Please don't make a pass
        you can go kiss my ass
        All I want is this mythical cask
        the cask of Amontillado

        I've heard so much through the grapevine
        I've heard so much on the line
        But the one thing that I lust after
        is the one thing I've never had

        So is it too much to ask
        too have just one taste of the cask
        Why you could go kiss my ass
        for the cask of Amontillado




intro                /A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (Don't take me to task ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (The cask of Amontillado)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (Please don't make a pass ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (All I want is this mythical cask ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (I've heard so much through the ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (But the one thing that I lust after ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (So is it too much to ask ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   (Why you could go kiss my ass ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   dialogue in German
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}   ....
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

<PRE>
===============================
"Catch 'Em In The Act"
===============================
album _Hitting The Ground_
(Gordon Gano, 2002)

written by Gordon Gano/Lou Reed

Lou Reed: vocals, guitar right
===============================


        This year's man is gonna be a man's man
        this little man is gonna be a man's man
        7-Eleven sells devil dogs and SPAM
        this year's man is gonna be a man's man

        This year's baby not gonna wet his booty
        this year's screamer gonna sniff too tooty
        Plurality of duty, singularity of beauty
        this little baby gets queer for big hot booty

        People come and go
        look at how they act
        they put down a scam
        I catch 'em in the act

        This little dog is gonna be a rottweiller
        this little bitch is gonna chew on an enchilada
        He's a husky at heart, she'd eat her own daughter
        this year's man is gonna take a poodle to the slaughter

        People come and go
        look at how they act
        they put down a scam
        and I catch 'em in the act

        {E7}{E7}{E7}{E7}

        {E7}{E7}{E7}{E7}   (7-Eleven sells devil dogs and SPAM ...)

        {C}{A/G}{E7}{E7}

<TITLE>Change</TITLE>

<PRE>
===================
"Change"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and change is always for the worse
        The worm on the hook always eaten by a fish
        the fish by bird man or worse
        A spot on the lung, a spot on your heart
        an aneurism of the soul
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it comes equipped with a curse

        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse

        The only thing constantly changing is change
        the living only become dead
        Your hair falling out, your liver swelled up
        your teeth rot your gums and your chin
        Your ass starts to sag, your balls shrivel up
        your cock swallowed up in their sack
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always change on your back

        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse, baby

        The only thing constantly changing is change
        ashes to ashes to dusk
        The deer and the rabbit, the musk of your hole
        filled up with myriad dread, ooohhh
        The dread of the living, the dread of the living
        the frightening pulse of the night, ah
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        it's changes that will kill us with fright

        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it's always for the worse
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        the only thing constantly changing is change
        The only thing constantly changing is change
        and it comes equipped with my curse

<TITLE>Charley's Girl</TITLE>

<PRE>
=========================
"Charley's Girl"
=========================
album _Coney Island Baby_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        Everybody said that you'd better watch out
        man, she's gonna turn you in
        And me, you know that I thought that I lucked out
        and now look at the trouble that I'm in
        you know you'd better -

        Watch out for Charley's girl
        watch out for Charley's girl
        Watch out for Charley's girl
        watch out for Charley's girl

        It happened on New Year's Eve
        they said everybody had to leave
        They had a warrant in their hand
        they wanted to bust the whole band
        I said if I ever see Sharon again
        I'm gonna punch her face in
        you know you're, you'd better -

        Watch out for Charley's girl
        hey now now
        watch out for Charley's girl
        you know she'll turn you, turn you in
        Watch out for Charley's girl
        watch out for Charley's girl
        she'll turn you in you'd better, huh
        Watch out, you'd better -
        watch out, you'd better -
        you'd better watch out, you'd better
        you'd better watch out for -
        Charley's girl




intro   {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}

        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Everybody said that ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (And me, you know, that ...)

chorus  {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Watch out for Charley's ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Watch out for Charley's ...)

        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}

        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (It happened on New ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (They had a warrant ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (I said if I ever see ...)

chorus  {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Watch out for Charley's ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Watch out for Charley's ...)

        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (- huh, Watch out, you'd ...)
        {E/E.B}{A/A.B}{E/E.B}{A/A.B}   (Charley's girl)
        ... fade out




* 16-beat rhythm

   ______  ______  ______  ______
| / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / | 1/16
  o                           o     (chord change timing)


   ___  ___  ___  ___    ___  ___  ___  ___
| //// //// //// //// | //// //// //// //// |
  o                o    o                o
 {E        /E.     B  }{A        /A.     B  }




* intro and chorus

      {E         / E.           B}   {A       /  A.   B}
 1e -----------------------------------------------------
 2B --7h9-x-9-9--x-9-x-9-x-9--7-7-----5/7--5-\---5/7--x--
 3G --8h9-x-9-9--x-9-x-9-x-9--8-8-----6/8--6-\---6/8--x--
 4D --------------------------9-9-----7/9--7-\---7/9--x--
 5A -----------------------------------------------------
 6E -----------------------------------------------------

  {E         / E.           B}   {A       / A.    B}
-----------------------------------------------------
--7h9-x-9-9--x-9-x-9-x-9--7-7-----5/7--5-------------
--8h9-x-9-9--x-9-x-9-x-9--8-8-----6/8--6---13r11-9---   ...
--------------------------9-9-----7/9--7-------------
-----------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








======================================================
"Charley's Girl"
(single version)
======================================================
7" single
(Lou Reed, 1976)

album _El Lado Salvaje - Los Grandes Exitos 1972-1986_
(Lou Reed, 1999)

        (Watch out for Charley)
        (watch out for Charley)

        Everybody said that you'd better watch out
        man, she's gonna turn you in (watch out for Charley)
        And me, you know that I thought that I lucked out
        and now look at the trouble that I'm in
        you know you'd better -

        watch out for Charley's girl (watch out for Charley)

        they said everybody had to leave

        When they knocked upon my door
        you know I'd been there before

        They had a search warrant to get it
        but it was all for him
        He once said you'd better help me out
        'cause Sharon's a bitch and she won't even help me out
        she'll turn me in, you'd better-better -

        Watch out, watch out for Charley's girl
        hey, watch out for Charley's girl
        she'll turn you in, you'd better -

=====================================
"Chelsea Girls"
=====================================
album _Chelsea Girl_
(Nico, 1967)

written by Lou Reed/Sterling Morrison

Lou Reed: guitar
=====================================


        Here's Room 506
        it's enough to make you sick
        Brigit's all wrapped up in foil
        you wonder if
        she can uncoil

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Here's Room 115
        filled with SM queens
        Magic marker row
        you wonder just
        how high they go

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Here's Pope dear Ondine
        Rona's treated him so mean
        She wants another scene
        she wants to be
        a human being

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Pepper she's having fun
        she thinks she's some men's son
        Her perfect loves don't last
        her future died
        in someone's past

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Dear Ingrid's found her lick
        she's turned another trick
        Her treats and times revolve
        she's got problems
        to be solved

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Poor Mary, she's uptight
        she can't turn out her light
        She rolled Susan in a ball
        and now she can't
        see her at all

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Drop-out, she's in a fix
        amphetamine has made her sick
        White powder in the air
        she's got no bones
        and can't be scared

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Here comes Johnny Bore
        he collapsed on the floor
        They shot him up with milk
        and when he died
        sold him for silk

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I found another error,
this time in the lyrics for the Nico song "Chelsea girls".
In the first verse, third line is supposed to be:

Bridget's all wrapped up in foil

I'm not sure if it is spelled "Brigit",
which is one of the persons
involved with Andy Warhol and the Factory.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Bjorn Waller (bjwa6373@hem1.passagen.se)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I found some errors in your lyrics for Chelsea Girls,
Velvet Nursery Rhyme and Lady Godiva's Operation.
Here are the correct ones:



Chelsea Girls 
        ==========
        Here's Room five four six
        it's enough to make you sick
        Bridget's all wrapped up in foil
        you wonder if
        she can uncoil

        Here they come now
        see them run now
        Here they come now
        Chelsea Girls

        Here's Room One fifteen
        filled with SM queens
        Magic marker row
        you wonder just
        how high they go

        Here's Pope dear Ondine
        Rona's treated him so mean
        She wants another scene
        she wants to be
        a human being

        Pepper she's having fun
        she thinks she's some men's son
        Her perfect loves don't last
        her future died
        in someone's past

        Dear Ingrid's found her lick
        she's turned another trick
        Her treats and times revolve
        she's got problems
        to be solved

        Poor Mary, she's uptight
        she can't turn out her light
        She rolled Susan in a ball
        and now she can't
        see her at all

        Dropout, she's in a fix
        amphetamine has made her sick
        White powder in the air
        she's got no bones
        and can't be scared

        Here comes Johnny Bore
        he collapsed on the floor
        They shot him up with milk
        and when he died
        sold him for silk

<PRE>
============================
"Chooser And The Chosen One"
(instrumental)
============================
album _Rock And Roll Heart_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

composed by Lou Reed
============================



sax.    {Asus2}{Asus2}{A}{A}
        {Asus2}{Asus2}{A}{A}
        {Asus2}{Asus2}{A}{A}
break   {Asus2}{Asus2}{A...

        {E}{E}{A}{A}            * tab1
        {E}{E}{A}{A}            * tab1

        {D}{D}{A}{E}            * tab3
        {A}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {A}{A}{A}{A/E}          * tab4

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>The City In The Sea/Shadow</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
============================
"The City In The Sea/Shadow"
============================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
============================



        Death has reared himself a throne



        In a strange city
        alone



        Death has reared himself a throne
        In a strange city
        alone
        Their shrines and palaces are not like ours
        They do not tremble and rot
        Eaten with time



        Death has reared himself a throne



        Lifted by forgotten winds
        Resignedly beneath the sky
        The melancholy waters lie
        A crown of stars



        In a strange city
        alone



        A heaven God does not condemn
        But the everlasting shadow
        Makes mockery of it all



        No holy rays come down
        Lights from the lurid deep sea
        stream up the turrets silently
        Up thrones, up arbors
        Of sculpted ivy and stone flowers
        Up domes, up spires
        Kingly halls all are melancholy shrines
        The columns, frieze and entablature
        Chokingly shockingly intertwined
        The mast, the viol, and the vine
        Twisted



        There amid no earthly moans
        Hell rises from a thousand thrones
        Does reverence to death
        And death does give his undivided time



        There are open temples and graves
        on a level with the waves
        Death looms and looks
        huge
        gigantic
        There is a ripple
        now a wave
        Towers thrown aside
        Sinking in the dull tide
        The waves glowing redder
        The very hours losing their breath



        Oh, the cunning stars
        watching fitfully over night after night of
        matchless wretched sleep
        matched only with the horror of the dream unfolding
        The tell-tale beating of the heart
        the suffocating breath
        The desire, the pose
        one poses upon the precipice
        to fall to run to dive to tumble to fall down
        down into the spiral down and then

        One sees one's own death
        one sees one committing murder or atrocious violent acts
        and then a cursed shadow
        not of man or God
        but the shadow resting upon the brazen doorway

        There were seven of us there
        who saw the shadow as it came out from among the draperies
        But we did not dare behold it
        We looked down into the depths of the mirror of ebony
        And the apparition spoke
        "I am a shadow
        and I dwell in the catacombs
        which border
        the country of illusion
        hard by the dim plains of wishing"

        And then did we start shuddering
        starting from our seats
        trembling
        for the tones in the voice of the shadow
        were not the tones of any one man
        but of a multitude of beings
        and varying in their cadences
        from syllable to syllable
        fell duskily upon our ears in the well-remembered
        and familiar accents of a thousand departed friends




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>City Lights</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"City Lights"
================================
album _The Bells_
(Lou Reed, 1979)

written by Lou Reed/Nils Lofgren
================================


        Don't these city lights
        light these streets to life
        Don't these crazy nights
        bring us together
        Any rainy day
        you can dance those blues away
        Don't these city lights
        bring us together

        Charlie Chaplin's cane
        well it flicked away the rain
        Things weren't quite the same
        after he came here
        But then when he left
        upon our own request
        Things weren't quite the same
        after he came here

        Don't these city lights
        bring these streets to life
        Don't these crazy nights
        bring us together
        Any rainy day
        you can dance those blues away
        Don't these city lights
        bring us together

        We're supposed to be
        a land of liberty
        And those city lights
        to blaze forever
        But that little tramp
        leaning on that street corner lamp
        When he left us
        his humor left us forever

        We're supposed to be
        a land of liberty
        And those city lights
        to blaze forever
        But that little tramp
        leaning on that street corner lamp
        When he left us
        his humor left us forever, ever

        Don't these city lights
        bring these streets to life
        Don't these crazy nights
        bring us together
        Any rainy day
        you can dance those blues away
        Don't these city lights
        bring us together
        Together




* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)




intro   /Dsus4}

        {D}{A}{Em}{G}    (Don't these city lights ...)
        {D}{A}{Em}{D}    (Don't these crazy nights ...)
        {D}{A}{Em}{G}    (Any rainy day ...)
        {D}{A}{Em}{D}    (Don't these city lights ...)
        {D}              (Charlie -)

        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- Chaplin's cane ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- quite the same ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (- when he left ...)
        {Em}{Em}{A}{A}   (- quite the same ...)

        ....

piano   {D}{A}{Em}{G}
        {D}{A}{Em}{D}
        {D}{A}{Em}{G}
        {D}{A}{Em}{D}
        {D}

        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (We're supposed to be ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- city lights to blaze forever ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}   (- little tramp, leaning on ...)
        {Em}{Em}{A}{A}   (When he left us, his humor left us ...)

        {D}{A}{Em}{G}    (Don't these city lights ...)
        {D}{A}{Em}{D}    (Don't these crazy nights ...)
        {D}{A}{Em}{G}    (Any rainy day ...)
        {D}{A}           (Don't these city lights)
        {Em/D...         (bring us together)
        {G/D...          (together)




---------------------------------------------------------------------




* chords for standard-tuning

        {D#m}{D#m}{G#}{G#}   (- quite the same ...)

        ....

<TITLE>Claim To Fame</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
===========================
"Claim To Fame"
===========================
album _Rock And Roll Heart_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
===========================


        Talk talk, yak yak
        watch out for that old one track
        Get it up and get it back
        making it upon your back

        No space, no rent
        the money's gone, it's all been spent now
        tell me 'bout your claim to fame

        Now ain't that some claim to fame

        Extra extra, read all about it now
        extra extra, something 'bout the claim to fame
        Ooohhh sweet mama, ooohhh sweet mama
        something 'bout a claim to fame

        Wet lips, dry mouth
        ready for that old hand out now
        ain't that some claim to fame

        Spaced out, spaced dead
        the head's round, the square is pegged
        ain't that some claim to fame

        Now tell me ain't that some claim to fame

        Extra extra, read all about it now
        extra extra, something, something 'bout some claim to fame
        Ooohhh-wheee sweet mama, extra extra, something
        something 'bout a claim to fame

        Yeah now

        I said now extra extra
        something 'bout a claim to fame
        I said now extra extra
        something 'bout a claim to fame
        Ooohhh mama, said now extra extra
        something 'bout a claim to fame
        Extra extra, something 'bout a
        about a, about a, something 'bout a claim to fame
        Extra extra, something 'bout a
        'bout a, 'bout a, something 'bout a claim to fame
        Ooohhh sweet mama
        something 'bout a claim to fame
        Oh, ooohhh sweet mama
        something 'bout a claim to fame
        ....



intro   {F}{Am}{D}{D}

        {F}{Am}{D}{D}        (Talk talk, yak yak ...)
        {F}{Am}{D}{D}        (Get it up and get it back ...)

        {G/C}{D}

        {F}{Am}{D}{D}        (No space, no rent ...)

        {G/C}{D}{G/C}{D}     (- ain't that some claim to fame)

        {F}{F}{A#}{C}        (Extra extra, read all about it ...)
        {F}{F}               (- fame)
        {F}{F}{A#}{C}        (Ooohhh sweet mama ...)
        {F/A#}{C}{F/A#}{C}   (- fame)

        {F}{Am}{D}{D}        (Wet lips, dry mouth ...)

        {G/C}{D}

        {F}{Am}{D}{D}        (Spaced out, spaced dead ...)

        {G/C}{D}{G/C}{D}     (- ain't that some claim to fame)

        {F}{F}{A#}{C}        (Extra extra, read all about it ...)
        {F}{F}               (- fame)
        {F}{F}{A#}{C}        (Ooohhh-wheee sweet mama ...)
        {F}{F}               (- fame, Yeah now)

        key change

        {G}{G}               (I said now -)

        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- extra extra, something 'bout ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- extra extra, something 'bout ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- extra extra, something 'bout ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- about a, about a, something ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- 'bout a, 'bout a, something ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- ooohhh sweet mama, something ...)
        {C}{D}{G}{G}         (- ooohhh sweet mama, something ...)
        ... fade out

<PRE>
=========================================
"Complete The Story Now"
=========================================
album _Wild Angel_
(Nelson Slater, 1976)

written by Nelson Slater

Lou Reed:
produce, piano, guitar, background vocals
=========================================


        Complete this story now
        defeat must take its bow
        Guide him and sweetly show him how

        You're not too late
        and you could never be
        but if you wait
        you're suffering needlessly

        Ooohhh
        ooohhh, oh-oh

        Again soon you will lie
        against him while you cry
        You must refill what you can't hide

        He won't refuse
        and even if he tried
        what forced to choose
        he'll keep you by your side

        Complete this story now
        defeat this story now
        Complete this story now
        defeat must take its bow

        Oh, oh
        yeah, oh



intro             /F}
        {F/G}{C}{F/G}

        {C}{F/G}{C}{F/G}           (Complete this story now ...)
        {C/{C.Em(onB)/Am.G}{F/G}   (Guide him and sweetly show ...)
        {C/G}{F/C}{C/G}{F/C}       (- not too late and you ...)

        {C/F}{F.G/C}{C/F}{F.G/     (Ooohhh ...)

        {C}{F/G}{C}{F/G}           (Again soon you will lie ...)
        {C/{C.Em(onB)/Am.G}{F/G}   (You must refill what you ...)
        {C/G}{F/C}{C/G}{F/         (- refuse and even if he ...)

        {C}{F/G}{C}{F/G}           (- side, Complete this story ...)
        {C}{F/G}{C}{F/G}           (Complete this story now ...)

        {C.Em(onB)/Am.G}{F}{F}     (Oh, oh, yeah, oh)
break   {C.....x

coda                 /C}
        {F/G}{C}{F/G}{C}
        {F/G}{C}{F/G}{C/C...

==========================
"Complete The Story Now"
==========================
unreleased live
(Lou Reed, 1975)

* written by Nelson Slater

Apr 26, 1975
Felt Forum, NYC

        Complete this story now, yeah
        defeat must take its bow
        Again and gently show him how

        It's not too late
        and refill never be
        but if you wait
        you're ..... suffering needlessly

        This must he said he lie
        against him while he cries
        You must ..... she can't hide

        They not .......
        and refill never be
        but if you please
        the suffering needlessly

        Just what he said he laugh
        against you while you cry
        You must keep what you can't hide

        It's not too late
        and refill never be
        but if you wait
        you're suffering needlessly

        Complete this story now
        defeat must take its bow
        Complete this story now
        you know defeat must take its bow

<HTML>
<HEAD>
   <TITLE>Coney Island Baby</TITLE>
   <META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================
"Coney Island Baby"
=========================
album _Coney Island Baby_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        You know man when I was a young man in high school
        you believe it or not
        I wanted to play football for the coach
        And all those older guys
        they said that he was mean and cruel, but you know -
        I wanted to play football for the coach
        They said I was a little too light weight
        to play line-backer
        so's I'm playing right-end
        I wanted to play football for the coach
        'Cause you know someday man you gotta stand up straight
        unless you're gonna fall
        then you're goin' to die
        And the straightest dude
        I ever knew was standing right by me all the time
        So I had to play football for the coach
        Man I wanted to play football for the coach

        When you're all alone and lonely
        in your midnight hour
        And you find that your soul
        it's been up for sale

        And you begin to think 'bout
        all the things that you've done
        And begin to hate
        just 'bout everything

        But remember the princess who lived on the hill
        Who loved you even though she knew you was wrong
        And right now she just might come shining through
        and the -

        - Glory of love, glory of love
        glory of love, just might come through

        When all your two-bit friends
        have gone and ripped you off
        They're talking behind your back saying
        man, you're never gonna be no human being
        Then you start thinking again
        'bout all those things that you've done
        And who it was and what it was
        and all the different things you made every different scene

        Ah, but remember that the city is a funny place
        Something like a circus or a sewer
        And just remember different people have peculiar tastes
        and the -

        - Glory of love, the glory of love
        the glory of love, might see you through
        yeah, but now now
        Glory of love, the glory of love
        the glory of love, might see you through
        Glory of love, uh huh huh, the glory of love
        Glory of love, glory of love
        Glory of love now, glory of love now
        Glory of love now now now, glory of love
        Glory of love, give it to me now
        glory of love see you through (huh)
        I'm a Coney Island Baby now
        (I'm a Coney Island Baby now)
        I'd like to send this one out to Lou and Rachel
        and all the kids in PS 192
        Coney Island Baby
        Man I swear I'd give the whole thing up for you




intro   {C}{F}{C}{F}

        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (You know man when I was a ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (And all those older guys ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (They said that I was a ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              ('Cause you know someday ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (And the straightest dude I ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (And I wanted to play ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (When you're all alone and ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (- midnight hour, And you ...)
        {Dm}{G}                   (- sale)

        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (And you begin to think ...)
        {C}{F}{Dm}{G}             (And begin to hate ...)

        {Am}{Am/Am.G}{F}{F/F.G}   (But remember the princess ...)
        {Am}{Am/Am.G}{F}{F/F.G}   (Who loved you even though ...)
        {Am}{Am/Am.G}{F}{F/F.G}   (And right now she just ...)

        {C}{F}{C}{F}              (Glory of love, glory of love)
        {C}{F}{Dm}{G}             (glory of love, just might ...)

        ....




* riff

     {C}              {F}
 1e -------------------------------------
 2B ------1--0--1----------1--0--1-------
 3G ------0--0--0----------2--2--2-------   ...
 4D ----2----------------3---------------
 5A --3----------------3-----------------
 6E -------------------------------------

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








=========================
"Coney Island Baby"
=========================
album _Take No Prisoners_
(Lou Reed, 1978)

May 1978
Bottom Line, NYC
=========================


        When I was a young man in high school
        I wanted to play football for the coach and
        Freeport, right
        Islip park, Massapequa park, Rockville Center
        The older guys said he's
        he's mean and he's cruel now
        I want to play football for the coach
        I was a little too light weight to go out for line-backer
        I wanted to be line-backer
        The grass is always greener
        so I went out for right-end
        Actually I was a pole vaulter
        I went out in the sectionals at eight-six, right
        That's pathetic, Big Mac, .....
        'Cause some day man you gotta stand up straight
        unless you're gonna fall and
        then you're goin' to die, going to die
        And the straightest dude
        I ever knew is standing right by me all the time
        but I had to play football for the coach
        And I wanted to play football for the coach
        I had to play ball with the coach
        and I wanted to do it with the coach

        When you're all alone and lonely
        baby babe you, it's your midnight hour
        And you find out that your soul
        don't you know that your soul has been up for sale

        Then you start thinkin' of
        baby, you've been doin' soon ..... drinkin' and
        thinkin' about all the things that you've done
        Listening to people that you said that shouldn't have fun -
        with who it was and what it was
        and all those things, all the things
        you hated everything I want
        everything I want

        Remember the princess on the hill
        Ah baby, baby, ah baby don't you know you was wrong
        Remember that a love just might come shining through but -

        Hey, the glory of love
        Ooohhh sweet nuthin'
        won't you tell me 'bout the glory of love
        Baby, how I miss your love and I need the glory of love
        It just might see you through
        Don't you know it might happen to you

        When all your two-bit friends they've gone
        and they ripped you right off says everything you ....
        They say, hey hey Lou Reed
        there's no way you'll live to be human being
        The things ain't what they seem
        I'm walking in a dream

        Then you start to thinking
        you're doing too much thinking and they said
        said, said, look at
        look at all those things that you've done
        And I said
        And what it was and who it was and
        all those things that I hate everything you want
        hate everything you want

        Remember that the city is a funny place
        Something like a circus or a sewer
        And right now, ah, just city's like a sewer for me, baby

        Ah baby babe, the glory of love
        Yeah, the glory of love
        Why don't you know the glory of love
        Baby, it will see you through

        (Glory of love, uh huh, yeah, glory of love)
        Don't you know 'bout the glory of love
        (Glory of love)
        The glory of love will see you through

        (Glory of love)
        Don't you know 'bout the glory of love, baby
        (Glory of love)
        Yeah, the glory of love
        (Glory of love)
        It just might see you through
        Baby, ah baby, ah baby

        (Glory of love)
        Baby, yeah yeah yeah glory of love
        (Glory of love)
        Don't you tell me 'bout the glory of love and
        (Glory of love)
        Don't you know the glory of love
        Might just see you through
        Baby, don't you know it will happen to you

        (Glory of love)
        It never happen to you
        (Glory of love, woh)
        (Glory of love)
        Don't you know I'm just a Coney Island Baby now

        (Glory of love)
        Don't you know I'm just a Coney Island Baby now
        (Glory of love)
        Don't you know, why don't you know
        It just might happen to you
        It just might love come ...... see you through
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Don't ......... see you through
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Don't you know that it just might see you through
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Yeah, yeah yeah, see you
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Baby baby baby, might see you through
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Don't you know, yeah
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Baby baby baby baby baby, how I love you
        (Glory of love, glory of love)
        Yeah yeah yeah, it's a Coney Island Baby

"Coney Island Baby"

album _Perfect Night Live In London_

Royal Festival Hall, London

        You know I was a young man in high school
        wanted to play football for the coach
        All the older guys, they said he was mean and cruel
        but you know I wanted to play football for the coach
        They said I was a little too light weight
        to play line-backer
        so I played right-end, wanted to play football for the coach
        Cause you know someday you gotta stand up straight
        unless you're gonna fallin' and you're goin' to die
        And the straightest dude
        I ever knew was standing right by me all the time
        so I had to play football for the coach
        I wanted to play football for the coach

        it's your midnight hour
        and you find that your very soul
        it's been up for sale

        And who it was, what it was
        and all the different things you made everything want

        Something like a circus or a sewer, ah
        Ah, and different people they got peculiar tastes
        and the -

"Coney Island Baby"


When I was a young man in high school
I want to play football for the coach
Ah....
The older guys said he's he's mean and he's cruel now
I want to play football for the coach
I was to little too light weight to go out for line-backer

The grass is always green
So I went out for right-end
Actually I was ...
I went for the section at eight six right
That's pathetic
Big mac

Cause some day, man, you gotta stand up straight
Unless you're gonna fall
And then you're going to die
Going to die
And the straightest dude I ever knew
Was standing right by me, all the time
But I had to play football for the coach
And I wanted to play football for the coach
I have eightball with the coach
And I wanted to do it with the coach

And you find out that your soul don't you know that your soul,
it has been up for sale

you've been doing too much drinking and thinking

with who it was and what it was

I wanted to play football for the coach, ahh, Freeport Right

thanks: Brad Saltzberg (bcsaltzberg@shaw.ca)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


from take no prisoners:

your version:

"When all your two-bit friends they've gone
        and they ripped you right off says everything you ....
        They say, hey hey Lou Reed
        there's no way you'll ever be human being
        The things ...... what they seem
        ah, walkin' in the train"



I think it goes:

"when all your two-bit freinds have gone a ripped you off...
every single one
they say hey hey lou reed,
there's no way you'll live to be human, babe
but things ain't what they seem, I'm walking in a dream..."


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Brad Saltzberg (bcsaltzberg@shaw.ca)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

another important correction: from Coney Island Baby TNP:

"Actually, I was a "coldwater",
I went out of the section .. eight-six"


The correct word is "pole vaulter"- as in gymnastics...
then it's

"I went out of the sectionals at 8' 6"
- as in eight feet, six inches

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
================================
"Coney Island Steeplechase"
================================
album _Another View_
(The Velvet Underground, 1986)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/
Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker

May 06, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
================================


        Would you like to go on the Coney Island Steeple
        go and have a good time
        We'll take the subway right down to King's Highway
        goin' out and have a good time

        It'd be so nice
        like summer with ice
        If you come and go with me
        the roller-coaster you and me
        We'd just fly

        Would you like to go on the Coney Island Steeple
        go and have a good time
        Like a sister and brother who cling to each other
        when they find out their parents are mad

        Oh, it'd be so nice
        like summer with ice
        Oh, if you come and go with me
        how nice it would be
        Don't we would fly

        Monday
        Tuesday, Wednesday
        Thursday, baby, not Friday
        Saturday, Sunday
        Coney Island, Coney Island
        Coney Island

        Coney Island, Coney Island
        Coney Island, Coney Island
        Coney Island, Coney Island
        ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro    A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}      (Would you -)

        {D}{A}{G}{G/Em}   (- like to go on the Coney Island ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{G/Em}   (We'll take the subway right down ...)

        {Em}{A}{B}{B}     (It'd be so nice, like summer ...)
        {G}{A}{G}{A}      (If you come and go with me ...)
        {B}{B}            (- fly)

        ...

        {G}{A}{D}{B}      (Monday)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}      (Tuesday, Wednesday)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}      (Thursday, baby, not Friday)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}      (Saturday, Sunday)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {G}{A}            (Coney Island)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        ... fade out




* intro (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

      A}
*1d -----
*2A --1--
*3F --2--
*4C --2--
*5G -----
*6D -----

---------------------------------------
--2-2-2-2--2-2-2-1---2-2-2-2--2-2-2-1--
--2-2-2-2--2-2-2-2---2-2-2-2--2-2-2-2--   ...
--2-2-2-2--2-2-2-2---2-2-2-2--2-2-2-2--

* chords and tabs for standard-tuning



intro    G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}      (Would you -)

        {C}{G}{F}{F/Dm}   (- like to go on the Coney Island ...)
        {C}{G}{F}{F/Dm}   (We'll take the subway right down ...)

        {Dm}{G}{A}{A}     (It'd be so nice, like summer ...)
        {F}{G}{F}{G}      (If you come and go with me ...)
        {A}{A}            (- fly)

        ...

        {F}{G}{C}{A}      (Monday)
        {F}{G}{C}{C}      (Tuesday, Wednesday)
        {F}{G}{C}{C}      (Thursday, baby, not Friday)
        {F}{G}{C}{C}      (Saturday, Sunday)
        {F}{G}{C}{C}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {F}{G}            (Coney Island)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}      (Coney Island, Coney Island)
        ... fade out

---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

there were still a lot of errors in the lyrics for
"Coney Island steeplechase".
I'm pretty sure I've got it right now,
although there are a couple of lines
that don't make much sense to me
I can't understand that he's saying something else.

The lines that don't make sense
(although I'm 99% sure this is what he's singing) are
"Like summer with ice" and "Don't we would fly"...
On the last one it's possible that he sang wrong,
and then corrected himself, making this a wierd line.
This is quite possible since this song wasn't released
(until "Another view" came along).
It's also possible that he's so fond of ice
that he likes to eat it all summer or something like
that and therefore sings "Like summer with ice".
But, like I said, I think I've got it right this time:



Would you like to go on a Coney Island steeple
Go out and have a good time
We'll take the subway right down to King's Highway
Goin' out and have a good time

It'd be so nice
Like summer with ice
If you come and go with me
The roller-coaster you and me
We'd just fly

Would you like to go on a Coney Island Steeple
Go out and have a good time
Like a sister and brother who cling to each other
When they find out their parents are mad

Oh, it'd be so nice
Like summer with ice
Oh, if you come and go with me
How nice it would be
Don't we would fly

Monday
Tuesday, Wednesday
Thursday, baby, not Friday
Saturday, oh baby, Sunday
Oh Coney Island, oh Coney Island
Oh Coney Island

Coney Island, Coney Island
Coney Island, Coney Island
Coney Island, Coney Island


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

NEXT SONG

<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Conqueror Worm</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
====================
"The Conqueror Worm"
====================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
====================



Young Poe:

        Lo! it's a gala night
        A mystic throng bedecked
        Sit in a theater to see
        A play of hopes and fears
        While the orchestra breathes fitfully
        The music of the spheres

        Mimes, mutter and mumble low
        Mere puppets they, who come and go
        Disguised as gods
        They shift the scenery to and fro
        Inevitably trapped by invisible Wo

        This motley drama
        to be sure
        Will not be forgotten
        A phantom chased for evermore
        Never seized by the crowd
        Through they circle
        Returning to the same spot
        Circle and return to the selfsame spot
        Always to the selfsame spot
        With much of madness and more of sin
        And horror and mimic rout
        The soul of the plot

        Out
        out are the lights
        out all
        And over each dying form
        The curtain, a funeral pall
        Comes with the rush of a storm
        The angels, haggard and wan
        Unveiling and uprising affirm
        That the play is the tragedy, "Man"
        And its hero the Conqueror Worm




        {D...   (drone)




* 1st and 6th string downtuned to D

*1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2B -----
 3G -----
 4D -----
 5A -----
*6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

<TITLE>Cool It Down</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================
"Cool It Down"
==============================
album _Loaded_
(The Velvet Underground, 1970)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Somebody took the papers
        and somebody's got the key
        And somebody's nailed the door shut
        and says, hey, what you think that you see

        But me l'm down around the corner
        you know I'm looking for Miss Linda Lee
        Because she's got the power to love me by the hour
        gives me W-L-O-V-E, oh

        Hey baby, if you want it so fast
        don't you know that it ain't gonna last
        Of course you know it makes no difference to me

        Somebody's got the time time
        somebody's got the right
        All of the other people
        trying to use up the night

        But now me, l'm out on the corner
        you know I'm looking for Miss Linda Lee
        Because she's got the power to love me by the hour
        gives me W-L-O-V-E, ooohhh

        Hey, if you want it so fast
        but don't you know honey, you can get it so fast
        But of course you know it makes no difference to me

        Oh oh, you better cool it down
        you know you better cool it down
        You know you better cool it down
        you know you better cool it down

        Oh oh oh, hey, if you want it so fast
        now look it, look baby, don't you want it to last
        But of course you know that
        hey, it makes no difference to me

        Oh oh oh, you better cool it down
        now baby, you better, oh, cool it down
        Don't you know you better cool it down
        you know you better cool it down

        You better cool it down
        oh baby, cool it down
        You better cool it down
        oh, you better cool it down



        .x}                       drums
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (Somebody took the papers ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (And somebody's nailed the ...)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}              (- l'm down around the corner ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (- she's got the power to ...)

        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{G/G.A}   (Hey baby, if you want it so ...)
        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{G}       (Of course you know it makes ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (Somebody's got the time time ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (All of the other people ...)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}              (- me, l'm out on the corner ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (- she's got the power to ...)

        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{G/G.A}   (Hey, if you want it so fast ...)
        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{A}       (But of course you know it ...)

        {D}{A}{A#}{D}             (- cool it down, you know you ...)
        {D}{A}{A#}{A#}            (- cool it down, you know you ...)

piano   {D}{D}{D}{D}              (- down)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{G/G.A}   (- hey, if you want it so ...)
        {Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{A}       (But of course you know that ...)

        {D}{A}{A#}{D}             (- cool it down, now baby ...)
        {D}{A}{A#}{A#}            (- cool it down, you know you ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (- down, You better cool it ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}              (- down, You better cool it ...)
        ... fade out

* scale ({Bm}{Bm/Bm.A}{G}{G/G.A} part)

             7   8   9  10
 1e ... -|-o-|---|---|---|- ...
 2B ... -|-o-|---|---|-o-|- ...
 3G ... -|-o-|---|-o-|---|- ...
 4D ... -|-o-|---|-o-|---|- ...
 5A ... -|---|---|---|---|- ...
 6E ... -|---|---|---|---|- ...



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







=====================================
"Cool It Down"
(early version)
=====================================
album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Somebody's got the papers
        and somebody's got the key
        Somebody nailed the door shut
        and what do you think they'd see

        Down on around the corner
        ah, looking for Miss Linda Lee
        Well she's with a guy that's sweet Jimmy Brown
        and what do you think that they see

        And if you move it fast
        you think that it won't last
        You gonna have to do it
        without me, oh oh ah

        Somebody made the fast call
        somebody yells out twice
        Somebody says, "Hey Henri
        now move your camera, you know it's not nice"

        Somebody's down on the corner
        they're looking for Miss Linda Lee, oh oh now
        Over the bin and the stone again
        but they gotta start without me

        And if they move it so fast
        you think that it won't last
        You know that they going right by me

        Wow, you gotta cool it down
        you gotta cool it down
        You gotta cool it down
        you know you gotta cool, ooohhh, cool down

        (scat)

        Well if you move it fast
        you're sure you want it to last
        You see that it's all right to me

        You know you better cool it down
        you know you better cool it down
        You know you better cool it down
        you know you better cool it down

 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)

---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I've tried the best
I can to update the lyrics for the early version of "Cool it down".
I've corrected some logical errors and filled in the empyt holes.
Here's my corrected version of the text:



Somebody's got the papers
And somebody's got the key
Somebody nailed the door shut
And what you think they'd see

Down on around the corner
Looking for Miss Linda Lee
Well, she's with a guy, that's sweet Jimmy Brown
And what do you think that they see

And if you move it fast, you think that it won't last
You gonna have to do it without me, oh, oh

Somebody made the first call
Somebody yells out twice
Somebody says "Hey, Henry"
Now move your camera, you know it's not nice

Somebody's down on the corner
They're looking for Miss Linda Lee, oh, oh, now
Over the bin and the stone again
But they gotta start without me

And if they move it so fast, you think that it won't last
You know that they going right by me

Wow, you gotta cool it down
You gotta cool it down
You gotta cool it down
You know you gotta cool, oooh, cool down

(scat)

Well, if you move it fast, you're sure you want it to last
You see, that it's all right to me

You know, you better cool it down
you know, you better cool it down
You know, you better cool it down
you know, you better cool it down


---------------------------------------------------------------------

<PRE>
==============================
"Countess From Hong Kong"
(demo)
==============================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale

late 1969
==============================


        Countess from Hong Kong she moves so lightly
        like the summer rain
        And everytime I see and think about her
        it ends up the same
        Walkin' the streets out in Singapore
        it was a funny sight
        But let me say the countess from Hong Kong
        she did everything right

        Countess from Hong Kong
        oh, countess from Hong Kong

        Countess from Hong Kong she moves so lightly
        she's like the summer breeze
        And all of the princes they came from India
        they fell down on their knees
        Silks and satins, what a purple swathe
        she cut among the trees
        The countess from Hong Kong believe me baby
        now you're, ooohhh, like a summer breeze

        Oh, countess from Hong Kong
        Countess from Hong Kong



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}
        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}

        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}   (Countess from Hong Kong she ...)
        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}   (- everytime I see and think ...)
        {C7}{C7}{C7}{C7}   (Walkin' the streets out in ...)
        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}   (But let me say the countess ...)

        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}   (Countess from Hong Kong, oh ...)

harp    {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}
        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}
guitar  {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}
        {G7}{G7}{G7}{G7}

        ....

thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Here's a minor correction for the lyrics of
"Countess from Hong Kong".
At least I think this is what he's singing:

    Silks and satins, what a purple suede
    she cut among the trees


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Geoff Chisholm (chisholm.g@gmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I noticed in the lyrics for "Countess from Hong Kong",
you have the lyrics as

        "Silks and satins, what a purple suede"

On listening to this,
I think he's saying 'swathe', not suede;
it makes more sense lyrically and grammatically.....

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<TITLE>Courtly Orangutans</TITLE>

<PRE>
====================
"Courtly Orangutans"
====================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
====================



Hop Frog:

        Tomorrow is the seasonal ball
        I propose costumes for you
        and the honourable ministers to wear



King:

        Yes?



Hop Frog:

        All dress as orangutans
        All your guests will run and scream
        with their mouths agape
        And try to hide
        And you, Sire, will have last laugh
        For such imperial cunning



        ---



Hop Frog:

        I will redress the wrong
        I will torture you
        I will burn you
        Dead



Tripitena:

        My prince
        My prince
        You light the fire of eternal fame
        Burn, monkeys
        Burn

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<TITLE>Coyote</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================
"Coyote"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        Coyote goes to the top of the hill
        doin' the things that coyotes will
        Staring at the sky, at the moon
        you know he starts to howl

        Coyote goes to the mountain top
        looks over down at the river, says what a drop
        No tame dog is gonna take my born

        Coyote at the top of the hill
        doin' the things coyotes will
        You gotta cast the first stone
        cast the first stone

        Jackal goes to the top of the hill
        doin' the things that jackals will
        Staring at the moon
        you know he starts to howl

        Wild dog up on a mountain top
        blood in his jaws, the bone he drops
        No tame dog is ever
        ever gonna take my bone

        Jackal up on the top of the hill
        doin' the things that jackals will
        Cast the first stone
        cast the first stone

        Coyote on top of the hill
        ooohhh, doin' the things that coyotes will
        Staring at the sky, looks at the moon
        he starts to howl

        Coyote up on the mountain top
        blood in his jaws, the bone he drops
        Says no tame dog is ever
        ever gonna take this bone

        Coyote up on a mountain top
        says what a drop
        You gotta cast the first stone
        cast the first stone
        Cast the first stone
        you gotta cast the first stone



intro    A}            bass
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{D}{D}   (Coyote goes to the top of the hill ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (Staring at the sky, at the moon ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}   (Coyote goes to the mountain top ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (No tame dog is gonna take my born)

        {A}{A}{G}{G}   (Coyote at the top of the hill ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}   (- stone, cast the first stone)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}   (Jackal goes to the top of the hill ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (Staring at the moon, you know he starts ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}   (Wild dog up on a mountain top ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (No tame dog is ever, ever gonna take ...)

        {A}{A}{G}{G}   (Jackal up on the top of the hill ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}   (- stone, cast the first stone)

guitar  {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {G}{G}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {G}{G}{D}{D}

        {C}{C}{F}{F}
        {C}{C}{F}{G}
        {G}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (Staring at the sky, looks at the moon ...)

        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (Says no tame dogs is ever ...)

        {D}{G}{D...    (- stone, you gotta cast the first stone)

----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------

 {F}                  {F}
--3\1--1/3--3--1-x------------------------10--
--3\1--1/3--3--1-x-1----------------------10--
-----------------------2v---------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------

 {C}                      {C}
--10\8--8/10--10\8--8/10---10\--8----------3--
--10\8--8/10--10\8--8/10---10\--8--5v------3--
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------

 {F}                  {G}
--3\1--1/3--3\1--1/3-------------------------
--3\1--1/3--3\1--1/3---3v-----5--5--5-----6--
---------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------

 {G}
--------------------------
--6v-------8--8--8----10--
--------------------------
--------------------------
--------------------------
--------------------------

 {D}                 {D}
---------------------------------------------------
--10v---10^--------------10^-10-10^--10--10^--/15--
---------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------

 {D}                 {D}
-------------------------------------------------
-15v----15--15--15^---15v------------------------
-------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------

(^ - picking harmonics)



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




*********************************************************************

thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I've filled some gaps.
I changed "standing" for "staring" and some other words,
take a look.
This time the problem isn't english,
i think this time it's the sound,
it's hard to understand even for an english speaker
because of the sound.
But  well, we'll wait for someone to complete it!!

Coyote goes to the top of the hill
Doin' the things the coyote's will
Staring at the sky, at the moon
You know he starts to howl

Coyote goes to the mountain top
Looks over down at the river, says "What a drop"
No tend dogs is
Gonna take my bone

Coyote at the top of the hill
Doin' the things coyote's will
You gotta kiss the first stone
Kiss the first stone

Jackal goes to the top of the hill
Doin' the things that jackal's will
Staring at the moon
You know he starts to howl

Wild dog up on a mountain top
Blood in his jaws, the bone, he drops
No tend dogs is ever
Ever gonna take my bone

Jackal up on the top of the hill
Doin' the things that jackal's will
Kiss the first stone
Kiss the first stone

Coyote on top of the hill
Oooh, doin' the things that coyote's will
Staring at the sky, looks at the moon
He starts to howl

Coyote up on the mountain top
Blood in his jaws, the bone, he drops
Says no tend dogs is ever
Ever gonna take this bone

Coyote up on the mountain top
Says "What a drop"
You gotta kiss the first stone
Kiss the first stone
Kiss the first stone
You gotta kiss the first stone

---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jim Hoover (bhoover247@aol.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Re: Please help me with this lyric!
Date: 4 Dec 1998 03:39:03 GMT
From: bhoover247@aol.com (BHoover247)
Organization: AOL http://www.aol.com
Newsgroups: alt.music.lou-reed


&gt;Coyote at the top of the hill
&gt;
&gt;Doin' the thing the coyote's will
&gt;
&gt;You gotta kiss the first stone
&gt;
&gt;Kiss the first stone

I thought the lyric was:
You gotta cast the first stone
Cast the first stone

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Yes you can use my post on your web site.
I'm sure this is the correct lyric.
It is from the biblical story of Jesus
who told a mob that is about to stone a woman to death.
Jesus told the mob that
"he who is without sin to cast the first stone".
It is kind of appropriate with the current political events
being in the current shape.

Peace,

Jim Hoover


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Rocky Sigman (mrrain422@hotmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I'm pretty sure that the line is "no tame dog" not "no tend dog".
Not only does it sound that way (to me anyways),
it also makes more sense.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

==============================
"Crackin' Up"
==============================
rehearsal
(The Velvet Underground, 1966)

written by
Ellas McDaniel ("Crackin' Up")
Lou Reed ("Venus In Furs")

Jan 03, 1966
The Factory, NYC
==============================


        (Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather)
        (to get right into ....)

        Baby, somethin' 'bout the money I spend
        ........

        (Whiplash girlchild in the dark)
        (Whiplash girlchild in the dark)

        ........

        (Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him)
        (Comes in bells)

        ........

        (Your servant)

        ........

        (Don't forsake him)

        Baby, somethin' 'bout the money I spend

        (Strike dear mistress and cure his heart)

        (Strike)
        (dear mistress and cure his heart)

        (Strike dear mistress)
        (Strike dear)

        (Cure his heart)

        (....... first verse, second verse)

        (Downy sins of streetlight fancies)

        (Downy sins of streetlight fancies)
        (streetlight)
        (of streetlight)
        (fancies)

        (chase the costumes)

        (She must wear)



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

<PRE>
=========================
"Crazy Feeling"
=========================
album _Coney Island Baby_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        You're the kind of person that I've been dreaming of
        You're the kind of person that I always wanted to love

        And when I first seen you walk right through that bar door
        And I seen those suit 'n' tie Johns buy you one drink
        then buy you some more, I had that -

        I knew you had that crazy feeling
        now now now you've got that, that crazy feeling
        You know that I've had that crazy feeling, too
        I can see it in ya

        You've got that crazy feeling
        now now now now now you've got that, that crazy feeling
        I've had that crazy feeling, too

        Now everybody knows that business ends at three
        And everybody knows an after hours love is free

        And you, you really are a queen
        oh, such a queen, such a queen
        And I know 'cause I've made the same scene
        I know just what you mean because

        You've got that crazy feeling
        now now now you've got that, that crazy feeling now
        You've got that crazy feeling deep inside
        now oh I can see it in your eyes

        You've got that crazy feeling
        now now now you've got that, that crazy feeling
        You've got that crazy feeling, too
        I feel just like ya, feel just like ya

        (Crazy feeling)
        (Crazy feeling)

        {G}{C/G}{D}{D}

<TITLE>Crazy Mary</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================================
"Crazy Mary"
=============================================
album _Columbia Records Radio Hour, Volume 2_
(Various Artists, 1996)

written by Victoria Williams

performed by Victoria Williams with Lou Reed

Victoria Williams: guitar, vocals
Lou Reed: guitar, vocals
(Mike Rathke: guitar)

Oct 24, 1993
Sony Music Studios, NYC
=============================================


        She lived on a curve of the road
        in an old tar paper shack
        on the south side of the town
        on the wrong side of the tracks

        Sometimes on the way into town
        we'd say, "Mama, can we stop and give her a ride"
        sometimes we did
        but she shocked her and hold hands flew from her side

        Wild eyed, Crazy Mary

        Well down a long dirt road
        past the parson's place
        your old blue car
        we used to race

        The little country store
        with a sign tagged to the side

        Said, "No L-O-I-T-E-R-I-N-G, A, allowed"

        Underneath that sign always congregated
        quite A crowd

        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it, hey, pass it all around
        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it, pass it all around
        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it all around, pass it A, pass it A, around

        One night thunder cracked
        Mercy backed outside my windowsill

        Dreamed I was flying high above the trees and over the hills
        looked down into the house of Mary

        Terrible ponderer
        newspaper covered walls
        and Mary rising up above it all

        Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh

        oh-oh, oh-oh-oh, oh

        Next morning on the way into town
        we saw some skid marks and followed them around
        over the curb
        through the fields into the house of Mary

        That what you fear the most
        could meet you half way
        that what you fear the most
        could meet you half way, yeah

        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it A, around
        take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it A, around
        Take a bottle, drink it, drink it down
        pass it A, around, pass it A, pass it A, around

        Around, 'round
        pass it all around, drink it down
        (Take a bottle, drink it down)
        (pass it all around, pass it all around) pass it all around
        (take a bottle, drink it down) around
        (pass it all around, pass it all around) around
        (Take a bottle, drink it down) around-around-around ...
        (pass it all around) around



        {Bm}{G/G.A}{Bm}{G}      (She lived on a curve in the ...)
        {D/A}{G}{Bm/A}{G}       (Sometimes on the way into ...)
        {G}{A}                  (Wild eyed, Crazy -)

        {A}{G#m}{G}{F#}

        {Bm/A}{G/A}             (Take a bottle, drink it down ...)

============================================
"Crazy Mary"
============================================
album _MTV 120 Minutes Live_
(Various Artists, 1998)

performed by Victoria Williams with Lou Reed

Victoria Williams: vocals, guitar
Lou Reed: guitar, vocals
(Mike Rathke: guitar)
============================================


        She lived on a curve in the road
        in an old tar paper shack
        on the south side of the town
        on the wrong side of the tracks

        Sometimes on the way into town
        we'd say, "Mama, can we stop and give her a ride"
        sometimes we did
        but she shocked her and hold hands flew from her side

        Wild eyed, Crazy Mary

        Down a long dirt road
        past the parson's place
        your old blue car
        we used to race

        The little country store
        with a sign tagged to the side

        Said, "No L-O-I-T-E-R-I-N-G, A, allowed"

        Underneath that sign always congregated
        quite A crowd

        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it around, pass it all around
        (Take a bottle) drink it down
        pass it around, pass it all
        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it A-around, pass it A, pass it all around

        One night thunder backed
        Mercy backed outside my windowsill

        Dreamed I was flying high above the trees and over the hills
        looked down into the house of Mary

        Terrible ponderer
        newspaper covered walls
        and Mary rising up above it all

        Oh, oh-oh-oh-oh
        oh-oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh-oh

        Next morning on the way into town
        we saw some skid marks and followed them around
        over the curb
        through the fields into the house of Mary

        That what you fear the most
        could meet you half way
        that what you fear the most
        could meet you half way
        yeah, say, babe

        Take a bottle, drink it down
        pass it around
        take a bottle, drink it down
        (pass it around) pass it all around
        (Take a bottle, pass it down) drink it down
        (pass it around, pass it around)
        pass it around-around-around-around-around
        (Take a bottle)

        Around
        'round, around, around, around
        around (take a bottle, drink it down)
        (pass it around)
        Around, around (take a bottle, drink it down) ....
        nobody know (pass it around)
        nobody know (take a bottle, drink it down)
        pass it around (pass it around, pass it around)
        Around (take a bottle)


        {Bm}{G/G.A}{Bm}{G}      (She lived on a curve in the ...)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Cremation</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
