NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Empty Bottles</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===============================
"Empty Bottles"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

written by John Cale

John Cale: vocal, guitar
Lou Reed: guitar

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        Empty, empty bottles
        Lying side by side
        Used up empty bottles
        Remembering long lost wine

        Keep our empty bottles
        Making empty wine
        Marking our intentions
        Sadly out of time

        And the summer make you lazy
        A day at a time
        And good company evades you
        Passing you by

        But I do love you against all odds
        Though you don't know what I want
        We're much poorer than that bottle
        More foolish than that wine

        Maybe we can make it
        Though we failed before
        You keep getting closer
        Closer to me once more

        And I'll try to entertain you
        A day at a time
        Try to make myself much clearer
        From your wine

        But I do love you against all odds
        Though you don't know what I want
        Seeing you and seeing me
        We're much poorer than that bottle
        More foolish than that wine



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




intro   {G}{C/{G}{C/
        {G}{C/{G}{C/

        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Empty, empty bottles)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Lying side by side)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Used up empty bottles)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Remembering long lost wine)
        {G}{C/

        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Keep our empty bottles)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Making empty wine)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Marking our intentions)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (Sadly out of time, And the -)

        {Am}{Am/{Am}{Am/   (- summer make you lazy)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (A day at a time, And good -)
        {Am}{Am/{Am}{Am/   (- company evades you)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (Passing you by, But I do -)

        {D}{D/{C}{C/       (- love you against all odds ...)
        {D}{D/{C}{C/       (- don't know what I want, We're much -)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (- poorer than that bottle, More -)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (- foolish than that wine)

        {G}{C/{G}{C/
        {G}{C/

        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Maybe we can make it)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (Though we failed before)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (You keep getting closer)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (Closer to me once more, And I'll -)

        {Am}{Am/{Am}{Am/   (- try to entertain you)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (A day at a time, Try to -)
        {Am}{Am/{Am}{Am/   (- make myself much clearer)
        {G}{C/{G}{G/       (From your wine, But I do -)

        {D}{D/{C}{C/       (- love you against all odds ...)
        {D}{D/{C}{C/       (- don't know what I want, Seeing -)
        {D}{D/{C}{C/       (- you and seeing me, We're much -)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (- poorer than that bottle, More -)
        {G}{C/{G}{C/       (- foolish than that wine)
        {G}{C/

coda    {Em}{Em/D}{C}{C/
        {Em}{Em/D}{C}{C/
        {G}{C/{G}{C/
        {G}{C/{G...




* riff

{G}{C/ means
    __   __   __   __     __   __
 | / /  / /  / /  / /  | / /  / /  |
 { G                   }{C        /




{Em}{Em/D}{C}{C/ means

    __   __   __   __     __   __   __   __
 | / /  / /  / /  / /  | / /  / /  / /  / /  |
 { Em                  }{Em      / D         }

    __   __   __   __     __   __
 | / /  / /  / /  / /  | / /  / /  |
 { C                   }{C       /




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Kandis Jordan (Kandis@pdx.edu)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I don't know if you care or not,
but I think you're the only site online
with the lyrics to this song, and they're wrong :p


Empty, empty bottles
Lying side by side
Used up empty bottles
Remembering long lost wine

Keep our empty bottles
Making empty wine
Marking our intentions
Sadly out of time

And the summers make you lazy
A day at a time
And good company evades you
Passing you by

But I do love you against all odds
Though you don't know what I want
We're much poorer than that bottle
More foolish than that wine

Maybe we can make it
Though we failed before
You keep getting closer
Closer to me once more

And I'll try to entertain you
A day at a time
Try to make myself much clearer
From your wine

But I do love you against all odds
Though you don't know what I want
Seeing you and seeing me
We're much poorer than that bottle
More foolish than that wine

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Endless Cycle</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Endless Cycle"
===================
album _New York_
(Lou Reed, 1989)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        The bias of the father runs on through the son
        Leaving him bothered and bewildered
        The drugs in his veins only cause him to spit
        At the face staring back in the mirror

        How can he tell a good act from the bad
        He can't even remember his name
        How can he do what needs to be done
        When he's a follower and not a leader

        The sickness of the mother runs on through the girl
        Leaving her small and helpless
        Liquor flies through her brain with the force of a gun
        Leaving her running in circles

        How can she tell a good act from the bad
        When she's flat on her back in her room
        How can she do what needs to be done
        When she's a coward and a bleeder

        The man if he marries will batter his child
        And have endless excuses
        The woman sadly will do much the same
        Thinking that it's right and it's proper

        Better than their mommy or their daddy did
        Better than the childhood they suffered
        The truth is they're happier when they're in pain
        In fact, that's why they got married

        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa
        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa
        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa
        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa
        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa
        Pa, pa, pa-pa, pa



intro   {x}            count
        {G}{C/{G}{G}
        {C}{D/{G}{G}
        {G}{C/{G}{G}
        {C}{D/{G}{G}

        {G}{C/{G}{G}   (The bias of the father runs on through ...)
        {C}{D/{G}{G}   (Leaving him bothered and bewildered)
        {G}{C/{G}{G}   (The drugs in his veins only cause him ...)
        {C}{D/{G}{G}   (At the face staring back in the mirror)

        {D}{C/{G}{G}   (How can he tell a good act from the bad)
        {C}{D/{G}{G}   (He can't even remember his name)
        {G}{C/{G}{G}   (How can he do what needs to be done)
        {C}{D/{G}{G}   (When he's a follower and not a leader)

guitar  {G}{C/{G}{G}   * tab 1
        {C}{D/{G}{G}
        {G}{C/{G}{G}
        {C}{D/{G}{G}

        ...

        {C}{D/{G}{G}
        {G}{C/{G}{G}
        {C}{D/{G}{G}

        {C}{D/{G}{G}
        {G}{C/{G}{G}

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Endlessly Jealous</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
======================
"Endlessly Jealous"
======================
album _New Sensations_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        Jealousy endlessly
        sweeps through my mind
        Jealousy often causes me to
        be unkind

        I'm sorry I said that
        I'm sorry I did that
        I'm sorry I hit you
        I'm sorry, I'm sorry

        Endlessly jealous of you
        being endlessly jealous of me
        The man that you thought I could be turning red
        with jealousy

        Endlessly jealousy
        eats through my skull
        Endlessly jealousy
        makes me feel dull

        Fighting
        endless jealous fighting
        I feel my fingers tightening
        tightening please don't break her arm

        Jealously thinking of you
        of your endless possession of me
        Of my jealousy, endlessly, jealousy, endlessly
        jealous of you

        Sorry, running to a phone to say
        I'm sorry, running out of dimes
        the phone on the street, spits at me
        have a good day

        Sorry, please you know how I am sorry
        I've been this way for
        Oh, so long, endlessly, zealously
        jealous of you

        Jealousy endlessly
        eats through my mind
        And jealousy endlessly
        makes me be unkind

        I'm sorry I said that
        I'm sorry I did that
        I'm sorry I hit you
        I'm sorry, I'm sorry

        Endlessly jealous of you
        being endlessly jealous of me
        Endlessly jealous of you being endlessly
        jealous of me

        Endlessly jealous of you
        Endlessly jealous of you
        Endlessly jealous of you
        Endlessly jealous of you



intro   {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{A}{A/A.G}

        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/A.G}
        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/A.G}

        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/A.G}   (Jealousy endlessly sweeps ...)
        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A}       (Jealousy often causes me to ...)

        {G}{D}{G}{G}           (- said that, I'm sorry I did ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}           (Endlessly jealous of you ...)
        {D/G}{D/G}{A}{A}       (- man that you thought I could ...)

guitar  {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{A}{A/A.G}

        ...

bridge  {E}{E}{A}{A}           (Sorry, running  to a phone to ...)
        {D}{A}{E}{E}           (the phone on the street spits ...)

bridge  {E}{E}{A}{A}           (Sorry, please you know how I ...)
        {D}{A}{E}{E}           (Oh, so long, endlessly ...)

guitar  {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{A}{A/A.G}

        ...

        {D}{G}{D}{G}           (Endlessly jealous of you ...)
        {D/G}{D/G}{A}{A.G}     (Endlessly jealous of you being ...)

coda    {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/A.G}   (Endlessly jealous of you)
        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/G}     (Endlessly jealous of you)
        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/A.G}   (Endlessly jealous of you)
cowbell {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/G}     (Endlessly jealous of you)
        {D/D.G}{D}{A}{A/G}
        ... fade out




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Kirill Rodionov (thaumaturge@chat.ru)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

"Endlessly Jealous"

    Sorry, running to a phone to say
    I'm sorry, running out of dimes
    a phone on the street spits at me
    have a good day

    Sorry, please you know how I'm sorry
    I've been this way for
    Oh, so long, endlessly, zealously
    jealous of you

<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================
"Ennui"
=========================
album _Sally Can't Dance_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        All the things you said
        you thought I was dead
        everything made me feel aware
        Ah, you're getting old
        you're doing things
        you're losing your hair

        All the things that you used to believe in
        Turned out to be true, you're guilty of reason

        You're the kind of person
        that I could
        do without
        Ah, certain kinds of money
        would make you see
        what it's all about

        There's a first time for everything
        And the first one's on me, don't you see

        All of the things that your old lover said
        well look at them, they jump out of windows
        and now they're just dead
        It's the truth, don't you realize

        They live without any talent or fun
        running out on the streets, balling anyone
        It's the truth, It's the truth

        Pick up the pieces that make up your life
        maybe someday you'll have a wife and then alimony
        Oh, can't you see



intro   {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}

        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}   (All the things you said ...)
        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}   (Ah, you're getting old ...)

        {Gm}{Gm}{A#}{A#}           (All the things that you ...)
        {Gm}{Gm}{C}{C}             (Turned out to be true ...)

        ...

guitar  {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}
        {Gm}{C}{Gm}{C}

        ...

        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}   (All of the things that ...)
        {Gm}{Gm}{C}{C}             (- truth, don't you realize)

        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}   (They live without any ...)
        {Gm}{A#}{F}{F}             (- truth, It's the truth)

        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}   (Pick up the pieces that ...)
        {Gm}{Gm}{Gm}{C}            (- alimony, Oh, can't you see)

guitar  {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F/Gm}{Am/C}
        {F/Gm}{Am/C}{F...




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for down-tuning



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}

        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}   (All the things you said ...)
        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}   (Ah, you're getting old ...)

        {Am}{Am}{C}{C}             (All the things that you ...)
        {Am}{Am}{D}{D}             (Turned out to be true ...)

        ...

guitar  {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}
        {Am}{D}{Am}{D}

        ...

        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}   (All of the things that ...)
        {Am}{Am}{D}{D}             (- truth, don't you realize)

        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}   (They live without any ...)
        {Am}{C}{G}{G}              (- truth, It's the truth)

        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}   (Pick up the pieces that ...)
        {Am}{Am}{Am}{D}            (- alimony, Oh, can't you see)

guitar  {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G/Am}{Bm/D}
        {G/Am}{Bm/D}{G...

<TITLE>European Son</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=======================================
"European Son"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/
Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker
=======================================


        You killed your European Son
        you spit on those under twenty-one
        But now your blue clouds have gone
        you'd better say so long, hey hey hey, bye bye bye

        You made your wallpapers green
        you want to make love to the scene
        Your European Son is gone
        you'd better say so long, your clouds driftin' goodbye



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E}                bass
        {E}{E}{E}{E}       guitar
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}
        
        {E}{E}{E}{E}       (You killed your European Son ...)
        {E}{E/A}{A}{E}     (But now your blue clouds have gone ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}       (You made your wallpapers green ...)
        {E}{E/A}{A}{E}     (Your European Son is gone ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}          S.E.

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E.D/D}
        {E}{E}{E}{E.D/D}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        ....




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {D}                bass
        {D}{D}{D}{D}       guitar
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}
        
        {D}{D}{D}{D}       (You killed your European Son ...)
        {D}{D/G}{G}{D}     (But now your blue clouds have gone ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{D}{D}       (You made your wallpapers green ...)
        {D}{D/G}{G}{D}     (Your European Son is gone ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}          S.E.

guitar  {D}{D}{D}{D.C/C}
        {D}{D}{D}{D.C/C}

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        ....








===================================================
"European Son"
(acetate version)
===================================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico - Unripened_
(The Velvet Underground, 2007)
===================================================



        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        European Son is a longer version
        with a one-minute extra guitar solo after the 'plate break',
        which was probably edited out for the final release.</em>




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Nick Heidel (kheidel@net-link.net)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Looking over the lyrics for European Son,
I believe the phrase
"your clown's bid you" is actually "your cloud's drifted".

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<TITLE>Every Frog Has His Day</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
========================
"Every Frog Has His Day"
========================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
========================



King:

        Oh mellifluous dwarf
        prince of all the jesters
        Funny little thing you are
        Make me laugh
        As God's voluminous star



Hop Frog:

        Gracious majesty
        Today is not made for laughter day
        This moment sacred is more for royal sunsets
        Then comic ruin or suicidal jests



King:

        I'll be the judge of that thank you
        Make me laugh le petite cur
        Drink some wine
        Lest you foul sweet time



Hop Frog:

        Drink upsets me
        please your liege
        This would mark the death me



King:

        I said drink you scabrous whore
        Are you deaf as well as short?



Tripitena:

        Kingdom's Sire
        big as you are
        Save such
        bile for larger foes



King:

        Make me laugh
        'Fore I stretch your neck like a giraffe

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<TITLE>Everybody's Sweetheart</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
=======================================================
"Everybody's Sweetheart"
=======================================================
album
_Swingin' Teen Sounds Of Ronnie Dove and Terry Philips_
(Ronnie Dove/Terry Philips, 1965)

written by Baron/Philips/Irby

performed by Terry Philips

Lou Reed: guitar (?)
=======================================================


        When I left you promised you'll be true
        Like a fool I believed in you
        When I return what did I find
        You've been everybody's sweetheart but mine

        Lonely nights you wrote me made you cry
        Now I know each letter was a lie
        When I return what did I find
        You've been everybody's sweetheart but mine

        While I was .........
        You wouldn't wastin' any time
        Lots of guys may show you ..........
        You've been everybody's sweetheart but mine

        All my dreams I shut out ....
        Every dream is just a nightmare now
        Since I returned only to find
        You've been everybody's sweetheart but mine
        Since I returned only to find
        You've been everybody's sweetheart but mine



          /E.F#m.G#m}
        {A}{D}{A}{A7}            (When I left you promised ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{A7}            (Like a fool I believed in you ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{F#m}           (- return what did I find ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{E/E.F#m.G#m}   (- everybody's sweetheart but mine)

        {A}{D}{A}{A7}            (Lonely nights you wrote me ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{A7}            (Now I know each letter was a ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{F#m}           (- return what did I find ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{A7}            (- everybody's sweetheart but ...)

bridge  {E}{E}{A}{A7}            (- I was .........)
        {E}{E}{A}{A7}            (You wouldn't wastin' any time)
        {E}{E}{F#m}{F#m}         (Lots of guys may show you ...)
        {D}{E}{A}{E/F}           (- everybody's sweetheart but mine)

        key change

        {A#}{D#}{A#}{A#7}        (All my dreams I shut out ...)
        {D#}{E#}{A#}{A#7}        (Every dream is just a ...)
        {D#}{E#}{A#}{Gm}         (- returned only to find ...)
        {D#}{E#}{A#}{A#7}        (- everybody's sweetheart but ...)
        {D#}{E#}{A#}{Gm}         (- returned only to find ...)
        {D#}{E#}{A#....          (- everybody's sweetheart but ...)




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Faces And Names</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================
"Faces And Names"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale

sung by John Cale
=============================


        Faces and names, I wish they were the same
        faces and names only cause trouble for me
        Faces and names

        If we all looked the same and we all had the same name
        I wouldn't be jealous of you or you jealous of me
        Faces and names

        I always fall in love with someone who looks
        the way I wish that I could be
        I'm always staring at someone who hurts
        and the one they hurt is me

        Faces and names, to me they're all the same
        if I looked like you and you looked like me
        There'd be less trouble you'd see

        Faces and names, I wish they'd go away
        I'd disappear into that wall and never talk
        Talk not talk

        I wish I was a robot or a machine
        without a feeling or a thought
        People who want to meet the name I have
        are always disappointed in me

        Faces and names, I wish they were the same
        faces and names only cause problems for me
        Faces and names

        I'd rather be a hole in the wall
        looking on the other side
        I'd rather look and listen, listen not talk
        To faces and names

        If I had a breakdown when I was a kid
        if I lost my hair when I was young
        If you dress older when you are not
        as you really age, you look the same

        If we all looked the same, we wouldn't play these games
        me dressing for you, you dressing for me
        Undressing for me

        Faces and names, if they all were the same
        you wouldn't be jealous of me or me jealous of you
        Me jealous of you, you jealous of you

        Your face and your name
        your face and your name
        Faces and names
        faces and names




intro   {F7}{F7}{F7}{F7}

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (Faces and names, I wish they were ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- for me, Faces and names, If we -)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (- all looked the same and we ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- me, Faces and names)

chorus  {A#m}{F7}{A#m}{F7}   (I always fall in love with ...)
        {A#m}{F7}{G}{C}      (I'm always staring at someone who ...)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (Faces and names, to me they're ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- me, There'd be less trouble ...)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (Faces and names, I wish they'd go ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (Talk not talk)

chorus  {A#m}{F7}{A#m}{F7}   (I wish I was a robot or a machine ...)
        {A#m}{F7}{G}{C}      (People who want to meet the name ...)

guitar  {F7}{F7}{F7}{F7}
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (Faces and names, I wish they were ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (me, Faces and names, I'd -)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (- rather be a hole in the wall ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- talk, To faces and names)

        {A#m}{F7}{A#m}{F7}   (If I had a breakdown when I was a ...)
        {A#m}{F7}{G}{C}      (If you dress older when you are ...)

guitar  {F7}{F7}             (If we -)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (- all looked the same, we ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- me, Undressing for me ...)

        {F7}{F7}{F7}         (Faces and names, if they all were ...)
        {G}{G}{F7}{F7}       (- you, Me jealous of you, you ...)

coda    {F7}{F7}{F7}{F7}     (- name, your face and your name ...)
        {F7}{F7}{F7...       (- name, faces and names)

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Fall Of The House Of Usher</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"The Fall Of The House Of Usher"
================================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
================================



Edgar:

        And then I had a vision



Roderick Usher:

        Ah Edgar
        Ah Edgar, my dear friend Edgar



Edgar:

        It's been a long time, Roderick
        I've ridden many miles
        It's been a dull and soundless day for autumn
        The leaves have lost their autumn glow
        and the clouds seem oppressive with their drifting finery



Roderick Usher:

        I know, my friend
        Though I own so much of this land I find
        the country insufferable
        I deal only in half pleasures



Edgar:

        Speaking of half pleasures
        would you care for a tincture of opium?



Roderick Usher:

        Nothing would please me more than to smoke
        with an old friend

        I've experienced the hideous dropping of the veil
        the bitter lapse into common life
        unredeemed dreariness of thought
        I have an iciness, a sickening of the heart



Edgar:

        It's true you don't look well, Roderick
        but I am your friend
        no matter the occasion or position of the stars
        I'm glad you wrote me
        but I must admit to concern



Roderick Usher:

        I cannot contain my heart
        Edgar, I look to you for solace
        for relief from myself
        What I have is constitutional
        a family evil, a nervous affection that must surely pass
        But I do have this morbid acuteness of senses
        I can eat only the most insipid food
        clothes only of the lightest texture
        The odor of flowers I find oppressive
        My eyes cannot bear even the faintest light



Madeline Usher:

        [moaning]



Roderick Usher:

        Did you hear that?



Edgar:

        I hear
        I am listening, go on



Roderick Usher:

        I shall perish
        I will perish in this deplorable folly
        I dread the future
        Not the events, the results
        The most trivial event
        causes the greatest agitation of the soul
        I do not fear danger except in its absolute effect
        terror
        I find I must inevitably abandon life and reason together
        in my struggles with the demon fear

        Perhaps you'll think me superstitious
        but the physique of this place
        it hovers about me like a great body
        some diseased outer shell
        some decaying finite skin encasing my morale



Edgar:

        You mentioned your sister was ill



Roderick Usher:

        My beloved sister, my sole companion
        has had a long continuing illness
        whose inevitable conclusion seems forsworn
        This will leave me the last of the ancient race of Ushers



Madeline Usher:

        [moaning]



Edgar:

        She looks so much like you



Roderick Usher:

        I love her in a nameless way
        more than I love myself
        Her demise will leave me hopelessly
        confined to memories and realities of a future
        so barren as to be stultifying



Madeline Usher:

        [moaning]



Edgar:

        Oh, what of physicians?



Roderick Usher:

        Ah, they are baffled
        Until today she refused bed rest
        wanting to be present in your honor
        but finally she succumbed to the prostrating power
        of the destroyer
        You will probably see her no more



Edgar:

        Sound and music take us to the twin curves of experience
        Like brother and sister intertwined
        they relieve themselves of bodily contact
        and dance in a pagan revelry



Roderick Usher:

        I have soiled myself with my designs
        I am ashamed of my brain
        The enemy is me
        and the executioner terror
        Music is a reflection of our inner self
        unfiltered agony touches the wayward string
        The wayward brain confuses itself
        with the self-perceived future
        and turns inward with loathing and terror
        Either by design or thought
        we are doomed to know our own end
        I've written a lyric



Edgar:

        May I hear it?



Roderick Usher:

        It is called "The Haunted Palace"


        In the greenest of our valleys,
        By good angels tenanted,
        Once a fair and stately palace --
        Snow-white palace -- reared its head.

        Banners yellow, glorious, golden,
        On its roof did float and flow;
        (This -- all this -- was in the olden
        Time long ago)
        And every gentle air that dallied,
        Along the rampart plumed and pallid,
        A winged odor went away.

        All wanderers in that happy valley
        Through two luminous windows saw
        Spirits moving musically
        The sovereign of the realm serene,
        A troop of echoes whose sweet duty
        Was but to sing
        In voices of surpassing beauty,
        The wit and wisdom of their king.

        But evil things in robes of sorrow,
        Assailed the monarch's high estate!
        And round about his home the glory,
        Is but a dim-remembered story.

        Vast forms that move fantastically
        To a discordant melody;
        While, like a ghastly river,
        A hideous throng rush out forever,
        And laugh -- but smile no more.

        Nevermore.



Edgar:

        It's cold in here



Roderick Usher:

        I tell you minerals are sentient things
        The gradual yet certain condensation of an atmosphere
        of their own about the waters and the walls proves this
        Thus the silent yet importunate and terrible influence
        which for centuries has molded my family
        And now me



Madeline Usher:

        [screaming]



Roderick Usher:

        Excuse me



Madeline Usher:

        [vomiting]



Roderick Usher:

        She is gone
        Out, sad light
        Roderick has no life

        I shall preserve her corpse for a fortnight



Edgar:

        But Roderick..



Roderick Usher:

        I shall place it in a vault facing the lake
        I do not wish to answer to the medical men
        nor place her in the exposed burial plot of my family
        We shall inter her at the proper date
        when I am more fully of a right mind
        Her malady was unusual
        Please do not question me on this



Edgar:

        I cannot question you



Roderick Usher:

        Then help me now



Madeline Usher:

        [moaning]



Edgar:

        One would think you twins



Roderick Usher:

        We are
        We have always been sympathetic to each other
        Have you seen this?
        It is her



Edgar:

        It is a whirlwind
        You should not
        you must not behold this

        Roderick, these appearances
        which bewilder you are mere electrical phenomena
        not uncommon
        Or perhaps they have their rank origins
        in the marshy gases of the lake
        Please, let's close this casement
        and I will read and you will listen
        and together we will pass this terrible night together

        What's that?
        What is that?
        Don't you hear that?



Roderick Usher:

        Not hear it?
        Yes, I hear it and have heard it many minutes
        have I heard it?
        Oh, pity me miserable wretch
        I dared not
        Oh no
        I dared not speak
        We have put her living in the tomb
        I have heard feeble movements in the coffin
        I thought I heard
        I dared not speak
        Oh God
        I have heard footsteps
        Do you not hear them?
        Attention
        Do I not distinguish that heavy and horrible beating
        of her heart?
        Madman
        Madman
        I tell you she now stands without the door



Madeline Usher:

        [moaning and screaming]




        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        ....




* riff

     {G}                {G}
 1e ---------------------------------------
 2B --3-3---3--3\--2/----3-----------------
 3G --0-0---0--0---0-----0-----------------
 4D ---------------------------------------
 5A ---------------------------------------
 6E ---------------------------------------

 {C}                {G}
-------------------------5-------------
--8-8---8--8\--2/----3-----------------
--0-0---0--0---0-----0-----------------   ...
---------------------------------------
---------------------------------------
---------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








========================================
"The Fall Of The House Of Usher"
========================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, local musicians (?)

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
========================================


        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher
        The fall of the house of Usher

        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        ... repeat
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        ... fade out



[strings and keyboard (drone)]

        {D...          dialogue in German

        {G}{G}{C}{G}   dialogue in German
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   ....
        {G}{G}

        {D...          dialogue in German

        {G}{G}         ....

        {D...          dialogue in German

        {G}{G}{C}{G}   dialogue in German
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   ...
        {G}{G}{C}{G}
        {G}{G}{C}{G}




        ["The Bed" (see "the_bed.html")]

        {G}{G}{C}{G}   (The fall of the house of Usher)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   (The fall of the house of Usher)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   (The fall of the house of Usher)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   (The fall of the house of Usher)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}   (The fall of the house of Usher)

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Klaus
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Here I give you a nearly complete transcription of
The Fall Of The House Of Usher.
The missing words I marked with $..$. Post it on your site

Here it comes, enjoy:

Lou Reed - The Fall Of The House Of Usher


Edgar (left): And then I had a vision.

Roderick (right): Ah Edgar. Ah Edgar, my dear friend Edgar.

e. It's been a long time, Roderick. I've ridden many miles.
It's been a dull and soundless day for autumn.
The leaves have lost their autumn low
and the clouds seem oppressive with their drifting finery.

r. I know, my friend.
Though I own so much of this land I find the country insufferable.
I deal only in half-pleasures.

e. Speaking of half-pleasure.
Would you care for a tincture of opium?

r. Nothing would please me more than to smoke with an old friend.

r. I've experienced the hideous dropping of the vale.
The bitter lapse into common life.
Unredeemed dreariness of thought I have and iciness,
a sickening of the heart.

e. It's true, you don't look well, Roderick. But,
I am your friend no matter the occasion or position of the stars.
I'm glad you wrote me, but, I must admit to concern.

r. I cannot contain my heart.
Edgar, I look to you for solace, for relief from myself.
But I have this constitution, a family evil,
a nervous affection that must surely pass.
But, I do have this morbid acuteness of senses.
I can eat only the most insipid food,
clothes only of the lightest texture,
the odour of flowers I find oppressive.
My eyes cannot bear even the faintest light.

r. Did you hear that?

e. I hear. I am listening. Go on.

r. I shall perish. I will perish in this deplorable folly.
I dread the future. Not the events, the results.
The most trivial event causes the greatest agitation of the soul.
I do not fear danger except in its absolute affect: terror.
I find I must inevitably abandon life
and reason together in my struggles with the demon fear.
Perhaps you'll think me superstitous
but the physique of this place
that hovers above me like a great body, some disease, outer shell,
some decaying, finite skin, encasing my morale.

e. You'd mentioned your sister was ill.

r. My beloved sister, my soul companion,
has had a long continuing illness
whose inevitable conclusion seems forsworn.
This will leave me the last of the ancient race of Ushers.

e. She looks so much like you.

r. I love her in a nameless way, more than I love myself.
Her demise will leave me hopelessly confined in memories
and realities of a future so barren as to be stultifying.

e. What of physicians?

r. They are baffled. Until today she refused bedrest.
Wanting to be present in your honour
but finally she's come to the prostrating power of the destroyer.
You'll probably see her no more.

e. Sound and music take us to the twin curves of experience.
Like brother and sister intertwined
they relieve themselves of bodily contact
and dance in a pagan reverie.

r. I have soiled myself with my designs. I'm ashamed of my brain.
The enemy is me. And the execution of terror.
Music is a reflection of our inner self.
Unfiltered agony touches the wayward string.
The wayward brain confuses itself with the self-perceived future
and turns inward with loathing and terror.
Either by design or thought, we are doomed to know our own end.
I've written a lyric.

e. May I hear it?

r. It is called the Haunted Palace
In the greenest of our valleys, by good angels tenanted
Once a fair and stately palace, a snowwhite palace, reared its head.
Banners yellow, glorious, golden on its roof did float and flow
This - all this - was in the olden time long ago.

And every gentle air that dallied
along the rampart plumed and pallid
A winged odour went away
All wanderers in that happy valley through two luminous windows
Saw spirits moving musically
The sovereign of the realm $...$
A troop of echoes whose sweet duty was but to sing in voices
Of surpassing beauty
The wit and wisdom of the king

But evil things in robes of sorrow
Assailed the monarch's high estate
And round about his home the glory is
But a dim-remembered story

Vast forms that move fantastically
To a discordant melody
While, like a ghastly river, a hideous throng
Rush out forever and laugh
But smile no more
Nevermore


e. It's cold in here.

r. I tell you minerals are sentient things.
The gradual yet certain condensation of an atmosphere
of their own about the waters in the walls proofs this.
Thus the silent yes importunate and terrible influence
which for centuries has moulded my family. And now me. Excuse me.

r. She has gone. Out sad light. Roderick has no life.
I shall preserve her corpse for a fortnight.

e. Roderick.

r. I shall place it in a vault facing the lake.
I don't wish $...$ medical men
nor place her in the exposed burial plot of my family.
We shall inter her at the proper date
when I am more fully of a right mind. Her malady was unusual.
Please do not question me on this.

e. I cannot question you.

r. Then help me now.

e. Huh, one would think you're twins.

r. We are. We have always been sympathetic to each other.
Have you seen this? It is her.

e. It is a whirlwind. You should not, you must not behold this!
Roderick, these appearences which bewilder
you are mere electrical phenomena not uncommon.
Or perhaps they have their rank origins
in the marshy gases of the lake.
Please, let's close this casement
and I will read and you will listen
and together we will pass this terrible night together.
What's that? What is that? Don't your hear that?

r. Not hear it. Yes, I hear it. And I've heard it many minutes.
Have I heard it? Oh pity me - miserable wretch. I dared not.
Oh no. I dared not speak. We have put her living in the tomb.
I've heard feeble movements in the coffin. I thought I heard.
I dared not speak. Oh god. I heard footsteps. Do you not hear them?
Attention. Do I not distinguish that heavy and horrible beating
of her heart? Madman. Madman.
I tell you, she now stands without the door!


---------------------------------------------------------------------

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Families</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Families"
================================
album _The Bells_
(Lou Reed, 1979)

written by Lou Reed/Ellard Boles
================================


        (How's the family)
        (How's the family)

        Mama, you tell me how's the family
        And mama, tell me how's things going by you
        And little baby sister, I heard that you got married
        And I heard that you had yourself a little baby girl, too
        And here's some uncles and some cousins I know vaguely
        And would you believe my old dog Chelsy's there, too
        And would you believe nobody in this family
        wanted to keep her
        And now that dog's more a part of this family
        than I am too
        I don't come home much anymore
        No no no I don't come home much anymore
        Mama

        And mama, I know how disappointed you are
        And papa, I know that you feel the same way too
        And no no no no no I still haven't got married
        And no no no there's no grandson planned here for you
        And by the way daddy tell me how's the business
        I understand that your stock she's growing very high
        No daddy, you're not a poor man anymore
        And I hope you realize that before you die
        Because I don't come home much anymore
        No no no no no I don't come home much no more
        But daddy

        And please please please please please
        come on let's not start this business again
        I know how much you resent the life that I have
        But one more time I don't want the family business
        Don't want to inherit it upon the day that you die
        Really dad, you should have given it to my sister
        You know Elizabeth, you know Elizabeth
        she has a better head for those things than I
        She lives practically around the corner
        That's really the kind of child you could be proud of
        But papa, I know that this visit's a mistake
        There's nothing here we have in common except our name
        And families that live out in the suburbs
        Often make each other cry
        And I don't think that I'll come home much anymore
        No no I don't think I'll come home much again
        Mama
        Papa
        Families
        Often make each other cry
        No I don't think that I'll come home much anymore
        (How's the families)




intro   {G}{G}
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (How's the family)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (How's the family)

        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (Mama, you tell me how's the family)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (And mama, tell me how's things going ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (And little baby sister ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (And I heard that you had yourself ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (And here's some uncles and some ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (- would you believe my old dog ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (- would you believe nobody in this ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (- now that dog's more a part of this ...)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (I don't come home much anymore)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (No no no I don't come home much ...)

        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (How's the family)
        {Am}{Am}{G}{G}   (How's the family)

        ....

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Femme Fatale</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=======================================
"Femme Fatale"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

written by Lou Reed
=======================================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She'll build you up to just put you down
        what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        You're written in her book
        you're number 37, have a look
        She's going to smile to make you frown
        what a clown

        Little boy, she's from the street
        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        ...

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Dm}{G}          (She'll build you up to ...)

        {C}{F}                         (- tease, See the way -)

=================================
"Femme Fatale"
=================================
album _Live At Max's Kansas City_
(The Velvet Underground, 1972)

Aug 23, 1970
Max's Kansas City, NYC
=================================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        yes, it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She'll build you up just to put you down
        oh, what a clown

        But everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        and hear the way she talks

        You're written in her book
        you know you're number 47, have a look
        He's going to play you for her fool
        ---

        Little boy, she's from the street
        you know, before you start you're already beat
        She'll make you smile just to watch you frown
        just like a clown

        And everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Look at the way that she walks
        and hear the way that she talks

        And everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        all the things that she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a ..... tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        stay away, oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        woh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)




intro   {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}

        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}   (Here she comes ...)
        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Bm}{E}          (She's going to break ...)

        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}   (It's not hard to ...)
        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Bm}{E}          (She'll built you up ...)

chorus  {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- knows, the things ...)
        {A}{D}                         (- tease, See the way -)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{E}                 (- she walks, and hear ...)

        ....

coda    {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- knows, all the ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- tease, stay away, oh ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- woh, wow wow -woh)
ending  {A6...A7




* ending

     {A6...             A7

 2B --2------------------2.--

 4D --2------------------2.--
 5A --0------------------0.--

==================================================
"Femme Fatale"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Oct 19, 1969
End of Cole Ave., Dallas, Texas
==================================================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        oh, it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She'll build you up just to put you down
        what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Ah, she's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        and hear the way she talks

        You're written in her book
        you're number 47, have a look
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        Little boy, she's from the street
        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to smile just to make you frown
        oh, what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh, see the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh woh



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Bm}{E}          (She'll build you up just...)

        {A}{D}                         (- tease, See the way -)
* tab2  {Bm}{Bm}{G}{E}                 (- she walks, and hear ...)

        ....

        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- tease, Oh wow woh ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- woh, Oh wow woh ...)
        {A6...

===================================
"Femme Fatale"
===================================
album _Boom Boom Chi Boom Boom_
(Tom Tom Club, 1989)

Lou Reed: guitars (lead and rhythm)
          background vocal
===================================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She'll build you up just to put you down
        what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        You're written in her book
        you're number 37, have a look
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        Little boy, she's from the street
        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to smile just to make you frown
        ooohhh, what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        wow wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        ....



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   /x.A}                          bass
        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}

        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}   (Here she comes ...)
        {Amaj7}{Bm}{Bm7}{E}            (She's going to break ...)

        {Amaj7}{Dmaj7}{Amaj7}{Dmaj7}   (It's not hard to ...)
        {Amaj7}{Bm}{Bm7}{E}            (She'll build you up ...)

chorus  {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- knows, the things ...)
        {A}{D}                         (- tease, See the way -)
        {Bm}{Bm7}{G}{E}                (- she walks, hear the ...)

        ....

coda    {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- knows, the things ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- tease, Wow wow woh ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- woh, Wow wow woh ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}                   (- woh, Wow wow woh ...)
        ... repeat and fade out

        for a clown

        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please

        (she's a femme fatale)

        see the way she talks

        number 37, have a look
        She's going to smile to make you frown
        what a clown

        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        see the way she talks

        number 37, have a look
        She's going to smile to make you frown
        what a clown

        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to play you for a fool

==================================================
"Femme Fatale"
(The Family Dog, San Francisco, 11-7-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 07, 1969
The Family Dog, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        woh, it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        You know you're written in her book
        you're number 47, have a look
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        You know little boy, she's from the street
        before you start you're already beat
        She'll make you smile just to see you frown
        what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh woh




* chords:
same as _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)








===============================
"Femme Fatale"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        Here she comes
        you'd better watch your step
        She's going to break your heart in two
        it's true

        It's not hard to realize
        just look into her false colored eyes
        She'll build you up to just put you down
        what a clown

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        You're written in her book
        you're number 37, have a look
        She's going to smile to make you frown
        what a clown

        Little boy, she's from the street
        before you start you're already beat
        She's going to play you for a fool
        yes it's true

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        the things she does to please
        (she's a femme fatale)
        She's just a little tease
        (she's a femme fatale)
        See the way she walks
        hear the way she talks

        'Cause everybody knows
        (she's a femme fatale)
        (she's a femme fatale)
        (She's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        oh wow woh
        (she's a femme fatale)
        Oh wow woh



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




intro   {Fmaj7}{A#maj7}{Fmaj7}{A#maj7.     [false start]

intro   {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}

        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   (Here she comes ...)
        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{Fm}{A#}           (She's going to ...)

        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   (It's not hard to ...)
        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{Fm}{A#}           (She'll build you up ...)

chorus  {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   (- knows, the things ...)
        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}                   (- tease, See the way -)
        {Fm}{Fm}{C#}{A#}                   (- she walks, hear ...)

        ....

coda    {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   ('Cause everybody ...)
        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   (She's a femme ...)
        {D#maj7}{G#maj7}{D#maj7}{G#maj7}   (- woh, Oh wow woh ...)
        {D#6...                            (- woh)




* intro and verse (1 + 1/2 down)

      {D#maj7}           {G#maj7}
*1c# --6...---------------6...--------------
*2G# --8...---------------8...--------------
*3E  --7...---------------7...--------------
*4B  --8...---------------6...--------------
*5F# --6...---------------6...--------------
*6C# ---------------------------------------

      {D#maj7}           {G#maj7}
*1c# --6...---------------8...--------------
*2G# --8...---------------8...--------------
*3E  --7...---------------8...--------------
*4B  --8...---------------6...--------------
*5F# --6...---------------------------------
*6C# ---------------------------------------

      {D#6...

*2G# --8...---------------------------------

*4B  --8...---------------------------------

*6C# ---------------------------------------



note: or using capo on 6 fret (false start - 8 fret)

* chords for standard-tuning

        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}   (Here she comes ...)
        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Dm}{G}          (She's going to ...)

        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}   (It's not hard to ...)
        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Dm}{G}          (She'll build you up ...)

        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}                 (- tease, See the way -)
        {Dm}{Dm}{A#}{G}                (- she walks, hear ...)

        ....

coda    {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}   ('Cause everybody ...)
        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}   (She's a femme ...)
        {Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}{Cmaj7}{Fmaj7}   (- woh, Oh wow woh ...)
        {C6...                         (- woh)



note: or using capo on 3 fret (false start - 5 fret)








===================================================
"Femme Fatale"
(acetate version)
===================================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico - Unripened_
(The Velvet Underground, 2007)
===================================================



        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        Femme Fatale seems to be the same take
        but with alternate 'falsetto' "she's a femme fatale"
        backing vocals.</em>

<PRE>
================================
"Ferryboat Bill"
================================
album _Another View_
(The Velvet Underground, 1986)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/
Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker

Jun 19, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
================================


        Ferryboat Bill won't you please come home
        You know your wife has married a midget's son
        And that's the short and long of it
        that's the short and long of it
        (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

        Ferryboat Bill won't you please come home
        You know your wife has married a midget's son
        You know your wife has married a midget's son
        And that's the short and long of it
        that's the short and long of it
        (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

        Ferryboat Bill won't you please come home
        You know your wife has married a midget's son
        And that's the short and long of it
        that's the short and long of it
        (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- wife has married a midget's son)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (And that's the short and long of it ...)
break   {A}{A}{A}{A}   (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- wife has married a midget's son ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- wife has married a midget's son)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (And that's the short and long of it)
break   {A}{A}{A}{A}   (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

g.solo  {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- wife has married a midget's son)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (And that's the short and long of it ...)
break   {A}{A}         (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

      {A}                         {A}
*1d ----------------------------------------------------------
*2A ----------------------------------------------------------
*3F --16b18r16-14-------16----16--16b18r16-14-------16----16--   ...
*4C --------------17-14----17-----------------17-14----17-----

*6D ----------------------------------------------------------

*5G -----------------------------------------------------
*6D -----------------------------------------------------

*3F ------------------4------------------------4-----4---
*4C -----------------------------------------------------
*5G -----------------------------------------------------
*6D -----------------------------------------------------

        14  15  16  17  18  19  20  21
*1d -|---|---|---|-o-|---|---|-o-|---|-
*2A -|---|---|---|-o-|---|-o-|-o-|---|-
*3F -|-o-|---|-o-|-o-|---|-o-|---|-o-|-
*4C -|-o-|---|---|-o-|---|-o-|---|---|-
*5G -|---|---|---|-o-|---|-o-|---|---|-
*6D -|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords and tabs for standard-tuning

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (And that's the short and long of it ...)
break   {G}{G}{G}{G}   (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (- wife has married a midget's son ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (- wife has married a midget's son)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (And that's the short and long of it)
break   {G}{G}{G}{G}   (dun-dun-dun-dun, dun-dun-dun-dun)

g.solo  {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}

        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (Ferryboat Bill won't you please come ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (- wife has married a midget's son)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}   (And that's the short and long of it ...)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Finish Line</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Finish Line"
================================
album _Set The Twilight Reeling_
(Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
================================


        Wind blows snow outside my window
        crowd below runs wild in the streets
        Two rented brothers race down two separate alleys
        heading for the finish line

        Down in the train yard out by the stockyard
        butchers with aprons hack meat in the snow
        Blood has the brothers pulsing with envy
        heading for the finish line

        Two rented brothers, faces keep changing
        like these feelings that I have for you
        Nothing's forever not even five minutes
        when you're headed for the finish line

        Down by the depot out by the meat rack
        ah, down by the tunnels surrounding the jail
        Prisoners are marching in squares and in circles
        they're heading for the finish line

        They're lining up for Noah's Ark
        they're stabbing each other in the dark
        Saluting a flag made of some rich guy's socks
        heading for the finish line

        Close to the line the ice is cracking
        two rented feelings sitting in the stands
        Two mothers, two fathers and both of them are paid for
        all of a sudden it comes back to me

        Just up ahead is the finish line
        two rented referees and two checkered rags
        Out of the corner of my eye comes
        a dark horse with black wings
        ooohhh, headed for the finish line

        I'm five years old the room is fuzzy
        I think there's also a very young girl
        It's hard to remember what happened exactly
        as I'm staring at the finish line

        Ooohhh, first came fire then came light
        then came feeling then came sight



intro   {A}{A}{A}{A}   (mmmm..)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (mmmm.., ah)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Wind blows snow outside my window ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- rented brothers race down two ...)

        ...

        ...

        ...

guitar  {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {E}{E}{A}{A}

        ...

        ...

        ...

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- five years old the room is fuzzy ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- hard to remember what happened ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- first came fire then came light ...)

ending  {E}{E}{A}{A}
        {E}{E}{A}{A}
        {A/A...




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>

<TITLE>Fired Up</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
============================================
"Fired Up"
============================================
album _I Spent A Week There The Other Night_
(Moe Tucker, 1991)

written by Moe Tucker

Lou Reed: lead guitar
============================================


        I'm fired up, pissed off
        I'm tired and I'm mad

        I work hard, get nowhere
        lousy job and no one cares

        Drugs and crime, flashin' knives
        violent people, wasted lives

        Go away and don't stop
        don't knock, the door's locked

        High price won't pay
        worry worry every day

        Homeless families in the streets
        no one help them on their feet

        They can't read, they can't spell
        what about welfare, what the hell

        Close the door and lock it tight
        hit the floor, keep from sight

        Drug dealers gettin' richer
        drug babies havin' seizures

        You and me, what I see
        living life is when we're free

        I'm fired up, pissed off
        I'm tired and I'm mad
        I'm fired up, pissed off
        I'm tired and I'm mad
        Fired up, pissed off
        I'm tired and I'm mad

        Go away and don't stop
        don't knock, the door's locked




intro   {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}
        {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}
        {D/G.C}{G}             drums

        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (I'm fired up, pissed off ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (I work hard, get nowhere ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (Drugs and crime, flashin' ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}                 (Go away and don't stop ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}

        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (High price won't pay ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (Homeless families in the ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (They can't read, they can't ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}

        {E}{E}                 (Close the door and lock it ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}{D/G.C}{G}

        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (Drug dealers gettin' richer ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (You and me, what I see ...)
        {D/G.C}{G}
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (I'm fired up, pissed off ...)
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (I'm fired up, pissed off ...)
        {E/A.{E/A.{E}          (Fired up, pissed off ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}                 (Go away and don't stop ...)




* intro

"Fired Up"

I'm fired up, pissed off
I'm tired and I'm mad
I work hard, get nowhere
Lousy job and no one cares
Drugs and crime, flashin' knives
Violent people, wasted lives

Go away and don't stop
Don't knock, the door's locked

High price won't pay
Worry worry every day
Homeless families in the streets
No one help them on their feet
They can't read, they can't spell
What about welfare, what the hell

Close the door and lock it tight
Hit the floor, keep from sight

Drug dealers gettin' richer
Drug babies havin' seizures
You and me, what I see
Living life is when we're free

I'm fired up, pissed off
I'm tired and I'm mad
I'm fired up, pissed off
I'm tired and I'm mad
I'm fired up, pissed off
I'm tired and I'm mad.

Go away and don't stop
Don't knock, the door's locked

<TITLE>First Impression</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
