<HEAD>
<TITLE>Halloween Parade</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Halloween Parade"
===================
album _New York_
(Lou Reed, 1989)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        There's a downtown fairy singing out "Proud Mary"
        as she cruises Christopher Street
        And some southern queen is acting loud and mean
        where the docks and the badlands meet

        This Halloween
        is something to be sure
        Especially
        to be here without you

        There's a Greta Garbo and an Alfred Hitchcock
        and some black Jamaican stud
        There's five Cinderellas and some leather drags
        I almost fell into my mug

        There's a Crawford, Davis
        and a tacky Cary Grant
        And some homeboys lookin'
        for trouble down here from the Bronx

        But there ain't no Hairy and no Virgin Mary
        you won't hear those voices again
        And Johnny Rio and Rotten Rita
        you'll never see those faces again

        This Halloween
        is something to be sure
        Especially
        to be here without you

        There's the Born Again Losers and the Lavender Boozers
        and some crack team from Washington Heights
        The boys from Avenue B, the girls from Avenue D
        a Tinkerbell in tights

        This celebration
        somehow gets me down
        Especially
        when I see you're not around

        There's no Peter Pedantic saying things romantic
        in Latin, Greek or Spic
        There's no Three Bananas or Brandy Alexander
        dishing all their tricks

        It's a different feeling
        that I have today
        Especially
        when I know you've gone away

        There's a girl from Soho with a T-shirt saying "I Blow"
        she's with the "Jive Five 2 Plus 3"
        And the girls for pay dates are giving cut rates
        or else doing it for free

        The past keeps knock-knock
        knocking on my door
        And I don't want to
        hear it anymore

        No consolations please for feelin' funky
        I got to get my head above my knees
        But it makes me mad and mad, makes me sad
        and then I start to freeze

        In the back of my mind
        I was afraid it might be true
        In the back of my mind
        I was afraid that they meant you

        The Halloween Parade (Halloween Parade)
        At the Halloween Parade (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        At the Halloween Parade (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        See you next year, at the Halloween Parade
        (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)
        (Wah-wah-ooohhh, Halloween Parade)



        /D}                (There's a -)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- some southern queen is acting ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{G}{G}     (- Halloween is something to be sure)

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Hang On To Your Emotions</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Hang On To Your Emotions"
================================
album _Set The Twilight Reeling_
(Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
================================


        When your imagination has too much to say
        when the chill of the night meets the sweat of the day
        And you have trouble understanding
        what other people have to say
        you'd better -

        Hang on to your emotions
        hang on to your emotions

        When a demagogue inside your head has taken charge
        and by default what you say or do is criticized
        And this litany of failures
        is recited a thousand times
        you'd better -

        Hang on to your emotions
        hang on to your emotions

        Could it be you've never felt like that
        that your mind's a cage inside the cage a cat
        that spits and scratches all it can get at

        And that's you and your emotions

        Could it be you've never felt like that
        your mind's a cage inside the cage a rat
        rabidly trying to get at

        You and your emotions
        you and your emotions

        When your imagination has too much to say
        when that facile voice inside your head
        says give your life away
        You might think to ask how it got that way
        what books it has read that make it that way
        And where it got the right to speak to anyone that way
        you'd better -

        Hold on to your emotions
        hold on to your emotions

        When a night city's breeze blows across the room
        and a 5 a.m. moon and sun start their swoon
        You hear your lover's breath
        and not a moment too soon
        you get to -

        Release all your emotions, you get to -
        let go of your emotions, and now -
        Release all your emotions, you'd better -
        let go of your emotions

        Release, I wanna let go
        I wanna release now



intro   {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}   (When your ...)
        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}                   (And you have ...)

chorus  {A}{D/A}{A}{D/A}                   (Hang on to your ...)

        {A}{A}

        ...

bridge  {D/A}{E/A}{D/A}                    (Could it be you've ...)
        {A}{D/A}                           (- you and your ...)
        {D/A}{E/A}{D/A}                    (Could it be you've ...)
break   {A}{D/A}{A}{D/A...                 (- you and your ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}   (When your  ...)
        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}   (You might think to ...)
        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}                   (And where it got ...)

chorus  {A}{D/A}{A}{D/A}                   (Hold on to your ...)

        {A}{A}

        ...

chorus  {A}{D/A}{A}{D/A}                   (Release all your ...)
        {A}{D/A}{A}{D/A}                   (Release all your ...)

        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}   (Release, I wanna ...)
        {A/Asus2}{D.E/A}{A/Asus2}{D.E/A}   (I wanna release now)

ending  {A}{A}{A/D...




* riff

     {A / Asus2}   {D. E /A}

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Hangin' 'Round</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Hangin' 'Round"
===================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Harry was a rich young man
        who would become a priest
        He dug up his dear father
        who was recently deceased

        He did it with tarot cards
        and a mystically attuned mind
        And shortly there
        and after he did find

        Jeanie was a spoiled young brat
        she thought she knew it all
        She smoked mentholated cigarettes
        and she had sex in the hall

        But she was not my kind
        or even of my sign
        The kind of animal
        that I would be about

        Wow-wow-wow, you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        Oh-wow-wow-wow, you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        alright now
        ah-huh-huh

        Kathy was a bit surreal
        she painted all her toes
        And on her face she wore dentures
        clamped tightly to her nose

        And when she finally spoke
        her twang her glasses broke
        And no one else could smoke
        while she was in the room

        Hark, the herald angels sang
        and reached out for a phone
        And plucking it with a knife in hand
        dialed long distance home

        But it was all too much
        sprinkling angel dust
        To AT and T
        who didn't wish you well

        Oh, but you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        Ho-ho-ho-ho, you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago

        Hangin' round
        hangin' round, that's all you're doing baby
        Hangin' round
        hangin' round, ooohhh
        Hangin' round
        hangin' round
        Hangin' round
        hangin' round
        ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (Harry was a rich young man ...)
        {A}
        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (He dug up his dear father ...)
        {A}

        {B/D}{A}{B/D}{A}   (He did it with tarot cards ...)
        {B/D}{A}{E}{E}     (And shortly there and after he ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (Jeanie was a spoiled young brat ...)
        {A}
        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (She smoked mentholated cigarettes ...)
        {A}

        {B/D}{A}{B/D}{A}   (But she was not my kind ...)
        {B/D}{A}{E}{E}     (The kind of animal that I would ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- you keep hangin' round me ...)
        {A}{A}{E}{E}       (You're still doing things that I ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- you keep hangin' round me ..)
        {A}{A}{E}{E}       (You're still doing things that I ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}       (ah-huh-huh)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (Kathy was a bit surreal ...)
        {A}
        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (And on her face she wore dentures ...)
        {A}

        {B/D}{A}{B/D}{A}   (And when she finally spoke ...)
        {B/D}{A}{E}{E}     (And no one else could smoke ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (Hark, the herald angels sang ...)
        {A}
        {A}{A}{D}{A}       (And plucking it with a knife in ...)
        {A}

        {B/D}{A}{B/D}{A}   (But it was all too much ...)
        {B/D}{A}{E}{E}     (To AT and T ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- you keep hangin' round me ...)
        {A}{A}{E}{E}       (You're still doing things that I ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- you keep hangin' round me ..)
        {A}{A}{E}{E}       (You're still doing things that I ...)

coda    {A}{A}{A}{A}       (Hangin' round, hangin' -)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}       (- round, that's all you're doing ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}       (- round, ooohhh, Hangin' round ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}       (- round, Hangin' round ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}       (- round ...)
        ... fade out




* riff (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)
note: Mick Ronson played using wah-pedal

       Harry was a  rich young man -
      {A}           {A}

*6D --------------------------------

* coda (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)
note: Mick Ronson played using wah-pedal

    - round, that's all you're doing baby,  Hangin' -
      {A}                 {A}
*1d --12------10-------9-------------------
*2A --15b17---13b15---12b14v---------------
*3F ---------------------------------------
*4C ---------------------------------------
*5G ---------------------------------------
*6D ---------------------------------------

- round,                       Hangin' -
  {A}                 {A}
--12------10-------9-------------------
--15b17---13b15---12b14v---------------
---------------------------------------   ...
---------------------------------------
---------------------------------------
---------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning

        {A/C}{G}{D}{D}     (The kind of animal that I would ...)

======================
"Hangin' 'Round"
(acoustic demo)
======================
album _Transformer_
reissue CD bonus track
(Lou Reed, 2002)
======================


        Harry was a rich young man
        who would become a priest
        He studied with his father
        who was recently deceased

        He did it with tarot cards
        and a mystically attuned mind
        And shortly there
        and after he did find

        Jeanie was a spoiled young brat
        she thought she knew it all
        She smoked mentholated cigarettes
        and had sex in the hall

        But she was not my sign
        or any of the kind
        The ............
        that I would be about

        But you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        Oh, you're still hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still ....... things that I gave up years ago

        Raymond was a stranger
        who had come from parts unknown
        He had no hair upon his head
        so he did not use a comb

        But ............
        and everyday did, babe
        And when at last he found himself
        ........... clean the ......

        Kathy was a bit surreal
        she painted all her toes
        On her face she wore dentures
        clamped tightly to her nose

        And when she finally spoke
        her twang her glasses broke
        And no one else could smoke
        while she was in the room

        But you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not very glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        Oh-wow-wow-wow, you're still hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago

        Hark, the herald angels sang
        and reached out for a phone
        And plucking it with ivory in hand
        dialed long distance home

        But it was all too much
        sprinkling angel dust
        To A and T
        who didn't wish you well not at all

        But-but-but you keep hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        Ho-wow-wow-wow-wow, you're still hangin' round me
        and I'm not so glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        You're still hangin' round me
        and I'm not, no-no, glad you found me
        You're still doing things that I gave up years ago
        no-no-no-no




* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Harry's Circumcision</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================================================
"Harry's Circumcision"
(reading from his first book of poetry
"Between Thought And Expression: Selected Lyrics Of Lou Reed")
==============================================================
12" single "What's Good"
(Lou Reed, 1992)

CDEP "What's Good"
(Lou Reed, 1992)

CDEP "Power And Glory"
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Lou Reed

* poetry reading (no instrument)
==============================================================


        Looking in the mirror
        Harry didn't like what he saw
        The cheeks of his mother
        The eyes of his father
        As each day crashed around him the future stood revealed
        He was turning into his parents

        The final disappointment

        Stepping out of the shower
        Harry stared at himself
        His hairline receding, the slight overbite

        He picked up the razor to begin his shaving and thought

        Oh
        I wish I was different

        I wish I was stronger
        I wish I was thinner
        I wish I didn't have this nose
        these ears that stick out remind me of my father

        And I don't want to be reminded at all

        The final disappointment

        Harry looked in the mirror thinking of Vincent van Gogh

        And with a quick swipe
        Lopped off his nose

        And happy with that
        He made a slice where his chin was
        He'd always wanted a dimple

        The end of all illusion

        Then peering down straight between his legs
        Harry thought of the range of possibilities

        A new face, a new life, no memories of the past
        and slit his throat from ear to ear

        Harry woke up with a cough, the stitches made him wince
        A doctor smiled at him from somewhere across the room

        Son
        We saved your life, but you'll never look the same

        And when he heard that
        Harry had to laugh

        And when he heard that
        Harry had to laugh

        Although it hurt
        Harry had to laugh

        The final disappointment







============================================
"Harry's Circumcision - Reverie Gone Astray"
============================================
album _Magic And Loss_
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Lou Reed
============================================


        Looking in the mirror
        Harry didn't like what he saw
        The cheeks of his mother, the eyes of his father
        As each day crashed around him
        the future stood revealed
        He was turning into his parents
        The final disappointment

        Stepping out of the shower
        Harry stared at himself
        His hairline receding, the slight overbite
        He picked up the razor to begin his shaving and thought
        Oh, I wish I was different

        I wish I was stronger
        I wish I was thinner
        I wish I didn't have this nose
        These ears that stick out remind me of my father
        and I don't want to be reminded at all
        The final disappointment

        Harry looked in the mirror thinking of Vincent van Gogh
        and with a quick swipe lopped off his nose
        And happy with that he made a slice where his chin was
        He'd always wanted a dimple
        The end of all illusion
        Then peering down straight between his legs
        Harry thought of the range of possibilities
        A new face, a new life, no memories of the past
        and slit his throat from ear to ear

        Harry woke up with a cough
        the stitches made him wince
        A doctor smiled at him from
        somewhere across the room
        Son, we saved your life
        but you'll never look the same
        And when he heard that
        Harry had to laugh
        And when he heard that
        Harry had to laugh
        Although it hurt Harry had to laugh
        The final disappointment



intro   {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}
        {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{A}{G}{D}

        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Looking in the mirror ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}   (The cheeks of his mother ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (The final disappointment)
        {D}{A}{G}{D}

        ....

guitar  {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}
        {D}{D}{G}{G}
        {D}{A}{G}{D}

coda    {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Harry woke up with a cough ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}   (A doctor smiled at him from ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G}     (Son, we saved your life ...)
        {D}{A}{D}{G}     (And when he heard that ...)
        {D}{A}{G}{D...   (Although it hurt Harry had to laugh ...)

<TITLE>Head Held High</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================
"Head Held High"
==============================
album _Loaded_
(The Velvet Underground, 1970)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Mama told me ever since I was seven
        hold your head up high
        My parents told me ever since I was eleven
        hold your head up high

        They said the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high
        Oh, just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        with their head up high

        Now I am older, I'm getting so much bolder
        with my head up high
        Oh, as I figured, just like I figured
        set your heads up high, baby

        Oh, now just like I figured, you know they was disfigured
        hold your head up high
        You know they says the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high, boy

        Ever since I was a baby on my mama's knee
        Oh, just listenin' to what everybody told me
        yeah yes, they did

        But still the answer was to become a dancer
        hey, hold your head up high
        But just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        they hold their heads up high, watch out

        Yeah, do the dog
        Oh, watch out

        And now I'm older, they say I'm so much bolder
        got your head up high, oh-oh-oh
        Oh, the answer was, hey, become a dancer
        head up high

        Well, but just like I figured, they're always disfigured
        they got their heads up high, oh-wow
        But the answer was, now boy, become a dancer
        with your head up high, oh

        Head held high, yeah-yeah-yeah
        head held high, oh baby
        Head held high, oh-wow now
        head held high, hey-yeah-yeah-yeah
        Head held high, oh-wow now
        head held high ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        ...G}                      ... fade in
        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Mama told me ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (My parents told me ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (They said the answer was to ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (- just like I figured ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Now I am older ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (As I figured ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (- just like I figured ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (- know they says the answer ...)

guitar  {D/A}{E}{D/A}{E}

        {A}{G/D}{A}{A}             (Ever since I was a baby ...)
        {A}{G/D}{A}{A}             (Oh, just listenin' to what ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (But still the answer was to ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (- just like I figured ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}               (Yeah, do the dog)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}               (Oh, watch out)

guitar  {A.G/E.D}{A}{A.G/E.D}{G}
        {A.G/E.D}{A}{A.G/E.D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{D}               (And now I'm older ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}               (Oh, the answer was ...)

        {G}{C}{D}{D}               (- but just like I figured ...)
        {G}{C}{D}{D}               (But the answer was, now boy ...)

coda    {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high ...)
        {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high, oh-wow now...)
        {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high, oh-wow now ...)
        ... fade out

=====================================
"Head Held High"
(alternate mix)
=====================================
album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Mama told me ever since I was seven
        hold your head up high
        My parents told me ever since I was eleven
        hold your head up high

        Just like I figured, you know they was disfigured
        hold your head up high
        You know they says the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high, boy

        Ever since I was a baby on my mama's knee
        Oh, just listenin' to what everybody told me
        yeah yes, they did

        But still the answer was to become a dancer
        hey, hold your head up high
        But just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        they hold their heads up high, watch out

        And now I'm older, they say I'm so much bolder
        got your head up high, oh-oh-oh
        Oh, the answer was, hey, become a dancer
        head up high

        Well, but just like I figured, they're always disfigured
        they got their heads up high, oh-wow
        But the answer was, now boy, become a dancer
        with your head up high, oh

        Head held high, yeah-yeah-yeah
        head held high, oh baby
        Head held high, oh-wow now
        head held high, hey-yeah-yeah-yeah
        Head held high, oh-wow now
        head held high, now-now-now
        Now-now, oh now-now
        oh now-now ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {A}{A}{A}{G}

        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Mama told me ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (My parents told me ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (Just like I figured ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (You know they says the ...)

guitar  {D/A}{E}{D/A}{E}

        {A}{G/D}{A}{A}             (Ever since I was a baby ...)
        {A}{G/D}{A}{A}             (Oh, just listenin' to what ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (But still the answer ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (- just like I figured ...)

guitar  {A.G/E.D}{A}{A.G/E.D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{D}               (And now I'm older ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}               (Oh, the answer was ...)

        {G}{C}{D}{D}               (- but just like I figured ...)
        {G}{C}{D}{D}               (But the answer was ...)

coda    {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high ...)
        {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high, oh-wow now ...)
        {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Head held high, oh-wow now ...)
        {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}           (Now-now, oh now-now ...)
        ... fade out




* intro
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone, played by 2 guitars)

       {A}             {A}           {A}              {G}
*1e ----9-10--12--10-9--9-------------9-10--12--10-9---------------
*2B --------------------------------------------------10b12v-------
*3G --(-6--7---6-----6-)------------(-6--7---6-----6-)-------------
*4D -------------(-7----7-)--------------------(-7-----7b-9v-)-----
*5A ---------------------------------------------------------------
*6E ---------------------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {G}{G}{G}{F}

        {G}{C}{G}{G}               (Mama told me ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{G}               (My parents told me ...)

        {C}{F}{G}{G}               (You know they says the ...)
        {C}{F}{G}{G}               (You know they says the ...)

guitar  {C/G}{D}{C/G}{D}

        {G}{F/C}{G}{G}             (Ever since I was a baby ...)
        {G}{F/C}{G}{G}             (Oh, just listenin' to what ...)

        {C}{F}{G}{G}               (But still the answer ...)
        {C}{F}{G}{G}               (- just like I figured ...)

guitar  {G.F/D.C}{G}{G.F/D.C}{F}

        {C}{F}{C}{C}               (And now I'm older ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{C}               (Oh, the answer was ...)

        {F}{A#}{C}{C}              (- but just like I figured ...)
        {F}{A#}{C}{C}              (But the answer was ...)

        {A#/F}{C}{A#/F}{C}         (Head held high ...)
        {A#/F}{C}{A#/F}{C}         (Head held high, oh-wow now ...)
        {A#/F}{C}{A#/F}{C}         (Head held high, oh-wow now ...)
        {A#/F}{C}{A#/F}{C}         (Now-now, oh now-now ...)
        ... fade out







=====================================
"Head Held High"
(early version)
=====================================
album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Mama told me since I was seven
        hold your head up high
        When I was baby, my mama told me
        hold your head up high, boy

        They said the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high
        Just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        hold your head up high

        Now I'm older, I'm getting so much bolder
        got my head up high, oh-wow-wow
        Like I figured, they all was disfigured
        they got their heads up high

        They said the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high, boy
        Just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        hold your head up high

        Ever since I was a baby on my mama's knee
        I listen to just what everybody told me
        oh yes, they did, oh-oh-oh

        But still the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high
        But just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        hold your head up high, watch out

        Now I'm older, I'm getting so much bolder
        got my head up high, oh-oh-oh
        I got figured, they all was disfigured
        got my head up high, you know that

        Still the answer was to become a dancer
        hold your head up high
        Just like I figured, they all was disfigured
        hold your head up high

        Head held high
        head held high, wow-wow
        Head held high
        head held high
        Head held high
        head held high, wow no-no-no
        Head held high, oh baby now
        head held high
        Head held high, now-now-now



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Mama told me ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (Just like I figured ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Now I'm older ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{A}               (Like I figured ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (They said the answer was to ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (Just like I figured ...)

        {D}{G}{A}{A}               (But just like I figured ...)

        {G}{C}{D}{D}               (Just like I figured ...)

        {C/G}{D.

<PRE>
=====================
"Heavenly Arms"
=====================
album _The Blue Mask_
(Lou Reed, 1982)

written by Lou Reed
=====================


        Heavenly arms reach out to hold me
        Heavenly arms entice you to dance
        In a world of ill will, the dancers are still
        Heavenly arms reach out to me

        Heavenly arms soft as a love song
        Heavenly arms bring a kiss to your ear
        In a world that seems mad, all the dancers seem sad
        Heavenly arms reach out to me

        Sylvia
        Sylvia
        Sylvia
        Sylvia

        Heavenly arms come to my rescue
        Only a woman can love a man
        In a world full of hate, love should never wait
        Heavenly arms reach out to me

        Heavenly arms strong as a sunset
        Heavenly arms pure as the rain
        Lovers stand warned of the world's impending storm
        Heavenly arms reach out to me

        Sylvia
        Sylvia
        Sylvia
        Sylvia

        Oh-oh-woh, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
        Ooohhh-ooohhh-ooohhh-ooohhh-ooohhh, oh-wow-woh
        Mmmm.., oh-woh-woh

        (Heavenly arms reach out to hold me)
        (Sylvia, you mean so much to me)
        (Heavenly arms reach out to hold me)
        (Sylvia, you mean so much to me)
        (Heavenly arms reach out to hold me)
        (Sylvia, you mean so much to me)
        (Heavenly arms reach out to hold me)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Hello It's Me</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================
"Hello It's Me"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        Andy it's me, haven't seen you in a while
        I wish I'd talked to you more when you were alive
        I thought you were self-assured when you acted shy
        hello it's me

        I really miss you, I really miss your mind
        I haven't heard ideas like that for such a long long time
        I loved to watch you draw and watch you paint
        but when I saw you last, I turned away

        When Billy Name was sick and locked up in his room
        you asked me for some speed, I thought it was for you
        I'm sorry if I doubted your good heart
        things always seem to end before they start

        Hello it's me, that was a great gallery show
        your cow wallpaper and your floating silver pillows
        I wish I paid more attention when they laughed at you
        hello it's me

        "Pop goes pop artist," the headline said
        "is shooting a put on, is Warhol really dead?"
        You get less time for stealing a car
        I remember thinking as I heard my own record in a bar

        They really hated you, now all that's changed
        but I have some resentments that can never be unmade
        You hit me where it hurt I didn't laugh
        your Diaries are not a worthy epitaph

        Oh well now Andy, I guess we've got to go
        I wish someway somehow you like this little show
        I know this is late in coming but it's the only way I know
        hello it's me

        Goodnight, Andy

        Goodbye, Andy




intro   {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (Andy it's me ...)
        {A/C#m}{F#m/F#m7}{Bm/Bm7}{E}   (I thought you were ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (I really miss you ...)
        {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}           (I loved to watch you ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (When Billy Name was ...)
        {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}           (I'm sorry if I doubted ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (Hello it's me ...)
        {A/C#m}{F#m/F#m7}{Bm/Bm7}{E}   (I wish I paid more ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 ("Pop goes pop artist," ...)
        {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}           (You get less time for ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (They really hated you ...)
        {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}           (You hit me where ...)

        {A}{E}{F#m}{D}                 (Oh well now Andy ...)
        {A/C#m}{F#m/F#m7}{Bm/Bm7}{E}   (I know this is late in ...)

        {A/F#m}{E}{A/F#m}{E}           (- Andy)

        {A...                          (Goodbye, Andy)




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Here Comes The Bride</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================================================
"Here Comes The Bride"
=========================================================
box set
_Between Thought And Expression - The Lou Reed Anthology_
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Lou Reed

* outtake from _Take No Prisoners_ sessions

May 21, 1978 late show
Bottom Line, NYC
=========================================================


        I just wanna tell you a story
        it happened to a friend of mine
        Didn't have no power and no glory
        said he didn't have the time
        He said he was a happy kind of person
        do anything to find out 'bout this girl
        She went and then she married another fellow
        knocked my friend right out of this world
        he heard the preacher say
        Here comes the bride

        (Here comes the bride)
        It haunts him every night, he is in hell
        here comes the bride, baby
        (Here comes the bride)
        .............
        (Here comes the bride)
        Here comes the bride
        hey, and doesn't she look lovely
        (Lovely)
        Here comes the bride

        Somebody call his Aunt Carrie
        and tell her that nephew Jimmy is comin' in from Vermont
        via the coast
        And somebody call up his old man
        hey you, tell him that his son's arriving
        and he's looking like a ghost
        And somebody find that Virgin Mary
        oh, won't you tell that bitch
        hey, your Jimmy's a comin' back home
        And somebody tell those ladies in waiting, "Hold it now"
        and don't tell the preacher go on with it
        we don't want to hear those words
        Oh, here comes the bride

        (Here comes the bride)
        I don't want to hear it now
        yeah-yeah-yeah, here comes the bride
        (here comes the bride)
        here comes the bride

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

Here is the first attempt at Here comes the Bride.
I will post it on my list and see if anyone can work out the gaps



"Here Comes The Bride"


Listen, I wanna tell you a story
It Happened to a True friend of mine
He didn't have no power and the glory
They said he didn't know how to have a good time???
They said he was a hard(?) kind of person
The only thing that ?he had was? his girl
She went and married another fellow
It knocked my friend right out of this world
He heard the preacher say "Here comes the Bride"
(Here comes the Bride)
It haunts him every night. He is in Hell
Here comes the Bride baby (Here comes the Bride)

Hey doesn't she look lovely (Lovely)
Here comes the Bride

And somebody call up his old man
Yeah you tell him that your son's arriving
??? is looking like a ghost
And somebody find that Virgin Mary
Oh Won't you tell that Bitch "Hey your Jimmy Is Coming back home"
And somebody tell those ladies in waiting "Hold it now"
Don't tell the preacher "Go on with it"
We don't want to hear words.

And don't you know the Preacher looks ugly?

=========================================
"Here's A Heart"
=========================================
album _Wild Angel_
(Nelson Slater, 1976)

written by E.Waters/W.Collier/S.Culley

Lou Reed:
produce, piano, guitar, background vocals
=========================================


        I see her on the street
        talk to her in my sleep
        And I see her face
        her pretty, pretty face

        And I say, here's a heart
        a true-true heart
        And I give my heart to her

        She casts an eye in my direction
        oh me, oh my, ain't that perfection
        And I see her face
        her pretty, pretty face

        and I say, here's a heart
        a true-true heart
        And I give my heart to her

        Here's a heart
        a true-true heart
        And I give my heart to her

        Give my heart to her, oh
        Yes, I give my heart to her, oh please, yeah
        I give my heart to her

        Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah ....

        (here's a heart, please take a part of the)
        (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)
        (here's a heart, please take a part of the)
        (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)
        (here's a heart, please take a part of the)
        ....

====================================
"Here She Comes Now"
====================================
album _White Light/White Heat_
(The Velvet Underground, 1968)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/Sterling Morrison
====================================


        Now, if she ever comes now-now
        if she ever comes now-now
        if she ever comes now

        if she ever comes now-now
        if she ever comes now-now

        oh, she's made out of wood
        Just look and see

        if she ever comes now-now
        if she ever comes now

        if she ever comes now-now
        if she ever comes now

        oh, she's made out of wood
        Just look and see

        just look and see now
        if she ever comes, if she ever comes now
        Now-now-now-now
        if she ever-ever-ever comes na-na-now-now
        if she ever-ever-ever comes na-na-na-na-now-now
        If she ever comes now, now-now-now
        if she ever, if she ever, if she ever
        If she ever comes now, na-na-na-na-na-na-now

        f she ever, if she ever

<TITLE>Heroin</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
=======================================
"Heroin"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

written by Lou Reed
=======================================


        I don't know just where I'm going
        But I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell you things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made big decision
        I'm gonna try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        And you can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you sweet girls with all your sweet talk
        You can all go take a walk
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        Ah, in a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all the evils of this town
        And of himself and those around
        Oh, and I guess that I just don't know
        Oh, and I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life, haha
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        I really don't care anymore
        About all the Jim-Jims in this town
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        'Cause when the smack begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore

        Ah, when that heroin is in my blood, hah
        And that blood is in my head
        Man thank God that I'm good as dead
        And thank your God that I'm not aware
        And thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess that I just don't know
        Oh, and I guess that I just don't know



* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   * tempo faster
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- going, But -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- can, 'Cause it makes me feel like ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- run, And I feel just like Jesus' son ...)
        {D}{G}         (- know, And I guess that I just don't -)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- know)

        ....

        {C#}{F#}{C#}{F#}   (- going, But -)

==================================================
"Heroin"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Nov 1969
San Francisco, California
==================================================


        I don't know just where I'm going
        And I'm going to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes my feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell ya things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made very big decision
        I'm going to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you girls with all your sweet pretty talk

        Oh, you can all go take a walk

        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from -

        - this land here and that

        Away from big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all the evils of this town
        And of himself and those around

        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, pretty babe, be the death of me
        Heroin, you know it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head, ah

        And then I'm better off than dead

        When the smack begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore
        'Bout all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody puttin' everybody else down
        All the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        'Cause while that heroin is in my blood
        Then the blood is in my head, oh
        Thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank God that I'm not aware
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        And the blood is in my head

        I just don't care
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess I just don't know

        I don't know just where I'm going
        But I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man

        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then things aren't quite the same

        When I'm rushing on my run
        I feel just like Jesus' son
        I guess that I just don't know
        I guess that I just don't know

        I have made very big decision
        I'm gonna try, I'm goin' to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck

        You can't help me, not you guys
        all you girls with all your sweet pretty talk
        Oh, you could all go take a walk
        I guess that I just don't know
        I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that, I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        In a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that

        Away from the big cities
        Where a man could not be free
        Of all of the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        And I guess that I just don't know
        Ooohhh, guess that I just don't know

        Heroin
        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        Then I'm better off than dead

        'Cause when the smack begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore
        About all your Jim-Jims in this town
        Everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        While that heroin is in my blood
        And the blood is in my head
        Oh-oh, thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank God I just don't care
        Thank God I'm not aware

        While that heroin is in my blood
        And the blood is in my head
        Oh-wow, thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank God I'm not aware
        Thank God I just don't care
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}         (I don't know just where I'm -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}         (- going)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}         (But I'm gonna try for the kingdom ...)
        {D}{G}               (- can,  'Cause it makes me feel ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}         (When I put a spike into my vein ...)
        {D}{G/G7}{D}{G/G7}   (- same)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G/G7}{D}{G/G7}   (- son, I guess that I just don't -)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}         (- know)

        ....

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

===============================
"Heroin"
(demo take-5)
===============================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

Jul 1965
John Cale's Ludlow Street loft,
lower Manhattan, NYC
===============================


        I know just where I'm going
        I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel that I'm a man
        When I put the spike into my vein
        Then things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing from my run
        And I feel like Jesus' son
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made a big decision
        I'm gonna nullify my life
        When the blood begins to flow
        When it squirts as the dropper's neck
        When the smack goes and hits my blood
        When I'm closing in on death
        And my head begins to brow
        You can't hit me, not you girl
        All you guys sweet all your talk
        You can all go take a walk
        Down the sheets and off the floors
        Through the windows with the people's halls
        And the cars with the people round
        And I love the people of my town
        And I guess that I just don't know
        Oh, I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I lived a hundred years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        In a sailor's suit and cap
        Go away from that big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        From the evils of this town
        Of himself and those around
        Wish I travelled all around
        But I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin is gonna be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my life and it's my wife
        'Cause the mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead
        With that smack blood starting to flow
        When I really don't care no more
        About all the Jim-Jims in this town
        All the animals making sounds
        People selling people a poun-poun-pound
        And the politicians and the clowns
        And all the too-gooders with their frowns
        And the dead bodies all piled in mounds
        But while the heroin is in my blood
        And the blood is in my head
        I thank god that I'm good as dead
        And thank god that I'm not aware
        And thank god that I just don't care
        I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {D}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   * tempo faster

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (I know just where I'm -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- going)
        .... repeat

==========================================
"Heroin"
==========================================
album _American Poet_
(Lou Reed, 2001)

Dec 26, 1972
Ultrasonic Recording Studio, Hempstead, NY
==========================================


        I don't know just where I'm going
        But I'm goin' to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell you things aren't quite the same
        ah-huh

        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made a very big decision
        I'm goin' to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you sweet pretty girls
        with all your sweet pretty talk
        You can all go take a walk
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Tell you a diary, junkie's dream, hahaha.. hahaha..

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        I put on a sailor's suit and a cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        Oh, and I guess I just don't know
        Oh, and I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        Oh, I really don't care anymore
        About all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds
        oh

        Ah, while that heroin is in my blood
        And that blood is in my head
        Yeah, thank God that I'm good as dead
        And thank God that I'm not aware
        And thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (I don't know just where I'm -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- going, But -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm goin' to try for the kingdom if I -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- can, 'Cause it makes me feel like ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- vein, Then I tell you things aren't ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (When I'm rushing on my run ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (And I guess I just don't know ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        ....

     {D}                {G}

and continue "D" chord on fast part








==================================================
"Heroin"
(The Matrix, San Francisco, 11-23-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Dec 01, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        I don't know where I'm going
        And I'm going to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes my feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell ya things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Now I have made very big decision
        And I'm going to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all your sweet pretty girls
        with all your sweet pretty talk
        You can all go take a walk
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        I put on a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, you know that it's my wife, it's my life
        'Cause a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        Then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        Oh, I really don't care anymore
        'Bout all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody puttin' everybody else down
        All the politicians making crazy sounds
        All the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        Oh, while that heroin is in my blood
        Then the blood is in my head, oh
        Thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank God that I'm not aware
        Thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

===============================
"Heroin"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        I don't know just where I'm going
        But I'm going to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Oh, I tell you things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I don't know
        I decided a couple of things
        But I know, but I'm going to try to give my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you sweet pretty girls
        with all your sweet pretty talk
        You can all go take a walk
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        And I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        Put on a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all of the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        Oh, and I guess I just don't know
        Oh, and I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        Oh then I really don't care anymore
        About all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds
        And all the politicians making crazy columns

        Ah, while that heroin is in my blood
        And that blood is in my head
        Woh, then thank God that I'm good as dead
        And thank God that I'm not aware
        And thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




intro   {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (I don't know just where I'm going, But -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm going to try for the kingdom ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (When I put a spike into my vein ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (When I'm rushing on my run ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (And I guess I just don't know ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- know)

        ....




note: play "G6" chord on slow part.

 3E  ---0---
 4B  ---0---

"Heroin"

album _American Poet Box: Lou Reed - Paris '72_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

Paris, France

        I don't know just where I'm going
        I'm going to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell you things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        I feel just like Jesus' son
        I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made very big decision
        I'm going to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you sweet pretty girls
        with all your sweet pretty talk
        You can all go take a walk
        I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        Put on a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all of the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore
        About all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        While that heroin is in my blood
        And that blood is in my head
        Man thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank God that I'm not aware
        And thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess I just don't know

        [skipped]

"Heroin"
========================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
========================


        I don't know just where I'm going
        But I'm going to try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell you things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made a very big decision
        I'm going to try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or all you pretty girls with all your sweet pretty talk
        You could all go take a walk
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I'll be your mirror
        I'll be your mirror

        I, I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I, I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        Put on a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of all of the evils in this town
        And of himself and those around
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the blood begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore
        About all your Jim-Jims in this town
        And everybody putting everybody else down
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds

        While that heroin is in my blood
        And that blood is in my head
        Oh oh, thank God that I'm good as dead
        Thank your God that I'm not aware
        Thank God that I just don't care

        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know




intro   {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (I don't know just where I'm -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- going)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (But I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I -)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- can, 'Cause it makes me feel like ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- vein, Then I tell you things ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- run, And I feel just like Jesus' son ...)
        {D}{G}         (- know, And I guess that I just don't -)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- know)

        ....




* chord forms

     {D}                {G}
 1e --2--------3---2-----------------------
 2B --3--------3---3-----3-----------------
 3G --2--------2---2-----0-----------------
 4D --0--------0---0-----0-----------------
 5A ---------------------2-----------------
 6E ---------------------3-----------------








===================================================
"Heroin"
(acetate version)
===================================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico - Unripened_
(The Velvet Underground, 2007)
===================================================


        I know just where I'm going
        I'm gonna try for the kingdom if I can
        'Cause it makes me feel like I'm a man
        When I put a spike into my vein
        Then I tell you things aren't quite the same
        When I'm rushing on my run
        And I feel just like Jesus' son
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know

        I have made big decision
        I'm gonna try to nullify my life
        'Cause when the blood begins to flow
        When it shoots up the dropper's neck
        When I'm closing in on death

        You can't help me, not you guys
        Or you girls with your sweet talk
        You can all go take a walk
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess I just don't know

        I wish that I was born a thousand years ago
        I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
        On a great big clipper ship
        Going from this land here to that
        In a sailor's suit and cap

        Away from the big city
        Where a man cannot be free
        Of the evils of this town
        And of himself and those around
        And I guess I just don't know
        And I guess I just don't know

        Heroin, be the death of me
        Heroin, it's my wife and it's my life
        Because a mainer to my vein
        Leads to a center in my head
        And then I'm better off than dead

        Because when the smack begins to flow
        Then I really don't care anymore
        About all the Jim-Jims in this town
        And all the politicians making crazy sounds
        And all the dead bodies piled up in mounds
        And everybody putting everybody else down

        Oh, while that heroin is in my blood
        And that blood is in my head
        Man thank God that I'm good as dead
        And thank God that I'm not aware
        And thank God that I just don't care
        And I guess that I just don't know
        And I guess that I just don't know




* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        "Heroin" and "Venus In Furs" have different pitch/tuning
        from other songs on this album.




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Here's my interpretation of what Lou's singing on the last take
of Heroin on "Peel slowly and see":



I know just where I'm going
I'm gonna try for the kingdom, if I can
'Cause it makes me feel that I'm a man
When I put the spike into my vein
Then things aren't quite the same
When I'm rushing from my run
And I feel like Jesus' son
And I guess that I just don't know
And I guess that I just don't know

I have made a big decision
I'm gonna nullify my life
When the blood begins to flow
When it squirts up the dropper's neck
When the smack goes and hits my blood
When I'm closing in on death
And my head begins to well
And you can't help me, not you girls
All you guys with all your talk
You can all go take a walk
Down the sheets and off the floors
Through the windows with the people's halls
And the cars with the people round
And I love the people of my town
And I guess that I just don't know
Oh, I guess that I just don't know

I wish that I lived a 100 years ago
I wish that I'd sailed the darkened seas
On a great big clipper ship
Going from this land here to that
In a sailor's suit and cap
Go away from the big city
Where a man cannot be free
From the evils of this town
Of himself and those around
I wish I traveled all around
But I guess that I just don't know
And I guess that I just don't know

Heroin is gonna be the death of me
Heroin, it's my life and it's my wife
'Cause the mainer to my vein
Leads to a center in my head
And then I'm better off than dead
With that smack blood starting to flow
When I really don't care no more
About all the Jim-Jims in this town
All the animals making sounds
People selling people a p-p-p-pound
And the politicians and the clowns
And the too-gooders with their frowns
And the dead bodies all piled in mounds
But while the heroin is in my blood
And the blood is in my head
I thank God that I'm good as dead
And thank God that I'm not aware
And thank God that I don't care
I guess that I just don't know
And I guess that I just don't know


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Bruno Chazard (bruno.p.chazard@euronet.be)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I bought the French translation of "Between thought and expression"
and in the lyrics of Heroin,
there's a difference between your version and the one in the book:


Heroin be the death of me
... Because a mainer to my vein
Leads to a center in my head...


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Vic Elliott (lucidrecords@msn.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I thought the following slang terms are more likely
what Lou is singing in Heroin (all versions):

mainers = main line

(from Webster's Collegiate Dictionary,
1995, Random House pub., New York)
"main' line' n. 2. Slang. a readily accessible vein
that can be used for the injection of a narcotic"

Jim-Jims= jim-jams
(also from Webster's Collegiate Dictionary, 1995)
"jim-jams n. Slang.
1. extreme nervousness, jitters 2. delirium tremens"

Just ideas, I don't know if your lyrics are confirmed
by some published source or not,
but I have just always thought these to be right.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: David Burns (dburns2@earthlink.net)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

One thing though, I was reading the lyrics to Heroin,
and some guy is saying that Lou Reed is singing
"jim-jams" instead of "jim-jims" which is not true.
Lou is not using common slang, but making up his own words.
I read in the liner notes some vinyl reissues
and in a book that Lou was creating his own language,
which elevated his work to that of a poet's.
So, jim-jams is not correct at all.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<TITLE>The Heroine</TITLE>
