<PRE>
=====================
"The Heroine"
=====================
album _The Blue Mask_
(Lou Reed, 1982)

written by Lou Reed
=====================


        The heroine stood up on the deck
        the ship was out of control
        the bow was being ripped to shreds
        men were fighting down below
        The sea had pummeled them for so long
        that they knew nothing but fear

        And the baby's in the box
        he thinks the door is locked
        the sea is in a state
        the baby learns to wait for the heroine
        Ooohhh-ooohhh, for the heroine
        locked in his defense, he waits for the heroine

        The mast is cracking as the waves are slapping
        sailors rolled across the deck
        and when they thought no one was looking
        they would cut a weaker man's neck
        While the heroine dressed in a virgin white dress
        tried to steer the mighty ship
        But the raging storm wouldn't hear of it
        they were in for a long trip

        Baby's in the box
        thinks the door is locked
        he finds it hard to breathe
        drawing in the sea
        And where's the heroine to fire off the gun
        to calm the raging seas
        and let herself be seized by the -

        - Baby in the box
        he thinks the door is locked
        the woman has the keys
        but there's no moment she can seize
        Here's to the heroine
        who transcends all the men
        Who are locked inside the box
        will the lady let him out
        Ooohhh, the heroine, ooohhh-ooohhh, the heroine
        Strapped to the mast, the pale ascendant heroine
        strapped to the mast, the pale ascendant heroine



                                     (The -)
        {D/Em}{G}{D/Em}{G}           (- heroine stood up on ...)
        {D/Em}{G/{A#}{A#}            (The sea had pummeled them ...)

        {C}{Am}{C}{Am/Am.G}          (And the baby's in the box ...)
        {C}                          (- the heroine)
        {F/G}{C}{F/G}{C}             (ooohhh-ooohhh, for the ...)

        {Em}{G}{Am.Em/G.Em}{A}

        {D/Em}{G}{D/Em}{G}           (The mast is cracking as ...)
        {D/Em}{G}                    (- heroine dressed in a ...)
        {D/Em}{G/{A#}{A#}            (- raging storm wouldn't ...)
        
        {C}{Am}{C}{Am}               (- Baby's in the box, he ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}                 (- the heroine to fire off ...)

        {C}{Am}{C}{A#dim}            (- Baby in the box, he ...)
        {F}{G}                       (- heroine, who transcends ...)
        {C}{Am}{F}{A#/C}             (- locked inside the box ...)
        {F}                          (- the heroine)
        {A#.F/C.G}{C}{A#.F/C.G}{C}   (Strapped to the mast, the ...)
        {A#.F/C.G}{C}{A#.F/C.G}{C}

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Doctor Bob (doctorbobnyc@hotmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

On Hey Mr Rain, during the verse,
the chord change goes from E to F, not E to A.

You can see this clearly on the Velvet Redux 1993 DVD
where Lou is playing an E barre chord at the 7th fret
and then just moves the chord up one fret to play an F
at the 8th fret.

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

======================
"High In The City"
======================
album _New Sensations_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        I got the time, I got my feet
        let's go hit the street
        High in the city
        high in the city

        I got my mace and you got your knife
        you gotta protect your own life
        High in the city
        high in the city

        I wanna get high in the city
        I wanna stay alive here in the city
        I wanna stay high in the city
        High in the city
        high in the city

        Let's not walk down Sutton Place
        you know everybody there's gotten Akitas
        High in the city
        high in the city

        Don't want to talk politics today
        I feel too good, let me have my way
        High in the city
        high in the city

        Watch out for that guy on your right
        seen him on the news last Saturday night
        He was high in the city
        high in the city

        Hey, look they're setting fire to that jeep
        there's not much you can keep
        High in the city
        here in the city

        I wanna get high in the city
        I wanna stay alive in the city
        I wanna stay high in the city
        High in the city
        high in the city

        So many people feeling low
        and there's only one way to go -
        - To get high in the city
        high in the city

        Let's grab a pie, let's hit the park
        I'll kiss and hug you till it gets dark
        Here in the city
        getting high in the city

        (High in the city)

        (High in the city and you're looking so pretty)
        (feelin' pretty witty, gettin' high off of the city)
        (Hi-ai-ai-ai, high in the city)

        (High in the city)
        (High in the city and you're looking so pretty)
        (feelin' pretty witty, gettin' high off of the city)
        (Hi-ai-ai-ai, high in the city)

        (High in the city)
        (High in the city and you're looking so pretty)
        (feelin' pretty witty, gettin' high off of the city)
        (Hi-ai-ai-ai, high in the city)

<TITLE>Hold On</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Hold On"
===================
album _New York_
(Lou Reed, 1989)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        There's blacks with knives and whites with clubs
        fighting in Howard Beach
        There's no such thing as human rights
        when you walk the New York streets
        A cop was shot in the head by a 10 years old kid
        named Buddah in Central Park last week
        The fathers and daughters are lined up by the coffins
        by the Statue of Bigotry, hey

        You better hold on
        something's happening here
        You better hold on
        well I'll meet you in Tompkins Square

        The dopers sent a message to the cops last weekend
        they shot him in the car where he sat
        And Eleanor Bumpers and Michael Stewart
        must have appreciated that
        There's a rampaging rage rising up like a plague
        of bloody vials washing up on the beach
        It'll take more than the Angels or Iron Mike Tyson
        to heal this bloody breach, hey-hey

        You better hold on
        something's happening here
        You better hold on
        I'm gonna meet you in Tompkins Square

        A junkie ran down a lady, a pregnant dancer
        she'll never dance but the baby was saved
        He shot up some China White and nodded out at the wheel
        and he doesn't remember a thing
        They shot that old lady
        'cause they thought she was a witness
        to a crime she didn't even see
        Whose home is the home of the brave
        by the Statue of Bigotry, hey

        You better hold on
        something's happening here
        You better hold on
        there's a lie in Tompkins Square

        You got a black 38 and a gravity knife
        you still have to ride the train
        There's the smelly essence of New York down there
        but you ain't no Bernard Goetz, ah
        There's no mafia lawyer to fight in your corner
        for that 15 minutes of fame
        The have and the havenots are bleeding in the tub
        that's New York's future not mine, oh

        You better hold on
        something's happening here
        You better hold on
        hey baby, something's happening here
        Hold on, ooohhh babe



intro   {A}{A}{D}{A}   (Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha, woh)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (Oh)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}
        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (There's -)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (- blacks with knives and whites with ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (- no such thing as human rights ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (- shot in the head by a 10 years old ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}   (- fathers and daughters are lined up ...)

chorus  {A}{Bm}{D}{A}  (- hold on, something's happening here ...)
        {A}{Bm}{D}{A}  (- hold on, well I'll meet you in ...)

        ....




* riff (left channel: Lou)

     {A}            {A}            {D}            {A}
 1e --------------------------------2--2-2-3p2--------------
 2B --2--2-2-3p2-----2--2-2-3p2-----3--3-3-----3---2--3--2--
 3G --2--2-2-----2---2--2-2-----2---2--2-2---------2--2--2--   ...
 4D --2--2-2---------2--2-2---------0--0-0---------2--2--2--
 5A --0--0-0---------0--0-0------------------------0--0--0--
 6E --------------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

<TITLE>Home Of The Brave</TITLE>

<PRE>
========================
"Home Of The Brave"
========================
album _Legendary Hearts_
(Lou Reed, 1983)

written by Lou Reed
========================


        Here's to Johnny with his Jo
        and Mickey's got a wife
        And here's to Jerry
        he has got his Joyce

        And me, I'm shaking
        in my boots tonight
        For the daughters and the sons
        lost in the home of the brave

        And here's to the home of the brave
        And here's to the life that's not saved
        Here's to the home of the brave
        Here's to the home of the brave

        Here's to Frank hit in some bar
        in picturesque Brooklyn Heights
        And here's to a friend who jumped in front of a train
        at seven o'clock one night

        And another friend who thinks he lacks worth
        has disappeared from sight
        Somewhere in the home
        of the brave

        And here's to the home of the brave
        And here's to the life that's not saved
        Here's to the home of the brave
        Here's to the home of the brave

        The stars are hiding in their clouds
        the street lights are too bright
        A man's kicking a woman
        who's clutching his leg tight

        And I think suddenly of you
        and blink my eyes in fright
        And rush off to the home
        of the brave

        And here's to the home of the brave
        Here's to the home of the brave
        And here's to the life that is saved
        Here's to the home of the brave

        And everyday you have to die some
        cry some and die some
        And everyday you have to die some
        cry some and die

        In the home of the brave
        Home of the brave

<TITLE>HookyWooky</TITLE>

<PRE>
================================
"HookyWooky"
================================
album _Set The Twilight Reeling_
(Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
================================


        I'm standing with you on your roof
        looking at the chemical sky
        All purple blue and oranges
        some pigeons flying by
        The traffic on Canal Street's so noisy
        it's a shock
        And someone's shooting fireworks or a gun
        on the next block

        An-an-and, I wanna HookyWooky with you
        I wanna HookyWooky with you

        The traffic's so noisy it's a shock
        sounds like fireworks or a gun on the next block
        Ah, HookyWooky with you

        Your ex-lover Satchel is here from France
        yet another ex
        They gather about you like a Mother Superior
        all of you still friends, but -
        None of my old flames ever talk to me when things
        end for me they end
        They take your pants, your money, your name
        but the song still remains

        An-an-and, I wanna HookyWooky with you
        Ah-ha-ha-ha, I wanna HookyWooky with you

        Then they take your pants, your money, your name
        but the song still remains the same
        I wanna HookyWooky with you

        You're so civilized it hurts
        I guess I could learn a lot, ha-ha...
        About people, plants and relationships
        how not to get hurt a lot
        And each lover I meet up your roof
        I wouldn't want to throw him off, mmmm..
        Into the chemical sky, down into the streets to die
        under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        And each lover I meet up on your roof
        I wouldn't want to throw him off, mmmm..
        Into the chemical sky
        under the wheels of a car to die on Canal street

        Ah-ah-hi, I wanna, ah, HookyWooky with you
        ah-huh, huh-huh-huh-ah
        I wanna HookyWooky with you

        I wouldn't want to throw him off into the chemical sky
        down into the streets to die
        Under the wheels of a car on Canal street

        Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        HookyWooky
        Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        HookyWooky
        Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street
        Hooky-Hooky-Hooky-Wooky
        (Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street)
        (Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street)
        (Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street)
        (Under the wheels of a car on Canal Street)

<PRE>
===================
"Hop Frog"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed

sung by David Bowie
===================


        Well they call me a juicy hop-frog
        you can see me in any wood bog
        don't you know that they call me the hop-frog
        hopping frog

        I'm a hop-frog
        a hop-frog
        they call me the hop-frog
        hop, hop-frog

        They call me the hop-frog
        see me in any wood bog
        don't you know that call me a hop-frog
        hop-frog

        They call me the hop-frog
        see me in a wood bog
        they're calling me a hop-frog
        hop-frog

        You can see me in a ballroom
        you can see me in a bedroom
        you can see me in the woods
        hop, hop-frog

        They call me the hop-frog
        they call you the hop-frog
        well they call you the hop-frog
        hop, hop-frog

        Frog




intro    D...     x}   guitar ... drums
        {D}{D}{D}{A}

        {D}{D}{D}{A}   (Well they call me a juicy hop-frog ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (I'm a hop-frog, A hop-frog ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{A}   (They call me the hop-frog ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{A}   (They call me the hop-frog ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (You can see me in a ballroom ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{A}   (They call me the hop-frog ...)
        {D}{D}{D....   (Frog)

\ - slide down

========================================
"Hop Frog"
========================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, local musicians (?)

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
========================================


        Well they call me a juicy hop-frog
        you can see me in any wood bog
        don't you know that they call me the hop-frog
        hopping frog

        a hop-frog
        they call me the hop-frog
        hop, hop-frog

        Call me the hop-frog
        see me in a wood bog
        don't you know that call me a hop-frog
        hop, hop-frog

        Call me the hop-frog
        see me in a wood bog
        don't you know that call me a hop-frog
        hop, hop-frog

        You can see me in a ballroom
        you can see me in a bedroom
        you can see me in the woods
        hop, hop-frog

        Well they call me hop-frog
        they call you hop-frog
        they call you hop-frog
        hop

        Hop-frog

<TITLE>Hopes On Hold</TITLE>

<PRE>
================================
"Hopes On Hold"
================================
album _Nothing But The Truth_
(Ruben Blades, 1988)

written by Lou Reed/Ruben Blades
================================


        Trying to find out what to do with all your love
        Should I keep it out or let it in
        Can I trust in someone else for a lifetime
        And hope that the distance disappears

        'Cause everytime we place ourselves in other hands
        We take a chance by giving up control
        And second guessing, feeling starts to fade away
        And hopes on hold

        It's not easy to believe in someone else
        Don't know many people that are true
        Still I got to choose between my loneliness
        And that fear to trust in someone new

        'Cause everytime we place our faith in other hands
        We take a chance by giving up control
        But second guessing, feeling starts to fade away
        And hopes on hold

        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold

        Do you want to know the truth
        You shouldn't settle for a lie
        Am I just playing the fool
        Are you really what I want

        Everytime we place our faith in other hands
        We stand the chance those hands might let it fall
        But second guessing, feeling starts to run away
        And hopes on hold

        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold
        Hopes on hold

        {A}{G}{F#m}{F6}
        {F6}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {Dm}{Dm}{A}{A}         (And hope that the distance ...)

        {F6}

        {A}{Asus4}{D}{Dsus4}   (Still I got to choose between ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{A}{A}         (And that fear to trust in ...)

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Hopes on Hold (L. Reed-R.Blades);


lyrics:

trying to find out what to do with all your love
should i keep it out or let it in?
can i trust in someone else for a lifetime, and hope that
the distance disappears?
'cause everytime we place ourselves in other hands,
we take a chance by giving up control,
and second guessing, feeling starts to fade away and
hope's on hold

it's not easy to believe in someone else
don't know many people that are true.
still, i got to choose between my loneliness and fear
to trust in someone new.
'cause everytime we place our faith in other hands,
we take a chance by giving up control.
but, second, guessing, feeling starts to fade away and
hope's on hold

do you wanna know the truth?
you shouldn't settle for a lie
am i just playing the fool?
are you really what i want?

everytime we place our faith in other hands we stand
the chance those hands might let it fall,
but second guessing, feeling starts to run away and
hope's on hold.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

chords/tabs transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

        funky hot hips, hip-hop-bop-flop
        Funky hot hips, hip-hop-bop-flop
        funky hot hips, hip-hop-bop-flop
        Funky hot hips, hip-hop-bop-flop
        funky hot hips, hip-hop-bop-flop

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (Funky hot hips)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (Funky hot hips, I would do anything ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (- anything, to get to your funky hot ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (- fool for you, to get to your funky ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (Hip-hop-bop-flop, baby, don't you ever ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (Funky hot hips, I would do anything ...)
        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (- anything, to get to your funky hot hip)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (- fool for you, to get to your funky ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}   (Hip-hop-bop-flop, baby, don't you ever ...)

        {A}{D}{A}{D}

        ....

    Funky hot hips     I would do anything
     {A}               {D}      {A}               {D}

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

not complete but...take a look!!



"Hot Hips"


Funky hot hips
funky hot hips
funky hot hips

I would do anything
I would do anything
to...to your funky hot hips

Funky hot hips
I would do play the fool
I'd play the fool for you

hip, hop, bop,...
don't you ever stop
your funky hot hips

(repeat)

<PRE>
===================================
"How Do You Speak To An Angel"
===================================
album _Growing Up In Public_
(Lou Reed, 1980)

written by Lou Reed/Michael Fonfara
===================================


        A son who is cursed with a harridan mother
        or a weak simpering father at best
        Is raised to play out the timeless classical motives
        of filial love and incest

        How does he speak to a
        how does he speak to the prettiest girl
        How does he talk to her
        What does he say for an opening line
        what does he say if he's shy

        What do you do with your pragmatic passions
        with your classically neurotic style
        How do you deal with your vague self-comprehension
        what do you do when you lie

        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl
        How do you speak to her
        How do you dance on the head of a pin
        when you're on the outside looking in

        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl
        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl

        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl
        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl

        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl
        How do you speak to a
        how do you speak to the prettiest girl
        You say, hello, baby
        ........ talk to the prettiest, prettiest girl
        Baby, angel
        how do you talk to the prettiest girl, you say -
        Hello baby, hello baby, angel-angel, pretty little girl
        Angel, angel ........ prettiest girl .......



intro   {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}
        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}

        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}   (A son who is cursed ...)
        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}   (Is raised to play ...)

        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How does he ...)
        {Cm}{A#}                          (How does he talk to her)
        {G#/D#}{G#/D#}{G#/D#}{G#}         (What does he say for ...)
        {G#}

        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}
        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}



        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}   (What do you do with ...)
        {D#/A#}{G#/G#.A#}{D#/A#}{Cm/A#}   (How do you deal with ...)

        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)
        {Cm}{A#}                          (How do you speak to her)
        {G#/D#}{G#/D#}{G#/D#}{G#}         (How do you dance on ...)
        {G#}

        {Cm}{Cm}{Fm}{Fm}
        {Cm}{Cm}{Fm}{Fm}
        {Cm}{Cm}{Fm}{Fm}
        {Cm/Cm.{Fm/G}{Bm.
        {Cm/Cm.{Fm/G}{Bm.

        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)

        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)

        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (How do you ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (- hello, baby, ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (- girl, Baby, angel ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (Hello baby, hello ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            (Angel, angel ...)
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            background vocals
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            background vocals
        {Cm}{A#}{G#/D#}{G#/A#}            background vocals
        ... fade out

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend

\ - slide down

---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Detlef Juergens (detlef.juergens@nwn.de)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Maybe it helps.


How Do You Speak To An Angel
 
A son who is cursed with a harridan mother
Or a weak simpering father at best
Is raised to play out the timeless classical motives
Of filial love and incest

How does he
Speak to a
How does he speak to the prettiest girl
How does he
Talk to her
What does he say for an opening line
What does he say if he's shy

What do you do with your pragmatic passions
With your classically neurotic style
How do you deal with your vague self-comprehensions
What do you do when you lie

How do you
Speak to a
How do you speak to the prettiest girl
How do you speak to her
How do you dance on the head of a pin
When you're on the outside looking in

How do you
Speak to a
How do you speak to the prettiest girl
How do you
Speak to a
How do you speak to the prettiest girl

You just say - Hello, hello, hello Baby

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
===========================
"How Do You Think It Feels"
===========================
album _Berlin_
(Lou Reed, 1973)

written by Lou Reed
===========================


        How do you think it feels
        when you're speeding and lonely, come here baby
        How do you think it feels
        when all you can say is if only

        If only I had a little
        if only I had some change, come here baby
        If only, if only, only

        How do you think it feels
        and when do you think it stops

        How do you think it feels
        when you've been up for five days, come down here mama
        Hunting around always, ooohhh
        'cause you're afraid of sleeping

        How do you think it feels
        to feel like a wolf and foxy
        How do you think it feels

        To always make love by proxy, uh
        how do you think it feels
        And when do you think it stops
        when do you think it stops




intro   {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}

        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}       (How do you think it feels ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}       (How do you think it feels ...)

        {F.C/G}{D}{F.C/G}{D}   (If only I had a little ...)
        {F.C/G}{D}             (If only, if only, only)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}           (How do you think it feels ...)

guitar  {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}

        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}       (How do you think it feels ...)
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}       (Hunting around always, ooohhh ...)

        {F.C/G}{D}{F.C/G}{D}   (How do you think it feels ...)
        {F.C/G}{D}             (How do you think it feels)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}           (To always make love by proxy ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}           (And when do you think it stops ...)

        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}

        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        {G}{C}{G}{F.C/C}
        ... fade out

* chords for down-tuning




* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        when you're speeding and lonely

* riff ({D/A}{E} part)

   If only  I   had a    little
     {D   / A }      {E}
 1e --------------------------------------------------
 2B -----------------------------9-9----9-9-----------
 3G -----------------------------9-9h11-9-9-----------
 4D --5-4------------------------9-9----9-9h11p9------
 5A ------5--4v--------------/11-----------------11\--
 6E -------------5----0---0---------------------------




*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

<TITLE>I'm Gonna Fight</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================================
"I'm Gonna Fight"
==============================================
album _Soundsville!_
(Various Artists, 1965)

written by
Lou Reed/Terry Philips/Jerry Vance/Jimmie Sims

performed by The Hi-Lifes
==============================================


        You want my girl
        but I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        Fight for her love
        the love that I need
        Oh, I won't let her go

        You want her, man
        but I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        She won't get hurt
        hurt from the last
        The love I know you tell her

        If I'd know that you would treat her .....
        .... stand in your way
        But I know the kind of guy you are
        so ....... stay away, stay away

        I love that girl
        so I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        I won't let some fool
        fool with my girl
        Oh, you won't break her heart

        I love that girl so much
        so much that I won't let anyone make her cry
        I'm gonna fight
        I'm gonna fight
        I'm gonna fight

        Yeah, I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        yeah, I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        Yeah, I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        yeah, I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight
        Yeah, I'm gonna fight, yeah, I'm gonna fight



* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)



intro   {E}{A}{E}{A}

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (You want my girl ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}     (Fight for her love ...)
        {E}{E}           (- go)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (You want her, man ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}     (She won't get hurt ...)
        {E}{E}           (- tell her)

bridge  {A}{A}{A}{A}     (If I'd know that you would ...)
        {F#}{F#}{B}{B}   (But I know the kind of guy you are ...)
piano   {B}{B}{B}{B}     (- stay away)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (I love that girl ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}     (I won't let some fool ...)
        {E}{E}           (- heart)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (I love that girl so much  ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}     (I'm gonna fight, I'm gonna fight)
        {B}{B}           (I'm gonna fight, Yeah -)

coda    {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        ... fade out




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* capo on 1 fret (standard-tuning)

         (0) (1) (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) (7) (8)
              0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7
1e ... --||-f-|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...
2B ... --||-C-|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...
3G ... --||-G#|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...
4D ... --||-D#|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...
5A ... --||-A#|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...
6E ... --||-F-|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...



intro   {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{D}{G}{G}   (You want my girl ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Fight for her love ...)
        {D}{D}         (- go)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}   (You want her, man ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (She won't get hurt ...)
        {D}{D}         (- tell her)

bridge  {G}{G}{G}{G}   (If I'd know that you would ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (But I know the kind of guy you are ...)
piano   {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- stay away)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}   (I love that girl ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (I won't let some fool ...)
        {D}{D}         (- heart)

        {D}{D}{G}{G}   (I love that girl so much ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (I'm gonna fight, I'm gonna fight)
        {A}{A}         (I'm gonna fight, Yeah -)

coda    {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        ... fade out




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* without-capo (standard-tuning)



intro   {D#}{G#}{D#}{G#}

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}   (You want my girl ...)
        {A#}{A#}{A#}{A#}   (Fight for her love ...)
        {D#}{D#}           (- go)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}   (You want her, man ...)
        {A#}{A#}{A#}{A#}   (She won't get hurt ...)
        {D#}{D#}           (- tell her)

bridge  {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}   (If I'd know that you would ...)
        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}     (But I know the kind of guy you are ...)
piano   {A#}{A#}{A#}{A#}   (- stay away)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}   (I love that girl ...)
        {A#}{A#}{A#}{A#}   (I won't let some fool ...)
        {D#}{D#}           (- heart)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}   (I love that girl so much ...)
        {A#}{A#}{A#}{A#}   (I'm gonna fight, I'm gonna fight)
        {A#}{A#}           (I'm gonna fight, Yeah -)

coda    {D#}{G#}{D#}{G#}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {D#}{G#}{D#}{G#}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        {D#}{G#}{D#}{G#}   (- I'm gonna fight, yeah ...)
        ... fade out




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


"I'm Gonna Fight"

but i'm gonna fight
fight for her love
the love that i need

but i'm gonna fight

yeah! i'm gonna fight

<PRE>
============================================
"I'm Not"
============================================
album _I Spent A Week There The Other Night_
(Moe Tucker, 1991)

written by Moe Tucker

Lou Reed: lead guitar
============================================


        I'm not workin' hard
        I'm just foolin' around
        My feet's in the stars
        my head's on the ground

        I'm not doin' very much
        floppin' on the couch
        And I'm not gettin' anywhere
        layin' round the house

        Another day is runnin' by
        And I'm still sittin' here
        I used to have a decay
        Now it's just a ...

        I'm not thinkin' very fast
        starin' at the tube
        I don't think I'm gonna last
        if this is all I do

        I think I need a job
        stop, stop sleeping in my walk
        I know I need to get smart
        don't listen to their talk

        I think I'm slowly drainin'
        Like a bathtub with leak
        I don't know which way is up
        I just can't seem to think

        I'm not foolin' anyone
        maybe just myself
        'Cause I'm not having any fun
        sittin' on the shelf

        Another day is runnin' by
        And I'm still sittin' here
        I used to have a decay
        Now it's just a ...




intro   {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {D#}{F#}{C#}{D#}
        {D#}
        {D#}{F#}{C#}{D#}
        {D#}

        {D#}{F#}{C#}{D#}   (I'm not workin' hard ...)
        {D#}
        {D#}{F#}{C#}{D#}   (My feet's in the stars ...)
        {D#}

        {E}                (Now it's just a -)

        {D#}

        {D#}

        {D#}
        {D#}{F#}{C#}{D#}   (I know I need to get smart ...)
        {D#}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}       (Like a bathtub with leak)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}       ( don't know which way is up)
        {E}                (I just can't seem to -)

        {D#}

<PRE>
=============================================
"I'm Not A Young Man Anymore"
=============================================
album _Psychedelic Sounds From The Gymnasium_
(The Velvet Underground, 2008)

written by
John Davies Cale/Sterling Morrison/
Lou Reed/Maureen Ann Tucker

April 1967
The Gymnasium, NYC
=============================================


        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know that I can get me some more

        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know that I can get me some more

        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know I get me some more

        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know I get me some more

        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know I get me some more

        Hey, I'm not a young man anymore
        I've got five nickles in my pocket
        You know I get me some more

 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>I'm Not Gonna Waste My Tears</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
=================================================================
"I'm Not Gonna Waste My Tears"
=================================================================
album
_The Four Seasons - Johnny Rivers - Neil Sedaka - The J Brothers_
(Various Artists, 1964)

written by John Giuffre

performed by The J Brothers

Lou Reed: guitar (?)
=================================================================



        please post lyrics to
        wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp



intro   {G}{G}            (I'm -)

chorus  {C}{G}{D7}{G}     (- not gonna waste my tears, cryin' ...)
        {C}{G}{D7}{G}     (Not even ...)
        {G}               (I -)

        {G}{C}{D7}{G}     (- fell in love with pretty girl ...)
        {G}{C}{D7}{G}     (it looked like ...)

<HEAD>
<TITLE>I'm Not Too Sorry (Now That You're Gone)</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==========================================
"I'm Not Too Sorry (Now That You're Gone)"
(demo)
==========================================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale

early 1967
John Cale's Ludlow Street loft,
lower Manhattan, NYC
==========================================


        If you think that it's so good
        you know what you'll have to do
        You're walkin' down 5th Avenue
        you're seein' things that aren't true
        Without you come and wait me
        you're not a hesitating, here it comes

        I'm not too sorry
        now that you're gone
        I don't think I'll miss you
        I found a new one

        If you know that it's not right
        hey, I'll see you some other night
        But if you want it when you're gone
        you'll find yourself another one
        So now, okay
        worry, it's around, oh-oh

        I'm not too sorry
        that you're gone
        I don't think I'm sorry
        'cause I found a new one
        It wouldn't break my heart
        it wouldn't make it hard to go around



        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}       (If you think that it's so good ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}       (You're walkin' down 5th Avenue ...)

        {Bm}{E}{Bm}{E}       (Without you come and wait me ...)
        {F#}{F#}{F#}{F#}     (- comes)

        {F#}{F#}{E}{C#}      (I'm not too sorry ...)
        {F#}{F#}{E}{C#}      (I don't think I'll miss you ...)

guitar  {F#}{F#}{F#}{F#}

        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}       (If you know that it's not right ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}       (But if you want it when you're ...)

        {Bm}{E}{Bm}{E}       (So now, okay, worry, it's around ...)
guitar  {F#}{F#}{F#}{F#}
        {F#}{F#}

        {F#}{F#}{E}{C#}      (I'm not too sorry that you're gone)
        {F#}{F#}{E}{C#}      (I don't think I'm sorry ...)

        {Bm}{E}{Bm}{E}       (It wouldn't break my heart ...)
guitar  {F#}{F#}{F#}{F#}     (- around)
        {F#}{F#}{F#}{F#...

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
==============================
"I'm Set Free"
==============================
album _The Velvet Underground_
(The Velvet Underground, 1969)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        I've been set free and I've been bound
        To the memories of yesterday's clowns
        I've been set free and I've been bound
        and now

        I'm set free
        I'm set free
        I'm set free to find a new illusion

        I've been blinded but now I can see
        What in the world has happened to me
        The prince of stories who walks right by me
        and now

        I'm set free
        I'm set free
        I'm set free to find a new illusion

        I've been set free and I've been bound
        Let me tell you people what I've found
        I saw my head laughing, rolling on the ground
        and now

        I'm set free
        I'm set free
        I'm set free to find a new illusion



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (I've been set free and I've been ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (To the memories of yesterday's ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (I've been set free and I've been ...)

chorus  {D}{G}{D}{G}       (I'm set free, I'm set free)
        {D}{G}{Em}{A}      (I'm set free to find a new illusion)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (I've been blinded but now ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (What in the world has happened ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}      (The prince of stories who walks ...)

chorus  {D}{G}{D}{G}       (I'm set free, I'm set free)
        {D}{G}{Em}{A}      (I'm set free to find a new illusion)
        {A}

guitar  {D}{C/G}{F#m}{G}
        {D}{C/G}{F#m}{G}
        {D}{G}{D}{G}
        {D}{G}{Em}{G}

        {D}{G}{Em}{A}      (I'm set free to find a new illusion)
        {A}{D...

        I'm set free, oh

        I'm set free

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>I'm So Free</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"I'm So Free"
===================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Yes, I am mother nature's son
        and I'm the only one
        I do what I want and I want what I see
        huh, could only happen to me

        I'm so free
        I'm so free

        Oh please, Saint Germaine
        I have come this way
        Do you remember the shape I was in
        I had horns and fins

        I'm so free
        I'm so free

        Do you remember the silver walks
        you used to shiver and I used to talk
        Then we went down to Times Square
        and ever since I've been hangin' round there

        I'm so free
        I'm so free

        Yes, I am mother nature's son
        and I'm the only one
        I do what I want and I want what I see
        could only happen to me

        I'm so free
        I'm so free

        Oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        Oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        early in the morning, I'm so free
        Late in the evening, I'm so free
        yeah-yeah-yeah, I'm so free
        When I feel good, I'm so free
        when it's in the morning, I'm so free
        When it's in the evening, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        feel so good now, I'm so free
        Oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        yeah-yeah-yeah, I'm so free
        Oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        feel so good now, I'm so free
        Feel little nice, I'm so free
        feel little down now, I'm so free
        You're so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        ....



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {A}{G}{D}{D}
        {A}{G}{D}{D}

        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (Yes, I am mother nature's son ...)
        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (I do what I want and I want what ...)

chorus  {A}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)
        {C}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)

guitar  {A}{G}{D}{D}         * see tab below
        {A}{G}{D}{D}

        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (Oh please, Saint Germaine ...)
        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (Do you remember the shape I was ...)

chorus  {A}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)
        {C}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)

        {D}{D}{G}{G/D}       (Do you remember the silver walks ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{G/D}       (Then we went down to Times Square ...)

chorus  {A}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)
        {C}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)

        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (Yes, I am mother nature's son ...)
        {D}{A/G}{C/G}{G/D}   (I do what I want and I want what ...)

chorus  {A}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free)
        {C}{G}{D}{D}         (I'm so free, Oh-oh-)

coda    {G}{D}{G}{D}         (- oh, I'm so free, oh-oh-oh ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}         (- oh, I'm so free, early in ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}         (- evening , I'm so free, yeah ...)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}         (- good, I'm so free, when it's ...)
        ... repeat and fade out




* guitar: (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)
note: played by 2 guitars, Mick Ronson played using wah-pedal

      {A}                          {G}
*1d ----------------------------------------------------------
*2A --15b17-17--r15..--14h15p14v---13b15----r13v--12h13p12v---
*3F ----------------------------------------------------------
*4C -(12b14-14---12..--11h12p11v---10b12-12--10..--9h10p-9v)--
*5G ----------------------------------------------------------
*6D ----------------------------------------------------------

  {D}                     {D}
-----------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------
--12b14v---12b14v------------------------------------
--(7v-------7v)--------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------

 {A}                          {G}
--------------------------------------------------------
--12b13-13-r12..--10h12p10v---10b12-12-r10..--8h10p8v---
--------------------------------------------------------
-(-9b10-10---9..---7h-9p-7v----7b-9--9---7..--5h-7p5v)--
--------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------

  {D}                     {D}
-----------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------
--12b14v---12b14v------------------------------------
--(7v-------7v)--------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {G}{F}{C}{C}
        {G}{F}{C}{C}

        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (Yes, I am mother nature's son ...)
        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (I do what I want and I want what ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{C}{C}          (I'm so free)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}         (I'm so free)

guitar  {G}{F}{C}{C}
        {G}{F}{C}{C}

        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (Oh please, Saint Germaine ...)
        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (Do you remember the shape I was ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{C}{C}          (I'm so free)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}         (I'm so free)


        {C}{C}{F}{F/C}        (Do you remember the silver walks ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{F/C}        (Then we went down to Times ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{C}{C}          (I'm so free)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}         (I'm so free)

        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (Yes, I am mother nature's son ...)
        {C}{G/F}{A#/F}{F/C}   (I do what I want and I want what ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{C}{C}          (I'm so free)
        {A#}{F}{C}{C}         (I'm so free, Oh-oh-)

coda    {F}{C}{F}{C}          (- oh, I'm so free, oh-oh-oh ...)
        {F}{C}{F}{C}          (- oh, I'm so free, early in ...)
        {F}{C}{F}{C}          (-evening , I'm so free, yeah ...)
        {F}{C}{F}{C}          (- good, I'm so free, when it's ...)
        ... repeat and fade out







==========================================
"I'm So Free"
==========================================
album _American Poet_
(Lou Reed, 2001)

Dec 26, 1972
Ultrasonic Recording Studio, Hempstead, NY
==========================================


        Yes, I am mother nature's son
        and I'm the only one
        I do what I want and I want what I see
        could only happen to me

        I'm so free
        don't you know now baby
        I'm so free
        alright now

        (scat)

        Oh please, Saint Germaine
        I have come this way
        Now do you remember the shape I was in
        I had horns and fins

        I'm so free
        don't you know now baby
        I'm so free

        Oh please, silver walks
        we used to shiver and we used to talk
        Then we went down to Times Square
        and ever since I've been hangin' round there

        I'm so free
        don't you know now baby
        I'm so free

        Yes, I am mother nature's son
        and I'm the only one
        I do what I want and I want what I see
        could only happen to me

        I'm so free
        don't you know now baby
        I'm so free

        Oh-oh-oh, I'm so free
        oh, early in the morning, I'm so free
        Early in the evening, I'm so free
        ............., I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        feel so good, I'm so free
        Hey now baby, I'm so free
        early in the morning, I'm so free
        Get it in the evening baby, I'm so free
        get it in the evening baby, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        I'm so free, I'm so free
        alright now



* chords: same as _Transformer_ version without ending
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)



coda    ....
        {G}{D}{G}{D}
        {G}{D}{G}{D}
        {G}{D}{G}{D}
        {G}{D}{G}{D}

ending  {A}{G}{D}{D}
        {C}{G}{D}{D/D7...

<PRE>
==============================
"I'm Sticking With You"
==============================
album _VU_
(The Velvet Underground, 1985)

written by Lou Reed

May 13, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
==============================


        I'm sticking with you
        'cause I'm made out of glue
        Anything that you might do
        I'm gonna do, too

        You held up a stagecoach in the rain
        and I'm doing the same
        Saw you hanging from a tree
        and I made believe it was me

        I'm sticking with you
        'cause I'm made out of glue
        Anything that you might do
        I'm gonna do, too

        Moon people going to the stratosphere
        soldiers fighting with the Cong
        But with you by my side I can do anything
        when we swing, we hang past right and wrong

        I'll do anything for you
        anything you'd want me to
        I'll do anything for you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G}       (I'm sticking with you ...)
        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G}       (Anything that you might do ...)

        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G}       (- held up a stagecoach in ...)
        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G}       (Saw you hanging from a tree ...)

        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G}       (I'm sticking with you ...)
        {G/D}{G}{C/D}{G/F#..   (Anything that you might do ...)

bridge  {Bm}{F#}{Bm}{F#}       (Moon people going to the ...)
        {D}{A..{C#}{F#..       (- you by my side I can do ...)
                               (I'll do any-)
coda    {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (-thing for you, anything you'd ...)
        {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (-thing for you, oh wow, I'm ...)
        {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {B}{E/F#}{B}{E/F#}     (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        ... fade out




* guitar on coda (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

     {B}                {E              / F#}
*1d ------7--------11----------12---------14----------
*2A --------------------------------------------------
*3F --6/8-----8/11-------11/13------13/15-------------   ...
*4C --------------------------------------------------
*5G --------------------------------------------------
*6D --------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics



---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords and tabs for standard-tuning



        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F}      (I'm sticking with you ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F}      (Anything that you might do ...)

        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F}      (- held up a stagecoach in ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F}      (Saw you hanging from a tree ...)

        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F}      (I'm sticking with you ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#/C}{F/E..   (Anything that you might do ...)

bridge  {Am}{E}{Am}{E}         (Moon people going to the ...)
        {C}{G..{B}{E..         (- you by my side I can do ...)
                               (I'll do any-)
coda    {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (-thing for you, anything you'd ...)
        {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (-thing for you, oh wow, I'm ...)
        {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        {A}{D/E}{A}{D/E}       (- you, oh wow, I'm sticking ...)
        ... fade out




* guitar on coda (standard-tuning)

     {A}                {D             / E}
 1e ------5-------9-----------10---------12----------
 2B -------------------------------------------------
 3G --4/6-----6/9--------9/11------11/13-------------   ...
 4D -------------------------------------------------
 5A -------------------------------------------------
 6E -------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

untitled CDEP
(The Velvet Underground, 1990)

box set _What Goes On_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Oct 19, 1969
End of Cole Ave., Dallas, Texas

        'cause I'm made out of glue
        Anything that you might do
        I'm gonna do, too

        You held up a stagecoach in the rain
        and I'm doing the same (the same)
        Saw you hanging from a tree (from a tree)
        and I made believe it was me

        'cause I'm made out of glue
        Anything that you might do
        I'm gonna do, too

        soldiers fighting with the Cong
        But with me by your side I can do anything
        when we swing, we hang past right and wrong

        anything that you'd want me to
        I'll do anything for you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you, oh wow
        I'm sticking with you

The Family Dog, San Francisco, California

        and I'm doing the same (the same)

        and I made believe it was me (was me)

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


I hope I can help improve the little details that can be improved;
I've found an error in the lyrics for "I'm sticking with you"...
Im pretty certain that the words are:


"There're people going into the stratosphere
Soldiers fighting with the Cong"


"The Cong" being slang for the Vietnamese army in the Vietnam war.
Hope this helped!

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<TITLE>I'm Waiting For The Man</TITLE>

<PRE>
=======================================
"I'm Waiting For The Man"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

written by Lou Reed
=======================================


        I'm waiting for my man
        26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown
        Hey white boy, you chasin' our women around
        Oh pardon me sir, it's furthest from my mind
        I'm just lookin' for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man

        Here he comes, he's all dressed in black
        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait
        I'm waiting for my man, ah, work it now

        Up to a brownstone, up three flights of stairs
        Everybody-body's pinned you, but nobody cares
        He's got the works, gives you sweet taste
        ah, then you gotta split because you got no time to waste
        I'm waiting for my man

        Baby don't you holler, darling don't you ball and shout
        I'm feeling good, you know I'm gonna work it on out
        I'm feeling good, I'm feelin' oh so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just some other time
        I'm waiting for my man, walk it home



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E}{A}{E}{A}
        {E}{A}{E}{A}

        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (I'm waiting for my man)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (26 dollars in my hand)

        {E}{G#}{A}{F#}   (Up to Lexington 125 ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (I'm waiting for my man)

        {E}{A}

        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (Hey white boy, you chasin' our women ...)

        {E}{G#}{A}{F#}   (Oh pardon me sir ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (I'm waiting for my man)

        {E}{A}

        ....




* riff (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

     {E}                    {A}
*1d ----9-----------0----------0-----------0------
*2A ----------------0--------2---2--3-------------
*3F --9---9--7----------------------4----------4--
*4C ----------------------------------------------
*5G ----------------------------------------------
*6D ----------------------------------------------

-----9--------7----------0-----------------
-----------------------2---2--3------3-----

p - pull off
b - bend string up

        {D}{G}{D}{G}    (26 dollars in my hand)

        {D}{F#}{G}{E}   (Up to Lexington 125 ...)
        {D}{G}{D}{G}    (I'm waiting for my man)

        {D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}    (Hey white boy, you chasin' our women ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}    (I'm waiting for my man)

=================================
"I'm Waiting For The Man"
=================================
album _Live At Max's Kansas City_
(The Velvet Underground, 1972)

Jul 26, 1970
Max's Kansas City, NYC
=================================


        I'm waiting for my man
        Yeah, got 26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey boy, what you doin' uptown
        Hey now boy, you chasin' our women around
        Oh pardon me sir, it's furthest from my mind
        I'm just waitin' for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man

        Here he comes, he's all dressed in black
        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait, oh
        I'm waiting for my man, alright, Sterl

        Ah, up to a brownstone, up three flights of stairs

        I'm waiting for my man, alright

==================================================
"Waiting For My Man"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Oct 19, 1969
End of Cole Ave., Dallas, Texas
==================================================


        I'm waiting for my man
        Got 26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey white boy, what you doing uptown
        Hey white boy, you chasing our women around
        Oh pardon me sir, it's furthest from my mind
        I'm just waitin' for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man

        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait
        I'm waiting for my man

        Goin' up to a brownstone, up three flights of stairs
        Now everybody's pinned you, baby, but nobody cares
        He's got good works, gives you sweet taste
        then you gotta split because you got no time to waste
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey baby don't you holler, darling don't you ball and shout
        I'm feeling good, you know know I'm gonna work it on out
        I'm feeling good, feeling so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just some other time
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man, oh man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man

 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait

        Everybody's pinned you and nobody cares
        He's got the works, gives you sweet taste
        then you gotta split because you got no time to waste

        I'm feeling good, I'm gonna work it on out
        I'm feeling good, feeling so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just some other time

        I'm waiting for my man

"I'm Waiting For The Man"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        I'm waiting for my man
        26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        Waiting for a man

        Here he come, white boy, what you doing uptown
        Hey white boy, chasin' our women around
        Pardon me sir, nothing's furthest from my mind
        I'm just waiting for a dear dear friend of mine
        Waiting for a man

        Here he come, all dressed in black
        PR shoes and this big straw hat
        He never early, he always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait
        Waiting, waiting for a man

        Up to a brownstone, three flights of stairs
        Everybody's pinned you, but nobody cares
        He got the works, he gives you sweet taste
        then he's gotta split 'cause he's got no time to waste
        Waiting, waiting for the man
        Waiting, waiting for the man

        Baby don't you holler, darling please don't ball or shout
        Feeling good, gonna work on out
        Feeling good, feeling so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just another time
        Waiting, waiting for the man
        Waiting, waiting for the man

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        until tomorrow but that's just some other time
        I'm waiting for the man

==================================================
"I'm Waiting For The Man"
(The Matrix, San Francisco, 11-27-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001) disc 3

Nov 27, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        I'm waiting for my man
        Got 26 dollars in my hand
        Go up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown
        Hey white boy, you chasin' our women around, ooohhh
        Oh pardon me sir, it's furthest from my mind
        I'm just waitin' for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man, ooohhh

        Ooohhh, ooohhh

        Oh, here he comes, he's all dressed in black, oh-wow
        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's never (always) late, oh
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait
        I'm waiting for my man, oh-wow

        [whistle]

        Times are gettin' heavy, I'm so sad
        Everyone it was good, you know they all turned out bad
        It's not a mystery, no mistake
        all I'm gonna have to do is wait
        Oh, I'm waiting for my man

        Standin' on the corner, waitin' for the sun to rise, oh-wow
        Miss Jean and Miss Ann said that they had a surprise
        Well it's no mystery, no mistake
        I guess I just have to wait
        I'm waiting for my man

        Ever since I was a little boy, had a stranger's dream
        Everything that I saw, didn't seem to be what it seem
        I'm no whizzer, take my scream
        always you know I've got to wait
        I'm waiting for my man

        Go up to a brownstone, up three flights of stairs
        Everybody's pinned you, but nobody cares, oh no
        He's got the works, gives you sweet taste
        then you gotta split because you got no time to waste
        I'm waiting for my man

        Hey baby don't you holler, darling don't you ball and shout
        You know that I'm feeling good, gonna work it on out
        I'm feeling good, feelin' so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just some other time
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man



* chords:
same as _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)








===============================
"Waiting For The Man"
===============================
album _Le Bataclan '72_
(Lou Reed/John Cale/Nico, 2003)

Jan 29, 1972
Le Bataclan, Paris, France
===============================


        I'm waiting for my man
        Got 26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        Ooohhh sweet mama, I'm waiting for my man

        Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown
        Hey white boy, you chasin' our women around
        Oh pardon me sir, it's furthest from my mind
        I'm just waiting for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man

        Here he comes, he's all dressed in black
        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait
        Ooohhh baby, I'm waiting for my man

        Here he comes, he's all dressed in black
        PR shoes and a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is that you always gotta wait, ah
        Ooohhh mama, I'm waiting for my man

        Hey baby don't you holler, darling don't you ball and shout
        I'm feeling good and you know I'm gonna work it on out
        I'm feeling good, feeling so fine
        until tomorrow but that's just some other time
        Ooohhh babe, I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my main man
        One tell you Jim, I'm waiting for my man
        I'm waiting for my man



* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        Olivier Landemaine's The VU Web Page says:<em>
        there is no speed correction
        and the whole recording is too slow (6%)
        as compared with the French TV broadcast.</em>




intro   {E}{A}{E}{A}
        {E}{A}{E}{A}

        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (I'm waiting for my man)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (Got 26 dollars in my hand)

        {E}{G#}{A}{A#}   (Up to Lexington 125 ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- sweet mama, I'm waiting for my man)

        {E}{A}

        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown)

=============================================
"I'm Waiting For The Man"
=============================================
album _Psychedelic Sounds From The Gymnasium_
(The Velvet Underground, 2008)

April 1967
The Gymnasium, NYC
=============================================


        I'm waiting for my man
        Hey, 26 dollars in my hand
        Up to Lexington 125
        feelin' sick and dirty more dead than alive
        Waiting for my man

        Hey white boy, what you doin' uptown
        Hey white boy, you chasin' our women around
        Oh pardon me sir, furthest from my mind
        I'm just waiting for a dear dear friend of mine
        I'm waiting for my man

        Here he comes, he's all dressed in black
        PR shoes, a big straw hat
        He's never early, he's always late
        first thing you learn is always gotta wait
        I'm waiting for my man, walk it home

        Up to a brownstone, up three flights of stairs
        Everybody's pinned you, but nobody cares
        He's got the works, gives you sweet taste
        then you gotta split, got no time to waste
        I'm waiting for my man

        Baby don't you holler, darling don't you ball and shout
        I'm feeling good, you know I work it on out
        I'm feeling good, oh so fine
        until tomorrow, just some other time
        I'm waiting for my man

same as _The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

thanks: Aaron Walton (walto010@mc.duke.edu)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

The B chord in "I'm Wating for the Man" should be  F#.
(album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version)


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Mat Thomas (mathomas@lycos.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

It would seem that, semantically speaking,
the word "ball" in the lyric
"Baby don't you holler, baby don't you ball and shout"
should actually be "bawl,"

as in:
"Baby don't you holler, baby don't you bawl and shout."


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Lyndon Cox (landoh@hotmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

It's not a mystery, no .....
"mistake" i believe

<PRE>
=============================
"I Believe"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        Valerie Solanis took the elevator
        got off at the 4th floor
        Valerie Solanis took the elevator
        got off at the 4th floor
        She pointed the gun at Andy
        saying you cannot control me anymore

        I believe
        there's got to be some retribution
        I believe
        an eye for an eye is elemental
        I believe
        there's something wrong if she's alive right now

        Valerie Solanis took three steps
        pointing at the floor
        Valerie Solanis waved her gun
        pointing at the floor
        From inside her idiot madness spoke and bang
        Andy fell onto the floor

        I believe
        life's serious enough for retribution
        I believe
        being sick is no excuse and
        I believe
        I would've pulled the switch on her myself

        When they got him to the hospital his pulse was gone
        they thought that he was dead
        His guts were pouring from his wounds onto the floor
        they thought that he was dead
        Not until years later would the hospital do to him
        what she could not, what she could not

        "Where were you
        you didn't come to see me"
        Andy said
        "I think I died, why didn't you come to see me"
        Andy said
        "It hurt so much, they took blood from my hand"

        I believe
        there's got to be some retribution
        I believe
        there's got to be some restitution
        I believe
        we are all the poorer for it now

        Visit me, visit me
        Visit me, visit me
        Visit me, why didn't you visit me
        visit me, why didn't you visit me
        Visit me, visit me
        visit me, why didn't you visit me

        {D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}   (Valerie Solanis took ...)

        {D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}   (- pointed the gun at ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{E}{E}               (I believe there's ...)

        {D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}

        {D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}{D.A/G}   (- inside her idiot ...)
