<HEAD>
<TITLE>My Old Man</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================================
"My Old Man"
===================================
album _Growing Up In Public_
(Lou Reed, 1980)

written by Lou Reed/Michael Fonfara
===================================


        When I was a young boy in Brooklyn
        going to public school
        During recess in the concrete playground
        they lined us up by twos
        In alphabetical order, Reagan, Reed and Russo
        I still remember the names
        And stickball and stoopball were the only games
        that we played

        And I wanted to be like my old man
        I, I wanted to grow up just like my old man
        I wanted to be like my old man

        I wanted to dress like, I wanted to be just like
        I wanted to act like my old man
        I wanted to be like, I wanted to act like
        I wanted to be just like my old man

        And then like everyone else I started to grow
        And I didn't want to be like my father anymore
        I was sick of his bullying
        and having to hide under a desk on the floor
        And when he beat my mother
        it made me so mad I could choke

        And I didn't want to be like my old man
        I, I didn't even want to look like my old man
        I didn't even want to seem like my old man

        A son watches his father, being cruel to his mother
        and makes a vow to return only when
        He is so much richer, in every way so much bigger that -
        - the old man will never hit anyone again

        Like my old man (just like my old man)
        like my old man
        Like my old man (just like my old man)
        like my old man
        and can you believe what he said to me
        he said, "Lou, act like a man" (walk like a man)
        Why don't you act just like a man
        act like your daddy, act like a man (just like my old man)
        Oh, why don't you act just like a man
        like your old man (walk like a man)
        (Just like my old man)
        (Just like my old man)


         /x.E}
        {E/B}{A/A.C#m}{B}{B}                    (When I was a young ...)
        {E/B}{A/A.C#m}{B}{B}                    (During recess in the ...)
        {E/B}{A/A.C#m}{B}{B}                    (In alphabetical order ...)
        {E/B}{A/A.C#m}{B}{B}                    (And stickball and ...)

        {F#}{B}{E}{E}                           (And I wanted to be ...)
        {F#}{B}{E}{E}                           (I, I wanted to grow up ...)
        {F#}{B}{E}{E}                           (I wanted to be like ...)

        {F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{E} (I wanted to dress like...)
        {F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}    (I wanted to be like ...)
        {E}{E}                                  (- old man)

        ...

        {F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{E} (A son watches his ...)
        {F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}{F#.G#m/A.B}    (He is so much richer ...)

guitar  {E}{E}{A}{F#m}
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (Like my old -)

        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (- man, like my old man ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (- man, like my old man ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (Why don't you act just ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (- man, Oh, why don't ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (walk like a man ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (Just like my old man)
        {E}{E}{A}{F#m}                          (Just like my old man)
        ... fade out




* riff

When I was a young boy in Brooklyn going to public school
    {E / B   }{A   /A.C#m}{B}        {B}
1e ---------------------------------------------------
2B --5---4-4---2-2-----5---4--------------------------
3G --4---4-4---2-2-----6---4----------4---------------
4D --6---4-4---2-2-----6---4----------4-6p4-----------
5A ---------------------------------6-------6p4\2-----
6E -----------------------------------------------4---

During recess in the concrete playground they ...
 {E / B   }{A   /A.C#m}{B}        {B}
-------------------------------------------------
--5---4-4---2-2-----5---4------------------------
--4---4-4---2-2-----6---4--------x-6b7r6-4-4v----
--6---4-4---2-2-----6---4------------------------
-------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------

In alphabetical order, Reagan, Reed and Russo ...
 {E / B   }{A   /A.C#m}{B}        {B}
-----------------------------------7---9-11--\---
--5---4-4---2-2-----5---4------------------------
--4---4-4---2-2-----6---4-------/8-----9-11--\---
--6---4-4---2-2-----6---4------------------------
-------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------

And stickball and stoopball were the only games ...
 {E / B   }{A   /A.C#m}{B}        {B}
-------------------------------------------------
--5---4-4---2-2-----5---4------------------------
--4---4-4---2-2-----6---4---------6\4--3/4--\3---
--6---4-4---2-2-----6---4------------------------
----------------------------------4\2--1/2--\1---
-------------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




*****************************************************************************
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Detlef Juergens (detlef.juergens@nwn.de)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------


Maybe it helps.


My Old Man
 
When I was a young boy in Brooklyn
Going to public school
During recess in the concrete playground
They lined us up by twos
In alphabetical order, Reagan, Reed and Russo
I still remember the names
And stickball and stoopball
Were the only games that we played
And I wanted to be like my old man
I wanted to grow up just like my old man
I wanted to be like my old man
I wanted to dress like
I wanted to be just like
I wanted to act like my old man
I wanted to be like
I wanted to act like
I wanted to be just like my old man

And then like everyone else I started to grow
And I didn't want to be like my father anymore
I was sick if his bullying
And having to hide under a desk on the floor
And when he beat my mother
It made me so mad I could choke
And I didn't want to be like my old man
I didn't even want to look like my old man
I didn't even want to seem like my old man

A son watches his father
Being cruel to his mother
And makes a vow to return only when
He is so much richer
In every way so much bigger
That the old man will never hit anyone again

Like my old man
Like my old man
Like my old man
Like my old man

And can you believe what he said to me
He said, "Lou, act like a man"
Why don't you act just like a man
Act like your daddy
Act like a man
Why don't you act like a man
Like your old man

Like my old man

thanks: Kirill Rodionov (thaumaturge@chat.ru)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

"My Old Man"

I was sick of his bullying...

<TITLE>My Red Joystick</TITLE>

<PRE>
======================
"My Red Joystick"
======================
album _New Sensations_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        The first bite of the apple made Eve smart
        the second bite taught her how to break men's hearts
        The third bite taught her how to strut her stuff
        but she never got to the fourth bite that says
        enough is enough

        Enough is enough, baby, I've had enough of you
        you can keep your dresses, you can keep your jewels
        You can keep the color TV, those soaps just make me sick
        all I'm asking you to leave me is my red joystick

        My red joystick, my red joystick
        all I'm asking you to leave me is my red joystick
        My red joystick, my red joystick
        all I'm asking you to leave me is my red joystick

        Eve kissed Able, that's how he got murdered by Cain
        Abraham gave up his son to keep his wife away
        And even the Lord almighty
        speaking from the trenches to the pits
        spoke for all mankind when he said

        Take the Porsche, take the kids
        take the stocks, baby take the rugs
        Take those roses from my poor heart wilting
        but please, please, please leave me my red joystick

        Leave me my red joystick
        leave me my red joystick
        Leave me my red joystick

        Eve drank apple cider, Eve brewed good apple wine
        Eve cooked up stewed apples, knew how to have a good time
        She came into the bedroom, raised her skirts up high
        she said, "If a little knowledge is a dangerous thing, baby
        give me a piece before I die"

        Hey, Eve take a bite of my apple
        I know you think you're pretty slick
        the one thing I ask you to leave me is my red joystick

        My red joystick, ooohhh, my red joystick
        all I'm asking you to leave me is my red joystick
        My red joystick, baby, my red joystick
        all I'm asking you to leave me is my red joystick

        My red joystick
        leave me my red joystick
        Ooohhh, my red joystick
        please leave me my red joystick
        Oh, my red joystick
        please leave me my red joystick
        My red joystick
        leave me my red joystick
        (My red joystick, my red joystick)
        (my red joystick, my red joystick)




intro   .x}                drums
        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}
        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}

        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (The first bite of the apple made ...)

        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (Enough is enough, baby, I've had ...)
        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (You can keep the color TV, those ...)

        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (- red joystick, my red joystick ...)
        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (- red joystick, my red joystick ...)

guitar  {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   * tab 2
        {E9}{E9/

        ....

        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   (Eve drank apple cider, Eve brewed ...)

        {E9}{E9}{E9}{E9}   background vocals
        ... fade out

        please leave me my red joystick

        leave me my red joystick

==================================
"My Red Joystick"
(instrumental version)
==================================

(Lou Reed, 1984)

        take the stocks, baby take the rugs

        but please, please, please leave me my red joystick

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Mystic Child</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Mystic Child"
===================
album _Ecstasy_
(Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        It was only the time of the newly born dead
        with wispy cobwebs in your head
        the polar moon looked out instead
        goin' wild

        Liquor shifting through the brain
        the manic depressive goes insane
        goin' wild
        goin' wild

        Desperate anger hits the streets
        by the foul smelling river by the meat market
        goin' wild
        mystic child

        Goin' wild
        mystic child

        In the winter with frozen toes
        looking out the big windows
        to fly
        goin' wild

        Situation X out of control
        my eyes half opened like a mole
        who smiles
        goin' wild

        Who smiles
        goin' wild

        In the mystic morning where the river meets
        the hurdy-gurdy of the hip-hop beat
        5 a.m. the viscous street

        Oh, wild
        goin' wild

        Out the window like a flash
        fallin' through a rooftop crash
        blind
        goin' wild

        Sick and misty like a pup by the curb
        he's throwin' up
        wild
        like a child

        Goin' wild
        like a child

        If he can't have all that relates
        to testify that he is great
        he'll cut someone with a broken plate
        stand upon the subway grate

        And smile
        goin' wild
        goin' wild

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Taco Veenstra (taco@tppveenstra.myweb.nl)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

They are the exact words he sings,
not just lyrics I copied from the booklet.



Mystic Child
-------------

It was only the time of the newly born dead
with wispy cobwebs in your head
The polar moon looked out instead
going wild

Liquor shifting through the brain
The manic-depressive goes insane
going wild, going wild

Desperate anger hits the streets
by the foul smelling river by the meat market
going wild
mystic child
going wild
mystic child

In the winter with frozen toes
Looking out the big windows
you fly
going wild

Situation x out of control
My eyes half opened like a mole
who smiles
going wild
who smiles
going wild

In the mystic morning where the river meets
the hurdy-gurdy of the hip hop beat
5 a.m. the viscous street
Oh wild
going wild

Out the window like a flash
Falling through the rooftop crash
blind
going wild

Sick and misty like a pup by the curb he's
throwin' up
wild
like a child
going wild
like a child

He can't have all that relates
to testify that he is great
He'll cut someone with a broken plate
and stand upon the subway grate
and smile
going wild
going wild
with a smile

Holy morning
sun is up and someone
here has lost his cups
The dawn is tattered all cut up
going wild
like a mystic child
like a mystic child

Sunday morning looking down from the rooftop
goin wild
with a smile
mystic child

Top of the world he's got it made
His rings are gold his braids are jade
He jumped to the street
He's got it made
Goodbye child
goodbye child
mystic child
going wild

Like a mystic child
Goodbye
Goodbye
Going wild
Going wild
like a mystic child
Early morning, the sun is gone
Going wild
like a mystic, like a mystic, like a mystic child
Going, going, going, going, going
like a mystic child

ooooooohhhh, ooooooohhh
don't you see

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

==============================
"New Age"
==============================
album _Loaded_
(The Velvet Underground, 1970)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Can I have your autograph
        he said to the fat blonde actress
        You know I've seen every movie you've been in
        from "Paths of Pain" to "Jewels of Glory"

        And when you kissed Robert Mitchum
        gee, but I thought you'd never catch him

        Over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me
        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me

        Can I have your autograph
        he said to the fat blonde actress
        You know I know everything you've done
        anyway I hate divorces

        To the left is a marble shower
        it was fun even for an hour, but

        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me
        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me

        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what
        Oh, something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        it's a new age

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

(The Velvet Underground, 1972)

Max's Kansas City, NYC

"New Age"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Nov 1969
San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Waiting for the phone to ring
        diamond necklace on my shoulder

        lipstick on my neck and shoulder

        to make it with Frank and Nancy when

        hey, hey, oh
        It's the beginning of a new age



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC

        he said to the fat blonde actress

        from "Paths of Pain" to "Jewels of Glory"

        gee, but I thought you'd never catch him

        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        honey, when you want me
        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me

        he said to the fat blonde actress
        You know I know everything you've done
        anyway I hate divorces

        To the left is a marble shower
        it was fun even for an hour, but

        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        honey, when you want me
        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me

        and I don't know what
        Oh, something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        it's a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        oh-oh, oh-oh

        {G}{D}{A}{A}      (It's the beginning of a new age)
        {G}{D}{A}{A}      (It's the beginning of a new age ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}      (It's the beginning of a new age ...)

"New Age"
(full-length version)

(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

        Can I have your autograph
        he said to the fat blonde actress

        You're over the hill right now

        anyway I hate divorces

        To the left is a marble shower
        it was fun even for an hour, but

        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me
        I'll come running to you
        honey, when you want me

        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what
        Oh, something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        it's a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        oh-oh, oh-oh
        It's the beginning of a new age



* chords: same as long version without coda part



coda    {D}{G}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age)
        {G}{D}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age)
        {G}{D}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age ...)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age ...)
        {G}{D}{A}{A}   (It's the beginning of a new age)
        {D}{G}{A}{A}
        {G}{D}{A}{A}
        {D}{G}{A}{A}
        {G}{D}{A}{A}
        ... fade out








==================================================
"New Age"
(The Matrix, San Francisco, 11-24-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 24, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Waiting for the phone to ring
        diamond necklace on my shoulder
        Putting all the things away
        lipstick on my neck and shoulder

        It was just my fancy
        to go make it with Frank and Nancy when

        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love
        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        baby, if you want me

        Calculating all the odds
        took the gun from off his shoulder
        Waiting for the bell to ring
        hands of ivory on my shoulder

        It seems to be my fancy
        to go make it with Frank and Nancy when

        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love
        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        baby, if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        baby, if you want me

        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what
        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age
        It's the beginning of a new age

same as _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone).

"New Age"

album _American Poet Box: American Poet Special Edition_

Jul 15, 1972
Scala Cinema, Kings Cross, London

        Now can I have your autograph
        he said to the fat blonde actress
        You know I've seen everything you've done
        from "Paths of Pain" to "Jewels of Glory"

        And when you kissed Robert Mitchum
        gee, but I thought you'd never catch him

        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        baby, if you want me

        Can I have your autograph
        he said to the fat blonde actress
        You know I know all the things that you've done
        but anyway I hate divorces

        To the left is a marble shower
        it was fun even for an, for an hour

        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love
        You're over the hill right now
        and you're looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me

        and I don't know what
        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age

        It's the beginning of a new age

        looking for love

        hey baby, if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me

        Hey, can I have your autograph
        he says to the blonde actress
        You know I love everything you've done
        I don't mind but hate divorces

        oh, how I love the way you kiss me

        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love
        Over the bridge we go
        looking for love

        I'll come running to you
        hey baby if you want me, hey baby if you want me
        I'll come running to you
        hey baby, if you want me

        and I don't know what, oh-oh
        Something's got a hold on me
        and I don't know what

        It's the beginning of a new age

        It's the beginning of a new age

        It's the beginning of a new age

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Aaron (pulpalittlesoul@yahoo.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

i just thought id mention a slight error
in your transcription of 'new age',
the original 'loaded' version.
in the bridge you have the chords listed as all E's,
but in fact it should read like so:

{E/A(onE)}{D(onE)/E}
{E/A(onE)}{D(onE)/E}

inasmuch as the chords read:

A/E   - 077600
D/E   - 00777X

i am fairly confident that this is indeed what
lou/sterling plays on loaded.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<PRE>
======================
"New Sensations"
======================
album _New Sensations_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        I don't like guilt be it stoned or stupid
        drunk and disorderly I ain't no cupid
        Two years ago today I was arrested on Christmas Eve

        I don't want pain, I want to walk not be carried
        I don't want to give it up, I want to stay married
        I ain't no dog tied to a parked car

        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, new sensations

        Talkin' 'bout some new sensations
        Talkin' 'bout some new sensations

        I want the principles of a timeless muse
        I want to eradicate my negative views
        And get rid of those people who are always on a down

        It's easy enough to tell what is wrong
        but that's not what I want to hear all night long
        Some people are like human Tuinals

        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, ooohhh, new sensations

        Talkin' 'bout some new sensations
        Talkin' a new sensations

        I took my GPZ out for a ride
        the engine felt good between my thighs
        The air felt cool, it was forty degrees outside

        I rode to Pennsylvania near the Delaware Gap
        sometimes I got lost and had to check the map
        I stopped at a roadside diner for a burger and a coke

        There were some country folk and some hunters inside
        somebody got themselves married and somebody died
        I went to the juke box and played a hillbilly song

        They was arguing about football as I waved and went outside
        and I headed for the mountains feeling warm inside
        I love that GPZ so much, you know that I could kiss her

        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, ooohhh, new sensations

        Talkin' 'bout your new sensations
        Talkin' new sensations

        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, new sensations
        Ooohhh, new sensations
        ...



intro   fade in  ...x}      drums
        {D}{D}{D}{D}        drums and bass

        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}      guitar
        {Dsus2}{G7}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}
        {Dsus2}{G7}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}      (I don't like guilt be it ...)
        {Dsus2}{G7}{D}{D}   (- years ago today I was ...)

        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}      (I don't want pain, I want to ... )
        {Dsus2}{G7}{D}{D}   (- ain't no dog tied to a ...)

        {F}{C}{G}{G}        (Ooohhh, new sensations)
        {F}{C}{G}{G}        (Ooohhh, new sensations)

        {A}{G}{D}{Em}
        {G}{Em}{D}{D}       (Talkin' 'bout some new sensations)
        {A}{G}{D}{Em}
        {G}{Em}{D}{D}       (Talkin' 'bout some new sensations)

        ....

ending  {D}{D}{G7}{G7}
        {D}{G7}{D}{D}

        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}      (Ooohhh, new sensations)
        {D}{G7}{D}{D}       (Ooohhh, new sensations)
        {D}{D}{G7}{G7}      (Ooohhh, new sensations)
        {D}{G7}{D}{D}       (Ooohhh, new sensations)
        ... repeat and fade out

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







====================================
"New Sensations"
====================================
album _Perfect Night Live In London_
(Lou Reed, 1998)

Jul 03, 1997
Royal Festival Hall, London
(Meltdown Festival)
====================================


        Ah
        I don't like guilt be it stoned or stupid
        drunk and disorderly I ain't no cupid
        Two years ago today I got arrested on big Christmas Eve

        I want to walk, baby, not be carried
        I don't want to give it up
        Ah, maybe I'm not meant to be married
        you know I'm no dog tied and put in a parked car

        Oh, new sensation, I wanna new sensation
        Ooohhh, ooohhh, now new sensation

        I said, I'm talkin' 'bout some new sensations
        I said, I'm talkin' about a new sensation

        I want the benefits of a timeless muse
        I want to get rid of my negative views
        And get rid of those people that are always such a down

        It's easy enough to say what's wrong
        that ain't what I want to hear all night long
        Some people are like human Tuinals

        Ooohhh, now baby, new sensation
        Oh, now new sensation

        I said, talkin' the new sensation
        I said, new sensation

        I took that GPZ out for a ride
        engine felt so good between my thighs
        The air was cool, forty degrees outside

        Rode to Pennsylvania by the Delaware Gap
        you know Michael, sometimes I got lost and check the map
        Went over a roadside diner
        for a scotch and a beer and a coke
        little boiler maker

        Some country folk, some hunters sitting inside
        somebody got married, somebody lay died
        Went to the juke box and I played, I played a hillbilly song

        They were arguing about soccer as I went outside
        heading for the mountains feeling warm inside
        You know I love my GPZ so much, I could kiss her

        Oh, a new sensation, I wanna new sensation
        Oh baby, a new sensation

        I said, I'm talkin' about a new sensation
        I wanna new sensation, new sensation
        Rip it open on the parkway, baby
        floor down a hundred and five, ah, I wanna new sensation

        I wanna go faster, baby
        Oh new-new, I wanna new sensation
        faster, baby, a hundred and five
        Crack it over, crack it motherfucker over
        crack it over, crack it motherfucker over
        I wanna hundred, a hundred and five, don't stop it now
        I said that new, new, new, new
        I said new sensation, I want a new sensation now
        ooohhh baby-baby-baby
        ah, na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-now
        A new, a new, a new, baby, please, new, new, new sensation




intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D7/D7.D6}    * tab 1
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}                 (Ah)

        {Bm}{A#}{D}{D}         (I'm not meant to be married ...)

        {F}{C}{G}{G}           (Oh, new sensation, I wanna new ...)
        {F}{C}{G}{G}           (-tion, Ooohhh, ooohhh now, new ...)

        {A}{G}{D}{D.Em/Em}     (I said -)
        {G}{Em}{D}{D}          (I'm talkin' 'bout some new ...)

        ....

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Joe Grigas (grig1@kode.net)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I think that there is a line in New Sensations that is incorrect.
"Some people are like human toulinols".
Toulinol is a barbitiuate type medication.
I'm not trying to be critical, just helpful!


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I found some gaps and little mistakes on the New Sensations'
version from the Perfect Night concert.
I send you my transcription.



line 04:
Two years ago today I got arrested on big Christmas Eve

line 15:
And get rid of those people that are always such a down

line 17:
that aint what I want to hear all night long

line 27:
you know, Michael, sometimes I got lost and check the map

line 28:
Went over a roadside diner for a scotch and a beer and a coke

line 40:
Rip it over on the parkway, baby

line 41:
floor down a hundred and five, I wanna new sensation

line 42:
I wanna go faster, baby

line 44:
faster, baby, a hundred and five

line 45:
Crack it over mother fucker, crack it mother fucker over

line 47:
I wanna hundred, a hundred and five, don't stop it now

line 49:
I want a new sensation now


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Breixo Xiz (breixo@hotmail.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

in my opinion,
Lou says "some people are like human ruinals" in "New sensations".


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Tomasz Galka (T.Galka@ien.com.pl)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I think I've found some minor inaccuracies
in 'New Sensations' (live version).

Namely:

line 8: I ain't no dog tied and put in a parked car
line 13: I want the benefits of a timeless muse
line 33: They were arguing about soccer as I went outside
line 34: Heading for the mountains feeling warm inside
line 40: Rip it open ot the parkway, baby


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Shawn Pavey (shawn.pavey@cotelligent.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

There seems to be a lot of confusion over the line,
"Some People are like human toulinols". That is correct.
What Lou meant is that some people, due to their negative attitudes,
can affect someone like a toulinol in that they suck positive energy.
I know we all know people like this.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Robert T. Reid III (rreidiii@home.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

On your lyrics for new sensations,
the verse where you say little boy america,
I believe he is saying a little boiler maker,
which is a whisky and a beer (not a scotch)


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Stephen Botha (gbotha@worldonline.co.za)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

One tiny correction for "New Sensations"
- I'm pretty sure that the line
"human toulinols" should be "human Tuinals."

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>New York Telephone Conversation</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=================================
"New York Telephone Conversation"
=================================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
=================================


        I was sleeping gently napping
        when I heard the phone
        Who is on the other end talking
        am I even home

        Did you see what she did to him
        did you hear what they said
        Just a New York conversation
        rattling in my head

        Oh, oh, my, and what shall we wear
        Oh, oh, my, and who really cares

        Just a New York conversation
        gossip all of the time
        Did you hear who did what to whom
        happens all the time

        Who has touched and who has dabbled
        here in the city of shows
        Openings, closings, bad repartee
        everybody knows

        Oh, how sad and why do we call
        Oh, I'm glad to hear from you all

        I am calling, yes I'm calling
        just to speak to you
        For I know this night will kill me
        if I can't be with you

        If I can't be with you



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {E/B}{A/B}{C#m/G#}{C#m.G#/C#m}   (I was sleeping ...)
        {A/B}{E/B}{A/B}{E.B/E}           (Who is on the other ...)

        {E/B}{A/B}{C#m/G#}{C#m.G#/C#m}   (Did you see what she ...)
        {A/B}{E/B}{A/B}{E.B/E}           (Just a New York ...)

        {C/B}{E.B/E}{A/B}{E.B/E}         (Oh, oh, my, and what ...)
        {C/B}{E.B/E}{A/B}{E.B/E}         (Oh, oh, my, and who ...)

        {E/B}{A/B}{C#m/G#}{C#m.G#/C#m}   (Just a New York ...)
        {A/B}{E/B}{A/B}{E.B/E}           (Did you hear who did ...)

        {E/B}{A/B}{C#m/G#}{C#m.G#/C#m}   (Who has touched and ...)
        {A/B}{E/B}{A/B}{E.B/E}           (Openings, closings ...)

        {C/B}{E.B/E}{A/B}{E.B/E}         (Oh, how sad and why ...)
        {C/B}{E.B/E}{A/B}{E.B/E}         (Oh, I'm glad to hear ...)

        {E/B}{A/B}{C#m/G#}{C#m.G#/C#m}   (I am calling, yes I'm ...)
        {A/B}{E/B}{A/B}{E.B/E}           (For I know this night ...)

        {A/E(onG#)}{F#m/B}{E...          (- I can't be with you)




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



        {D/A}{G/A}{Bm/F#}{Bm.F#/Bm}   (I was sleeping, gently ...)
        {G/A}{D/A}{G/A}{D.A/D}        (Who is on the other end ...)

        {D/A}{G/A}{Bm/F#}{Bm.F#/Bm}   (Did you see what she did ...)
        {G/A}{D/A}{G/A}{D.A/D}        (Just a New York ...)

        {A#/A}{D.A/D}{G/A}{D.A/D}     (Oh, oh, my, and what ...)
        {A#/A}{D.A/D}{G/A}{D.A/D}     (Oh, oh, my, and who ...)

        {D/A}{G/A}{Bm/F#}{Bm.F#/Bm}   (Just a New York ...)
        {G/A}{D/A}{G/A}{D.A/D}        (Did you hear who did ...)

        {D/A}{G/A}{Bm/F#}{Bm.F#/Bm}   (Who has touched and who ...)
        {G/A}{D/A}{G/A}{D.A/D}        (Openings, closings, bad ...)

        {A#/A}{D.A/D}{G/A}{D.A/D}     (Oh, how sad and why do ...)
        {A#/A}{D.A/D}{G/A}{D.A/D}     (Oh, I'm glad to hear ...)

        {D/A}{G/A}{Bm/F#}{Bm.F#/Bm}   (I am calling, yes I'm ...)
        {G/A}{D/A}{G/A}{D.A/D}        (For I know this night ...)

        {G/D(onF#)}{Em/A}{D...        (- I can't be with you)




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Kirill Rodionov (thaumaturge@chat.ru)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

"New York Telephone Conversation"


...
here in the city of shows
Openings, closings, bad repartee
everybody knows


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Matt Heydon (geronimo@froggy.com.au)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

In the version on your website the last line of this song
(if I can't be with you..) has the chords;

{ A / G#m }  { F#m / B }  { E...

The G#m should be an E played with a G# bass.
There is only one note difference
(E rather than Eb in the right hand)
but it does make a difference.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

<TITLE>No Chance</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
======================
"No Chance - Regret"
======================
album _Magic And Loss_
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        It must be nice to be steady
        it must be nice to be firm
        it must be nice never to move off the mark

        It must be nice to be dependable
        and never let anyone down
        it must be great to be all the things you're not
        It must be great to be all the things that I'm not

        I see you in the hospital
        your humor is intact
        I'm embarrassed by the strength I seem to lack

        If I was in your shoes
        so strange that I am not
        I'd fold up in a minute and a half
        I'd fold up in a minute and a half

        And I didn't
        get a chance to say goodbye
        No, I didn't
        get a chance to say goodbye

        It must be nice to be normal
        it must be nice to be cold
        it must be nice not to have to go, oh, up or down

        But me I'm all emotional
        no matter how I try
        you're gone and I'm still here alive
        You're gone and I am still here alive

        And I didn't
        get a chance to say goodbye
        No, I didn't
        get a chance to say goodbye

        There are things we say, we wish, we knew
        and in fact we never do
        but I wish I'd known that you were going to die

        Then I wouldn't feel so stupid
        such a fool that I didn't call
        and I didn't get a chance to say goodbye
        I didn't get a chance to say goodbye

        No there's no logic to this
        who's picked to stay or go
        if you think too hard it only makes you mad

        But your optimism made me think
        you really had it beat
        so I didn't get a chance to say goodbye
        I didn't get a chance to say goodbye
        No, I didn't get a chance to say goodbye
        I didn't get a chance to say goodbye

        {A}{A}{D}{A}    (It must be nice to be steady ...)
        {A}             (It must be -)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}    (- nice to be dependable and never let ...)
        {D}{A}{A}{A}    (- great to be all the things that I'm ...)
        {A}             (I -)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}    (- see you in the hospital your humor ...)
        {A}             (If -)

        {A}{A}{D}{A}    (- I was in your shoes, so strange that ...)
        {D}{A}{A}       (- fold up in a minute and a half, And I -)

        {D}{E}{A}{A}    (- didn't get a chance to say goodbye, No -)
        {D}{E}{A}{A}    (- I didn't get a chance to say goodbye)
        {A}{A}

        ....

<PRE>
===================
"No Money Down"
===================
album _Mistrial_
(Lou Reed, 1986)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        I know you're disappointed
        in the way I handled things
        You're thinking I misread the times
        and acted cowardly
        And since what I do affects us both
        and you feel that I let you down

        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        lovers trust, no money down
        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        it's a lover's trust, no money down

        (Hey, lovers)
        (Hey, lovers)
        (lovers)

        They say there's someone for everyone
        and for everyone a someone
        And some tattoo roses across their chests
        with a heart that says Rollo
        And some work without a public relations man
        and do their best work, babe, out of sight

        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        it's a lover's trust, no money down
        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        lovers trust, no money down

        (Hey, lovers)
        (Hey, lovers)
        (lovers)

        Now I have known a hero or two
        and they all learn to swim through mud
        And they all got boots caked with dirty soles
        that they get from squashing bugs
        So when push comes to shove get the Harley revved up
        the moon can eclipse even the sun

        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        lovers trust, no money down
        You're paying a price when there's no price to pay
        it's a lover's trust, no money down

        Lovers trust, no money down (Hey, lovers)
        It's a lover's trust, no money down (Hey, lovers)
        mmmm..
        Lovers trust, no money down (Hey, hey, lovers)
        Lovers trust, no money down (Hey, hey, lovers)
        (Hey, hey, lovers)
        (Hey, hey, lovers)
        ...

"No Money Down"

I know you're disappointed
in the way I handled things
You're thinking I misread the times
and acted cowardly
and since what I do affects us both
and you feel that I let you down

You're paying a price
When there is no price to pay
Lovers Trust----No Money Down

They say there's someone for everyone
and for everyone a someone
and some tattoo roses across their chests
with a heart that says Rollo
and some work without a Public Relations man
And do their best work
Baby out of sight

You're paying a price
When there is no price to pay
Lovers Trust----No Money Down

Now I have known a hero or two
And they all learn to swim through mud
And they all got boots caked with
Dirty soles that they get from
Squashing bugs
So when push comes to shove
Get the Harley revved up
The moon can eclipse even the sun

You're paying a price
When there is no price to pay
Lovers Trust----No Money Down

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
=============================
"Nobody But You"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        I really care a lot
        although I look like I do not
        Since I was shot
        there's nobody but you

        I know I look blas&eacute;
        party Andy's what the papers say
        At dinner I'm the one who pays
        for a nobody like you

        Nobody but you
        a nobody like you
        Since I got shot
        there's nobody but you

        Won't you decorate my house
        I'll sit there quiet as a mouse
        You know me I like to look a lot
        at nobody but you

        I'll hold your hand and slap my face
        I'll tickle you to your disgrace
        Won't you put me in my proper place
        a nobody like you

        Sundays I pray a lot
        I'd like to wind you up and paint your clock
        I want to be what I am not
        for a nobody like you

        The bullet split my spleen and lung
        the doctors said I was gone
        Inside I've got some shattered bone
        for nobody but you

        Nobody but you
        a nobody like you
        Shattered bone
        for nobody but you

        I'm still not sure I didn't die
        and if I'm dreaming I still have bad pains inside
        I know I'll never be a bride
        to nobody like you

        I wish I had a stronger chin
        my skin was good, my nose was thin
        This is no movie I'd ask to be in
        with a nobody like you

        Nobody like you
        a nobody like you
        All my life

        It's been nobodies like you




intro   {A}{A}{D}{D}
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (I really -)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- care a lot, although I look like I do ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- I was shot, there's nobody but you ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- look blas&eacute;, party Andy's ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- one who pays, for a nobody like you ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- you, a nobody like you, Since -)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- I got shot, there's nobody but you ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (-rate my house, I'll sit there quiet as ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- like to look a lot, at nobody but you ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- slap my face, I'll tickle you to your ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- proper place, a nobody like you)

guitar  {A}{A}{D}{D}
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (Sundays I -)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- pray a lot, I'd like to wind you up ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- I am not, for a nobody like you ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- spleen and lung, the doctors said I ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- shattered bone, for nobody but you ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- you, a nobody like you)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (Shattered bone, for nobody but you ...)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- be a bride, to nobody like you ...)

        {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- stronger chin, my skin was good ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{A}   (- to be in, with a nobody like you ...)

coda    {A}{A}{D}{D}   (- you, a nobody like you)
        {E...          (All my life)
                       (It's been nobodies like you)

<PRE>
=========================
"Nobody's Business"
=========================
album _Coney Island Baby_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        Hey, if you're moving too fast
        don't you want this thing to last
        But if you start moving slow then -
        hey pretty mama, you just will have to go, because -

        It's nobody's business but my own
        It's nobody's business but my own
        No no no no no no no, no no no no, no no no
        No no no no no no no no, no no no no, no no no

        But if you start acting mean
        then I'll have to mess up the scene
        But if you start treating me nice
        hey now baby, I'm gonna have to raise your price

        Because it's nobody's business but my own
        It's nobody's business but my own
        No no no no no no no, no no no no, no no no
        No no no no, no no, no no no

        Nobody's business
        nobody's business, come on now
        Hey, nobody's business, yeah, but my own
        nobody's business, oh my, no no no
        Nobody's business, no no no no no
        hey, nobody's business, yeah, but my own
        Nobody's business, my own
        no no, no no no
        No no, no no no

        Nobody's business
        nobody's business
        Nobody's business
        nobody's business, but my own now
        ...

<TITLE>Noise</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================================================
"Noise"
=============================================================
album
_The East Village Other - Electric Newspaper - Hiroshima Day_
(Various Artists, 1966)

written by ? (free improvisation)

Aug 06, 1966
=============================================================



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        * improvisation and drone (key in A)




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<TITLE>Now And Then</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================
"Now And Then"
=========================
unreleased live
(Lou Reed, 1994)

written by Pete Townshend

Feb 19, 1994
Shrine Auditorium, LA
=========================


        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it

        In you I saw someone
        that I recognized
        Had no idea
        what was in your mind
        I met your eyes
        and I was hypnotized
        I let our lives
        become entwined

        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        take it, Rob

        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it

        For though you knew that I was twice your age
        make you laugh seemed you enough
        I thought we'd love and then and
        turn the page, to suffer your rebuff
        And it was me who had the most to gain despite the fact that
        I now have lost
        The only love that ever caused me pain
        I feel like I was double ....

        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love
        you can't do a thing about it
        Now and then you see a soul and you fall in love

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Nowhere At All</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================================
"Nowhere At All"
==============================================
7" single "Charley's Girl" B-side
(Lou Reed, 1976)

7" single "Crazy Feeling" B-side
(Lou Reed, 1976)

album
_Walk On The Wild Side - The Best Of Lou Reed_
(Lou Reed, 1977)

album _Coney Island Baby_
reissue CD bonus track
(Lou Reed, 2006)

written by Lou Reed
==============================================


        Somebody's got to help me
        this girl's drivin' me insane, huh
        Cause some they likes it hot (so hot)
        and some they likes it cold (so cold)
        and some they just don't like it at, like it at all now

        Somebody's got to help me
        this girl's drivin' me insane
        Now somebody she's got to help me
        It makes me feel like, ah, that I'm nowhere at all
        It makes me feel like I'm nowhere at all

        Somebody's got to help me
        this girl's got me on the line now
        Cause some they likes it hot (so hot)
        and some they likes it cold (so cold)
        and some they just don't like it at, like it at all now

        Somebody's got to help me
        this girl's drivin' me insane
        Somebody's got to help me
        She's makin' me feel like, ah, I'm nowhere at all
        It makes me feel like I'm nowhere at all

        I'm nowhere at all now
        I'm nowhere at, give it to me now
        I'm nowhere at all now
        Now honey, .......... nowhere
        I'm no, no, nowhere at all
        I'm nowhere at all now
        oh, give it to me now now




intro   {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}           (Somebody's got to help me ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}           (Cause some they likes it hot ...)

        {D/C}{A}{D/C}{A}       (Somebody's got to help me ...)
        {D/C}{A}               (Now somebody she's got to help ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}           (- feel like, ah, that I'm ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}           (- feel like I'm nowhere at all)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}            (Somebody's got to help me ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}            (Cause some they likes it hot ...)

        {D/C}{A}{D/C}{A}       (Somebody's got to help me ...)
        {D/C}{A}               (Somebody's got to help me ...)
        {D/C}{D}{A}{A}         (- feel like that I'm nowhere ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}           (- feel like I'm nowhere at all)

guitar  {B}{D}{A}{A}
        {B}{D}{A}{A}           (I'm nowhere at -)

        {A}{A/C.D}{A}{A/C.D}   (- all, I'm nowhere at, give it ...)
        {A}{A/C.D}{A}{A}       (- all now, Now honey ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}           (- at all, I'm nowhere at all ...)
        {A/G}{A}{A/G}{A}
        {A/G}{A}{A/G}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}
        ... fade out




* intro

        {A}                 {A}
 1e -----------------------------------------------
 2B -----------------------------------------------
 3G -----2--2--x-2-x-2-2-----2--2--x-2-x-2-2-------     ...
 4D -----2--2--x-2-x-2-2-----2--2--x-2-x-2-2-------
 5A -----0--0--x-0-x-0-0-----0--0--x-0-x-0-0-------
 6E --3v------------------3v------------------3v---



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

<TITLE>N.Y. Stars</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=========================
"N.Y. Stars"
=========================
album _Sally Can't Dance_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        The stock is empty
        in our eyeball store
        All we got left
        a few cataracts and sores
        The faggot mimic machine
        never had ideas
        Mission impossible
        they self-destruct on fear

        On a standard New York night
        ghouls go to see their so-called stars
        A fairly stupid thing
        to pay five bucks for fourth-rate imitators

        They say, "I'm so empty
        no surface, no depth
        Oh please can't I be you
        your personality's so great"

        Like new buildings
        square, tall and the same
        Sorry, Miss Stupid
        didn't know, you didn't know it's a game
        I'm just waiting
        for them to hurry up and die
        It's really getting too crowded here
        help your New York Stars

        Contributions accepted all the same
        We need a new people store
        remember we're very good at games



intro   {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}

        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (The stock is empty ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (All we got left ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (The faggot mimic machine ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (Mission impossible ...)

        {Em}{D}{A}{Em}      (On a standard New York night ...)
        {Em}{D}{A/A.G}{E}   (A fairly stupid thing ...)

        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (They say, -)

        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (- "I'm so empty, no surface, ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (Oh please can't I be you ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (Like new buildings ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (Sorry, Miss Stupid ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (I'm just waiting ...)
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}     (It's really getting to crowded ...)

        {Em}{D}{A}{Em}      (Contributions accepted all the same)
        {Em}{D}{A/A.G}{E}   (We need a new people store ...)

guitar  {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}

g.solo  {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        {G}{F}{D#/C}{G}
        ... repeat and fade out

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>NYC Man</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"NYC Man"
================================
album _Set The Twilight Reeling_
(Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
================================


        It can only lead to trouble if you break my heart
        if you accidentally crush it on the Ides of March
        I'd prefer you were straightforward
        you don't have to go through all of that
        I'm a New York City man, baby
        and say, "Go" and that is that

        New York City man
        you just say, "Go" and that is that
        I'm a New York City man
        you just say, "Go" and that is that

        It's far too complicated, mmmm.., to make up a lie
        that you'd have to remember and really why
        I wouldn't want to be around you
        if you didn't want to have me around
        I'm a M-A-N-N man
        you blink your eyes and I'll be gone

        M-A-N-N man, you blink your eyes
        honey, I love you, I'll be gone
        New York City man
        you blink your eyes and I'll be gone

        Brutus made a pretty speech but Caesar was betrayed
        Lady Macbeth went crazy but Macbeth ended slain
        Ophelia and Desdamona dead leaving Hamlet in a play
        but I'm no Lear with a blinded eye, say, "Go" and I am gone

        The stars have shut their eyes up tight
        the earth has changed it's course
        a kingdom sits on a black knight's back
        as he tries to mount a white jeweled horse
        While a clock full of butterflies on the hour
        releases a thousand moths
        You say, "Leave" and I'll be gone
        without any remorse
        No letters, faxes, phones or tears
        there's a difference between bad and worse

        I'm a New York City man
        blink your eyes and I'll be gone
        New York City man, M-A-N
        you blink your eyes and I'll be gone

        New York City, I love you
        New York City man
        New York City, how I love you
        blink your eyes and I'll be gone
        just a little grain of sand
        New York City
        ooohhh, how I love you
        New York City, babe
        blink your eyes and you've gone
        Oh, how I love you



* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)



intro   {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          guitar
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          drums and bass
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}

        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (It can only lead to trouble if ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (- prefer you were ...)

        {D}{D}{G/F#m}{Em}       (New York City man, you just ...)
        {D}{D}{G/F#m}{Em}       (I'm a New York City man, you ...)

        ....

        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (Brutus made a pretty speech ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (Ophelia and Desdamona dead ...)

        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (- stars have shut their eyes ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{Am}         (- clock full of butterflies ...)
        {A}{Am}                 (- letters, faxes phones or ...)

        {D}{D}{G/F#m}{Em}       (I'm a New York City man, blink ...)
        {D}{D}{G/F#m}{Em}       (- man, M-A-N, you blink your ...)

        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          drums and bass
horns   {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          (New York City, I love you ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          (- city, how I love you, blink ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          (New York City, ooohhh, how I ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          (New York city, babe, blink ...)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}          (- love you)
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}
        {E}{G#m}{A}{B}
        {E...

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Ocean</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Ocean"
===================
album _Lou Reed_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Don't swim tonight my love, the sea is mad my love
        it's known to drive men crazy
        Malcolm has burned at sea, the castle it sits and reeks
        the madness can make you hazy

        But here come the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing the rocks that have been here
        centuries or more

        Down by the sea

        Here come the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Castles glowing at night, towers above out fright
        warlocks decapitating
        Malcolm he lives on hate, serve your brain on a plate
        feasts on your mouth for dinner

        But here come the waves
        down by the sea
        Washing the eyes of the men
        who have died

        Down by the sea

        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves

==================================================
"Ocean"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Nov 1969
San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the shore
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea

        Earth is a hollow hair, part of a bigger head
        it nearly drives me crazy
        I am a lazy son, I never get things done
        mostly made up of water

        But here comes the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing the eye of the land
        that has been

        Down by the sea
        down by the sea
        Down by the sea
        down by the sea

        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the shore
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea

        In sex or evil thoughts, fought off by selfish men
        it nearly drives me crazy
        I am a lazy son, I never get things done
        mostly made up of water

        But here comes the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing the eye of the land
        that has been

        Down by the sea
        Down by the sea

        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves



* chords: same as _VU_ version (see down below)
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

album _VU_
(The Velvet Underground, 1985)

Jun 19, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
==============================

        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves crashing in

        it nearly drives me crazy

        we caught up all our actions

        that has been

=====================================
"Ocean"
(outtake)
=====================================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Silver and black lit night, here's to a stealer's night
        an empty splendid castle
        Glowering alone at night, the princess has had a fight
        madness seeks out a lover

        And here come the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing the soul of the body
        that comes form the depth of the sea

        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Don't swim tonight my love, the tide is out my love
        Malcolm's curse haunts our family
        Odious loud and rich, ruler of filthy seas
        revel in heaven's justice

        And here come the waves
        and save for a scream
        There's much like a song to be heard
        in the wind that blows by the sea
        Like the wind

        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves



* chords: same as _VU_ version




* guitar octave play (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

- sea
     {E}     {G}               {A}          {G}
*1d ---------------------------------------------------------------
*2A ------------14/15---12---------------------14/15---12----------
*3F -----------------------12---9--------------------------12---9--
*4C ------------11/12----9---------------------11/12----9----------
*5G -----------------------10---7--------------------------10---7--
*6D ---------------------------------------------------------------

{E}      {G}               {A}            {G}
---------------------------------------------------------------
------------14/15---12-----------------------14/15--15-15--17--
-----------------------12---14---------------------------------
------------11/12----9-----------------------11/12--12-12--14--
-----------------------10---12---------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato

=====================================
"Ocean"
(demo)
=====================================
album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Lyin' here on the beach, with you it seems out of reach
        it could just drive me crazy
        You're such a lazy son, but you're the only one
        I could stay here forever

        But here come the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing our eyes then it's gone
        just once more

        Down by the sea
        Down by the sea

        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves down by the sea
        Here comes the ocean
        and the waves where have they been

        Lyin' down on the beach, it seems so out of reach
        does any just drive he crazy
        You know that you feel so strong
        and you know they would be long
        till they stone on the water

        But here come the waves
        down by the shore
        Washing our eyes till it's gone
        just once more

        Down by the sea

        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves
        Here come the waves



* chords: same as _VU_ version




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Andy Linus (andy.linus@virgin.net)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

One main correction: in Ocean, you have Reed singing 'ho-ho-holler'
or somesuch on a couple of the versions.
The line is, variously, 'mostly made up of water'
and 'made up mostly of water'.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************

<PRE>
=====================================
"Oh Gin"
(demo)
=====================================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

written by Lou Reed

Apr 16, 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Oh, Gin
        how could you treat me this way
        Oh, treat me this way

        Oh, Gin
        how could you treat me this way
        Baby, treat me this way

        You know you broke my heart
        ever since you went away

        You gotta feel it and like it
        and if you move you gotta drill it and hold it
        Oh, oh, oh, oh, Gin
        how could you treatin' me this way

        You know you broke my heart
        ever since you went away

        Oh, Gin
        how could you treat me this way
        Hey, you treat me this way

        Oh, Gin
        how could you treat me this way
        How you treat me this way

        You know you broke my heart
        ever since you went away

        You gotta feel it and like it
        and if you move it like it
        Oh, oh, oh, oh, Gin
        how could you treat me this way

        You know I'm gonna stay alone
        'til you're coming back and play

        You know I've been so sad
        ever since you went away
        You know I've been so sad
        ever since you went away



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E}{E/D.D#}{E}{E/D.D#}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}            (Oh, Gin, how could you treat me this -)
        {E}{A}{E}{E}            (- way, Oh, treat me this way)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}            (Oh, Gin, how could you treat me this -)
        {E}{A}{E}{E}            (- way, Baby, treat me this way ...)

        {E}{B}{B}{E}            (- broke my heart, ever since you ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}            (- feel it and like it ... )
        {A}{A}{E}{E}            (- Gin, how could you treat me ...)

        {E/B}{B}{B}{E/D.D#}     (- broke my heart, ever since you ...)

guitar  {E}{E/D.D#}{E}{E/D#.D}
        {A}{A/D.D#}{E}{E}
        {E/B}{B}{E}{E}

        ....

        {E/B}{B}{B}{E/D.D#}     (- gonna stay alone, 'til you're ...)

guitar  {E}{E/D.D#}{E}{E/D#.D}
        {A}{A/D.D#}{E}{E}       (You know I've -)

        {B}{B}{B}{E}            (- been so sad, ever since you ...)
        {E/B}{B}{B}{E. ..       (- been so sad, ever since you ...)




-------------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning




intro   {D}{D/C.C#}{D}{D/C.C#}

        {D}{D}{D}{D}            (Oh, Gin, how could you treat me this -)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}            (- way, Oh, treat me this way)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}            (Oh, Gin, how could you treat me this -)
        {D}{G}{D}{D}            (- way, Baby, treat me this way ...)

        {D}{A}{A}{D}            (- broke my heart, ever since you ...)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}            (- feel it and like it ... )
        {G}{G}{D}{D}            (- Gin, how could you treat me ...)

        {D/A}{A}{A}{D/C.C#}     (- broke my heart, ever since you ...)

guitar  {D}{D/C.C#}{D}{D/C#.C}
        {G}{G/C.C#}{D}{D}
        {D/A}{A}{D}{D}

        ....

        {D/A}{A}{A}{D/C.C#}     (- gonna stay alone, 'til you're ...)

guitar  {D}{D/C.C#}{D}{D/C#.C}
        {G}{G/C.C#}{D}{D}       (You know I've -)

        {A}{A}{A}{D}            (- been so sad, ever since you ...)
        {D/A}{A}{A}{D. ..       (- been so sad, ever since you ...)

<PRE>
===================
"Oh Jim"
===================
album _Berlin_
(Lou Reed, 1973)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        All your two-bit friends
        they're shootin' you up with pills, huh
        They said that it was good for you
        that it would cure your ills

        I don't care just where it's at
        I'm just like an alley cat

        And when you're filled up to here with hate
        don't you know you gotta get it straight
        Filled up to here with hate
        beat her black and blue and get it straight

        Do, do, do, do, do, do
        when you're lookin' through the eyes of hate

        All your two-bit friends
        they asked you for your autograph
        They put you on the stage
        they thought it'd be good for a laugh

        But I don't care just where it's at
        'cause honey, I'm just like an alley cat

        And when you're filled up to here with hate
        don't you know you gotta get it straight
        Filled up to here with hate
        beat her black and blue and get it straight
        Uh huh


        Oh Jim
        how could you treat me this way
        Hey hey hey
        how'd you treat me this way

        Oh Jim
        how could you treat me this way
        Hey hey
        how'd you treat me this way

        You know you broke my heart
        ever since you went away

        Now you said that you love us
        but you only make love to one of us
        Oh oh oh oh Jim
        how could you treat me this way

        You know you broke my heart
        ever since you went away

        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        When you're looking through the eyes of hate
        oh oh oh oh
        ...
