==================================================
"We're Gonna Have A Real Good Time Together"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

written by Lou Reed

Nov 1969
San Francisco, California
==================================================


        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna laugh and dance and shout together

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na
        hey, hey, hey, baby, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        oh, early in the morning
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        hey, hey, baby, now, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        Oh, we're gonna laugh and dance and shout together

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na
        no, no-no-no-no-no-no-no-no
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        hey, early now, baby
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        hey, early in the morning
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        oh, now, watch me

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        all right
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        hey, hey, baby, now, now, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

"Real Good Time Together"

album _Street Hassle_

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na

        We're gonna have a real good time together

        oh, baby, please
        We're gonna have a real good time together

============================================
"We're Gonna Have A Real Good Time Together"
============================================
album _Another View_
(The Velvet Underground, 1986)

Sep 30, 1969
NY
============================================


        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna laugh and dance and shout together, ooohhh

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        oh, baby, oh
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        oh, oh, oh

        We're gonna have a real good time together
        you know that
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        oh, oh
        We're gonna laugh and dance and shout together
        I tell you, baby, now

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na
        oh, baby
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        early in the morning, baby
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        ooohhh

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        yeah, yeah, baby, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        well, come, babe, come, baby, come, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        oh, oh, baby, now, now
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        get it, get it, ooohhh



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {A}{B}{E}{E}
        {A}{B}{E}{E}
        {A}{B}{E}{E}
        {A}{B}{E}{E}
        {A}{B}{D}{D}

        {A}{B}{E}{E}    (We're gonna have a real good time together)
        {A}{B}{E}{E}    (We're gonna have a real good time together)
        {A}{B}{E}{E}    (We're gonna have a real good time together)
        {A}{B}{E}{E}    (We're gonna laugh and dance and shout ...)

        {A}{B}{D}{D}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)
        {A}{B}{D}{D}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)
        {A}{B}{D}{D}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)
        {A}{B}{D}{D}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)

        ....

--x-0-0-0-0--0----x-0-0-0-0--0-----
-----------------------------------
-----------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning

        {G}{A}{D}{D}
        {G}{A}{D}{D}
        {G}{A}{D}{D}
        {G}{A}{C}{C}

        {G}{A}{D}{D}    (We're gonna have a real good time together)

        {G}{A}{D}{D}    (We're gonna laugh and dance and shout ...)

        {G}{A}{C}{C}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)
        {G}{A}{C}{C}    (Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na-na)

============================================
"We're Gonna Have A Real Good Time Together"
============================================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
============================================


        Gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna have a real good time together
        We're gonna laugh and shout together
        Have a real good time together

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

        Gonna have a real good time together
        Have a real good time together
        We're gonna laugh and ball and shout together
        We're gonna have a, we're gonna have a, real good, good
        real good time together, I said -

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na
        Na-na-na-na-na, na-na-na-na-na, na

<TITLE>Really Really Really Really Really Really Love</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
================================================
"Really Really Really Really Really Really Love"
================================================
7" single B-side
(Spongy and The Dolls, 1964?)

written by
Terry Philips/Jimmie Sims/Jerry Vance

Lou Reed: guitar (?)
================================================


        Pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la

        Really-really-really-really
        really-really love
        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love

        I'm just as happy as .... girl -
        - can be
        I'll met a boy who gave this -
        - love to me

        I never ...... before
        pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la
        I never gave my love before
        pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la
        Till now
        till now

        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love
        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love

        It's time I know it's really -
        - love I know
        It's something in this ........ -
        - talk me so

        I never knew a ...... before
        pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la
        I never knew a love before
        pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la
        Till now
        till now

        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love
        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love
        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love
        It's really-really-really-really
        really-really love



* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)



intro   {B}{B}{B}          (Pa-pa-la, la-la-la-la-la ...)

chorus  {E}{E}{A}{B}       (Really-really-really-really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)

        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (I'm just as happy as ....)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (I'll met a boy who gave this ...)

        {C#m}{C#m}{E}{E}   (I never ...... before ...)
        {C#m}{C#m}{E}{E}   (I never gave my love before ...)
break   {B}{B}{B}{B}       (- now, till now, It's -)

chorus  {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)

        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (It's time I know it's really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (It's something in this ........)

        {C#m}{C#m}{E}{E}   (I never knew a ...... before ...)
        {C#m}{C#m}{E}{E}   (I never knew a love before ...)
break   {B}{B}{B}{B}       (- now, tell now, It's -)

chorus  {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}       (- really-really-really-really ...)
        .... fade out




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* capo on 1 fret (standard-tuning)

         (0) (1) (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) (7) (8)
              0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7

2B ... --||-C-|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...

6E ... --||-F-|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|-...

chorus  {D}{D}{G}{A}     (Really-really-really-really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (I'm just as happy as ....)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (I'll met a boy who gave this ...)

        {Bm}{Bm}{D}{D}   (I never ...... before ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{D}{D}   (I never gave my love before ...)
break   {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- now, till now, It's -)

chorus  {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (It's time I know it's really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (It's something in this ........)

        {Bm}{Bm}{D}{D}   (I never knew a ...... before ...)
        {Bm}{Bm}{D}{D}   (I never knew a love before ...)
break   {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- now, tell now, It's -)

chorus  {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{A}     (- really-really-really-really ...)
        ... fade out

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{A#}   (- really-really-really-really ...)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{A#}   (I'll met a boy who gave this ...)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{A#}   (- really-really-really-really ...)
        .... fade out

<TITLE>Reverse Diminuendo</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================================
"Reverse Diminuendo"
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
(music is same as "Vanishing Act",
also used in this play)

performed by actors, German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================


        It must be nice to have a home
        that always stays under your feet
        that can always be depended on
        one place to eat and sleep

        How nice it must be to have a rug
        on which to stretch your legs
        a T-bone steak beside me
        I want to be a dog

        It must be nice to have a home
        A place that you can trust
        it stays forever in one spot
        and never moves about

        How nice it is to have a fire lit
        and stretch out on a rug
        a meaty bone next to my nose
        I want to be a dog

        I want to be a dog
        I want to be a dog
        With a T-bone in my paws
        I want to be a dog



intro   {A}{C#m}{D}{D}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (- must be nice to have a home ...)
break   {A}{C#m}{D}{D...   (- nice it must be to have a rug ...)

guitar  {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E}     (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (- must be nice to have a home ...)
break   {A}{C#m}{D}{D...   (- nice it is to have a fire lit ...)

guitar  {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E}

coda    {A}{A}{D}{D}       (I want to be a dog, I want to be -)
        {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- a dog, With a T-bone in my paws ...)
        {A...              (- dog)




* guitar part: rhythm ({E}{E/A} part)

   ______   ______     ______   ______
| / / / /  / / / /  | / / / /  / / / /  |
  o                   o          o x o
  E                   E          A   A  }




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>

<TITLE>Revien Cherie</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
============================
"Revien Cherie"
============================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

written by Fernando Saunders

sung by Fernando Saunders

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
============================


        Lovely day
        The sunshine
        A light of love, love divine
        As time strode away

        A test of love
        I bring to you my love
        like a bird who builds your unborn a home
        full of warmth
        I give to you the same test of love

        Revien Cherie
        Revien Cherie

        Sitting all alone in a daze
        I sing a song to you my love
        I wish I were dead, mmmm..
        My love was far away

        A test of love
        I bring to you my love
        like a bird who builds your unborn a home
        full of warmth
        I give to you the same test of love

        Revien Cherie
        Revien Cherie

        Life to me is a share
        To be, to see, to understand each other
        To love one another
        I give to you the same test of love

        Revien Cherie
        Revien Cherie
        Revien Cherie




intro   {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}{A#}{A#}

        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (Lovely day)
        {Fsus4}{F}                 (The sunshine)
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (A light of love, love divine)
        {Fsus4}{F}{A#}{A#}         (As time strode away)

        {D#}{F}{A#sus4/A#}         (A test of love, I bring to ...)
        {D#}{Asus4}{A}             (- my love, like a bird who ...)
        {D}{Gsus4/G}{C}{Fsus4/F}   (- home, full of warmth ...)

        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (- the same test of love)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)

        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (Sitting all alone in a daze)
        {Fsus4}{F}                 (I sing a song -)
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (- to you my love, I wish I ...)
        {Fsus4}{F}{A#}{A#}         (My love was far away)

        {D#}{F}{A#sus4/A#}         (A test of love, I bring to ...)
        {D#}{Asus4}{A}             (- my love, like a bird who ...)
        {D}{Gsus4/G}{C}{Fsus4/F}   (- home, full of warmth ...)

        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (- the same test of love)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)

guitar  {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}
        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}
        {Fsus4}{F}{A#}{A#}

        {D#}{F}{A#sus4/A#}         (Life to me is a share)
        {D#}{Asus4}{A}             (To be, to see, to understand -)
        {D}{Gsus4/G}{C}{Fsus4/F}   (- each other, To love one ...)

        {A#6}{A#6(onB)}{Cm}{Cm}    (- the same test of love)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#}{A#}         (Revien Cherie)
        {Fsus4}{F}{D#..{A#..       (Revien Cherie)




* riff

     {A#6}               {A#6(onB)}

_Animal Serenade_ talking part:

this is a song written by the magnificent fernando,
a beautiful chord combination and his gorgeous voice.
it is called revien cherie.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Ed (vufan@tiscali.co.uk)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I have the lyrics for Revien Cherie from Animal Serenade.

A light of love
Love divine

I bring to you my love
Like a bird who builds your unborn a home
Full of warmth
I give to you the same test of love
Revien cherie
Revien cherie

I sing a song to you my love
I wish I were dead
My love was far away

A test of love
I bring to you my love
Like a bird who builds your unborn a home
Full of warmth
I give to you the same test of love
Revien cherie
Revien cherie

To be, to see, to understand each other
To love one another
I give to you the same test of love
Revien cherie
Revien cherie
Revien cherie

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>R &amp; B jam</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==========================================
"R &amp; B jam"
==========================================
rehearsal
(The Velvet Underground, 1966)

written by ? (jam)

* they played the short riff taken from
Ike &amp; Tina Turner / Mickey &amp; Sylvia's song
"It's Gonna Work Out Fine"

Jan 03, 1966
The Factory, NYC
==========================================



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {E}{A/B}{E}{A/B}
        {E}{A}{E}{A/B}
        {E}{A}{B/B.A#}{A}
        {E}
        {E}{E}{A}{B}
        {E}



        ...tape skipped...
        ..}{E}{A}{E}
        {F#m}{C#m}{F#m}{C#m}
        {F#m}{E}{D}{Bm/E}

        {A...tape skipped...
               ...E}
        {F#m}{C#m}{F#m}{C#m}
        {F#m}{E}{D}{Bm/E}

        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {F#m}{C#m}{F#m}{C#m}
        {F#m}{E}{D}{Bm/E}

        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {F#m}{C#m}{F#m}{C#m}
        {F#m}{E}{D}{Bm/E}

        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {A}{E}{A}{E}
        {A}{E}
        {F#m}{C#m}{F#m}{C#m}
        {F#m}{E}{D}{Bm/E}

        {A...

transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
===================
"Ride Into The Sun"
===================
album _Lou Reed_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Looking for another chance
        for someone else to be
        Looking for another place
        to ride into the sun

        Ride into the sun
        ride into the sun
        Ride into the sun
        ride into the sun
        Where -

        - everything seems so pretty
        but if you're tired and you're sick of the city
        Remember that it's just a flower
        made out of clay
        Oh oh oh, the city -

        - where everything seems so dirty
        but if you're tired and you're filled with self-pity
        Remember that you're just one more
        person who's there

        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city, oh, oh oh
        It's hard to live in the city, oh, wow wow
        It's hard to live in the city



intro   {Bm/Bm.A}{G/G.A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/G.A}
        {Bm/Bm.A}{G/G.A}

        {D/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/A}{D}             (Looking for another ...)
        {D/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/A}{D}             (Looking for another ...)

        {D/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/A}{D}             (Ride into the sun ...)
        {D/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/A}{D}             (Ride into the sun ...)

        {G/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/Gm}{D/Bm}         (- everything seems ...)
        {G}{Em}{A}{D}                      (Remember that it's ...)

        {G/A}{Bm/Bm.A}{G/Gm}{D/Bm}         (- where everything ...)
        {G}{Em}{Em}                        (Remember that ...)

guitar  {A#}{A#}{F}{F}
        {C}{C}{D}{A}

coda    {D}{D}{G}{Em}                      (It's hard to live ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}                      (It's hard to live ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}                      (It's hard to live ...)
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}                      (It's hard to live ...)

guitar  {D}{D}{G}{Em}
        {D}{D}{G}{Em}
        ... fade out

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

"Ride Into The Sun"
(demo)
=====================================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/
Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Lookin' for another place
        someone else to be
        Lookin' for another chance
        to ride into the sun

        Ride into the sun
        ride into the sun
        Ride into the sun
        ride into -

        - The sun where -
        - everything seems so pretty
        if you're lonely and tired of the city
        Remember it's a flower made out of clay

        To the city -
        - where everything seems so ugly
        when you're sitting alone in self pity
        Remember you're just one more person who's living there

        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

==================================================
"Ride Into The Sun"
(The Matrix, San Francisco, 11-24-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 24, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Lookin' for another chance
        someone else to be
        Lookin' for another chance
        to ride into the sun

        Ride into the sun
        ride into the sun
        Ride into the sun
        ride into -

        - The sun where -
        - everything seems so pretty
        when you're lonely and tired of the city
        Remember it's a flower made out of clay

        To the city -
        - where everything seems so ugly
        when you're sitting alone in self pity
        Remember you're just one more person who's living there

        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city
        It's hard to live in the city

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {D#}

<TITLE>Ride Sally Ride</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<PRE>
=========================
"Ride Sally Ride"
=========================
album _Sally Can't Dance_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

written by Lou Reed
=========================


        Sit yourself down
        bang out a tune on that grand piano
        Sit yourself down
        lay languidly down upon the sofa

        Ooohhh, isn't it nice
        when your heart is made out of ice

        Ride Sally ride
        it's not your time or way of confusion
        Ride Sally ride
        'cause if you don't, you'll get a contusion

        Ooohhh, isn't it nice
        when your heart is made out of ice

        Sit yourself down
        take off your pants, don't you know this is a party
        Sit yourself down
        why do you think we brought all these people, Miss Brandy

        Ooohhh, isn't it nice
        when you find your heart's made out of ice

        Ride Sally ride
        it's not your time, it's just your confusion
        Ride, Sally, ride
        it's not your time, you'll get a contusion

        Ooohhh, isn't it nice
        when you find your heart is made out of ice

        (Ride Sally ride)
        (Ride, ride, ride, ride Sally ride) Ride Sally ride
        (Ride, ride, ride, ride Sally ride) Hey, ride Sally ride
        (Ride, ride, ride, ride Sally ride) Ride Sally ride
        (Ride, ride, ride, ride Sally ride, oh-oh-oh, oh)
        (Ride, ride, ride, ride Sally ride, hey-hey-hey, hey-hey)



intro   {Dm/A}{Dm/G}{Dm/A}{Dm/G}

        {F}{C}{Dm/Gm}{A#/C}        (Sit yourself down ...)
        {F}{C}{Dm/Gm}{A#/C}        (Sit yourself down ...)

        {D#}{A#}{Fm}{Cm}           (Ooohhh, isn't it nice ...)

        {F}{C}{F}{C/A#.C}          (Ride Sally ride ...)
        {F}{C}{F}{C/A#.C}          (Ride Sally ride ...)

        {D#}{A#}{Fm}{Cm}           (Ooohhh, isn't it nice ...)

        {F}{C}{Dm/Gm}{A#/C}        (Sit yourself down ...)
        {F}{C}{Dm/Gm}{A#/C}        (Sit yourself down ...)

        {D#}{A#}{Fm}{Cm}           (Ooohhh, isn't it nice ...)

        {F}{C}{F}{C/A#.C}          (Ride Sally ride ...)
        {F}{C}{F}{C/A#.C}          (Ride Sally ride ...)

        {D#}{A#}{Fm}{Cm}           (Ooohhh, isn't it nice ...)

        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           background vocals
        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           (Ride Sally ride)
        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           (Hey, ride Sally ride)
        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           (Ride Sally ride)
        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           background vocals
        {D#}{D#}{G#}{G#}           background vocals

coda    {Cm/G}{Cm/F}{D#...

thanks: Jose Alberto (brooklyn@usuarios.retecal.es)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

line 22: .... you'll get a contusion

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Riptide</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Riptide"
================================
album _Set The Twilight Reeling_
(Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
================================


        She's out of her mind
        like the wind in a storm
        Oh, like the ocean at dawn
        as it disappears, with the riptide

        She's out of her mind
        she's pulled away by the moon
        She's ripped from her sleep
        as the cold lunar sweep gains control

        Ooohhh, what you gonna do with your emotions
        Ah-ah, ones you barely recognize
        In your sleep I heard your screaming, ooohhh
        "This is not voluntary, this is not voluntary
        If this is life I'd rather die"

        In the riptide
        in the riptide

        She's out of her mind, riptide
        like a muscle that swells
        You know when you trip
        whether you're well or sick, your body aches

        She's out with the tide
        gone to a prisoner's dance
        Where a monkey's her date
        eating limbs off a plate with a spoon

        Ooohhh, what you gonna do with your emotions
        said the seagull to the loon
        What you gonna do with your emotions

        She said, "Please wake me up"
        She said, "Don't touch me now"
        She said, "I wish I was dead"

        With the riptide

        She's out of her mind
        riptide, you always win
        It happens over and over again
        riptide

        She's out of her mind
        like a hurricane's rain
        She does not stand a chance
        at this lunar dance, riptide

        I was thinking of van Gogh's last painting
        the wheatfields and the crows
        Is that perhaps what you've been feeling
        When you see the ground
        as you fall from the sky
        As the floors disappears from beneath your feet riptide

        She's going out of her mind
        out with the tide
        Out of her mind
        riptide

        She's going out of her mind, ah
        ah, with the riptide
        She's going out of her mind, ah
        ah, riptide



intro   feedback guitar improvisation (key in E)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}              drums
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}                    (She's -)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (- out of her mind ...)
        {Amaj7}{Am}{E}{E}         (Oh, like the ocean at ...)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (She's out of her mind ...)
        {Amaj7}{Cm/Cm7}{G}{G}     (- ripped from her sleep ...)

        {D}{Em}{C}{C}             (Ooohhh, what you gonna do ...)
        {D}{Em}{C}{C}             (In your sleep I heard your ...)
        {C}{D}{D}                 (If this is life I'd ...)

chorus  {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- riptide, in the riptide)
        {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (She's out of her -)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (- mind, riptide, like a ...)
        {Amaj7}{Am}{E}{E}         (- when you trip, Whether ...)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (- out with the tide ...)
        {Amaj7}{Cm/Cm7}{G}{G}     (- monkey's her date, eating ...)

        {D}{Em}{C}{C}             (Ooohhh, what you gonna do ...)
        {D}{Em}                   (What you gonna do with ...)

break   {C}{C}{C}                 (She said, "Please wake me up ...)
        {D}{D}                    (- dead", With the -)

chorus  {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- riptide)
break   {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (She's out of her -)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (- mind, riptide, you ...)
        {Amaj7}{Am}{E}{E}         (- over and over again, riptide)

        {E}{E}{G}{G}              (She's out of her mind ...)
        {Amaj7}{Cm/Cm7}{G}{G}     (- not stand a chance, at ...)

        {D}{Em}{C}{C}             (I was thinking of van Gogh's ...)
        {D}{Em}{C}{C}             (Is that perhaps what you've ...)
        {C}{D}{D}                 (- floors disappears from ...)

chorus  {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- mind, out with the -)
        {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- tide, out of her mind)
        {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- mind, riptide)

        {E}{E}{C}{Cm/Cm7}         (She's going out of her mind ...)
        {G}{Em}{C}{Cm/Cm7}        (- riptide, She's going out ...)

chorus  {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}       (- riptide)
        {G/G(onF#)}{G(onF)}

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        ... repeat E chords
        ... feedback guitar improvisation (key in E)
        ...
        {E.

     {G      / G(onF#)} {G(onF)           }

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







====================================
"Riptide"
====================================
album _Perfect Night Live In London_
(Lou Reed, 1998)

Jul 03, 1997
Royal Festival Hall, London
(Meltdown Festival)
====================================


        She's out of her mind
        like the wind in a storm
        Like the ocean at dawn
        as it disappears, with the riptide

        She's out of her mind
        she's pulled away by the moon
        She's ripped from her sleep
        as the cold lunar sweep gains control

        What you gonna do with your emotions
        ones you barely recognize
        In your sleep I heard your screaming, ah-ah-ah
        "This is not voluntary, this is not voluntary
        If this is life I'd rather die"

        Ah, in the riptide

        She's going out of her mind

        She's out of her mind
        oh baby, like a muscle that swells
        You know when you trip
        whether you're well or sick, your body aches

        She's out with the tide
        gone to a prisoner's dance
        Where a monkey's her date
        eating limbs off a plate with a spoon

        Ah, what you gonna do with your emotions
        said the seagull to the loon
        What you gonna do with your emotions, she

        She said, "Please wake me up
        Oh baby, don't touch me now, ah"
        She said, "I wish I was dead"

        Ah-ah-ah, in the riptide

        She's out of her mind

        She's out of her mind
        ah, riptide, you always win
        It happens over and over again, ah-ah
        riptide

        She's out of her mind
        it's like a hurricane's rain
        She doesn't stand a chance
        at this lunar dance, riptide

        I was thinking of van Gogh's last painting
        the wheatfields and the crows
        Is that perhaps what you've, you've been feeling
        When you see the ground
        as you fall from the sky
        As the floors disappears from beneath your feet riptide
        riptide

        She's going out of her mind

        She's going out of her mind
        with the riptide
        out of her mind
        with the riptide

==============================
"Rock And Roll"
==============================
album _Loaded_
(The Velvet Underground, 1970)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she puts on the radio
        there was nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        Then one fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        you know she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started shakin' to that fine-fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you know you could just go out
        and dance to the rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right, hey baby, you know
        it was all right

        Jenny said when she was just about five years old
        you know my parents are gonna be the death of us all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well you know ain't gonna help me at all
        not just you ....

        Then one fine morning, she turns on a New York station
        she doesn't believe what she hears at all
        Ooohhh, she started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yeah, rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the computations
        you could just dance to that rock 'n' roll station
        And baby, it was all right
        hey, it was all right
        hey, here she comes now

        Oh, jump-jump

        Like Jenny said when she was just about five-five years old
        hey, you know there's nothin' happening at all
        not at all
        Every time I put on the radio
        you know there's nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        But one fine morning, she hears a New York station
        she doesn't believe what she heard at all
        hey, not at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yes, rock 'n' roll

        Ooohhh, despite all the computations
        You know you could just dance to the rock 'n' roll station

        All right, all right
        And it was all right
        oh, you listen to me now
        It was all right
        come on now, believe me
        It was all right, it was all right
        Hey, it's all right, hey, it's all right
        hey, it's all right now, hey, it's all right now
        Hey, it's all right, hey, it's all right, now
        hey, it's all right now, hey, it's all right now
        Oh baby, oh baby
        oh baby, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah
        Now it's all right now, ooohhh, it's all right now
        oh, all right, all right now

==================================================
"Rock And Roll"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)
* soundboard recording

box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)
* audience recording

Nov 25, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' happening at all

        Then one fine mornin', she put on a New York station
        she didn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        It took no computation
        to dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        yeah, it was all right

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well baby, they ain't help me at all

        Then one fine morning, she heard a New York station
        she didn't believe, hey, what you heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right
        here she comes now

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' happening at all

        One, one fine mornin', she heard a New York station
        she didn't believe, hey, what you heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        It took no computation
        to dance to a rock 'n' roll station

        It was all right
        it was all right
        It was all right, it was all right
        it was all right, it was all right

============================
"Rock 'N' Roll"
============================
album _Rock 'N' Roll Animal_
(Lou Reed, 1974)

Dec 21, 1973
The Academy of Music, NYC
============================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        One fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        and she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine fine fine music
        ooohhh, her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        hey baby, rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right
        hey babe

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Two TV sets, two Cadillac cars
        ah, hey, ain't help me nothin' at all
        not at all

        One fine morning, she heard on a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        not at all

        Despite the amputation
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        It was all right
        it was all right
        oh, now here she comes now-now

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Yeah, every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        Then one fine morning, she put on a New York station
        and she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        ah, her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to the rock 'n' roll station

        It's all right, all right
        all right, all right
        All right, it's all right
        all right, all right
        Baby, baby
        baby, baby, ooohhh

        {C}{F}{C}{F}     (- all right, it was all right, hey babe)

* guitar (tab 1)

     {C}
 1e --------------------------------------
 2B --------------------------------------
 3G --------5--------5--------5--5-x-x-x--
 4D --------5--5h6h7-5--------5--5-x-x-x--
 5A --5h6h7-------------5h6h7-------------
 6E --------------------------------------

 {A#}
--------------------------------------
--------------------------------------
--------3--x-x-3-x--x-x-x-x--x-x-x-x--   ...
--------3--x-x-3-x--x-x-x-x--x-x-x-x--
--3h4h5-------------------------------
--------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







=======================
"Rock And Roll"
=======================
album _Live In Italy_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

Sep 07 (or 10), 1983
Verona (or Rome), Italy
=======================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there's nothin' happening at all
        Every time she puts on the radio
        nobody's doin' it at all

        One fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        then can't believe what heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine, to fine
        her life was saved by rock, rock
        baby, rock 'n' roll, yeah

        Despite all the amputations
        you can dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        It's all right
        it's all right

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        her parents are gonna be the death of us all
        Two TV sets, two Cadillac cars
        it ain't gonna help us at all

        One fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        then couldn't believe what heard at all
        She started dancin', dancin', dancin', to that, to fine
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll, roll
        baby, and you're rockin'

        Despite all the amputations
        you can dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        It's all right, babe
        it's all right now
        here she comes

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        nothin' happening at all
        Every time I put on the radio
        nobody's doin' it at all, baby

        One fine mornin', puts on a New York station
        then couldn't believe what she heard at all
        ooohhh-wheee, baby
        She started dancin' to that music
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you can dance to a rock 'n' roll station

        And it's all right
        Baby, don't you know it's all right
        ooohhh-wheee, baby
        Baby, hey, it's all right
        ....
        Baby, everything is all right
        ....
        All right

(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)

==============================
"Rock And Roll"
(original version)
==============================
album _Another View_
(The Velvet Underground, 1986)

Jun 19, 1969
Record Plant Studios, NY
==============================


        Jennie said when she was just five years old
        there was nothing happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothing going on at all

        Then one fine morning, she put on the New York station
        she didn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock and roll

        The good Lord computation
        to dance to a rock and roll station
        It was all right, babe, ahh
        now it was all right

        Jennie said when she was just five years old
        you know her parents agreed to the death of us all
        Two TV sets and two cadillacs cars
        well, you know, baby, it's not gonna help us at all

        Then one fine morning, she put on the New York station
        she didn't believe, baby, what she heard at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock and roll

        In spite of amputation
        she could dance to a rock and roll station
        And it was all right, hey babe
        now it was all right
        here she comes now

        Jennie said when she was just five years old
        there was nothing happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothing going down at all

        Then one fine morning, she put on the New York station
        she didn't believe what she heard at all
        Oh, she started dancing to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock and roll

        The good Lord computation
        to dance to a rock and roll station

        It was all right
        It was all right
        It was all right
        It was all right, all right
        All right, all right
        All right, all right
        All right, all right
        All right, all right
        All right, all right
        ...

 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)

==============================
"Rock 'N' Roll"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        Jenny said when she's just five years old
        you know nothin' happenin' at all
        Every time she puts on the radio
        nobody's doin' it at all

        One fine mornin', puts on a New York station
        can't believe what she heard at all
        Started dancin' to that fine fine fine fine music
        her life's saved by rock 'n' roll
        rock 'n' roll

        Despite your amputation
        you can dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        don't you know that
        It's all right
        ooohhh, it's all right

        Jenny said when she's just five years old
        you know my parents are gonna be the death of us all
        Two TV sets, two Cadillac cars are
        you know the only thing gonna help us at all

        One fine mornin', puts on a New York station
        can't believe what she heard at all
        She started dan-dan-dan-dancin', dancin' to the music
        her life's saved by rock 'n' roll
        rock 'n' roll

        Despite all your complications
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        don't you know
        It's all right
        it's all right

        Jenny said when she's just five years old
        you know nothing's happenin' at all
        Every time I put on the radio
        nobody's doin' it at all

        Now one fine mornin', puts on a New York station
        I can't believe what I heard at all
        Ah, she started dan-dan-dan-dancin' to the music
        her life's saved by rock 'n' roll
        hey, yeah, by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        well, you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station

        Oh, ah
        Baby-baby-baby, don't you know it's all right
        Hey-hey-hey, don't you know it's all right
        Baby, don't you know, yeah, baby
        baby, just all, it's just all right
        All right, all right, all right, all right
        Ooohhh-wheee, ooohhh-wheee, ooohhh-wheee-ooohhh-wheee
        hey, baby
        Ooohhh-wheee, baby, ooohhh-wheee
        Ooohhh, ooohhh, ooohhh, ooohhh, baby
        ooohhh-wheee
        All right, now, all right, now
        All right, now, all right, now
        Baby-baby-babe, baby-baby-babe
        It's all right now, it's all right now
        it's all right now, it's a-a-a-a-all right now
        It's all right now, it's all right now
        it's all-all-all-all-all, a-a-a-a-all right

=====================================
"Rock And Roll"
(full-length version)
=====================================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr-Jul 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she puts on the radio
        there was nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        Then one fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        you know she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started shakin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you know you could just go out
        and dance to the rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right, hey baby, you know
        it was all right

        Jenny said when she was just about five years old
        you know my parents are gonna be the death of us all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well, you know ain't gonna help me at all
        not just you ....

        Then one fine morning, she turns on a New York station
        she doesn't believe what she hears at all
        Ooohhh, she started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yeah, rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the computations
        you could just dance to that rock 'n' roll station
        And baby, it was all right
        hey, it was all right
        hey, here she comes now

        Oh, jump-jump

        Like Jenny said when she was just about five-five years old
        hey, you know there's nothin' happening at all
        not at all
        Every time I put on the radio
        you know there's nothin' goin' down at all
        not at all

        But one fine morning, she hears a New York station
        she doesn't believe what she heard at all
        hey, not at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        you know, her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yes, rock 'n' roll

        Ooohhh, despite all the computations
        You know you could just dance to the rock 'n' roll station

        All right, all right
        And it was all right
        oh, listen to me now
        It was all right
        come on now, believe me
        It was all right, it was all right
        Hey, it's all right, hey, it's all right
        hey, it's all right now, hey, it's all right now
        Hey, it's all right, hey, it's all right, now
        hey, it's all right now, hey, it's all right now
        Oh baby, oh baby
        oh baby, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah
        Now it's all right now, ooohhh, it's all right now
        oh, all right, all right now



* chords: same as _Loaded_ version

=====================================
"Rock And Roll"
(demo)
=====================================
album _Loaded - Fully Loaded Edition_
(The Velvet Underground, 1997)

Apr 15, 1970
Atlantic Recording Studios, NYC
=====================================


        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' happening at all

        And one fine mornin', she put on a New York station
        she didn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the computations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        there was nothin' happening at all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well, you know, baby, it's not gonna help us at all

        Then one fine morning, she put on a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite all your amputations
        she could dance to that rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right
        here she comes now

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        well, you know there was nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        there was nothin' going down at all

        One fine mornin', she put on a New York station
        she didn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        you know her life was saved by rock 'n' roll

        Despite the computation
        she could dance to the rock 'n' roll station

        It was all right
        It was all right
        It was all right
        it was all right
        It was all right



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        {D}

==========================================
"Rock "N" Roll"
==========================================
album _American Poet_
(Lou Reed, 2001)

Dec 26, 1972
Ultrasonic Recording Studio, Hempstead, NY
==========================================


        Now Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Every time she puts on the radio
        there's nothin' goin' down at all
        no, not at all

        Then one fine mornin', she puts on a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        not at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yeah rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right

        Now Jenny said when she was just about five years old
        you know my parents are gonna be the death of us all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well they're ain't gonna help us at all
        not at all

        Then one fine morning, she turns on a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she hears at all
        no, not at all
        she started dancing to that fine fine music
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        and rock 'n' roll

        Yeah, despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        And it was all right
        it was all right
        yeah now, here she comes

        Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Every time I put on the radio
        there's nothin' goin' down at all

        Then one fine morning, she heard a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancing to that fine fine music
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yeah rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station

        You can clap

        And it was all right
        And it was all right
        And it was all right
        And it was all right

        And it's all right, all right
        all right, all right
        I said that baby, yeah baby
        well now baby, well now baby
        I said it's all right, it's all right
        it was all right, it's all right
        alright



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone (basic)

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



* Lou Reed's tuning (6th string = C)

 1d -----
 2A -----
 3F -----
 4C -----
 5G -----
*6C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone



* slide guitar player's tuning (2nd string = A#)

 1d -----
*2A#----- * uptuned a half-tone
 3F -----
 4C -----
 5G -----
 6D -----

        {G6}{G6}{D}{D}

        {D}
        {D}{C6}{G6}{D}    (Every time she puts on the radio ...)
        {D}               (- all)
        {D}{C6}{G6}{D}    (Then one fine mornin', she puts on a ...)
        {D}               (- all)
        {D}{C6}{G6}{D}    (She started dancing to that ...)
        {D}               (- roll)

        {Em}{G}{A}{G}     (Despite all the amputations ...)
        {D7}{G}{D7}{G}    (- all right, it was all right)

guitar  {D}{D}{C6}{C6}    * twin guitar part
        {G6}{G6}{D}{D}

        ....

        {D7}{G}{D7}{G}    (- all right, it was all right ...)

        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {D}{G}{D}{G}

        {G6}{G6}{D}{D}

        ....

guitar  {D}{C6}{D}{C6}
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (You can clap)

        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- all right, And it was -)
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- all right, And it was -)
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- all right, And it was -)
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- all right, And it's -)

        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- all right, all right ...)
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- baby, yeah baby ...)
        {D}{C6}{D}{C6}    (- it's all right, it's all right ...)

note: tuning for slide play (2nd string = A#)

 *1d --/14v--/14v--/14v------------------------------

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

(The Matrix, San Francisco, 11-25-69)

box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 25, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California

========================================================
"Rock "N" Roll"
========================================================
album _American Poet Box: American Poet Special Edition_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

* Special Edition CD bonus track

Jul 15, 1972
Scala Cinema, Kings Cross, London
========================================================


        Now Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know my parents agreed to the death of us all
        Every time I put on the radio
        nothin' goin' down

        Every time I put on the radio
        you know there was nothin' goin' down at all
        Then one fine mornin', she heard a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all

        Despite the amputation
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        It was all right
        hey baby, it was all right

        Now Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know my parents agreed to the death of us all
        death of us all
        Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars
        well baby, ain't gonna help me at all
        no, not at all

        Then one fine morning, she heard a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        heard at all
        ......

        Despite all the amputations
        you could dance to a rock 'n' roll station
        It was all right
        hey, it was all right

        Now Jenny said when she was just five years old
        you know there's nothin' happening at all
        Every time she put on the radio
        nothin' goin' down at all
        no, not at all

        One fine mornin', she put on a New York station
        she couldn't believe what she heard at all
        She started dancin' to that fine fine music
        her life was saved by rock 'n' roll
        yeah, rock 'n' roll

        Despite all the amputations
        dance to a rock 'n' roll station




* chords: same as _American Poet_ version
They played using down-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone).

<PRE>
===========================
"Rock And Roll Heart"
===========================
album _Rock And Roll Heart_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
===========================


        I don't like opera and I don't like ballet
        and new wave French movies they just drive me away
        I guess I'm just dumb 'cause I know that I ain't smart
        but deep down inside I've got a rock and roll heart
        Yeah-yeah-yeah, deep down inside
        I've got a rock and roll heart

        Oh, rock and roll heart
        lookin' for a good time
        Just a rock and roll heart, roll heart, roll heart
        lookin' for a good time

        I don't like messages or something meant to say
        and I wish people like that would just go away
        I guess I'm just dumb 'cause I know I'm not smart
        but deep down inside I've got a rock and roll heart
        Yeah-yeah-yeah, deep down inside
        I've got a rock and roll heart

        Yeah, rock and roll heart
        searchin' for a good time
        Just a rock and roll heart, roll heart, roll heart
        lookin' for a good time

        Yeah, just a rock and roll heart
        lookin' for a good time
        Just a rock and roll heart, roll heart, yeah, roll heart
        lookin' for a good time, yeah now

        Yeah, I've got a rock and roll heart
        searchin' for a good time
        Got a rock and roll heart
        searchin' for a good time
        Just a rock and roll heart
        yeah, searchin' for a good time
        Yeah, got a rock and roll heart
        yeah, now-now searchin' for a good time
        Let me hear you now
        oh, hear you now



intro   {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}
        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/
        {C}{C}

        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (I don't like opera and ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (- guess I'm just dumb ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}             (- deep down inside I got a ...)

        {C/F}{G}{C/F}{G}       (- roll heart, lookin' for a ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{G}{G}     (- roll heart, roll heart, roll ...)

guitar  {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/
        {C}{C}

        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (I don't like messages or ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (- guess I'm just dumb ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}             (- deep down inside I got a ...)

        {C/F}{G}{C/F}{G}       (- roll heart, searchin' for a ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{G}{G}     (- roll heart, roll heart, roll ...)

        {C/F}{G}{C/F}{G}       (- roll heart, lookin' for a ...)
        {C/Bm}{Am/F}{G}{G}     (- roll heart, roll heart, yeah ...)

guitar  {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (Yeah, got a rock 'n' -)

        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (- roll heart, searchin' for a ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (- roll heart, yeah, searchin' ...)
        {F/C}{G/C}{F/C}{G/C}   (oh, hear you now)
        ... fade out

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<TITLE>Rock And Roll Music</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
==================================================
"Rock And Roll Music"
==================================================
unreleased live
(Various Artists, 1987)

written by Chuck Berry

performed by:
Paul Simon, Bruce Springsteen, Billy Joel,
Lou Reed (background vocals), James Taylor, Dion,
Debbie Harry, Grace Jones, Ruben Blades,
Ladysmith Black Mambazo, Chevy Chase,
Lorne Michaels, Jon Lovitz,
Paul Schaefer and The World's Most Dangerous Band,
Bil Cosby, Laurie Anderson, Chaka Khan,
Whoopi Goldberg and more

Dec 13, 1987
Madison Square Garden, NYC
(Homeless Children's Medical Benefit Concert)
==================================================


        Just let me hear some of that rock and roll music
        any old way you choose it
        It's got a back beat you can't lose it
        well any old time you use it
        It's gotta be rock and roll music
        Well if you wanna dance with me
        yeah, if you wanna dance with me


        I took my love on over across the tracks
        so she ....... heard a man a-wailin' sax
        I got said they had a rockin band
        well they were blowing like a hurricane

        And ...... playing that rock and roll music
        any old way you choose it
        It's got a back beat you can't lose it
        any old time you use it
        It's gotta be rock and roll music
        Well if you wanna dance with me
        if you wanna dance with me

        I got no kick against modern jazz
        unless you try to play it too darn fast
        I lose the beauty of a melody
        until it sounds just like a symphony

        That's why I go for that rock and roll music
        any old way you choose it
        It's got a back beat you can't lose it
        any old time you use it
        It's gotta be rock and roll music
        If you wanna dance with me
        if you wanna dance with me

        And Way down south they gave a jubilee
        and Georgia folks, they had a jamboree
        They're drinking home brew from a wooden cup
        the folks dancing got all shook up

        And started playing that rock and roll music
        any old way you choose it
        It's got a back beat you can't lose it
        any old time you use it
        It's gotta be rock and roll music
        If you wanna dance with me
        if you wanna dance with me
        If you wanna dance with me
        if you wanna dance with me



              {E}{E}     (Just let me hear some of that -)

chorus  {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- rock and roll music, any old way ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (- back beat you can't lose it ...)
        {E}{E}           (- gotta be rock and roll music, Well -)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- if you wanna dance with me ...)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (- across the tracks, so she ...)
        {D}{D}{E}{E}     (- rockin band, well they were blowing ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- rock and roll music, any old way ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (- back beat you can't lose it ...)
        {E}{E}           (- gotta be rock and roll music, Well -)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (- if you wanna dance with me ...)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (- modern jazz, unless you try to play ...)
        {D}{D}{E}{E}     (- melody, until it sounds just like a ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- rock and roll music, any old way ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (- back beat you can't lose it ...)
        {E}{E}           (- gotta be rock and roll music)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (If you wanna dance with me ...)

sax     {E}{E}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{E}{E}

sax     {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {D}{D}{A}{A}
        {E}{E}
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (And Way down south they gave a -)

        {E}{E}{A}{A}     (- jubilee, and Georgia folks ...)
        {D}{D}{E}{E}     (- wooden cup, the folks dancing got ...)

chorus  {A}{A}{A}{A}     (- rock and roll music, any old way ...)
        {D}{D}{A}{A}     (- back beat you can't lose it ...)
        {E}{E}           (- gotta be rock and roll music)
        {E}{A}{E}{A}     (If you wanna dance with me ...)
        {E}{A}{E}{A...   (If you wanna dance with me ...)

<TITLE>Rock Minuet</TITLE>

<PRE>
===================
"Rock Minuet"
===================
album _Ecstasy_
(Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Paralyzed by hatred and a piss ugly soul
        if he murdered his father, he thought he'd become whole
        While listening at night to an old radio
        where they danced to the rock minuet

        In the gay bars in the back of the bar
        he consummated hatred on a cold sawdust floor
        While the jukebox played backbeats, he sniffed coke off a jar
        while they danced to a rock minuet

        School was a waste, he was meant for the street
        but school was the only way, the army could be beat
        The two whores sucked his nipples 'til he came on their feet
        as they danced to the rock minuet

        He dreamt that his father was sunk to his knees
        his leather belt tied so tight that it was hard to breathe
        And the studs from his jacket were as cold as a breeze
        as he danced to a rock minuet

        He pictured the bedroom where he heard the first cry
        his mother on all fours, ah, with his father behind
        And her yell hurt so much, he had wished he'd gone blind
        and rocked to a rock minuet

        In the back of the warehouse were a couple of guys
        they had tied someone up and sewn up their eyes
        And he got so excited he came on his thighs
        when they danced to the rock minuet

        On Avenue B, someone cruised him one night
        he took him in an alley and then pulled a knife
        And thought of his father, as he cut his windpipe
        and finally danced to the rock minuet

        In the curse of the alley, the thrill of the street
        on the bitter cold docks where the outlaws all meet
        In euphoria drug in euphoria heat
        you could dance to the rock minuet

        In the thrill of the needle and anonymous sex
        you could dance to the rock minuet

        So when you dance hard, slow dancing
        when you dance hard, slow dancing
        When you dance hard, slow dancing
        when you dance to the rock minuet




intro   /x.E.E}        guitar
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (Paralyzed by hatred and a piss ugly ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- listening at night to an old radio ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (In the gay bars in the back of the bar ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- jukebox played backbeats, he sniffed ...)
        {E}{E}         (- minuet)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- whores sucked his nipples 'til he ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- studs from his jacket were as cold as ...)

        {E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- yell hurt so much, he had wished he'd ...)

        {E}{E}         (In the -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- got so excited he came on his thighs ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- thought of his father, as he cut his ...)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}   (- dance hard, slow dancing, when you ...)

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








===========================================
"Rock Minuet"
===========================================
album _Berlin: Live At St. Ann's Warehouse_
(Lou Reed, 2008)

Dec 15 (or 16), 2006
St. Ann's Warehouse, Brooklyn, NY
===========================================


        Paralyzed by hatred and a piss ugly soul
        if he murdered the old man, he thought he'd become whole
        While listening at night to an old radio
        where they danced to the rock minuet

        In the gay bars in the back of the bar
        he consummated hatred on a cold sawdust floor
        While the jukebox played backbeats, he sniffed coke off a jar
        while they danced to a rock minuet

        School was a waste, he was meant for the street
        but school was the only way that the army could be beat
        The two whores sucked his nipples 'til he came on their feet
        as they danced to the rock minuet

        He dreamt that the old man was sunk to his knees
        the leather belt tied so tight that it was hard to breathe
        And the studs from his jacket were as cold as a breeze
        as he danced to a rock minuet

        He pictured the bedroom where he heard the first cry
        Mama on all fours, with daddy behind
        And her yell hurt so much, he had wished he'd gone blind
        and rocked to a rock minuet

        In the back of the warehouse were a couple of guys
        they'd tied someone up and sewn up their eyes
        And he got so excited he came on his thighs
        when they danced to the rock minuet

        On Avenue B, someone cruised him one night
        he took him in an alley and then pulled a knife
        And he thought of the old man, as he cut his windpipe
        and finally danced to the rock minuet

        In the curse of the alley, the thrill of the street
        on the bitter cold docks where the outlaws all meet
        In euphoria drug in euphoria heat
        you could dance to the rock minuet

        In the thrill of the needle and anonymous sex
        you could dance to a rock minuet

        So when you dance hard, slow dancing
        when you dance hard, slow dancing
        When you dance hard, slow dancing
        when you dance to a rock minuet




* chords: same as _Ecstasy_ version




**********************************************************************
----------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Taco Veenstra (taco@tppveenstra.myweb.nl)
----------------------------------------------------------------------

They are the exact words he sings,
not just lyrics I copied from the booklet.



Rock minuet
-------------
Paralyzed by hatred and a piss ugly soul
If he murdered his father he thought he'd become whole
While listening at night to an old radio
Where they danced to the rock minuet

In the gay bars in the back of the bar
He consummated hatred on a cold sawdust floor
While the jukebox played backbeats
He sniffed coke off a jar
While they danced to a rock minuet

School was a waste he was meant for the street
But school was the only way the army could be beat
The two whores sucked his nipples until he came on their feet
As they danced to the rock minuet

He dreamt that his father was sunk to his knees
His leather belt tied so tight that it was hard to breathe
And the studs from his jacket were as cold as a breeze
As he danced to a rock minuet

He pictured the bedroom where he heard the first cry
His mother on all fours, aah, with his father behind
And her yell hurt so much, he had wished he'd gone blind
And rocked to a rock minuet

In the back of the warehouse were a couple of guys
They had tied someone up and sewn up their eyes
And he got so excited he came on his thighs
When they danced to the rock minuet

On Avenue B someone cruised him one night
He took him in an alley and then pulled a knife
And thought of his father, as he cut his windpipe
And finally danced to the rock minuet

In the curse of the alley the thrill of the street
On the bitter cold docks
Where the outlaws all meet
In euphoria drug in euphoria heat
You could dance to the rock minuet
In the thrill of the needle and anonymous sex
You could dance to the rock minuet

So when you dance hard, slow dancing
When you dance hard, slow dancing
When you dance hard, slow dancing
When you dance to the rock minuet

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
