<PRE>
===================
"Sick Of You"
===================
album _New York_
(Lou Reed, 1989)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        I was up in the morning with the TV blarin'
        brush my teeth sittin' watchin' the news
        All the beaches were closed the ocean was a Red Sea
        but there was no one there to part it in two
        There was no fresh salad
        'cause there's hypos in the cabbage
        Staten Island disappeared at noon
        And they say the Midwest is in great distress
        and NASA blew up the moon

        The ozone layer has no ozone anymore
        and you're gonna leave me for the guy next door
        I'm sick of you
        I'm sick of you

        They arrested the mayor for an illegal favor
        sold the Empire State to Japan
        And Oliver North married William Secord
        and gave birth to a little Teheran
        And the Ayatollah bought a nuclear warship
        if he dies he wants to go out in style
        And there's nothing to eat that don't carry the stink
        of some human waste dumped in the Nile

        Well one thing is certainly true
        no one here knows what to do
        And I'm sick of you
        I'm sick of you

        The radio said there were 400 dead
        in some small town in Arkansas
        Some whacked out trucker drove into a nuclear reactor
        and killed everybody he saw
        Now he's on Morton Downey and he's glowing and shining
        doctors say this is a medical advance
        They say the bad makes the good
        and there's something to be learned
        in every human experience

        Well I know one thing that really is true
        this here's a zoo and the keeper ain't you
        And I'm sick of it
        I'm sick of you

        They ordained the Trumps and then he got the mumps
        and died being treated at Mt. Sinai
        And my best friend Bill died from a poison pill
        some wired doctor prescribed for stress
        My arms and legs are shrunk, the food all has lumps
        they discovered some animal no one's ever seen
        It was an inside trader eating a rubber tire
        after running over Rudy Giuliani

        They say the president's dead, no one can find his head
        it's been missing now for weeks
        But no one noticed it, he had seemed so fit
        and I'm Sick of it

        I'm sick of you
        I'm so sick of you
        bye-bye-bye

        Bye, bye, bye

        {G}{G}{D}{D}   (The ozone layer has no ozone anymore ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (- sick of you, I'm sick of you, They -)

        ....

        side-side-side-side-side-side-side ways
        Hey just like

        Si-Si-Si-Sister Ray says

* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



* chord progression pattern #1 (basic)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}




* chord progression pattern #2

        {A}{A/G.D}{A}{A/G.D}




* chord progression pattern #3

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}




* chord progression pattern #4

        {A}{D}{A}{D}




* chord progression pattern #5

        {A.G#/A}{A.G#/A}{A.G#/A}{A.G#/A}




* chord progression pattern #6

        {A.A#/A.G#}{A.A#/A.G#}{A.A#/A.G#}{A.A#/A.G#}




* chord progression pattern #7

        {A}{A}{A}{A.G/G.G#}




* chord progression pattern #8

        {A}{A.C/C}{G}{G.D/D}




* chord progression pattern #9

        {A/C}{G/D}{A/C}{G/D}

        {A}{C}{D/C}{A}
and 
        {A}{C}{D/C.G}{A}


* chord progression pattern #11 (ending)

        {A7}{A7}{A7}{A7}

     {A}             {A}

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Hans De Backer (hans.debacker@student.kuleuven.ac.be)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

"Duck and Sally" in Sister Ray should be "Doc and Sally".
At least, that's what the Peel Slowly booklet says.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Rhapsodist912 (Rhapsodist912@aol.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

On the first disc of the Quine Tapes
the sister ray opening lyrics are as follows: 

This is a story about somebody named Duck and Sally, Cecil,
Miss Rosie and Miss Rayon
and other assorted friends of ours,
and the late dearly lamented,
sadly deceased and quite demented Sister Ray


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Rhapsodist912 (Rhapsodist912@aol.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


On the version of the Quine Tapes on Disc 3 of Sister Ray
Reed's introduction goes like this:


This is gonna go on for a while,
This is a story about a person we know in New York,
And her name is Sister Ray,
Very, very good friend of ours,
Sister Ray has a very peculiar occupation,
And because of that has certain, occupational hazards,
And so this song's about what happens down in the street,
Which I'm sure you're all familiar with,
There are five characters in this song,
Duck, Sally, Cecil, a sailor, a booster, and Sister Ray,
Down on the Lower East Side,
Just sitting around, gettin' it on,
gettin' it together


---------------------------------------------------------------------

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
=============================
"Slip Away" (A Warning)
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        Friends have said to lock the door
        and have an open house no more
        they said the Factory must change
        And slowly slip away

        But if I have to live in fear
        where will I get my ideas
        with all those crazy people gone
        Will I slowly slip away

        Still there's no more Billy Name
        Ondine is not the same
        Wonton and the Turtle gone
        Slowly slip away
        slowly slip away

        If I close the Factory door
        and don't see those people anymore
        if I give in to infamy
        I'll slowly slip away

        I know it seems that friends are right
        hello daylight, goodbye night
        but starlight is so quiet here
        Think I'll slowly slip away

        What can I do by myself
        it's good to here from someone else
        it's good to hear a crazy voice
        Will not slip away
        will not slip away

        If I have to live in fear
        my ideas will slowly slip away

        If I have to live in fear
        I'm afraid my life will slip away

        If you can't see me past my door
        why your thoughts could slowly slip away

        If I have to lock the door
        another life exists no more slip away

        Friends have said to lock the door
        watch out for what comes through the door
        they said the Factory must change

        But I don't




intro   {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}

        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (Friends have said to lock the door ...)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- away, But -)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- if I have to live in fear ...)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- slip away)

        {F}{A#}{Cm}{Cm7}   (Still there's no more Billy Name ...)
        {F}{F}{F}{F}       (- away, slowly slip away)

        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}

        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (If I close the Factory door ...)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- away, I -)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- know it seems that friends are ...)
        {D}{Dsus2}{G}{G}   (- away)

        {F}{A#}{Cm}{Cm7}   (What can I do by myself ...)
        {F}{F}{F}{F}       (- away, will not slip away)

        {F}{A#}{F}{F}      (If I have to live in fear ...)
        {F}{A#}{F}{F}      (If I have to live in fear ...)
        {F}{A#}{F}{F/A#}   (If you can't see me past my door ...)
        {F}{A#}{F}{F}      (If I have to lock the door ...)

        {D}{Dsus2}{G...    (Friends have said to lock the door ...)
                           (But I don't)

 3G ---2---

<PRE>
=============================
"Smalltown"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        When you're growing up in a small town
        when you're growing up in a small town
        when you're growing up in a small town
        you say no one famous ever came from here

        When you're growing up in a small town
        and you're having a nervous breakdown
        and you think that you'll never escape it
        yourself or the place that you live

        Where did Picasso come from
        there's no Michelangelo coming from Pittsburgh
        if art is the tip of the iceberg
        I'm the part sinking below

        When you're growing up in a small town
        bad skin, bad eyes, gay and fatty
        people look at you funny
        when you're in a small town

        My father worked in construction
        it's not something for which I'm suited
        oh, what is something for which you are suited?
        getting out of here

        I hate being odd in a small town
        if they stare let them stare in New York City
        at this pink-eyed painting albino
        how far can my fantasy go?

        I'm no Dali coming from Pittsburgh
        no adorable lisping Capote
        my hero, oh do you think I could meet him?
        I'd camp out at his front door

        There's only one good thing about a small town
        there's only one good use for a small town
        there's only one good thing about a small town
        you know that you want to get out

        When you're growing up in a small town
        you know you'll grow down in a small town
        there's only one good use for a small town

        You hate it and you'll know you have to leave




intro   {D}{D/                     (When you're -)

        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (- growing up in a small ...)

        {D/                        (When you're -)

        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (- growing up in a small ...)
        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (Where did Picasso come from ...)

        {D/

piano   {A/D}{G.A/D}{A/D}{G.A/D}

        {D/                        (When you're -)

        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (- growing up in a small ...)
        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (My father worked in ...)

        {D/

piano   {A/D}{G.A/D}{A/D}{G.A/D}

        {D/

        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (I hate being odd in a small ...)
        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (- Dali coming from ...)
        {D/G6}{A6/D}{D/G6}{A6/D}   (- one good thing about a ...)

        {D.

_Animal Serenade_ talking part:


first:


well, michael rathke,
that's mike rathke,
michael you're a guitar player
that's a piano
is that you doing that? would you stand up?
now, is that really you playing that man?
prove it

ok you know fernando is playing a bass that looks like a bass.
you're playing a guitar that sounds like piano.
so i've warned you nobody's playing it off stage
so we don't have any tapes off stage
we don't have any loops off stage
every fucking note you hear is us
right in front of you, you get it?
live, we're live, not note up my sleeve baby we don't have any.


second:

you know
as we traveled across the united states we're taking a survey
depending on when we're playing.
i can wonder your opinion about
i think you're from NY as the first place
so i mean so there's almost no point right
but just to complete my survey
which will be published in the biblical quaterly at washington,
so do you think this is a smalltown?
yes? and, no?
oh there you go
nice to know that's somebody from long island here
who'd drink the water.

<PRE>
===================================
"Smiles"
===================================
album _Growing Up In Public_
(Lou Reed, 1980)

written by Lou Reed/Michael Fonfara
===================================


        Smiles, I was taught never to smile
        I was told the stylish smiles of buffoonery
        chicanery and larceny abound

        My mom said unless someone sticks you right in front of a camera
        a smile is the last thing that you wanna do
        Those smiles, those mirthless toothy smiles

        Smiles, they all smile on TV
        The quizmaster with his withered crones
        the talkshow hosting movie stars, the politician licking feet

        The mugger, the rapist, the arsonic lover
        all smile out from the news, at one time or another
        Those smiles, those garish sickly smiles

        When I was young my mother said to me
        never, ever, let anyone see that you're happy

        Smiles, never, ever let them see you smile
        they'll always put you down
        With those smiles, never, ever let them see you smile
        they'll always put you down
        With your smiles, never, ever let them see you smile
        don't you know they'll make you go

        Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo)
        (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo
        doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo)



intro   {C}{C}{C}{C.(break)}

        {C}{F}{C}{C}            (Smiles, I was taught never to smile)
        {C}{F}{C}{C}            (- stylish smiles of buffoonery ...)

        {Em}{Dm}{Em}{F/G}       (My mom said unless someone sticks ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{C.(break)}    (- do, Those smiles, those ...)

        {C}{F}{C}{C}            (Smiles, they all smile on TV)
        {C}{F}{C}{C}            (The quizmaster with his withered ...)

        {Em}{Dm}{Em}{F/G}       (The mugger, the rapist ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{C}            (Those smiles, those garish sickly ...)

        {Em}{Dm}{Em}{G}         (When I was young my mother said to ...)
        {G}

piano   {C}{C}{F}{G}
        {C}{C}{F}{G}
guitar  {C}{C}{F}{G}
        {C}{C}{F}{G}
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (Smiles, never, ever let them see ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (- down, With those smiles, never ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (- down, With those smiles, never ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo ...)
        {C}{C}{F}{G}            (Doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo, doo ...)
        ... fade out




* intro
    {C}               {C}               {C}               {C.(break)}

     Smiles,      I was taught never to smile           I was told the -

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Detlef Juergens (detlef.juergens@nwn.de)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Maybe it helps.


Smiles

Smiles - I was taught never to smile
I was told the stylish smiles of buffoonery
chicanery and larcemy abound
My man said unless someone sticks you right in front of a camera
A smile is the last thing that you wanna do
Those smiles - those mirthless toothy smiles

Smiles - they all smile on T.V.
the quizmaster with his withered crones
The talk show hosting moviestars
the politician licking feet
The mugger, the rapist,
The arsonist lover
All smile out from the news
At one time or another
Those smiles - those garish, sickly smiles

When I was young my mother said to me -
"Never, ever, let anyone see that you're happy"
Smiles, never, ever let them see you smile -
They'll always put you down - with your smiles -
never, ever, let them see you smile -
Don't you know, they'll make you go:
Doo doo doo doo doo doo doo doo
Doo doo doo doo doo doo doo doo
Doo


-------------------------------------------------------------------------
*************************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*************************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>

<TITLE>Sneaky Pete</TITLE>

<PRE>
==============================================
"Sneaky Pete"
==============================================
7" single B-side
(The Primitives, 1964)

written by
Lou Reed/Jimmie Sims/Jerry Vance/Terry Philips
==============================================



        please post lyrics to
        wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {G}{G/G.D}{G}{G/G.D}

        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    (I ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    (I ...)

        {F}{F}{G}{G/G.D}                (Everybody ...)
        {G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)

        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    ( ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    ( ...)

        {F}{F}{G}{G/G.D}                (Everybody's gonna put me down ...)
        {G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)

guitar  {G}{Gsus2}{G}{Gsus2}
        {G}{Gsus2}{G}{D}

        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    (I ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{C}                    (I ...)

        {F}{F}{G}{G/G.D}                (Everybody ...)
        {G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}{G/G.D}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)
        {G}{G/G.D}{G}{G/G.D}            (Sneaky Pete, yeah, yeah ...)
        {G}{G/G.D}{G}{G/G.D}            (oh, yeah, yeah, alright ...)
        {G}{G/G.D}{G}{G/G.D}            ( ...)
        ... fade out



* Gsus2 chord (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

*1d --------
*2A ---10---
*3F ---12---
*4C ---12---
*5G ---10---
*6D --------




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {F}{F/F.C}{F}{F/F.C}

        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  (I ...)
        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  (I ...)

        {D#}{D#}{F}{F/F.C}              (Everybody ...)
        {F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)

        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  ( ...)
        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  ( ...)

        {D#}{D#}{F}{F/F.C}              (Everybody's gonna put me down ...)
        {F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)

guitar  {F}{Fsus2}{F}{Fsus2}
        {F}{Fsus2}{F}{C}

        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  (I ...)
        {F}{F}{A#}{A#}                  (I ...)

        {D#}{D#}{F}{F/F.C}              (Everybody ...)
        {F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}{F/F.C}    (Sneaky Pete, Sneaky Pete ...)
        {F}{F/F.C}{F}{F/F.C}            (Sneaky Pete, yeah, yeah ...)
        {F}{F/F.C}{F}{F/F.C}            (oh, yeah, yeah, alright ...)
        {F}{F/F.C}{F}{F/F.C}            ( ...)
        ... fade out



* Fsus2 chord (standard-tuning)

 1e --------
 2B ----8---
 3G ---10---
 4D ---10---
 5A ----8---
 6E --------

<TITLE>So Alone</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================================
"So Alone"
===================================
album _Growing Up In Public_
(Lou Reed, 1980)

written by Lou Reed/Michael Fonfara
===================================


        She calls on the phone
        she says she doesn't want to be alone
        She says it's making her neurotic
        but please don't mistake it for being erotic

        So alone, so all alone

        She says let's go for a walk
        we'll have a drink and maybe we will talk
        And he thinks she has possibilities
        if she could just put away her rosary

        So alone, nobody wants to be alone

        But I just didn't know
        I swear to you, I just didn't know
        I would never make you sad
        if I had known I never would have
        said those things to you
        you have to be crazy to say those things to you

        Let's face it I made a mistake
        well you know, fools rush in where angels take a break
        I can't be smart all of the time
        and anyway I didn't know you were making time over him

        To tell you the truth, I forget all about him

        And you know, I don't think it's nice
        asking one man about another man's vice
        I don't care if you pick my head
        as long as we end up in bed

        Alone, just the two of us alone

        I just didn't know
        I swear to God, I just didn't know
        Can't you understand that it's frightening
        when you hear women talking about castrating and hating men
        who wants to know about how you hate men

        Well, you said now you wanted to dance
        so now we're going to dance
        You said that you weren't complete
        but we're going to put you on your feet
        You said that you were very vexed
        you told me to forget about sex
        You said you liked me for my mind
        well, I really love your behind

        Oh, get up and boogie, oh baby, get up and dance
        Oh, get, get, get, get up and boogie, baby, oh, get up and dance
        Shake your booty, mama, oh, get up and dance

        Your points very clear
        you're not one to cry into your beer
        Why don't we go to my place
        believe me, I'm very chaste

        And I'm so alone, ao all alone

        Sure all men are beasts
        hey, look, I'll sit here quietly and I'll stare at my feet
        I don't blame you for taking umbrage
        with animals staring at your cleavage

        So alone, we're so all alone

        Hey, do you mind if I turn out the light
        don't take offense, but why don't you spend the night
        I know your passions run very deep
        but at this point we both need sleep

        So alone, and who wants to be alone



        /x.D}
        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (She calls on the phone ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (She says it's making her ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (So alone, so all alone)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (She says let's go for a walk ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (And he thinks she has ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (So alone, nobody wants to be ...)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (But I just didn't know ...)
        {G/D}{D/Em}                     (I would never make you sad ...)
        {D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am}        (- things to you, You have ...)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (Let's face it I made a ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (I can't be smart all of the ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (To tell you the truth ...)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (And you know, I don't think ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (I don't care if you pick my ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (Alone, just the two of us alone)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (I just didn't know, I swear ...)
        {G/D}{D/Em}                     (Can't you understand that ...)
        {D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am}        (- and hating men, who wants ...)

        {C}{C/{D/Am}{D/Am}
        {C}{C}{D/Am}{D/Am}

        {F/Am}{Am/F}{F/Am}{Am/F}        (Well, you said now you ...)
        {F/Am}{Am/F}{F/Am}{Am/F}        (You said that you were very ...)

        {A#m}{A#m/D#m}{A#m}{A#m/D#m}    (Oh, get up and boogie ...)
        {A#m}{A#m/D#m}                  (Shake your booty, mama ...)

        {D}{D}

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (Your points very clear ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (Why don't we go to my place ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (And I'm so alone, ao all alone)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (Sure all men are beasts ...)
        {Em}{A}                         (I don't blame you for ...)

        {A/D}{A/D}{A/D}{A/D}            (So alone, we're so all alone)

        {G}{D}{D}{Em}                   (Hey, do you mind if I turn ...)
        {G/D}{D/Em}                     (I know your passions run ...)
        {D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am}{D/Am...      (So alone, and who wants to ...)

        {D/Am...




***************************************************************************

<TITLE>So Blue</TITLE>

<PRE>
=========================================================
"So Blue"
=========================================================
7" single B-side
(The Jades, 1958)

album _Rockin' On Broadway - The Time, Brent, Shad Story_
(Various Artists, 2000)

7" EP "All Tomorrow's Dance Parties"
(Lewis Reed/The Jades, 2000)

written by Phil Harris/Lewis Reed

performed by The Jades (The Shades)
=========================================================


        Walked down in your house last night
        see if you were home
        Found out that you'd gone out
        and I was all alone

        So blue, (so blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue, so blue) so
        (cryin' over you)

        Went to the candy store
        but you weren't there
        Somehow I knew deep down
        that you weren't there

        So blue, (so blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue)

        Why did I have to go and stop
        your love
        Why hadn't I been true
        and all attentive to you

        Sometime when days are gone
        and memories have past
        I will recall our love
        one that didn't last

        So blue, (so blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue, so blue)

        (So blue, so blue)

        I will recall our love
        one that didn't last

        So blue, (so blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue) so blue (so blue)
        I'm always cryin' over you
        (So blue) so blue (so blue)
        ... repeat and fade out



intro   {G}{Em}{C}{D}
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (woo, wah, woo, wah)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (Walked down in your house last time ...)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (Found out that you'd gone out ...)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (So blue, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (- you, cryin' over you)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (Whet to the candy store, ...)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (Somehow I knew deep down ...)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (So blue, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{C}{G}{G}    (- you, cryin' over you)

bridge  {C}{D}{G}{G}    (Why did I have to go and stop, your love)
        {C}{C}{Am}{D}   (Why hadn't I been true ...)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (Sometime when days are gone ...)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (I will recall our love ...)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (So blue, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (- you)

sax.    {G}{Em}{C}{D}
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (So blue, so blue)

        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (I will recall our love ...)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (So blue, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (- you, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (- you, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        {G}{Em}{C}{D}   (- you, so blue, I'm always cryin' over -)
        ... fade out




*********************************************************************

thanks: Ondrej KLEPSA (walkonvu@post.cz)

Walk down to your house last night

i have noticed your lyrics for so blue are a bit patchy
here is my own ears version taken from the Rockin on Broadway album



So Blue
(the jades 1958)

Walked down your house last night,
See if you were home,
Found out that you'd gone out,
And I was all alone,

So blue (so blue), So blue (so blue),
I'm always crying over you (crying over you),

Went to the candy store,
But you weren't there,
Somehow i knew deep down,
That you weren't there,

So blue (so blue), So blue (so blue),
I'm always crying over you (so blue),

Why did I have to go and stop, your love,
Why hadn't I been true, and all attentive to you?,

Sometime when days are gone,
And memories have past,
I will recall our love,
One that didnt last,

So blue (so blue), So blue (so blue),
I'm always crying over you (so blue),

(So blue) (so blue),
(So blue) (so blue),
(So blue) (so blue),

I will recall our love,
One that didn't last,

So blue (so blue), So blue (so blue),
I'm always crying over you (so blue),

So blue (so blue),---------------------------------/ repeat and fade
I'm always crying over you (so blue),-------------/ two lines

<HEAD>
<TITLE>So Sad (To Watch Good Love Go Bad)</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================================
"So Sad (To Watch Good Love Go Bad)"
=============================================
box set _All The Young Dudes - The Anthology_
(Mott The Hoople, 1998)

written by Don Everly

Lou Reed: guitar, background vocals (?)

* 1972 studio demo
with Mott The Hoople/David Bowie

May 1972
Trident Studio, London
=============================================


        We used to have good times together
        But now I feel them slip away

        It makes me cry to see love die
        So sad to watch good love go bad

        Remember how you used to feel, dear
        You said nothing could change your mind

        It breaks my heart to see us part
        So sad to watch good love go bad

        Is it any wonder (that I feel so blue)
        When I know for certain that I'm losing you

        Remember how you used to feel, dear
        You said nothing could change your mind

        It breaks my heart to see us part
        So sad to watch good love go bad

        So sad to watch good love go bad



intro   {B}

        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (We used to have good times together)
        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (But now I feel them slip away)

        {E}{A}{E}{C#m}    (It makes me cry to see love die)
        {E}{A/B}{E}{B}    (So sad to watch good love go bad)

        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (Remember how you used to feel, dear)
        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (You said nothing could change your mind)

        {E}{A}{E}{C#m}    (It breaks my heart to see us part)
        {E}{A/B}{E}{E7}   (So sad to watch good love go bad)

bridge  {A}{F#m}{B}{E}    (Is it any wonder (that I feel so blue))
        {A}{F#m}{F#}{B}   (When I know for certain that I'm ...)

        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (Remember how you used to feel, dear)
        {E}{A}{F#m}{B}    (You said nothing could change your mind)

        {E}{A}{E}{C#m}    (It breaks my heart to see us part)
        {E}{A/B}{E}{E}    (So sad to watch good love go bad)
        {E}{A/B}{E...     (So sad to watch good love go bad)




*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

NEXT SONG
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Some Kinda Love</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
==============================
"Some Kinda Love"
(closet mix)
==============================
album _The Velvet Underground_
(The Velvet Underground, 1969)

box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

written by Lou Reed
==============================


        Some kinds of love
        ah, Marguerita told Tom
        Between thought and expression
        lies a lifetime
        Situations arise
        because of the weather
        And no kinds of love
        are better than others

        Some kinds of love
        ah, Marguerita told Tom
        Like a dirty French novel, ooohhh
        the absurd courts the vulgar
        And some kinds of love
        the possibilities are endless
        And for me to miss one
        would seem to be groundless
        mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-ta

        I heard what you said
        ah, Marguerita heard Tom
        And of course you're a bore
        but in that you're not charmless
        For a bore what is a straight line, ah
        that finds a wealth in division
        And some kinds of love, ooohhh
        are mistaken for vision
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta, ooohhh yeah

        Mmmm.. put jelly on your shoulder
        let us do what you fear most
        That from which you recoil, ooohhh
        but which still makes your eyes moist
        Ooohhh, put jelly on your shoulder
        lie down upon the carpet
        Between thought and expression
        let us now kiss the culprit
        mmmm.. la-la-ta-ta

        I don't know just what it's all about
        Ooohhh, put on your red pajamas and find out
        Mmmm.. oh, la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        Mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        Mmmm..



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro    x/A.E}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Between thought and expression ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Situations arise ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And no kinds of love ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Like a dirty French novel, ooohhh ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And for me to miss one ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-ta)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (I heard what you said ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And of course you're a bore ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (For a bore what is a straight ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And some kinds of love, ooohhh ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (-ta, ooohhh yeah, Mmmm.. put ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (- shoulder, let us do what you ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (- recoil, ooohhh,  but which ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (- shoulder, lie down upon the ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (- expression, let us now kiss the ...)
        {E}{E}               (-mmmm.. la-la-ta-ta)

bridge  {A/D}{G/D.A}{E}{E}   (I don't know just what it's all ...)
        {A/D}{G/D.A}         (- put on your red pajamas and find -)

coda    {E}{E}{E}{E}         (- out, Mmmm.. oh, la-dee-ta-ta-)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}         (-ta, Mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}         (-ta, Mmmm..)
        ... fade out



* Sterling's play (example, all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

     {E}               {E        / A        }
*1d ------0--------------2/4\2-0---0---0----
*2A -------------------------------2v--2v---
*3F --0h1----------------2/4\2-1------------   ...
*4C ----------------------------------------
*5G ----------------------------------------
*6D ----------------------------------------




* bridge (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

    I don't know just what it's all about
     {A      / D      } {G     /  D.A }
*1d -----------x-2------/7---7\---2--------
*2A --2---2----x-3------/8---8\---3-2v-----
*3F --2---2----x-2------/7---7\---2-2v-----   ...
*4C --2---2----x-0----------------0-2v-----
*5G --0---0-------------------------0------
*6D ---------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics



---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro    x/G.D}
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Between thought and expression ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Situations arise ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (And no kinds of love ...)

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Like a dirty French novel, ooohhh ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (And some kinds of love ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (And for me to miss one ...)

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (Mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-ta)

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (I heard what you said ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (And of course you're a bore ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (For a bore what is a straight ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (And some kinds of love, ooohhh ...)

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (-ta, ooohhh yeah, Mmmm.. put ...)

        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (- shoulder, let us do what you ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (- recoil, ooohhh,  but which ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (- shoulder, lie down upon the ...)
        {D}{D/G}{D}{D/G}     (- expression, let us now kiss the ...)
        {D}{D}               (-mmmm.. la-la-ta-ta)

        {G/C}{F/C.G}         (- put on your red pajamas and find -)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}         (-ta, Mmmm.. la-dee-ta-ta-)
        {D}{D}{D}{D}         (-ta, Mmmm..)
        ... fade out








==============================
"Some Kinda Love"
(Valentin mix, alternate take)
==============================
album _The Velvet Underground_
(The Velvet Underground, 1969)

* UK 1st edition LP (1969),
US reissue LP (1985), CDs
==============================


        Some kinda love
        ah, Marguerita told Tom
        Between thought and expression
        lies a lifetime
        Situations arise
        because of the weather
        And no kinds of love
        are better than others

        Some kinds of love
        ah, Marguerita told Tom
        Like a dirty French novel
        combines the absurd with the vulgar
        And some kinds of love
        the possibilities are endless
        And for me to miss one
        would seem to be groundless
        mmmm.. ah

        I heard what you said
        ah, Marguerita heard Tom
        And of course you're a bore
        but in that you're not charmless
        'Cause a bore what is a straight line, ah
        that finds a wealth in division
        And some kinds of love, ooohhh
        are mistaken for vision, la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        ooohhh, all right

        Put jelly on your shoulder
        let us do what you fear most, uh
        That from which you recoil
        but which still makes your eyes moist
        Put jelly on your shoulder, baby
        lie down upon the carpet
        Between thought and expression, ah
        let us now kiss the culprit, move it on
        uh, ha-ha..

        I don't know just what it's all about
        I'll tell you somethin'
        But put on your red pajamas and find out
        Mmmm.. ooohhh, now put it on
        Long-long time ....
        Mmmm.. ooohhh ...

 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

==================================================
"Some Kinda Love"
==================================================
album _1969 Velvet Underground Live With Lou Reed_
(The Velvet Underground, 1974)

Nov 1969
San Francisco, California
(intro part:
Oct 19, 1969
End of Cole Ave., Dallas, Texas)
==================================================


        Some kinds of love
        Marguerita told Tom
        Between thought and expression
        lies a lifetime
        Situations arise
        because of the weather
        And no kinds of love
        are better than others

        Some kinds of love
        now Marguerita told Tom
        Like a dirty French novel
        the absurd courts the vulgar
        And baby, some kinds of love
        the possibilities are endless
        And for me to miss one
        would seem to be groundless

        Well I heard what you said
        Marguerita heard Tom
        And of course you're a bore
        but in that you're not charmless
        Because a bore is a straight line
        that finds a wealth in division
        Some kinds of love
        are mistaken for vision, woh
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta

        Put jelly on your shoulder
        hey babe, lie down upon the carpet
        Let us do what you fear most
        but which still makes your eyes moist
        Woh, put jelly on your shoulder, ooohhh
        lie down upon the carpet
        Between thought and expression
        let us now kiss the culprit, wow
        Oh-woh-woh-oh
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta

        Woh, I don't know just what it's all about
        But put on your red pajamas, baby, and find out
        Woh, woh-woh
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        Woh-woh-woh-woh
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta

 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)

        Hey, some kinds of love
        Marguerita told Tom
        Between thought and expression
        lies a lifetime
        Situations arise
        because of the weather
        And no kinds of love
        are better than others

        now Marguerita told Tom
        Well of course, baby, you're a bore
        but at that you're not charmless
        Because a bore is a straight line
        finds a wealth in division
        And no kinds of love
        mistaken for vision
        la-dee-ta

        now Marguerita told Tom
        They turn to division
        woh baby, you're not charming
        Oh baby, now some kinda love

        And no kinds of love
        mistaken for vision

        oh baby, lie down upon the carpet
        Put jelly on your shoulder
        let's do what you fear most
        That from which you recoil
        but still makes your eyes moist
        Put jelly, baby, on your shoulder
        lie down, now baby, on the carpet, ooohhh
        Ooohhh-ooohhh, ooohhh
        ooohhh-ooohhh-ooohhh, ooohhh-ooohhh

        Well some kinds of love
        they're mistaken for vision

        Well I don't know, baby, what it's all about
        Woh little baby, why don't you come back
        hey, la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        Oh no Lord, ta-li-ta-li-sha
        oh now baby, la-dee-ta-ta
        Oh baby, la-dee-ta, la-ti-ta-ti-ta
        da-ti-da-ti-ta, la-ta-ta

==================================================
"Some Kinda Love"
(The Family Dog, San Francisco, 11-8-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Nov 08, 1969
The Family Dog, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Some kinds of love
        now Marguerita told Tom
        Between thought and expression
        lies a lifetime
        Now situations arise
        because of the weather
        And some kinds of love
        are better than others

        Some kinds of love
        now Marguerita told Tom
        Like a dirty French novel
        the absurd courts the vulgar
        And some kinds of love
        the possibilities are endless
        And for me to miss one
        would seem to be groundless

        Yeah, I heard what you said
        now Marguerita heard Tom
        And of course you're a bore
        but in that you're not charmless
        You know baby, a bore is a straight line
        that finds a wealth in division
        And baby, some kinds of love
        are mistaken for vision

        So put jelly on your shoulder
        hey babe, lie down upon the carpet
        Let us do what you fear most
        which still makes your eyes moist
        Put jelly on your shoulder
        babe, lie down upon the carpet
        Between thought and expression
        let us now kiss the culprit
        Oh-woh
        la-dee-ta-ta-ta

        Woh, I don't know just 'bout what it's all about
        Woh, put on your red pajamas, baby, and find out
        Oh, wow-wow-woh
        ooohhh la-dee-ta-ta-ta
        Oh woh-woh-woh now
        la-dee-la-dee-la-ta now, wow
        Wow-wow-wow-wow now
        la-dee-la-ta-ta



 the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



        {x}                  count
        /A.E}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Between thought and expression ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Now situations arise ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And some kinds of love ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Like a dirty French novel ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And some kinds of love ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And for me to miss one ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Yeah, I heard what you said ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And of course you're a bore ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (You know baby, a bore is a ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (And baby, some kinds of love ...)

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}

        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (So put jelly on your shoulder ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Let us do what you fear most ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Put jelly on your shoulder ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}     (Between thought and expression ...)
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E}       (Oh-woh, la-dee-ta-ta-ta)

bridge  {A/D}{G/D.A}{E}{E}   (Woh, I don't know just 'bout what ...)
        {A/D}{G/D.A}         (Woh, put on your red pajamas ...)

coda    {E/A}{E}{E/A}{E}     (- out, Oh, wow-wow-woh ...)
        {E/A}{E}{E/A}{E}     (-ta, Oh woh-woh-woh now ...)
        {E/A}{E}{E/A}{E}     (-ta now, wow, Wow-wow-wow-wow now ...)
        {E/A}{E...           (-ta)




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Just a minor correction for the lyrics of "Some Kinda Love".

In the second verse it's
"Like a dirty French novel/Combines the absurd with the vulgar"

and in the third verse it says
"'Cause a bore is a straight liner/That finds a wealth in division".


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Aaron (pulpalittlesoul@yahoo.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

just thought id throw in a correction or two.
in your lyric transcription
you have used the 'closet' mix of 'Some Kinda Love';
this would be fine for the rest of the album,
but that song is actually a different take,
and the lyrics in the 'clean' Valentin mix
(which is what most people have) are quite different.
Personally I prefer the Valentin version,
but perhaps you should include both the lyrics to the Valentin mix
and the 'closet' mix.
Here are the revised, correct lyrics
for the more common Valentin mix:



Some kinds of love
ah, Margarita told Tom
Between thought and expression
lies a lifetime
Situations arise
because of the weather
And no kinds of love
are better than others

Some kinds of love
Margarita told Tom
Like a dirty French novel
Combines the absurd with the vulgar
In some kinds of love
the possibilities are endless
And for me to miss one
would seem to be groundless

I heard what you said
ah, Margarita heard Tom
And of course you're a bore
but in that you're not charmless
'Cos a bore what is a straight liner
that finds a wealth in division
And some kinds of love, ooohhh
are mistaken for vision
la-dee-ta-ta-ta, ooohhh, all right

Put jelly on your shoulder
let us do what you fear most
That from which you recoil
but which still makes your eyes moist
Put jelly on your shoulder baby
lie down upon the carpet
Between thought and expression, uh
let us now kiss the culprit, move it on

I don't know just what it's all about
(I'll tell you something)
But put on your red pajamas and find out
Mmm, mmm, mmm
(Oooh, put it on
Long long time)


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>

<PRE>
==================================
"Some Kind Of Nature"
==================================
album _Plastic Beach_
(Gorillaz, 2010)

written by Gorillaz/Lou Reed

Lou Reed: vocal, additional guitar
==================================


        Some kind of nature, some kind of soul
        some kind of mixture, some kind of goal
        Some kind of majesty, some chemical load-load

        Some kind of metal made up from glue
        some kind of plastic I could wrap around you
        The needy eat man mades they wear phony clothes
        they sit with barbiturates
        until they grow old-old-old-old-old

        Some kind of nature, some kind of soul
        some kind of mixture, some kind of goal
        Some kind of majesty, some chemical load-load

        While me I love plastics and digital foils
        to wrap up the sound and protect the girls
        From the spiritual poison we expel at night
        like phony clothes but I really like might

        Some kind of nature
        some kind of nature, some kind of soul
        Come forth within us
        Oh lord forgive me
        some kind of mixture, some kind of goal
        It's gonna come and find us
        all we are is stars

        Some kind of metal made up from glue
        some kind of plastic I could wrap around you
        The needy eat man mades they wear phony clothes
        they sit with barbiturates
        until they grow old-old-old-old-old

        Some kind of nature
        some kind of nature, some kind of soul
        Come forth within us
        Oh lord forgive me
        some kind of mixture, some kind of goal
        It's gonna come and find us
        all we are is stars




* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)




intro   {x}{x}                Lou plays D note

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}   (Some kind of nature ...)
        {B}{C#m/E}{A}{A}      (Some kind of majesty ...)

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}   (Some kind of metal made up from ...)

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}   (Some kind of nature ...)
        {B}{C#m/E}            (Some kind of majesty ...)

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}   (While me I love plastics and ...)
        {B}{C#m/E}{A}{A}      (From the spiritual poison we ...)

        {F#}{G#m}{E}          (Come forth within us)
        {G#m}{C#m/E}{E}       (Oh lord forgive me ...)
        {F#}{G#m}{C#m}{C#m}   (It's gonna come and find us ...)

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}
        {B}{C#m/E}

        {G#m}{B/E}{B}{E/D#}   (Some kind of metal made up from ...)
        {B}{C#m/E}{A}{A}      (The needy eat man mades they ...)

        {G#m}{C#m/E}{E}       (Some kind of nature ...)
        {F#}{G#m}{E}          (Come forth within us)
        {G#m}{C#m/E}{E}       (Oh lord forgive me ...)
        {F#}{G#m}{C#m...      (It's gonna come and find us ...)

I never saw this on tv

It's Something happened...

Don't seem the same
The things I touch 'n' feel
Are forever changed
I've never felt this way before
and  I hope I never do again

<PRE>
==============================================
"Soul City"
==============================================
album _Soundsville!_
(Various Artists, 1965)

album _Out Of Sight!_
(Various Artists, 1967)

written by
Lou Reed/Terry Philips/Jerry Vance/Jimmie Sims

performed by The Hi-Lifes
==============================================


        People uptown
        people downtown
        Listen close still what I am
        puttin' down

        We're going where the girls are hip
        and the girls are sweet
        everybody's dancin' out in the streets
        so come on, come on, come on

        Soul city
        soul city, mmmm..

        Where the girls are hip
        and the girls are sweet
        everybody's dancin' out in the streets
        so come on, come on, come on

        Soul city
        soul city

        You mockin' and swing
        you can ......
        Tell 'em you that you'll have to
        really move

        So let's go where the girls will swing
        and the chicks will shout
        everybody there's gonna working on out
        come on, come on, come on

        Soul city
        soul city

        They're doing .....
        down in soul city
        You can even .... swing
        down in soul city, hah

        You know the girls are hip
        and the girls are sweet
        everybody's dancin' out in the streets
        so come on, come on, come on

        Soul city
        come and go with me
        Down to soul city
        they got to swing the chicks, down there
        In soul city, yes we do
        you know the ....
        Down to soul city



intro   {G}{G}{G}{G}

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (People uptown, people downtown)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (Listen close still what I am ...)

        {Bm}{Bm}{C}{D}  (- girls are hip and the girls are ...)
        {D}{D}{D}       (- come on, come on, Soul -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, soul city, mmmm.., Where -)

        {Bm}{Bm}{C}{D}  (- girls are hip and the girls are ...)
        {D}{D}{D}       (- come on, come on, Soul -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, soul city)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (You mockin' and swing ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (Tell 'em you that you'll have to ...)

        {Bm}{Bm}{C}{D}  (- girls will swing and the chicks ...)
        {D}{D}{D}       (- come on, come on, Soul -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, soul city, ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (.... down in soul city ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- swing, down in soul city, hah ...)

        {Bm}{Bm}{C}{D}  (- girls are hip and the girls are ...)
        {D}{D}{D}       (- come on, come on, Soul -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, come and go with me ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, they got to swing the chicks ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city, yes we do ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}    (- city)
        ... fade out

so c'mon c'mon c'mon

<TITLE>Soul Man</TITLE>

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================================
"Soul Man"
===================================
album _Soul Man_
(Original Soundtrack, 1986)

written by Isaac Hayes/David Porter

performed by Sam Moore and Lou Reed
===================================


        Coming to you, on a dusty road
        good loving, I've got a plenty of
        And when you're dirty, your dark side
        don't worry, 'cause I'm coming

        I'm a soul man (oh)
        I'm a soul man
        I'm a soul man (oh no)
        I'm a soul man

        Got what I got, the hard way
        and I'll make it better, each and every day
        Be sure honey, hey, don't you fret
        'cause you ain't seen nothing yet

        I'm a soul man (oh no)
        I'm a soul man (say, Lou)
        I'm a soul man (oh no)
        I'm a soul man (look)

        I was brought up, on a side street (hahaha)
        I learned how to love, before I could eat
        Hey, I was educated, from good-good stock
        and I've got loving, oh, I can't stop

        (Oh babe) I'm a soul man (oh)
        hey babe, I'm a soul man
        I'm a soul man (yeah)
        I'm a soul man

        Grab the rope, and I'll pull you in
        give you hope, and be your funky boyfriend
        (Yeah) yeah (yeah) yeah

        I'm a soul man
        I'm a soul man (can I be your)
        I'm a soul man (....)
        I'm a soul man (oh no)
        I'm a soul man, uh-huh (....)
        I'm a soul man, sure you are
        I'm a soul man (....)
        I'm a soul man, oh yeah
        Hey baby, I'm a soul man (....)
        I'm a soul man (oh)
        I'm a soul man (....)
        I'm a soul man, oh yeah (....)
        ...



intro   {G}{F}{A#}{C/D}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Coming -)

Sam     {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- to you, on a dusty road ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- when you're dirty, your dark ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, Got -)

Lou     {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- what I got, the hard way ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Be sure honey, hey, don't you ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I was -)

duet    {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- brought up, on a side street ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- educated, from good-good stock ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, hey babe, I'm a soul ...)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man)

bridge  {D#}{A#}{C}{C}       (Grab the rope, and I'll pull ...)
        {C#}                 (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)

        * key change * 

guitar  {G#}{F#}{B}{C#/D#}   (I'm a -)

coda    {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (- soul man, I'm a soul man ...)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (- soul man, I'm a soul man ...)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (- soul man, I'm a soul man ...)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (- soul man, I'm a soul man ...)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (- soul man, I'm a soul man ...)
        ... fade out




* intro

    {G}                   {F}
 1e -------7-----------------7\5--5------5-------
 2B ---------------------------------------------
 3G --5/7-----------------7-----------5----------
 4D ---------------------------------------------
 5A ---------------------------------------------
 6E ---------------------------------------------

 {A#}                      {C          /  D }
--------10------10---------------12------14-\---
------------------------------------------------
--8/10------10------------10/12------12--14-\---
------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------





* riff

     {G}                      {G}
 1e -----------7-7---7-5-x--------------7-7---7-5-x-----
 2B --8-x-8-x--8-8---8-5-x-8---8-x-8-x--8-8---8-5-x-8---
 3G --7-x-7-x--7-7---7-5-x-7---7-x-7-x--7-7---7-5-x-7---   ...
 4D --9-x-9-x--------------9---9-x-9-x--------------9---
 5A ----------------------------------------------------
 6E ----------------------------------------------------




* chorus

   - soul man,                              I'm a -
     {G}                     {F}
 1e --3-x-5-x-7-----------------7\5--5-----5-------
 2B -----------------------------------------------
 3G --4-x-5-x-7--------------7----------5----------
 4D -----------------------------------------------
 5A -----------------------------------------------
 6E -----------------------------------------------

- soul man                          I'm a -
 {G}                  {G}
------------------13v--13v--13/15v---------
-------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------   ...
-------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







========================================
"Soul Man"
(the more Sam version)
========================================
12" single
(Sam Moore and Lou Reed/other, 1986)

* listed as "The More Sam Mix" on cover,
"The More Sam Version" on label.

* different mix
========================================


        Coming to you, on a dusty road
        good loving, I've got a plenty of
        And when you're dirty, your dark side
        don't worry, 'cause I'm coming

        I'm a soul man, oh
        I'm a soul man
        I'm a soul man, oh no
        I'm a soul man

        Got what I got, the hard way
        and I'll make it better, each and every day
        Be sure honey, don't you fret
        'cause you ain't seen nothing yet

        I'm a soul man, oh no
        I'm a soul man, say, Lou
        I'm a soul man, oh no
        I'm a soul man, look

        I was brought up, on a side street, hahaha
        I learned how to love, before I could eat
        I was educated, from good stock
        and I've got loving, oh, I can't stop

        Oh babe, I'm a soul man, oh
        (hey babe) I'm a soul man
        I'm a soul man, yeah
        I'm a soul man

        Grab the rope, and I'll pull you in
        give you hope, and be your funky boyfriend
        Yeah (yeah) yeah (yeah)

        Soul man
        soul man, can I be your
        Soul man, ....
        soul man, oh no
        Soul man (uh-huh), ....
        soul man, (sure you are)
        Soul man, ....
        soul man, (oh yeah)
        Soul man, ....
        soul man, oh
        Soul man, ....
        soul man (oh yeah)
        Soul man (uh-huh), ....
        soul man, ....
        Soul man, wow-wow-wow
        soul man (sure you are)
        ...



intro   {G}{F}{A#}{C/D}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Coming -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- to you, on a dusty road ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- when you're dirty, your dark ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, Got -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- what I got, the hard way ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Be sure honey, don't you fret ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I was -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- brought up, on a side street ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- educated, from good stock ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, hey babe, I'm a soul ...)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man)

bridge  {D#}{A#}{C}{C}       (Grab the rope, and I'll pull ...)
        {C#}                 (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)

        * key change * 

guitar  {G#}{F#}{B}{C#/D#}

coda    {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        ... fade out








===============================================
"Soul Man"
(7" single version)
===============================================
7" single
(Sam Moore and Lou Reed, 1986)

* listed as "new version"
on Japanese promotional 7" single (1987)

* different mix
("the more Sam mix" with hi-hat count on intro)
===============================================



        * lyrics: same as 12" - "the more Sam mix"



intro   {x}                  * count (hi-hat)*
        {G}{F}{A#}{C/D}
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Coming -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- to you, on a dusty road ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- when you're dirty, your dark ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, Got -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- what I got, the hard way ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (Be sure honey, don't you fret ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I'm a -)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man, I was -)

        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- brought up, on a side street ...)
        {G}{G}{G}{G}         (- educated, from good stock ...)

chorus  {G}{F}{G}{G}         (- soul man, hey babe, I'm a soul ...)
        {G}{F}{G}{C/D}       (- soul man, I'm a soul man)

bridge  {D#}{A#}{C}{C}       (Grab the rope, and I'll pull ...)
        {C#}                 (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)

        * key change * 

guitar  {G#}{F#}{B}{C#/D#}

coda    {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        {G#}{G#}{G#}{G#}     (Soul man, soul man)
        ... fade out

==============================================
"Spine Music"
(instrumental)
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed

performed by Lou Reed (taped guitar solos),
German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================



for the basic melody line and chord progression,
better to see the Lou Reed's 1998 live version below.

===========================================
"Spine Music"
(instrumental)
===========================================
unreleased live
(Lou Reed, 1998)

* written for the play _Time Rocker_ (1996)

performed by
Lou Reed with his '98 backing band

Nov 25, 1998
Knitting Factory, NYC
===========================================

<TITLE>Spit It Out</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Spit It Out"
===================
album _Mistrial_
(Lou Reed, 1986)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        If there's rage inside you so you cannot think
        spit it out
        If you get so angry that you cannot speak
        spit it out
        Talk to him or her or it
        and tell them where they can put it
        Spit it out, spit it out
        You got to talk to him or her or it
        and take aim with your mouth and spit
        Spit it out, spit it out

        If you get worked over at your job
        spit it out
        If a taxi almost runs you down
        spit it out
        You got to take aim with your mouth and speak
        and give it to them right between the teeth
        Spit it out, spit it out
        Talk to him or her or it
        and take aim with your mouth and spit
        Spit it out, spit it out

        Spit it out
        Hey, hey, hey

        If you're patient and you have the time
        spit it out
        Wait till they're on the decline
        spit it out
        The Chinese say you meet the hard with the soft
        the Yin with the Yang, the down with the up, oh
        Spit it out, spit it out
        You got to grab that dumb he, she or it
        and give it to them right between the teeth
        Spit it out, spit it out

        Spit it out, babe, spit it out
        Hey



intro   {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (If there's -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (- rage inside you so you cannot think ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (- get so angry that you cannot speak ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}    (Talk to him or her or it ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Spit it out, spit it out)
        {B}{B}{A}{A}    (You got to talk to him or her or it ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Spit it out, spit it out. If you -)

        ...

guitar  {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Spit it out)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}    (Hey, hey, hey)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {B}{B}{A}{A}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (If you're -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (- patient and you have the time ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Wait till they're on the decline ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}    (- Chinese say you meet the hard with ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Spit it out, spit it out)
        {B}{B}{A}{A}    (You got to grab that dumb he she or it ...)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Spit it out, spit it out. Spit it out, -)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (- babe, spit it out)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}    (Hey)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        ... fade out

and speak

the teeth

the down with the up

<TITLE>Standing On Ceremony</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
===================================
"Standing On Ceremony"
===================================
album _Growing Up In Public_
(Lou Reed, 1980)

written by Lou Reed/Michael Fonfara
===================================


        Remember your manners
        will you please take your hat off
        Your mother is dying
        listen to her cough

        We were always standing on ceremony
        We were always standing on ceremony

        Can't you show some respect please
        although you didn't in real life
        Your mother is dying
        and I god damn well hope you're satisfied

        We were always standing on ceremony
        We were always standing on ceremony

        So please play another song on that juke box
        Please play another pretty sad song for me
        And if that phone rings, tell them that you haven't seen me
        If that last phone rings
        tell them that you haven't seen me for weeks
        and this one here's on me

        Standing on ceremony, standing on ceremony
        Standing on ceremony, standing on ceremony
        Standing on ceremony, you were always standing on ceremony
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        (Standing, on ceremony)
        ...



intro    /x.E}
        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}
        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}

        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}          (Remember your manners, will you ...)
        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}          (Your mother is dying, listen to ...)

        {Em}{Bm}{F}{Am/E}       (We were always standing on ceremony)
        {Em}{Bm}{F}{Am/E}       (We were always standing on ceremony)

        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}
        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}

        ...

        {C}{F}{C}{G}            (So please play another song on ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{G}            (Please play another pretty sad ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{G}            (And if that phone rings, tell ...)
        {C}{F}{C}{F}            (If that last phone rings ...)

        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}
        {Am}{Am}{F}{F}

        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing on ceremony, standing ...)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing on ceremony, standing ...)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing on ceremony, you were ...)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        {F/G}{Am}{F/G}{Am}      (Standing, on ceremony)
        ...fade out




* intro and riff

   /x.E}{Am}           {Am}           {F}           {F}
1e ---------------------------------------------------------------
2B ---------------0-1---------------------------------------------
3G -------------------2------------------------2p0----------------
4D ---x---2-------------2v-------------------------3--------------
5A ---x---0----------------------------3-------------3v-----------
6E ------------------------------------1--------------------------

 {Am}           {Am}           {F}           {F}
-----------------------------------------------------------
-----------0-1---------------------------------------------
---------------2------------------------2p0----------------
---2-------------2v-------------------------3--------------
---0----------------------------3-------------3v-----3--2--
--------------------------------1--------------------------



* We were always standing on ceremony
    {Em}            {Bm}              {F}              {Am   / E   }

Standing On Ceremony

Will you please take your hat off
Your mother is dying
Listen to her cough

We were always Standing on Ceremony

Although you didn't in real life
Your mother is dying
And I god damn will hope you're satisfied

We were always Standing on Ceremony

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Starlight</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=============================
"Starlight"
=============================
album _Songs For Drella_
(Lou Reed/John Cale, 1990)

written by Lou Reed/John Cale
=============================


        Starlight open wide
        starlight open up you door
        This is New York calling
        with movies from the street
        Movies with real people
        what you get is what you see
        Starlight open wide
        Andy's Cecil B. DeMille

        Come on L.A. give us a call
        We've got superstars who talk
        they'll do anything at all
        Ingrid, Viva, Little Joe
        Baby Jane, and Eddie S.
        But you'd better call us soon
        before we talk ourselves to death

        Starlight open wide
        everybody is a star
        Split-screen eight hour movies
        we've got color, we've got sound
        Won't you recognize us
        we're everything you hate
        Andy loves old Hollywood movies
        he'll scare you hypocrites to death

        You know that shooting up's for real
        That person who's screaming
        that's the way he really feels
        We're all improvising
        five movies in a week
        If Hollywood doesn't call us
        we'll be sick

        Starlight open wide
        do to movies what you did to art
        Can you see beauty in ugliness
        or is it playing in the dirt
        There are stars out on the New York streets
        we wanna capture them on film
        But if no one wants to see 'em
        we'll make another and another

        Starlight let us in that magic room
        We've all dreamt of Hollywood
        it can't happen too soon
        Won't you give us a million dollars the rent's due
        Andy will give you two movies and a painting
        starlight open wide



intro   {A}{A}{G}{D}
        {A}{A}{G}{D}

        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (Starlight open wide ...)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (- door)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (This is New York calling ...)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (Movies with real people ...)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (Starlight open wide ...)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (-Mille)

        {F}{Em}{G}{G}         (Come on L.A. give us a call ...)
        {F}{Em}{G}{G}         (- superstars who talk ...)
        {F}{Em}{G}{G}         (Ingrid, Viva, Little Joe ...)
        {F}{Em}{A#/A}{G#/G}   (But you'd better call us soon ...)

        {A}{A}{G}{D}
        {A}{A}{G}{D}

        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (Starlight open wide ...)
        {A}{A}{G}{D}          (Split-)

<TITLE>Stephanie Says</TITLE>
