        {A.B/E}

        {E}{E}{A/E}{B.A/E}             (Lover-lover why is ...)
        {A.B/E}

        {E}{E}{A/E}{B.A/E}             (See the eagle above the ...)
        {A.B/E}

        {E}{E}{A/E}{B.A/E}             (Moon on the mountain ...)
        {A.B/E}                        (- turn off the light, oh -)
        {A.B/E}{A.B/E}{A.B/E}{A.B/E}   (- turn off the light ...)

<TITLE>Turn To Me</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<BODY>
<PRE>
======================
"Turn To Me"
======================
album _New Sensations_
(Lou Reed, 1984)

written by Lou Reed
======================


        If you gave up major vices
        you're between a hard place and a wall
        And your car breaks down in traffic
        on the street
        Remember, I'm the one who loves you
        you can always give me a call
        Turn to me, turn to me
        baby, turn to me

        If your father is free basing
        and your mother turning tricks
        That's still no reason
        you should have a rip
        Remember, I'm the one who loves you
        you can always give me a call
        Turn to me, turn to me
        turn to me

        When your teeth are ground down to the bone
        and there's nothing between your legs
        And some friend died of something
        that you can't pronounce, ah
        Remember, I'm the one who loves you
        hey baby, you can always give me a call
        Turn to me, turn to me
        turn to me

        You can't pay your rent, your boss is an idiot
        and your apartment has no heat
        And your wife says, "Maybe
        it's time to have a child"
        Remember, I'm the one who loves you
        and you can always give me a call
        Turn to me, turn to me
        turn to me

        When it's all too much you turn the TV set on
        and light a cigarette
        And then a public service announcement
        comes creeping on
        And you see a lung corroding
        or a fatal heart attack
        Turn to me, turn to me
        baby, turn to me, I'm just a phone call away

        Turn to me, turn to me
        hey, turn to me, one .... a dollar
        Turn to me, baby
        turn to me
        (Turn to me, turn to me
        turn to me)
        (Turn to me, turn to me
        turn to me)

        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}

        {G}{A}{D}{D}            (- me, turn to me, baby, turn to me)

        ...

        ...

        {D}{D}{G}{G/A}

        {G}{A}{D}{D}            (You -)

clap.   ...

        {D}{D}{G}{D}            (- all too much you turn the TV ...)

        {D}{D}{G}{D}            (- see a lung corroding or a ...)
        {G}{A}{D}{D}            (- me, turn to me, baby, turn ...)

<TITLE>Turning Time Around</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===========================================
"Turning Time Around"
===========================================
album _Ecstasy_
(Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

* written for the play _Time Rocker_ (1996)
===========================================


        She says, what do you call love
        well I call it Harry
        Oh, please I'm being serious
        what do you call love

        Well I don't call it family and I don't call it lust
        and as we all know marriage isn't a must
        And I suppose in the end, it's a matter of trust
        if I had to I'd call love time

        She says, what do you call love
        can't you be more specific
        What do you call love
        is it more than the heart's hieroglyphic

        Well for me time has no meaning, no future, no past
        and when you're in love, you don't have to ask
        There's never enough time to hold love in your grasp
        turning time around

        Turning time around
        that is what love is
        Turning time around
        yes, that is what love is

        My time is your time when you're in love
        and time is what you never have enough of
        You can't see or hold it, it's exactly like love

        Turning time around
        turning time around
        Turning time around
        turning time around
        Turning time around
        well I gotta have it
        I gotta-gotta-gotta have it

        Turning, turning time around
        gotta have it, turning time around
        Turning, turning time around
        turning time around



intro   /E}                          bass
        {A}{A}{E}{E}
        {A}{A}{E}{E}

        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (She says, what do you ...)
        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (Oh, please I'm being ...)

        {D/Dm}{A/F#m}{D/Dm}{A/F#m}   (Well I don't call it ...)
        {D/Dm}{A/F#m}{D}{E}          (- suppose in the end ...)
        {E}

        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (She says, what do you ...)
        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (What do you call love ...)

        {D/Dm}{A/F#m}{D/Dm}{A/F#m}   (Well for me time has no ...)
break   {D/Dm}{A/F#m...              (There's never enough time ...)

        {D}{E}{E}                    (turning time around)
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (Turning time around ...)
        {A/E}{A}{D}{E}               (Turning time around ...)

        {D/Dm}{A/F#m}{D/Dm}{A/F#m}   (My time is your time when ...)
break   {D/Dm..                      (- see or hold it, it's ...)

coda    {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (- have it)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (Turning, turning time ...)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (- turning time around ...)
        {D}{E}{D}{E}                 (Turning time around)
        .... fade out

------9-9-9/7-7--7/6-6-6-----------------------------------------
--------------------------------4/6------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------------------------------




* riff

 She says, What do you call love         well I call it Harry
     {A    / E}     {A}            {D}            {E}
 1e ---------0----------------------2--------------0------4\2-2--

 4D --2------2-------2------2-2-2---0--------------2-------------
 5A --0------2-------0------0-0-0------------------2-------------
 6E ---------0-------------------------------------0-------------

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







==============================================
"Turning Time Around"
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

performed by actors, German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================


        What do you call love
        (well, I call it Harry)
        Please I'm being serious
        what do you call love

        (Well I don't call it family and I don't call it lust)
        (and as we all know marriage isn't a must)
        (And I suppose in the end, it's a matter of trust)
        (if I had to I'd call love time)

        What do you call love
        can't you be more specific
        What do you call love
        ah, is it more than the heart's hieroglyphic

        (Time has no meaning, no future, no past)
        (and when you're in love, you don't have to ask)
        (There's never enough time to hold love in your grasp)
        (turning time around)

        Turning time around
        that is what love is
        Turning time around
        yes, that is what love is

        (My time is your time when you're in love)
        and time is what you never have enough of
        (You can't see or hold it)
        (it's exactly like love)
        haha..

        Turning time around
        turning time around
        Turning time around
        turning time around
        Turning time around
        turning time around
        Turning time around
        turning time around



intro   {C}                            guitar

        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (What do you call love ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (Please I'm being ...)

        {A#/A#m}{F/Dm}{A#/A#m}{F/Dm}   (- don't call it family ...)
break   {A#/A#m}{F/Dm...               (And I suppose in the ...)
        {A#}{C}                        (- I'd call love time)

        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (What do you call love ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (What do you call love ...)

        {A#/A#m}{F/Dm}{A#/A#m}{F/Dm}   (Time has no meaning ...)
break   {A#/A#m}{F/Dm...               (There's never enough ...)

        {A#}{C}{C}                     (turning time around)
guitar  {C}{C}{C}{C}                    * see tab2 below

        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (Turning time around ...)
        {F/C}{F}{A#}{C}                (Turning time around ...)

        {A#/A#m}{F/Dm}{A#/A#m}{F/Dm}   (My time is your time ...)
break   {A#/A#m..                      (You can't see or hold ...)

coda    {A#}{C}{A#}{C}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {A#}{C}{A#}{C}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {A#}{C}{A#}{C}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {A#}{C}{A#}{C}                 (Turning time around ...)
        {F...




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Taco Veenstra (taco@tppveenstra.myweb.nl)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

They are the exact words he sings,
not just lyrics I copied from the booklet.



Turning time around
--------------------
She says: what do you call love
Well I call it Harry
Ah please, I'm being serious
What do you call love
Well I don't call it family
And I don't call it lust
And as we all know, marriage isn't a must
And I suppose in the end it's a matter of trust
If I had to I'd call love time
She said: what do you call love
Can't you be more specific
What do you call love
Is it more than the hearts hieroglyphic
Well for me time has no meaning
No future, no past
And when you're in love, you don't have to ask
There's never enough time to hold love in your grasp
Turning time around
Turning time around
That's what love is
Turning time around
Yes, that's what love is
My time is your time
When you're in love
And time is what you never have enough of
You can't see or hold it
It's exactly like love
Turning time around
Turning time around
Turning time around
Turning time around
Turning time around

Well I gotta have it
I gotta gotta gotta have it
Turning time around
Well I gotta have it
Turning time around
Turning, turning time around
Turning time around

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Underneath The Bottle</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
=======================
"Underneath The Bottle"
=======================
album _The Blue Mask_
(Lou Reed, 1982)

written by Lou Reed
=======================


        Ooohhh-wheee, look at me
        lookin' for some sympathy
        It's the same old story -
        - of man and his search for glory
        and he found it, there underneath the bottle

        Things are never good, things go from bad to weird
        hey gimmie another scotch with my beer
        I'm sad to say -
        - I feel the same today as I always do
        gimmie a drink to relax me

        Ooohhh-wheee, liquor set me free
        I can't do no work, the shakes inside me
        Ah shucks
        I got the lousiest luck, I'm sick of this
        underneath the bottle

        Seven days make a week, on two of them I sleep
        I can't remember what the heck I was doin'
        I got bruises on my leg -
        - from I can't remember when
        I fell down some stairs, I was lyin' underneath the bottle

        Ooohhh-wheee, son of a B
        you get so down, you can't get any lower
        So long world you play too rough
        and it's getting me all mixed up
        I lost my pride and it's hiddin' there underneath the bottle



* Lou Reed (right channel): standard-tuning



intro   ..x/A.G}
        {D}{G/D}{D/A}{A/A.G}
        {D}{G/D}{G.A/D}{D}

        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}         (Ooohhh wheee, look at me ...)
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{G}         (- same old story, of man ...)

        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}         (Things are never good ...)
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{G}         (I'm sad to say ...)

        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}         (Ooohhh-wheee, liquor set me ...)
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{G}         (Ah shucks, I got the ...)

        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}         (Seven days make a week ...)
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{G}         (- bruises on my leg ...)

        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}         (Ooohhh-wheee, son of a B ...)
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{G}         (- world you play too rough ...)

coda    {A.G/D}{D/G}{D}{A}
        {A.G/D}{D/G}{D/G.A}{D...




- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -



* Robert Quine (left channel): D-tuning
(all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   ..x/B.A}
        {E}{A/E}{E/B}{B/B.A}
        {E}{A/E}{A.B/E}{E}

verse   {B.A/E}{E/A}{E}{B}         (Ooohhh wheee, look at me ...)
        {B.A/E}{E/A}{E}{A}         (- same old story, of man ...)

        ....

coda    {B.A/E}{E/A}{E}{B}
        {B.A/E}{E/A}{E/A.B}{E...




* chords (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

       E            E            A            B
*1d ---0---      ---4---      ---0---      ---0---
*2A ---0---      ---5---      ---5---      ---7---
*3F ---1--- and  ---4---      ---6---      ---8---
*4C ---2---      -------      ---7---      ---9---
*5G -------      -------      -------      -------
*6D -------      -------      -------      -------




* intro (all the strings downtuned a whole-tone)

     ..x(drums) / B . A}
*1d --------------0-x-0-x--
*2A --------------7-x-5-x--
*3F --------------8-x-6-x--
*4C --------------9-x-7-x--
*5G -----------------------
*6D -----------------------

 {E             }{A      / E      }
--0---x-0--x-4-x--0---0-0--x-0-x-0--
--0---x-0--x-5-x--5---5-0--x-0-x-0--
--1---x-1--x-4-x--6---6-0--x-1-x-1--
--2---x-2--x------7---7-0--x-2-x-2--
------------------------------------
------------------------------------

{E     / B      } {B       /B . A}
--x-4-x--0---x-0---0-0-x-0--0-x-0-x--
--x-5-x--7---x-7---7-7-x-7--7-x-5-x--
--x-4-x--8---x-8---8-8-x-8--8-x-6-x--   ...
--x------9---x-9---9-9-x-9--9-x-7-x--

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Vanishing Act</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Vanishing Act"
===================
album _The Raven_
(Lou Reed, 2003)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be looking forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It might be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be looking forward
        never look over your back

        It must be nice to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        Looking for a kiss
        float into a mist




intro   {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- nice it is to disappear ...)

piano   {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- might be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)

piano   {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- nice it is to disappear ...)

strings {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (Looking for a kiss, float into a mist)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}








========================
"Vanishing Act"
========================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
========================


        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        to float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It might be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never look over your back

        It must be nice to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        Never




* chords: same as _The Raven_ version.








==============================================
"Vanishing Act"
==============================================
from the play _Time Rocker_
(Robert Wilson/Darryl Pinckney/Lou Reed, 1996)

written by Lou Reed
(music is same as "Reverse Diminuendo",
also used in this play)

performed by actors, German musicians

Jun 11, 1996
Thalia Theater, Hamburg, Germany
(pre-premiere)
==============================================


        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It might be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be looking forward
        never look over your back

        It must be nice to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        Float into the mist
        float into the mist
        Disappear into the mist
        and float into the mist



intro   {A}{C#m}{D}{D}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (- must be nice to disappear ...)
break   {A}{C#m}{D}{D...   (- nice it is to disappear ...)

guitar  {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E}     (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{D}     (- might be nice to disappear ...)
break   {A}{C#m}{D}{D...   (- must be nice to disappear ...)

guitar  {E}{E/A}{E}{E/A}
        {E}{E/A}{E}{E}

coda    {A}{A}{D}{D}       (Float into the mist, float into the ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{D}       (- mist, Disappear into the mist ...)
        {A...              (- mist)




* guitar part: rhythm ({E}{E/A} part)

   ______   ______     ______   ______
| / / / /  / / / /  | / / / /  / / / /  |
  o                   o          o x o
  E                   E          A   A  }








========================================
"Vanishing Act"
========================================
from the play _POEtry_
(Robert Wilson/Lou Reed, 2000)

written by Lou Reed

performed by actors, local musicians (?)

May 09, 2001
Muziek Theater, Amsterdam, Holland
========================================


        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It must be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be moving forward
        and never looking back

        How nice it is to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss

        It might be nice to disappear
        to have a vanishing act
        to always be looking forward
        and never look over your back

        It must be nice to disappear
        float into a mist
        with a young lady on your arm
        looking for a kiss




intro   {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   piano
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- nice it is to disappear ...)

piano   {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (It -)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- nice it is to disappear ...)

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- might be nice to disappear ...)
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   (- must be nice to disappear ...)

coda    {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   guitar and bass
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}
        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}

        {A}{C#m}{D}{Dm}   piano
        {A}{C#m}{D.

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Velvet Nursery Rhyme</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
================================
"Velvet Nursery Rhyme"
================================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

written by
Lou Reed/John Cale/
Sterling Morrison/Maureen Tucker

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
================================


        We're the Velvet Underground and we have come to play
        it's been 28 years since we've been here to the day

        There's Maureen, she's on the drums, she's havin' lot of fun
        let's hear it for Moe Tucker, beat those skins for everyone

        There is Sterling Morrison, he's playing the guitar
        he's a guitar hero, kicks their asses really far

        Now you got here John and me

        Now you got here John and me, we want no part of this
        that's because we think it is real pretentious shit



intro   {D}{D.A/A}{D}{D.A/A}
        {Bm}{A}{Bm}{A}

        {D}{D.A/A}{D}{D.A/A}    (We're the Velvet Underground ...)
piano   {D}{D.A/A}{D}{D.A/A}

        {D}{D.A/A}{D}{D.A/A}    (There's Maureen, she's on the ...)
piano   {Bm}{A}{Bm}{A}

        {D}{D.A/A}{D}{D.A/A}    (There is Sterling Morrison ...)
piano   {Bm}{A}{Bm}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A/            (Now you got here John and me)
piano   {D}{D.A/A}

ending  {D}{D.A/A}{D}{A..       (Now you got here John and me ...)




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Jan Timmer (jantim1@yahoo.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


my compliments for your website
and all the lyrics of Lou Reed you've put on the web.
I saw that you asked for some lyrics of the velvet nursey rhyme.
It's hear as attachment, excuse me for (maybe) some
faults in the text, I'm from the Netherlands.
Hope you can use it.



"Velvet Nursery Rhyme"


We're the Velvet Underground and we've come to play
it's been 28 years since we've been here to the day

There's Maureen, she's on the drums,
she's having 'lot of fun
let's hear it for Mo Tucker.........for everyone.

There is Sterling Morrison, he's playing the guitar,
he's a guitar hero, kicks there asses realy far.

Now you've got here John and Me,...
now you've got here John and Me, we want no part of this
that's because we think this is real pretentious shit.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Bjorn Waller (bjwa6373@hem1.passagen.se)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I found some errors in your lyrics for Chelsea Girls,
Velvet Nursery Rhyme and Lady Godiva's Operation.
Here are the correct ones:



      Velvet Nursery Rhyme
       ================
        We're the Velvet Underground and we have come to play
        it's been 28 years since we've been here to the day

        There's Maureen, she's on the drums, she's havin' lot of fun
        let's hear it for Moe Tucker, beat those skins for everyone

        There is Sterling Morrison, he's playing the guitar
        he's a guitar hero, kick their asses really far

        Now you got here John and me...

        Now you got here John and me, we want no part of this
        that's because we think it is real pretentious shit


(Note: "beat skins" = play drums)


---------------------------------------------------------------------
*********************************************************************
chords transcribed by Shiroh KOUCHI (wildside@mx21.tiki.ne.jp)
http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/
*********************************************************************
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

<TITLE>Venus In Furs</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">

<PRE>
=======================================
"Venus In Furs"
=======================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico_
(The Velvet Underground, 1967)

written by Lou Reed
=======================================


        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Kiss the boot of shiny shiny leather
        shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Severin, Severin, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on your bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        taste the whip, now bleed for me

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Severin your servant, comes in bells
        please don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart




* all the strings downtuned a half-tone

 1d# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from e to d#)
 2A# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from B to A#)
 3F# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from G to F#)
 4C# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from D to C#)
 5G# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from A to G#)
 6D# ----- * downtuned a half-tone (from E to D#)




intro   {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm/A}       (Shiny shiny, shiny boots of ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}         (Comes in bells, your servant ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm/A}       (Downy sins of streetlight ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}         (Ermine furs adorn imperious ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

chorus  {F/A#}{C/F}{F/A#}{C/F}   (I am tired, I am weary ...)
        {F/A#}{C/F}{Dm}{Dm}      (A thousand dreams that would ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm/A}       (Kiss the boot of shiny shiny ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}         (Tongue of thongs, the belt ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm/A}       (Severin, Severin, speak so ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}         (Taste the whip, in love not ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

chorus  {F/A#}{C/F}{F/A#}{C/F}   (I am tired, I am weary ...)
        {F/A#}{C/F}{Dm}{Dm}      (A thousand dreams that would ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm/A}       (Shiny shiny, shiny boots of ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}         (Severin your servant, comes ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}
        {Dm...

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up

==============================
"Venus In Furs"
==============================
album _Live MCMXCIII_
(The Velvet Underground, 1993)

Jun 1993
L'Olympia, Paris, France
==============================


        Shiny shiny shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        Oh, I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Taste the whip, shiny shiny leather
        ooohhh, shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear mistress, cure his heart

        Severin, Severin, oh, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on your bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        Severin, taste the whip, Severin taste the whip
        now bleed for me

        Oh, I'm tired and I'm weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would, that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Shiny shiny shiny boots of leather
        shiny leather in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart




* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)




* chords: same as _The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version.

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics








===============================
"Venus In Furs"
(demo)
===============================
box set _Peel Slowly And See_
(The Velvet Underground, 1995)

Jul 1965
John Cale's Ludlow Street loft,
lower Manhattan, NYC
===============================


        Shiny shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress, cure his heart

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        Kiss the boot of shiny shiny leather
        shiny shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear master, cure my heart

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Severin, Severin, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        Severin, taste the whip, now bleed for me

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Shiny, shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Severin your servant, comes in bells
        please don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress, cure his heart

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears




* chords: same as _The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version.
but this version played in standard-tuning.
note: this version has different pitch.
NOT "A=440Hz". about a half note up.




* intro (chord forms only. detailed arpeggio notes were omitted):

     {Dm}               {Dm}

==================================================
"Venus In Furs"
(The Matrix, San Francisco, 12-01-69)
==================================================
box set _Bootleg Series Volume 1: The Quine Tapes_
(The Velvet Underground, 2001)

Dec 01, 1969
The Matrix, San Francisco, California
==================================================


        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Kiss the boot of shiny shiny leather
        shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Severin, Severin, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on your bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        taste the whip, now bleed for me

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Severin your servant, comes in bells
        please don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart




* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)




* chords: same as _The Velvet Underground and Nico_ version.








========================
"Venus In Furs"
========================
album _Animal Serenade_
(Lou Reed, 2004)

Jun 24, 2003
The Wiltern, Los Angeles
========================


        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Kiss the boot of shiny shiny leather
        shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Severin, Severin, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on your bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        oh Severin, taste the whip, now bleed for me

        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Severin your servant, comes in bells
        please don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Different colors made, different colors made
        different colors made of tears




intro   {Dm}{Dm}
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{F.G/A}      (Shiny shiny, shiny boots of ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{F.G/Dm}     (Comes in bells, your servant ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{F.G/A}      (Downy sins of streetlight ...)
        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{F.G/Dm}     (Ermine furs adorn imperious ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

chorus  {F/A#}{C/F}{F/A#}{C/F}   (I am tired, I am weary ...)
        {F/A#}{C/F}{Dm}{Dm}      (A thousand dreams that would ...)

        {Dm}{Dm}{Dm}{Dm}

        ....

===================================================
"Venus In Furs"
(acetate version)
===================================================
album _The Velvet Underground and Nico - Unripened_
(The Velvet Underground, 2007)
===================================================


        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Comes in bells, your servant, don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Downy sins of streetlight fancies
        chase the costumes she shall wear
        Ermine furs adorn imperious
        Severin, Severin awaits you there

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Kiss the boot of shiny shiny leather
        shiny shiny leather in the dark
        Tongue of thongs, the belt that does await you
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart

        Severin, Severin, speak so slightly
        Severin, down on your bended knee
        Taste the whip, in love not given lightly
        taste the whip, now bleed for me

        I am tired, I am weary
        I could sleep for a thousand years
        A thousand dreams that would awake me
        different colors made of tears

        Shiny shiny, shiny boots of leather
        whiplash girlchild in the dark
        Severin your servant, comes in bells
        please don't forsake him
        strike dear mistress and cure his heart




* all the strings downtuned one and a half tone (1 + 1/2)

 1c# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from e to c#)
 2G# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from B to G#)
 3E  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from G to E)
 4B  ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from D to B)
 5F# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from A to F#)
 6C# ----- * downtuned one and a half tone (from E to C#)

        "Heroin" and "Venus In Furs" have different pitch/tuning
        from other songs on this album.




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Yossarian (yossarian@ozemail.com.au)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

The line is "Taste the whip, now bleed for me". Not plead.

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
===================
"Vicious"
===================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        oh baby, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you want me to hit you with a stick
        But all I've got's a guitar pick
        huh baby, you're so vicious

        When I watch you come
        baby, I just wanna run far away
        You're not the kind of person around I -
        - wanna stay

        When I see you walking down the street
        I step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I want to meet

        Oh baby, you're so vicious
        you're just so vicious

        Vicious
        hey, you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        oh baby, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        hey, why don't you swallow razor blades
        You must think that I'm some kind of gay blade
        but baby, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        I just have to run
        You're not good and you certainly aren't -
        - very much fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        I step on your hand and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I even want to meet

        'Cause you're so vicious
        baby, you're so vicious
        Vicious, vicious
        vicious, vicious
        Vicious, vicious
        vicious, vicious
        ...



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (Vicious, you hit me ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (- hour, oh baby ...)

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (Vicious, you want me ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/D}{E}         (- guitar pick, huh ...)

        {B}{A}{E/D.A}{E}               (When I watch you come ...)
        {B}{A}{E/D}{E}                 (You're not the kind of ...)

        {F#m/G#m}{A}{F#m/G#m}{A}       (When I see you walking ...)
        {F#m/G#m}{A/B}                 (You're not the kind of ...)

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (- you're so vicious ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}

        ....

note: Mick Ronson played using wah-pedal
(step treble-boost position)

*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (Vicious, you hit me ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (- hour, oh baby ...)

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (Vicious, you want me ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/C}{D}         (- guitar pick, huh ...)

        {A}{G}{D/C.G}{D}               (When I watch you come ...)
        {A}{G}{D/C}{D}                 (You're not the kind of ...)

        {Em/F#m}{G}{Em/F#m}{G}         (When I see you walking ...)
        {Em/F#m}{G/A}                  (You're not the kind of ...)

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (- you're so vicious ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}

        ....







=========================
"Vicious"
=========================
album _Lou Reed Live_
(Lou Reed, 1975)

Dec 21, 1973
The Academy of Music, NYC
=========================


        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        hey baby, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you want me to hit you with a stick
        All I've got's a guitar pick
        ah honey, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        I just want to run away
        You're not the kind of person that
        I wanna stay

        When I see you walked down the street
        I step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I want to meet

        You're just too damn, vicious
        you think that vicious

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        oh honey, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you must think that I'm the gay blade
        Woh, why don't you go, swallow razor blades
        'cause honey, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        I just got to run
        You're not that good
        you're really not very much fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        I step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You ain't even the kind of person, ah, that I wanna meet

        You're damn, vicious
        hey baby, you're just too damn, vicious

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        hey honey, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you must think that I'm the gay blade
        Oh, why don't you go, swallow razor blades
        ah, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        I just got to run
        You're not very good
        you're not even any fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I wanna meet

        'Cause you're so vicious
        hey, you're vicious
        Vicious
        yeah, vicious



intro   {Em/F#m}{G}{Em/F#m}{G}
        {Em/F#m}{G/A}
break   {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (Vicious, you hit me ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (- hour, oh baby ...)

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (Vicious, you want me ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/C.G}{D}       (- guitar pick, ah ...)

        {A}{G}{D/C.G}{D}               (When I see you coming ...)
        {A}{G}{D/C.G}{D}               (You're not the kind of ...)

        {Em/F#m}{G}{Em/F#m}{G}         (When I see you walked ...)
        {Em/F#m}{G/A}                  (You're not the kind of ...)

        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}   (- damn, vicious ...)
        {D/D.C}{G/G.C}{D/D.C}{G/G.C}

        ....

ending  {Em/F#m}{G}{Em/F#m}{G}
        {Em/F#m}{G/A}{D/




* intro

         { Em    / F#m                }  {G}
 1e --------------------------------------------------------------
 2B --(15b)17-r15--15v---12h15p12------------------------------0--
 3G ------------------------------14-12--14b16r14-12-14b16v-------
 4D --------------------------------------------------------------
 5A --------------------------------------------------------------
 6E --------------------------------------------------------------

 { Em    / F#m         } {G}
--15b17--------15b17-15--15b17r15--12h15p12--------------------
--------------------------------------------15b17v----(15b)17--
---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------

{ Em                           / F#m                }
------------------------------------------------------
--15b17r15-12h15p12-----------------------------------
--------------------14--12h14p12----------------------
---------------------------------14--12h14p12-----12--
----------------------------------------------14------
------------------------------------------------------

 { G         / A             }  { D. (break) ...
---------------14b15-----------|-------------
----------------------17b19r17-|-15\---------
------14-16-14-----------------|-14\---------
--/16--------------------------|-------------
-------------------------------|-------------
-------------------------------|-------------



*** please note ***

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato
^ - harmonics







====================================
"Vicious"
====================================
album _Perfect Night Live In London_
(Lou Reed, 1998)

Jul 03, 1997
Royal Festival Hall, London
(Meltdown Festival)
====================================


        Vicious

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower, mmmm..
        You do it every hour
        oh honey, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you want me to hit you with a stick
        All I've got's a guitar pick
        oh honey, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        I've just got to run
        You ain't no good
        and you really ain't no fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        step on your hands and I ma-ma-ma-ma-mangle your feet
        You ain't the kind of person that I wanna meet

        'Cause you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        Oh, you do it every hour
        honey-honey-honey, you're so vicious

        Hey Tony
        let me know that you're there big guy, hah

        Ooohhh, vicious
        you must think I'm some kinda gay blade
        Why don't you swallow razor blades
        'cause you're so vicious, vicious

        Ooohhh, when I see you coming, running
        I've just got to run, ooohhh
        You ain't no good
        and you really ain't no fun

        When I see you walking dow-dow-dow-down the street
        step on your hands and I ma-ma-ma-ma-mangle your feet
        Ooohhh, see, You ain't the kind of person
        I really wanna meet

        Oh baby, you're so vicious
        baby, you're so vicious
        Baby, you're so vicious, Michael
        hey Michael

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        honey-honey-honey, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you want me to hit you with a stick
        Oh, now-now-now-now got a guitar pick
        ooohhh honey, you're so vicious

        When I see you coming
        oh honey, I've just got to run
        You ain't no good
        and baby, you ain't no fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        step on your hands and I ma-ma-ma-ma-mangle your feet
        You ain't the kind of person that I wanna meet

        'Cause you're so vicious
        you're so vicious
        'Cause you're so vicious
        oh, you're so vicious

        {E}{E}{E}{E}

==========================================
"Vicious"
==========================================
album _American Poet_
(Lou Reed, 2001)

Dec 26, 1972
Ultrasonic Recording Studio, Hempstead, NY
==========================================


        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        and baby, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you want me to hit you with a stick
        But all I've got's a guitar pick
        and baby, you're so vicious

        When I see you comin'
        baby, I just wanna run far away
        You're not the kind of person around
        that I want to stay

        When I see you walking down the street
        I step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I really want to meet

        'Cause you're so vicious
        oh darling, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        you hit me with a flower
        You do it every hour
        and baby, you're so vicious

        Vicious
        why don't you swallow razor blades
        You must think I'm some kinda gay blade
        and baby, you're so vicious

        When I see you comin'
        baby, I just want to run
        You're not very good and you're not really even -
        - very much fun

        When I see you walking down the street
        I step on your hands and I mangle your feet
        You're not the kind of person that I really want to meet

        'Cause you're so vicious
        baby, you're so vicious
        Ah darling, you're so vicious
        oh baby, you're so vicious
        Hey baby, you're so vicious



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (Vicious, you hit me ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (- hour, and baby ...)

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (Vicious, you want me to ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/D.A}{E}       (- guitar pick, and baby ...)

        {B}{A}{E/D.A}{E}               (When I see you comin' ...)
        {B}{A}{E/D.A}{E}               (You're not the kind of ...)

        {F#m/G#m}{A}{F#m/G#m}{A}       (When I see you walking ...)
        {F#m/G#m}{A/B}                 (You're not the kind of ...)

        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   (- vicious, oh darling ...)
        {E/E.D}{A/A.D}{E/E.D}{A/A.D}   scat

        ....

    {E              / E   .  D}   {A       / A .    D}

*2A -------------x--x--x------------------------------
*3F -------------9--9--9-\----------------------------
*4C --------------------------------------------------
*5G --------------------------------------------------
*6D --------------------------------------------------

h - hammer on
p - pull off
b - bend string up
r - release bend
/ - slide up
\ - slide down
v - vibrato

---------------------------------------------------------------------


hi. this is really no big deal
but in the lyrics for the perfect night version of vicious
i think he says, "hey tony, let me know that you're there big guy."
that's just what it sounds like to me.
like i said, no big deal.

<HEAD>
<TITLE>Vicious Circle</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===========================
"Vicious Circle"
===========================
album _Rock And Roll Heart_
(Lou Reed, 1976)

written by Lou Reed
===========================


        You're caught in a vicious circle
        surrounded by your so-called friends
        You're caught in a vicious circle
        and it looks like it will never end

        'Cause some people think that they like problems
        and some people think that they don't
        And for everybody who says yes
        there's somebody whose staring saying don't

        You're caught in a vicious circle
        surrounded by your so-called friends
        You're caught in a vicious circle
        and it looks like it will just never end

        'Cause some people think that it's nerves
        and some people think that it's not
        And some people think that it's things that you do
        and others think that you were cold when you were hot
        They think that that was what it was all about

        You're caught in a vicious circle
        You're caught in a vicious circle
        You're caught in a vicious circle
        You're caught in a vicious circle
        surrounded by all of your friends



intro    /x.G}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}     (You're -)

        {D}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle ...)
        {D}              (You're -)
        {D}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle ...)
        {D}              ('Cause -)

        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- some people think that they like ...)
        {G}{D}           (- for everybody who says yes ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- somebody who's staring, saying don't)
        {D}{D}           (You're -)

        {D}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle ...)
        {D}              (You're -)
        {D}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle ...)
        {D}              ('Cause -)

        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- some people think that it's nerves ...)
        {G}{D}           (- some people think that it's things ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- think that you were cold when you ...)
        {G}{G}{D}{D}     (- think that that was what it was all ...)

coda    {G}{D}{G}{D}     (You're -)

        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle, You're -)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle, You're -)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle, You're -)
        {G}{D}{G}{D}     (- caught in a vicious circle ...)
        {D}{D}{D}{D...   (- friends)

<PRE>
===================
"Video Violence"
===================
album _Mistrial_
(Lou Reed, 1986)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        The currents rage deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence
        The currents rage so deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        Up in the morning, drinking his coffee
        turns on the TV to some slasher movie
        Cartoon-like women, tied up and sweaty
        painting and screaming, thank you, have a nice day

        the currents rage, the dawn's upon us
        this is the age of video violence
        The currents rage so deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na

        His heart is pounding he switches the channel
        looking for something other than rape or murder
        Or beatings or torture but except for Walt Disney
        it's a twisted alliance, this age of video violence

        The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
        this is the age of video violence
        The current rage so deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        Down at his job, his boss sits there screaming
        if he loses his job, then life loses its meaning
        His son is in high school, there's nothing he's learning
        he sits by the TV, watching Corvettes exploding 'cause

        The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
        this is the age of video violence
        No age of reason landing upon us
        this is the age of video violence

        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na

        Down at a bar some woman is topless
        she's acned and scarred, her hair is a mess
        While he shoves 5 dollars down her exotic panties
        the video jukebox is, ah, playing Madonna
        While just down the block at some local theater
        they're grabbing their crotches at the 13th beheading
        As the dead rise to live, the live sink to die
        the currents are deep and raging inside

        The currents rage so deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence
        No age of reason is landing upon us
        this is the age of video violence

        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na

        Our good working stiff looks a whore in the eye
        ties her to a bed while he beats her back bloody
        And then back at home, drinking more instant coffee
        calls some red-neck evangelist that he's seen on TV and says

        The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
        this is the age of video violence
        No age of reason is landing upon us
        this is the age of video violence

        The currents rage so deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence
        The currents rage so deep down inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        ...




intro   {A}{A}{A}{A}
        {A}{A}{A}{A}

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (The currents rage deep inside us ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (The currents rage so deep inside us ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Up in the morning drinking his coffee ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Cartoon-like women, tied up and sweaty ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (the currents rage, the dawn's upon us ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (The currents rage so deep inside us ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}   (Na-na-na, na-na-na, na-na-na, na-na-na)

        ....

================
"Video Violence"
(remix version)
================
12" single
(Lou Reed, 1986)
================


        The currents rage deep inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        His son is in high school, there's nothing he's learning
        he sits by the TV, watching Corvettes exploding 'cause

        she's acned and scarred, her hair is a mess
        While he shoves 5 dollars down her exotic panties
        the video jukebox is, ah, playing Madonna
        While just down the block at some local theater
        they're grabbing their crotches at the 13th beheading
        As the dead rise to live, the live sink to die
        the currents are deep and raging inside

        this is the age of video violence
        No age of reason is landing upon us
        this is the age of video violence

        na-na-na, na-na-na

        na-na-na, na-na-na

        Our good working stiff looks a whore in the eye
        ties her to a bed while he beats her back bloody
        And then back at home, drinking more instant coffee
        calls some red-neck evangelist that he's seen on TV and says

        The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
        this is the age of video violence
        No age of reason is landing upon us
        this is the age of video violence

        this is the age of video violence
        The currents rage so deep down inside us
        this is the age of video violence

        Na-na-na, na-na-na

        Na-na-na, na-na-na
        na-na-na, na-na-na
        Na-na-na, na-na-na




* chords: same as _Mistrial_ version




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Detlef Juergens (detlef.juergens@nwn.de)
---------------------------------------------------------------------


"Video Violence"

The currents rage deep inside us
This is the age of Video Violence
The currents rage so deep inside us
This is the age of Video Violence

Up in the morning drinking his coffee
Turns on the TV to some slasher movie
Cartoon-like women, tied up and sweaty
Painting and screaming
Thank you, have a nice day

the currents rage, the dawn's upon us
This is the age of Video Violence
The currents rage so deep inside us
This is the age of Video Violence

Na Na Na Na Na Na
Na Na Na Na Na Na

His heart is pounding he switches the channel
looking for something
other than rape or murder
or beatings or torture
but except for Walt Disney
it's a twisted alliance
this age of Video Violence

The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
This is the age of Video Violence
The current rage so deep inside us
This is the age of Video Violence

Down at his job his boss sits there screaming
if he loses his job, life looses its meaning
his son is in high school
there's nothing he's learniung
he sits by the TV
Watching Corvettes exploding, 'cause

The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
This is the age of Video Violence
No age of reason landing upon us
This is the age of Video Violence

Na Na Na Na Na Na
Na Na Na Na Na Na

Down at a bar some woman is topless
she's acned and scarred, her hair is a mess
While he shoves $5 down her exotic panties
the video jukebox is playing Madonna
while just down the block
at some local theater
they're grabbing their crotches
at the 13th beheading
as the dead rise to live
the live sink to die
the currents are deep and raging inside

The currents rage so deep inside us
This is the age of Video Violence
No age of reason is landing upon us
This is the age of Video Violence

Na Na Na Na Na Na
Na Na Na Na Na Na

Our good working stiff looks a whore in the eye
ties her to a bed
while he beats her back bloody
and then back at home
drinking more instant coffee
calls some red-neck evangelist
that he's seen on TV and says

The currents rage, the dawn's upon us
This is the age of Video Violence
No age of reason is landing upon us
This is the age of Video Violence

The currents rage so deep upon us
This is the age of Video violence
the currents rage so deep down inside us
This is the age of Video Violence

Na Na Na Na Na Na
Na Na Na Na Na Na

<TITLE>Voices Of Freedom</TITLE>

<PRE>
=========================================================
"Voices Of Freedom"
=========================================================
album _The Secret Policeman's Third Ball_
(Various Artists, 1987)

box set
_Between Thought And Expression - The Lou Reed Anthology_
(Lou Reed, 1992)

written by Lou Reed

Mar 1987
London Palladium, London, England
=========================================================


        Hey, if you're looking for a little action
        hey, if you're looking for a place to go
        Hey, if you're looking for some satisfaction
        Wow, it's the voices of freedom
        well it's the voices of freedom

        Hey, if you're looking for a little inspiration
        hey, if you're looking for a little bit of soul
        Hey, if you're looking for a little, hey, gut reaction
        It's the voices of freedom, oh babe
        it's the voices of freedom

        The river runs right through those mountains
        voices of freedom
        and reduces that rock to stone
        The ocean reduces that stone to sand
        Hey, it's the voices of freedom, ooohhh baby
        hey, it's the voices of freedom

        I hear the voices of freedom from the left
        I hear the voices of freedom from the right
        I hear the voices of freedom, babe, from all over this world
        Well it's the voices of freedom, ooohhh baby baby
        voices of freedom now now, hey hey

        (Voices of freedom, voices of freedom)
        (voices of freedom, voices of freedom)
        (Voices of freedom, voices of freedom)
        (voices of freedom, voices of freedom)

        Hey, if you're looking for a little action
        hey, if you're looking for a place to go
        If you're looking for a little, oh, hey, inspiration
        It's the voices of freedom
        it's the voices of freedom

        Hey, if you're looking for a little inspiration
        hey baby, looking for a little bit of soul
        If you're looking for a little, ah, hey, gut reaction
        It's the voices of freedom, huh
        ooohhh baby, voices of freedom

        A river runs right down through that mountain
        and it reduces that rock to stone
        The ocean reduces that stone to sand
        Well it's the voices of freedom, hey hey
        oh, the voices of freedom

        I hear the voices coming at me from the left
        I hear voices coming at me, babe, from the right
        Ah, I hear voices coming at me from all over this world
        Wow, it's the voices of freedom
        voices of freedom, oh baby now, ah, ah
        Voices of freedom, oh baby now

        Voices of freedom, voices of freedom
        voices of freedom, help us out now
        Voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom now, oh baby now, ah, ah
        Voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        I hear the voi-oi-oices of free-free-freedom
        I hear the voices of freedom
        (Voices of freedom, voices of freedom)
        (voices of freedom, voices of freedom)
        (Voices of freedom)

<TITLE>Wagon Wheel</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<PRE>
===================
"Wagon Wheel"
===================
album _Transformer_
(Lou Reed, 1972)

written by Lou Reed
===================


        Won't you be my wagon wheel
        (spoke spoke)
        Won't you tell me baby, how do you feel

        Yeah, you've gotta live, yeah, your life
        as though you're number one
        Yeah, you've gotta live, yeah, your life
        and make a point of having some fun

        But iff'n you think
        that you get kicks from flirting with danger
        Danger, ooohhh
        just kick her in the head and rearrange her

        Oh heavenly father, what can I do
        what she's done to me is making me crazy
        Oh heavenly father, I know I have sinned
        but look where I've been, it's making me lazy

        Won't you be my wagon wheel
        Won't you tell me baby, how does it feel

        You've gotta live, yeah, your life
        as though you're number one
        Yeah, you've gotta live, yeah, your life
        and make a point of having some fun

        But iff'n you think
        that you get kicks from flirting with danger
        Danger, ooohhh
        just kick her in the head and rearrange her

        And then why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Don't wanna miss it now, wake me, shake me baby
        please don't let me sleep too long
        I wanna know why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Why, why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Why don't you wake me, oh shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long
        Why, why don't you wake me, shake me
        please don't let me sleep too long



* all the strings downtuned a whole-tone

 1d ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from e to d)
 2A ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from B to A)
 3F ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from G to F)
 4C ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from D to C)
 5G ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from A to G)
 6D ----- * downtuned a whole-tone (from E to D)



intro   {E}{E}{E}{E}                fade in
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{B}{E}{E}                (Won't you be my wagon ...)
        {E}{B}{E}{E}                (Won't you tell me baby ...)

        {G#}{C#m}{D}{A}             (- live, yeah, your life ...)
        {G#}{C#m}{D}{A}             (- live, yeah, your life ...)

        {B}{B}{B}{B}                (- think, that you get ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}                (- ooohhh, just kick her in ...)

bridge  {E}{A/G#}{C#m/A}{E/D}       (Oh heavenly father, what ...)
        {A.D/D}                     (- crazy)
        {C#m/E}{A/G#}{C#m/A}{E/D}   (Oh heavenly father, I know ...)
break   {A.D/D...                   (- lazy)

        {E}{E}{E}{E}
        {E}{E}{E}{E}

        {E}{B}{E}{E}                (Won't you be my wagon wheel)
        {E}{B}{E}{E}                (Won't you tell me baby ...)

        {G#}{C#m}{D}{A}             (- live, yeah, your life ...)
        {G#}{C#m}{D}{A}             (- live, yeah, your life ...)

        {B}{B}{B}{B}                (- think, that you get ...)
        {B}{B}{B}{B}                (- ooohhh, just kick her in ...)

coda    {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, oh shake me ...)
        {A}{A}{D}{A}                (- wake me, shake me ...)




---------------------------------------------------------------------



* chords for standard-tuning



intro   {D}{D}{D}{D}              fade in
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{A}{D}{D}              (Won't you be my wagon ...)
        {D}{A}{D}{D}              (Won't you tell me baby ...)

        {F#}{Bm}{C}{G}            (- live, yeah, your life ...)
        {F#}{Bm}{C}{G}            (- live, yeah, your life ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}              (- think, that you get ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}              (- ooohhh, just kick her in ...)

bridge  {D}{G/F#}{Bm/G}{D/C}      (Oh heavenly father, what ...)
        {G.C/C}                   (- crazy)
        {Bm/D}{G/F#}{Bm/G}{D/C}   (Oh heavenly father, I know ...)
break   {G.C/C...                 (- lazy)

        {D}{D}{D}{D}
        {D}{D}{D}{D}

        {D}{A}{D}{D}              (Won't you be my wagon wheel)
        {D}{A}{D}{D}              (Won't you tell me baby ...)

        {F#}{Bm}{C}{G}            (- live, yeah, your life ...)
        {F#}{Bm}{C}{G}            (- live, yeah, your life ...)

        {A}{A}{A}{A}              (- think, that you get ...)
        {A}{A}{A}{A}              (- ooohhh, just kick her in ...)

coda    {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, oh shake me ...)
        {G}{G}{C}{G}              (- wake me, shake me ...)




*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Einar Stenseng (einar@asker.online.no)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I just thought I might tell you:
"Wagon wheel" from "Transformer"
is actually written by David Bowie,
not Lou Reed as it says inside the cover.
This is a "secret" that has become known in the past years.

http://ww21.tiki.ne.jp/~wildside/

<PRE>
=====================
"Wait"
=====================
album _Street Hassle_
(Lou Reed, 1978)

written by Lou Reed
=====================


        Wait
        (disgrace)
        I know I shouldn't, but please wait
        (such a pretty face)
        I know the time is getting late
        (and it was such a waste)
        and he is lost who hesitates
        (of such a pretty face)
        But still I really wish that you'd wait
        (and it was such a waste)
        although this passion might abate
        (of such a pretty face)
        And find you in another state
        (it was such a disgrace)
        that will see this as some mistake
        (it was such a waste)
        Oh babe, I really think you oughta wait
        (of such a pretty face)

        Wait
        (it was such a waste)
        I really wouldn't want your hate
        (of such a pretty face)
        Certainly not at this late date
        (and it was such a waste)
        you wanna give not only take
        (of such a pretty face)
        I know propriety is such a weight
        (it was such a disgrace)
        but then it makes no sense to wait
        (such a pretty face)
        Considering the present state
        (and it was such a waste)
        don't change my mind at this late date
        (.......... such a waste)
        Oh baby, don't you think we oughta wait
        (of such a pretty face)

        (Ooohhh ...)
        (Ooohhh ...)
        (Ooohhh ...)
        (Ooohhh ...)

        Wait
        oh now baby, how I wish you would wait
        I really wish you'd hesitate
        oh baby baby, please why don't you wait
        Oh, how I really wish that you would wait
        oh, how I wish you'd hesitate
        But ................ wait
        baby, how I wish you would wait
        Don't you ..........
        I really wouldn't want get your hate
        But someone who ..........
        I really really wish you would wait
        Oh baby baby baby, please wait

        (Well I met him on a Sunday)




intro   {E}{E}{B}{B}
        {E}{E}{B}{B}
        {E}{E}{B}{B}
        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (disgrace)

        {E}{E}{A}{B}   (Wait, I know I shouldn't, but please ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}   (- late, and he is lost who hesitates ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}   (- wait, although this passion might ...)
        {E}{E}{A}{B}   (- state, that will see this as some ...)

        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (- wait)
        {E}{E}{B}{B}

        ....

        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (Ooohhh ...)
        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (Ooohhh ...)
        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (Ooohhh ...)
        {E}{E}{B}{B}   (Ooohhh ...)

        ....



*********************************************************************
---------------------------------------------------------------------
thanks: Ian Leonard Betts (ianlbetts@yahoo.com)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

I was looking at 'Wait.'
You have the song fading out to the lyric '...someday'.
I think it's the backing singers coming in with a line
from an old doowop song ending in ...
I met him on a sunday.
So...sunday instead of someday...?

<TITLE>Walk Alone</TITLE>
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
